summary: The CVT and battery pack add enough thrust to the 1.5-liter 4-cylinder to get you off the line adequately. In our testing it took 10.4 seconds to reach 60 mph.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Performance usually doesn't apply to hybrids in terms of hairpins and switchbacks. And that's the case with the ILX, too. It neither truly disappoints, nor impresses.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Acura
model.name: ILX
style.name: Hybrid w/Technology Package 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The ILX required 129 feet to reach a stop from 60 mph, which is about average for its class. Pedal feel was as confident in a panic stop as under normal driving conditions.
ratings.title: Performance

summary: The electric power steering didn't feel as numb as other systems we've tested. Steering reaction was somewhat slow in quick transitions, but suited for driving around town.

summary: Seat comfort is fine for short drives but we encountered some soreness over long distances. The seats are plenty adjustable, but taller folks will encounter headroom constraints.

ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Let's be honest, compact luxury hybrid sedans aren't designed with a fun driving experience in mind. Rather, these cars are built for a practical and economical reasons. Enthusiasts, other than hypermilers, need not apply.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Acura
model.name: ILX

summary: This car lacks any emotion, unless you consider frugality a personality trait. The ILX Hybrid goes from A to B with decent fuel conservation. Thatâ€™s what you're getting here.

model.name: ILX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5A)
summary: A 2.4L four-cylinder with the 6-sp manual hits 60 mph in 7.1 sec., which is slower than rivals. The 150-hp 2.0-liter with the 5-sp automatic is almost 2 sec. slower. In sum: It's a lackluster performer.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Since the free-revving 2.4L four-cylinder requires a manual transmission, few buyers will get the chance to enjoy it. Instead, they'll be stuck with the weak 2.0-liter base engine. The steering and handling are above average regardless of engine.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Acura
model.name: ILX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5A)
summary: In typical driving the brake pedal is quite responsive. At our test track we recorded 121 to 130-foot panic stops (average performances) from both 2.0L and 2.4L models with a bit of pedal fade in each car.

ratings.summary: An ILX with the 2.4-liter 201-hp engine and a 6-speed manual transmission is reasonably fun, but few will actually buy it (because hardly anyone buys manual gearboxes anymore). There's nothing fun about the base 2.0L that most will buy.

summary: Soft-touch surfaces are found in all of the right places. The RLX looks and feels well-made, even for our early-build test car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Acura offers consumers average value for this class. Where our RLX Advance stands out is with its extensive list of technology features.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The Tech and Advance packages include features that are segment-leading. Since these packages can't be ordered a la carte, it's hard to compare their value directly to competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Acura offers consumers average value for this class. Where our RLX Advance stands out is with its extensive list of technology features.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Some will consider the RLX expensive for what it offers compared to the more well-established, segment-leading European competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Acura offers consumers average value for this class. Where our RLX Advance stands out is with its extensive list of technology features.
title: Cost

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The EPA estimates fuel economy at 20 mpg/31 mpg highway. We averaged 23 mpg over 800 miles of mixed driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Acura offers consumers average value for this class. Where our RLX Advance stands out is with its extensive list of technology features.
title: MPG

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Four-year/50,000-mile basic warranty, six-year/70,000-mile drivetrain, four-year/50,000-mile roadside assistance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Acura offers consumers average value for this class. Where our RLX Advance stands out is with its extensive list of technology features.
title: Warranty

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Acura doesn't offer the free scheduled maintenance programs that are available from a few of its competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Acura offers consumers average value for this class. Where our RLX Advance stands out is with its extensive list of technology features.
title: Ownership

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Point the RLX toward the highway. If you can come to terms with its stiffer-than-average ride, the plethora of technology bits will take care of the rest.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The RLX can be fun to drive. It is an above-average performer and the V6 is adequately powerful. But what's actually more fun is playing with all the gadgets via the soft-touch media interface.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Acura
model.name: RLX
style.name: 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: A pinch of sport. A spoonful of luxury. And a bucket of technology. That's the RLX.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The RLX can be fun to drive. It is an above-average performer and the V6 is adequately powerful. But what's actually more fun is playing with all the gadgets via the soft-touch media interface.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The powertrain feels hesitant off the line, but once the turbo hits, you're going places. Ultra-refined engine. Technically, the 0-60-mph sprint of 6.2 seconds is just okay; the sedan is a half-second quicker (and 300 lbs lighter).
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: VW/Audi's familiar 2.0 TFSI gasoline engine makes 220 hp and 258 lb-ft here, which is enough for confident passing and merging. Fuel economy is also a strength, and while the A3 Cabriolet isn't a sports car, its precise steering and good body control give it a sporty feel.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3 Cabriolet showed excellent braking composure, stopping straight with intuitive pedal feel, no extraneous motions and zero fade. Panic stop from 60 mph took 120 feet with all-season tires, a satisfactory but non-stellar result.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: VW/Audi's familiar 2.0 TFSI gasoline engine makes 220 hp and 258 lb-ft here, which is enough for confident passing and merging. Fuel economy is also a strength, and while the A3 Cabriolet isn't a sports car, its precise steering and good body control give it a sporty feel.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Our test car's steering effort was adjustable via Audi's Drive Select system, but even the heaviest Dynamic setting still felt light. Path control is very good, though, and this precision inspires confidence in real-world driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: VW/Audi's familiar 2.0 TFSI gasoline engine makes 220 hp and 258 lb-ft here, which is enough for confident passing and merging. Fuel economy is also a strength, and while the A3 Cabriolet isn't a sports car, its precise steering and good body control give it a sporty feel.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: This sport-suspended A3 felt nimble and composed. No surprise there; the suspension tune and MQB platform mean it's kind of like a GTI convertible. Little playfulness at the limit, however. Capable, but not particularly exciting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: VW/Audi's familiar 2.0 TFSI gasoline engine makes 220 hp and 258 lb-ft here, which is enough for confident passing and merging. Fuel economy is also a strength, and while the A3 Cabriolet isn't a sports car, its precise steering and good body control give it a sporty feel.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Light steering makes parking maneuvers a breeze, as do the A3's compact dimensions. Rev-matched downshifts from S tronic transmission are awesomely quick and precise. S tronic can feel sleepy at low speeds but is mostly on-point.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: VW/Audi's familiar 2.0 TFSI gasoline engine makes 220 hp and 258 lb-ft here, which is enough for confident passing and merging. Fuel economy is also a strength, and while the A3 Cabriolet isn't a sports car, its precise steering and good body control give it a sporty feel.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Our A3 Cab's Sport package included manual front seats (twist-knob to recline!) that offered wide adjustability. Not much lateral support by sport-seat standards. Rear comfort hurt by lack of space.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Manual front seats with less-than-sporty bolstering offer generous space but could hold tighter. Tight rear-seat, though the 2 Series is similarly cramped. On the bright side, the ride is supple and the top creates a well-insulated cockpit when in place.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Despite the Sport package's firmer suspension, the ride remained reasonably supple over most surfaces. Mild cowl shake was noted on rough patches, as were occasional pops/creaks from the top of the windshield with the soft-top up.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Manual front seats with less-than-sporty bolstering offer generous space but could hold tighter. Tight rear-seat, though the 2 Series is similarly cramped. On the bright side, the ride is supple and the top creates a well-insulated cockpit when in place.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Top up, the A3 Cab is well-insulated from the elements. Talk radio on the highway is easy to hear. Top down, there's notable wind noise and buffeting at speed. Accessory wind-blocker helps but prevents rear seats from being used.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Manual front seats with less-than-sporty bolstering offer generous space but could hold tighter. Tight rear-seat, though the 2 Series is similarly cramped. On the bright side, the ride is supple and the top creates a well-insulated cockpit when in place.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Controls are well-placed for quick usage while driving. No awkward reaches. The knob-based MMI infotainment system is responsive and pretty easy to get the hang of. Central display screen provides crisp graphics and sensible menus.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Audi is renowned for its superlative interiors, and the A3 delivers. The austere dashboard takes Audi's minimalism to a new level, but the effect is distinctly upscale. Cramped backseat and trunk are on par with the 2 Series, but may make the two-seat TT Roadster seem more viable.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Long, heavy doors can make you think twice in tight spots. Sedan roots mean the front seats aren't too low; you don't fall down into them. Rear-seat access isn't the issue; it's the lack of space once you get back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Audi is renowned for its superlative interiors, and the A3 delivers. The austere dashboard takes Audi's minimalism to a new level, but the effect is distinctly upscale. Cramped backseat and trunk are on par with the 2 Series, but may make the two-seat TT Roadster seem more viable.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: No shortage of front space. Wheel telescopes out as far as you need. Rear seats have climate vents (nice) but hard armrests and little legroom, plus scant top-up headroom. Looks like a four-seater but more of a 2+2.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Audi is renowned for its superlative interiors, and the A3 delivers. The austere dashboard takes Audi's minimalism to a new level, but the effect is distinctly upscale. Cramped backseat and trunk are on par with the 2 Series, but may make the two-seat TT Roadster seem more viable.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Relatively thin windshield pillars mean excellent visibility out the front. Rear visibility is predictably limited with the top up. High beltline makes you feel ensconced within the car; short-waisted drivers might complain.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Audi is renowned for its superlative interiors, and the A3 delivers. The austere dashboard takes Audi's minimalism to a new level, but the effect is distinctly upscale. Cramped backseat and trunk are on par with the 2 Series, but may make the two-seat TT Roadster seem more viable.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3 Cabriolet's trunk is generous on paper at 10.1 cu-ft, and it's fine for a grocery run or a weekend getaway, but there's not enough width for a full set of golf clubs -- we had to take the driver out and put it in the cabin.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Audi is renowned for its superlative interiors, and the A3 delivers. The austere dashboard takes Audi's minimalism to a new level, but the effect is distinctly upscale. Cramped backseat and trunk are on par with the 2 Series, but may make the two-seat TT Roadster seem more viable.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3's power soft-top has a lot of real estate to cover from windshield to rear deck, and it shows in the leisurely 19.3 seconds required to power it down (20.5 seconds on the way up). The top stows neatly under its tonneau lid.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Audi is renowned for its superlative interiors, and the A3 delivers. The austere dashboard takes Audi's minimalism to a new level, but the effect is distinctly upscale. Cramped backseat and trunk are on par with the 2 Series, but may make the two-seat TT Roadster seem more viable.
title: Convertible Top

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Interior materials are beyond reproach, even in this entry-level Audi. Supple and/or thoughtfully textured materials are everywhere. Knobs and levers move with well-damped fluidity. Top-shelf engineering and construction.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A3 Cab's primary rival is the BMW 228i convertible. The Audi with the base 1.8-liter engine undercuts the 228i on price, but the 2.0-liter A3 loses that edge and still isn't as quick as the BMW. Competitive value, but nothing special. Mustang GT beckons with V8 power for less.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Lack of USB connectivity is glaring (proprietary cable is standard). As noted, "sport seats" that aren't sporty seem a strange choice for this luxury convertible. Bang & Olufsen stereo less powerful than expected; hard to hear music top-down at speed.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A3 Cab's primary rival is the BMW 228i convertible. The Audi with the base 1.8-liter engine undercuts the 228i on price, but the 2.0-liter A3 loses that edge and still isn't as quick as the BMW. Competitive value, but nothing special. Mustang GT beckons with V8 power for less.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3 convertible's pricing is generally in line with expectations, but our heavily optioned Prestige was around $50,000. Seems about what it should be.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A3 Cab's primary rival is the BMW 228i convertible. The Audi with the base 1.8-liter engine undercuts the 228i on price, but the 2.0-liter A3 loses that edge and still isn't as quick as the BMW. Competitive value, but nothing special. Mustang GT beckons with V8 power for less.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Against EPA estimates of 26 mpg combined (23 city/32 highway), we saw an impressive 30.9 mpg on our diverse evaluation loop. Laudable efficiency for a quick car with AWD.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A3 Cab's primary rival is the BMW 228i convertible. The Audi with the base 1.8-liter engine undercuts the 228i on price, but the 2.0-liter A3 loses that edge and still isn't as quick as the BMW. Competitive value, but nothing special. Mustang GT beckons with V8 power for less.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Audi's 4-year/50,000-mile comprehensive warranty is competitive for a luxury brand. Anti-corrosion coverage extends to 12 years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A3 Cab's primary rival is the BMW 228i convertible. The Audi with the base 1.8-liter engine undercuts the 228i on price, but the 2.0-liter A3 loses that edge and still isn't as quick as the BMW. Competitive value, but nothing special. Mustang GT beckons with V8 power for less.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The first scheduled maintenance is on the house, and the standard warranty includes free 24-hour roadside assistance. But BMW offers 4 years/50,000 miles' worth of free maintenance, including wear items.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A3 Cab's primary rival is the BMW 228i convertible. The Audi with the base 1.8-liter engine undercuts the 228i on price, but the 2.0-liter A3 loses that edge and still isn't as quick as the BMW. Competitive value, but nothing special. Mustang GT beckons with V8 power for less.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: With no dynamic weaknesses to speak of, the A3 2.0 TFSI Cabriolet almost always feels smooth, swift and sure of itself. It provides a proper luxury-car experience, lacking only the thrills of a more dedicated performance car.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The A3 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro convertible is poised and responsive on twisty roads, but the experience is more clinical than emotional. Although this Audi is a very well-executed product, it may lack visceral excitement for some drop-top shoppers.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro 2dr Convertible AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: As convertibles go, this one embodies the cold, calculating German-car stereotype. The engineers did a masterful job, but are you moved by the result? Some will love its relentless execution; others may yearn for a bit more spice.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The A3 2.0 TFSI Prestige quattro convertible is poised and responsive on twisty roads, but the experience is more clinical than emotional. Although this Audi is a very well-executed product, it may lack visceral excitement for some drop-top shoppers.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: There's some hesitation from a standstill, but once underway thrust from the turbocharged 4-cylinder is impressive, reaching 60 mph in a class-leading 5.8 seconds. The all-wheel drive gives plenty of grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque, the A3 provides plenty of power to accelerate with purpose yet still returns good fuel economy figures. Handling is noteworthy, with a direct feel and cornering that's both entertaining and reassuring.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: In panic braking there's little nosedive and the car tracks straight. It needed 118 feet to stop from 60 mph, which is better than average for the class and remained consistent after several runs.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque, the A3 provides plenty of power to accelerate with purpose yet still returns good fuel economy figures. Handling is noteworthy, with a direct feel and cornering that's both entertaining and reassuring.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Steering effort is light, making parking lot maneuvers easy, but still conveys  direct feedback to the driver. On winding roads, it is predictably precise and further instills confidence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque, the A3 provides plenty of power to accelerate with purpose yet still returns good fuel economy figures. Handling is noteworthy, with a direct feel and cornering that's both entertaining and reassuring.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3 feels light and athletic in curves. The Quattro AWD system makes the most of available grip and the well-tuned suspension gives it a balanced, reassuring feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque, the A3 provides plenty of power to accelerate with purpose yet still returns good fuel economy figures. Handling is noteworthy, with a direct feel and cornering that's both entertaining and reassuring.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Despite its compact appearance the A3 is surprisingly wide, yet still easy to maneuver in tight spaces thanks to its light steering. It tackles the everyday commute with ease.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 lb-ft of torque, the A3 provides plenty of power to accelerate with purpose yet still returns good fuel economy figures. Handling is noteworthy, with a direct feel and cornering that's both entertaining and reassuring.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Front seats are roomy and comfortable even after several hours of touring. They do lack some side bolstering, though. Rear seat space is restrictive and suitable for smaller passengers only.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: This is the kind of front seat comfort that we've come to expect from larger and more expensive sedans. Furthermore, the A3 manages this without sacrificing performance. The rear seats are cramped, but no more than other cars in this class.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3 finds a remarkable balance between cornering confidence and a compliant ride that smoothes over most road imperfections. Larger undulations can cause some uneasy jostling.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: This is the kind of front seat comfort that we've come to expect from larger and more expensive sedans. Furthermore, the A3 manages this without sacrificing performance. The rear seats are cramped, but no more than other cars in this class.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Road and wind noise are detectable on the highway, but never intrusive, even on rough pavement. There's some diesel-like clatter on start-up due to the direct injection, but the idle quickly smoothes out.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: This is the kind of front seat comfort that we've come to expect from larger and more expensive sedans. Furthermore, the A3 manages this without sacrificing performance. The rear seats are cramped, but no more than other cars in this class.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Controls are placed exactly where you'd expect them, especially the MMI controller with handwriting recognition. The central screen rises from the dash for easy viewing, with sharp graphics and intuitive menus.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like all Audis, the A3 sports an austere interior design, and that's a good thing. Tasteful aluminum accents, excellent material quality and a generous features list make this car feel anything but entry level.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Front seat access is easy even in tight spaces thanks to a tall opening and doors that aren't too long. Rear access is decidedly less simple, requiring some twisting and stooping to get in.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like all Audis, the A3 sports an austere interior design, and that's a good thing. Tasteful aluminum accents, excellent material quality and a generous features list make this car feel anything but entry level.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Front seats are roomy enough for taller passengers, but the rear seats lack the head and legroom needed for the average adult. Only small folks could possibly find comfort back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like all Audis, the A3 sports an austere interior design, and that's a good thing. Tasteful aluminum accents, excellent material quality and a generous features list make this car feel anything but entry level.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Forward visibility is excellent thanks to narrow roof pillars -- a rarity in modern cars. Rear visibility is good enough that you could get by without the optional backup camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like all Audis, the A3 sports an austere interior design, and that's a good thing. Tasteful aluminum accents, excellent material quality and a generous features list make this car feel anything but entry level.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The A3's trunk is the smallest in the class with only a 10 cu-ft capacity. Large golf bags or long clubs will require folding the rear seats down. Interior storage is also on the small side.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like all Audis, the A3 sports an austere interior design, and that's a good thing. Tasteful aluminum accents, excellent material quality and a generous features list make this car feel anything but entry level.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: All interior surfaces in the A3 are well textured for an upscale look and feel. Every knob and switch has a distinct heft and click, and the car just feels sturdy.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,795 the base A3 price is virtually identical to the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. The CLA has better fuel economy and a larger trunk, but its transmission lacks refinement and the rear seats are even tighter. The A3 is definitely more engaging to drive.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: As options are added, the Audi A3's price remains reasonably close to the CLA250's, with some packages pushing one car's tally past another's. The A3 benefits from AWD, which will soon be available on the CLA.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,795 the base A3 price is virtually identical to the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. The CLA has better fuel economy and a larger trunk, but its transmission lacks refinement and the rear seats are even tighter. The A3 is definitely more engaging to drive.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Even with the 2.0-liter engine with AWD and options like navigation, heated seats and upgraded interior trim, our A3's as-tested price of $36,645 is still lower than a similarly equipped front-drive CLA250.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,795 the base A3 price is virtually identical to the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. The CLA has better fuel economy and a larger trunk, but its transmission lacks refinement and the rear seats are even tighter. The A3 is definitely more engaging to drive.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: EPA estimates of 27 mpg Combined (24 City/33Hwy) seem attainable judging by the 33.7 mpg we achieved on our highway-heavy evaluation loop. Exuberant driving dropped our overall average to just 21.5 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,795 the base A3 price is virtually identical to the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. The CLA has better fuel economy and a larger trunk, but its transmission lacks refinement and the rear seats are even tighter. The A3 is definitely more engaging to drive.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Audi's 4-year/48,000-mile basic warranty essentially matches Mercedes' 4-year/50,000-mile coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,795 the base A3 price is virtually identical to the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. The CLA has better fuel economy and a larger trunk, but its transmission lacks refinement and the rear seats are even tighter. The A3 is definitely more engaging to drive.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Unlike Mercedes, the Audi's first scheduled maintenance is free. Both offer 4 years of 24-hour roadside assistance. Prepaid scheduled maintenance is available at extra cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,795 the base A3 price is virtually identical to the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. The CLA has better fuel economy and a larger trunk, but its transmission lacks refinement and the rear seats are even tighter. The A3 is definitely more engaging to drive.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Despite the A3's potential for performance, it remains well mannered in normal driving conditions and places few demands on the driver. On the whole, it delivers more than we expected.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The 2015 Audi A3 with the 2.0-liter turbo and obligatory all-wheel-drive is incredibly fun to drive on twisting mountain roads. It is impeccably balanced, with equal levels of performance and trust. It's as entertaining as the more expensive Mercedes CLA45 AMG.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: A3
style.name: 2.0 TFSI Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The 2015 A3 is unmistakably Audi in its execution, which is to say understated in style, more focused on driver engagement and embracing cutting-edge technology.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The 2015 Audi A3 with the 2.0-liter turbo and obligatory all-wheel-drive is incredibly fun to drive on twisting mountain roads. It is impeccably balanced, with equal levels of performance and trust. It's as entertaining as the more expensive Mercedes CLA45 AMG.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The A4 hit 60 mph in 6.5 seconds, which is typical for a small luxury sedan with a turbocharged four-cylinder. There is no engine upgrade, unlike most competitors. It's quick enough to satisfy most buyers.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: All-out performance is not the A4's strength. Acceleration is on par with other four-cylinder powered cars in this class, but its driver friendly handling is likely better than most customers will ever explore.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The A4's brakes proved sufficient to bring the compact sedan to a halt with confidence, though pedal feel is softer than some competitors. Stopping distances with all-season tires were typical for the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: All-out performance is not the A4's strength. Acceleration is on par with other four-cylinder powered cars in this class, but its driver friendly handling is likely better than most customers will ever explore.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The steering is precise and informative in all situations. Effort builds quickly, though some editors felt it was to a higher-than-necessary level.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: All-out performance is not the A4's strength. Acceleration is on par with other four-cylinder powered cars in this class, but its driver friendly handling is likely better than most customers will ever explore.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Handling is sure-footed and sporty but only average for the segment. The all-wheel-drive system is seamless and aids traction in all situations, not just rain or snow.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: All-out performance is not the A4's strength. Acceleration is on par with other four-cylinder powered cars in this class, but its driver friendly handling is likely better than most customers will ever explore.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The addition of an 8-speed automatic transmission that shifts seamlessly increases this car's desirability. The high-effort steering might surprise some buyers while cornering hard. At low speed, though, it's quite light.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: All-out performance is not the A4's strength. Acceleration is on par with other four-cylinder powered cars in this class, but its driver friendly handling is likely better than most customers will ever explore.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Power front seats with standard leather are supportive, well contoured and optionally heated. Rear seats are surprisingly accommodating for the compact category.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Unlike some other cars in its class, the A4 doesn't sacrifice comfort for performance. Seating, ride and noise intrusion are all tuned to soothe rather than challenge. Despite its aging platform, the A4 remains compteitively comfortable.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Only slightly biased toward sporty, the A4 offers a ride/handling balance that is at the top of its class. Despite its comfortable ride, the A4 holds its own when driven aggressively. Adjustable damping is available.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Unlike some other cars in its class, the A4 doesn't sacrifice comfort for performance. Seating, ride and noise intrusion are all tuned to soothe rather than challenge. Despite its aging platform, the A4 remains compteitively comfortable.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Wind and road noise are well isolated. The engine can drone at certain speeds, but only one driver commented on this. Overall, the engine note is pleasing and better than several others in the segment.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Unlike some other cars in its class, the A4 doesn't sacrifice comfort for performance. Seating, ride and noise intrusion are all tuned to soothe rather than challenge. Despite its aging platform, the A4 remains compteitively comfortable.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The A4's center console-mounted MMI controller will be a challenge for some users. Its single-knob, four-button interface isn't as intuitive as some. Otherwise, most controls in the A4 are easy to use and well located.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The A4 remains a benchmark for other manufacturers in terms of materials and construction, but its design is beginning to look dated and its controls aren't always straightforward.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Typical compact-sedan sized doors allow easy entry/exit. Wide opening angles ease entry.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The A4 remains a benchmark for other manufacturers in terms of materials and construction, but its design is beginning to look dated and its controls aren't always straightforward.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The A4 feels larger inside than its competitors and the rear seats have a surprising amount of room. With relatively basic shapes inside, the A4 offers a real sense of space relative to cars with more sculpted cockpits.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The A4 remains a benchmark for other manufacturers in terms of materials and construction, but its design is beginning to look dated and its controls aren't always straightforward.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: An upright seating position and thin pillars make for good visibility in every direction. Parking sensors, blind-spot monitoring and a reverse camera are optional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The A4 remains a benchmark for other manufacturers in terms of materials and construction, but its design is beginning to look dated and its controls aren't always straightforward.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: This sedan's 12.4 cu-ft of cargo space is adequate, but isn't as big as it appears. The low loading height is convenient. Split-fold rear seatbacks are optional to increase cargo-carrying ease.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The A4 remains a benchmark for other manufacturers in terms of materials and construction, but its design is beginning to look dated and its controls aren't always straightforward.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The A4 remains a solid-feeling machine offering quality assembly and high-end materials. We witnessed no quality problems and all gaps and seams were even.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With the exception of an average warranty, the Audi A4 represents a strong value in a highly competitive segment: generous standard features, quality materials and solid manufacturing. That the A4 offers one of the lowest starting prices in the segment is a bonus.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A4
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Considering all of this trim level's standards such as a ski-weekend-friendly turbocharged engine, all-wheel drive, and so on, it arrives well equipped for the money.

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The sweet and smooth turbocharged 2.0-liter inline-four offers plenty of low-end grunt and enough pep for a 6.3-second run to 60 mph. Need more power? Audi's 333-hp S5 and 450-hp RS 5 will suit you better, but cost much more.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The A5's four-cylinder turbocharged engine makes just 220 horsepower compared to some competitors' 300-plus. But standard all-wheel drive, inspiring handling and effective brakes make it competitive in ways beyond pure straightline speed.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Highly effective brakes offer excellent pedal feel and intuitive response and never whithered during extreme use. We recorded a best 60-0 mph panic-stop distance of 108 feet, which is excellent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The A5's four-cylinder turbocharged engine makes just 220 horsepower compared to some competitors' 300-plus. But standard all-wheel drive, inspiring handling and effective brakes make it competitive in ways beyond pure straightline speed.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We used to criticize Audi steering, but not anymore. It turns in precisely and offers a secure and substantial feel through turns, yet it's relaxed and never darty when driving straight on down the highway.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The A5's four-cylinder turbocharged engine makes just 220 horsepower compared to some competitors' 300-plus. But standard all-wheel drive, inspiring handling and effective brakes make it competitive in ways beyond pure straightline speed.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Sport suspension system that was part of our test car's S-Line Competition package proved its worth, making the A5 one of the best-handling luxury coupes we've ever tested. Only true sports cars provide better grip or agility.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The A5's four-cylinder turbocharged engine makes just 220 horsepower compared to some competitors' 300-plus. But standard all-wheel drive, inspiring handling and effective brakes make it competitive in ways beyond pure straightline speed.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Although not huge on power, the engine never feels sluggish. The clutch has an intuitive action and the 6-speed manual transmission's shifter glides with ease between gears. This is a highly competent and rewarding daily driver.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The A5's four-cylinder turbocharged engine makes just 220 horsepower compared to some competitors' 300-plus. But standard all-wheel drive, inspiring handling and effective brakes make it competitive in ways beyond pure straightline speed.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Front seats supply generous dimensions, the optional S-Line versions proving extremely comfortable and highly adjustable. The rear seats (there are only two) have decent leg- and shoulder-room but are noticeably short on headroom.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite optional sport suspension and performance tires, the A5 offers surprisingly good comfort. A quiet and smooth ride combines with great front seats and standard tri-zone air conditioning to pamper passengers.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Absent Audi's optional adaptive suspension, but with our example's sport suspension, ride comfort is remarkably good. Only the busiest surfaces cause mild annoyance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite optional sport suspension and performance tires, the A5 offers surprisingly good comfort. A quiet and smooth ride combines with great front seats and standard tri-zone air conditioning to pamper passengers.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Wind noise barely registers. Same story with engine noise. However, the short sidewalls on the summer tires slap audibly over highway seams while coarse pavement stirs up quite a hum.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite optional sport suspension and performance tires, the A5 offers surprisingly good comfort. A quiet and smooth ride combines with great front seats and standard tri-zone air conditioning to pamper passengers.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: As multi-controllers go, Audi's MMI lacks intuitiveness and presentation. It requires study and frequent glances to navigate displays and options within screens. Music-storage devices must be connected through the glovebox.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's no question the A5's interior is handsome, well equipped and impeccably built. However, there are some ergonomic, packaging and storage realities for this intimate coupe.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The large coupe doors can make entry/exit difficult in angled parking. Also, without a roof-mounted grab handle, falling into and climbing out of the rear seats is unusually difficult.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's no question the A5's interior is handsome, well equipped and impeccably built. However, there are some ergonomic, packaging and storage realities for this intimate coupe.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The A5 caters to front-seat passengers, as most coupes do, but this is an intimate setting. The two rear passengers enjoy a decent-sized window, but they'll rub the headliner if they're taller than five-foot-nine.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's no question the A5's interior is handsome, well equipped and impeccably built. However, there are some ergonomic, packaging and storage realities for this intimate coupe.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The A5 has large rear-side windows and relatively slender rear pillars, giving good visibility. Optional visibility aids include xenon headlamps, a rearview camera, parking sensors, blind-spot monitor and adaptive cruise control.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's no question the A5's interior is handsome, well equipped and impeccably built. However, there are some ergonomic, packaging and storage realities for this intimate coupe.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Despite a large glovebox, the A5 lacks small-item storage, with a notably small center armrest bin. But cupholders are robust, including bottle holders in the doors. Rear seats fold, but trunk only holds 12.2 cubic-feet.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's no question the A5's interior is handsome, well equipped and impeccably built. However, there are some ergonomic, packaging and storage realities for this intimate coupe.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: There isn't a seam, surface or knob that doesn't exude exacting assembly or top-tier quality. Solid-feeling and impeccable to look at. Clearly, this is where a good portion of your money went.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A5's base MSRP of $39,895 is less than most rivals, even with its standard all-wheel drive, but the engine lacks power. Start adding high-cost bundled options and our car's $50,845 as-tested price is a tough pill to swallow. Excellent fuel economy is a plus, however.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Standard equipment includes a 4-cylinder turbo engine, all-wheel drive, halogen headlamps, fog lights, tilt-only glass roof, Bluetooth, tri-zone climate control, leather seats, satellite radio and a single-CD/SD-card player.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A5's base MSRP of $39,895 is less than most rivals, even with its standard all-wheel drive, but the engine lacks power. Start adding high-cost bundled options and our car's $50,845 as-tested price is a tough pill to swallow. Excellent fuel economy is a plus, however.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Our example's sport package, intelligent key and push-button start, xenon headlamps, LED tail lights, heated seats with driver memory function, auto-dimming mirrors, navigation and multi-controller pushed the total to $50,845.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A5's base MSRP of $39,895 is less than most rivals, even with its standard all-wheel drive, but the engine lacks power. Start adding high-cost bundled options and our car's $50,845 as-tested price is a tough pill to swallow. Excellent fuel economy is a plus, however.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The A5 is rated by the EPA at 26 mpg Combined (22 City/32 Highway). We managed 32.3 mpg on the 116-mile Edmunds evaluation loop, and 25.6 mpg over the car's 449 mile stay with us.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A5's base MSRP of $39,895 is less than most rivals, even with its standard all-wheel drive, but the engine lacks power. Start adding high-cost bundled options and our car's $50,845 as-tested price is a tough pill to swallow. Excellent fuel economy is a plus, however.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Both the basic warranty and drivetrain coverage last for 4 years/50,000 miles. That's average for this segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A5's base MSRP of $39,895 is less than most rivals, even with its standard all-wheel drive, but the engine lacks power. Start adding high-cost bundled options and our car's $50,845 as-tested price is a tough pill to swallow. Excellent fuel economy is a plus, however.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Roadside assistance is covered for 4 years/unlimited miles, but only the first scheduled maintenance visit is free.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The A5's base MSRP of $39,895 is less than most rivals, even with its standard all-wheel drive, but the engine lacks power. Start adding high-cost bundled options and our car's $50,845 as-tested price is a tough pill to swallow. Excellent fuel economy is a plus, however.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: There's a real sense of connection to the A5 with its direct steering, reassuring brakes and confident handling. Sure, it would be more fun with more power and a husky voice, but silent satisfaction has its merit too.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Yes, some coupes are quicker than the A5. But few pack as much sexy sophistication or thrilling sports-car handling into one sleek wrapper the way this 4-seat Audi does.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: A5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Sleek and sporty, the Audi A5 has allure beyond raw 0-60 times. It's equally as impressive pulling up to the valet as it is clicking off miles during a couple's weekend getaway.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Yes, some coupes are quicker than the A5. But few pack as much sexy sophistication or thrilling sports-car handling into one sleek wrapper the way this 4-seat Audi does.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: In our testing the Q5 reached 60 mph in 6.7 seconds, which is comparable to other SUVs in this class. Shifts are smooth and quick from the 8-speed automatic transmission, while traction from the Quattro AWD system is plentiful.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 pound-feet of torque from the base 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder, there's plenty of power to get the Q5 up to speed with confidence. Handling is sporty for a crossover SUV and braking is good for the class. It's an SUV for those who enjoy a little performance.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: In panic braking from 60 mph, the Q5 only needed 114 feet to come to a stop (best in class) and distances remained consistent. Nosedive is minimal and the vehicle was composed and controllable. Around-town modulation was normal.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 pound-feet of torque from the base 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder, there's plenty of power to get the Q5 up to speed with confidence. Handling is sporty for a crossover SUV and braking is good for the class. It's an SUV for those who enjoy a little performance.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The Q5's heavier steering effort is appropriate for its sport-themed intentions. We wish for a bit more steering feedback, but overall it's precise and turn-in is intuitive. It lightens up nicely at low speeds for effortless parking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 pound-feet of torque from the base 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder, there's plenty of power to get the Q5 up to speed with confidence. Handling is sporty for a crossover SUV and braking is good for the class. It's an SUV for those who enjoy a little performance.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Get the Q5 on a twisty mountain pass and you'll experience one of the few SUVs that's entertaining to drive hard. Confident balance and all-wheel-drive provide impressive traction. Body roll is prevalent but far from excessive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 pound-feet of torque from the base 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder, there's plenty of power to get the Q5 up to speed with confidence. Handling is sporty for a crossover SUV and braking is good for the class. It's an SUV for those who enjoy a little performance.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Other than its stiff ride, the Q5 is easy to live with on a daily basis, whether you're backing into a tight parking spot, driving aggressively in the canyons or anything in between.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 220 hp and 258 pound-feet of torque from the base 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder, there's plenty of power to get the Q5 up to speed with confidence. Handling is sporty for a crossover SUV and braking is good for the class. It's an SUV for those who enjoy a little performance.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The standard 8-way power-adjustable leather seats provide appropriate support for a variety of body types. The sliding and reclining rear seats (cool feature) are also quite comfortable for adults, even on long trips.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: In most areas the Q5 delivers high levels of comfort. This is especially true in terms of the seats and the quiet cabin. The one drawback is the suspension's inability to soak up bumps like competitors. Otherwise, it is just as luxurious as competing SUVs.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: While we wouldn't quantify the Q5's ride as harsh, it is stiffer than rivals. The bumps aren't intrusive, but occupants will get jostled around more so than in competing SUVs.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: In most areas the Q5 delivers high levels of comfort. This is especially true in terms of the seats and the quiet cabin. The one drawback is the suspension's inability to soak up bumps like competitors. Otherwise, it is just as luxurious as competing SUVs.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Road and wind noise are barely detectable and engine noise is noticeable only under hard acceleration. Overall the cabin is as pleasantly calm and quiet as any other luxury SUV.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: In most areas the Q5 delivers high levels of comfort. This is especially true in terms of the seats and the quiet cabin. The one drawback is the suspension's inability to soak up bumps like competitors. Otherwise, it is just as luxurious as competing SUVs.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Controls are well placed, and all display and gauges are easy to read at a quick glance. Like competing systems, the MMI infotainment interface takes some getting used to, but becomes simple and intuitive after a short time.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Front- and rear-seat access is easy, even in tight spaces, thanks to short doors that open wide. Ride height isn't overly high, so entry doesn't require much more effort than with a typical sedan.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: There's no shortage of front headroom or legroom. Sliding/reclining rear seats offer more legroom than rivals, accommodating adult passengers even on all-day adventures.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Forward visibility is mostly unobstructed, but the rear view is somewhat hampered by thick roof pillars. Still, backing into a parking spot is relatively easy, especially with the optional rearview camera and parking sensors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Trunk capacity is a best-in-class 29.1 cu-ft., though the rear-seats-folded/max capacity space of 57.3 cu-ft is just average. Remote releases simplify seat folding. Interior bins and cupholders are adequate but not particularly generous.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Interior surfaces have nice textures for an upscale look and feel. Every knob and switch has a distinct heft and click, this car feels sturdy and extremely well built.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The base Q5 comes with all-wheel drive, leather upholstery and tri-zone climate control, most of which are are options on rivals. Even as options are added, its price advantage remains strong against its chief competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: With the Premium Plus and navigation options added, the Q5's as-tested price climbs to $45,645. A similarly equipped all-wheel-drive BMW X3 will cost about $1,500 more and a Mercedes GLK runs about $5,000 more.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: EPA estimates for the Q5 are 23 mpg Combined (20 City/28 Highway), comparable numbers to others in the class. On our highway-heavy evaluation loop we attained 26.2 mpg. Its overall average came to just 20.0 mpg, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Audi's 4-year/50,000-mile basic and powertrain warranties are similar to the competition. So is an extended warranty, at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Four years of roadside assistance, plus the first scheduled maintenance is free. BMW includes 4 years of free maintenance, which is the most generous in the class. Audi and Mercedes both offer a prepaid maintenance program.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Whether you're road tripping, commuting or enjoying its potential for performance, the Q5 does it all with ease and confidence. As with many SUVs in this class, it drives much like the smaller sedan upon which it's based.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Audi Q5 is actually quite fun to toss around on a curvy road. With standard all-wheel drive, there's a considerable amount of grip, which further instills confidence. Even with the base 4-cylinder turbo engine, it should exceed expectations for most drivers.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The Q5 is unmistakably Audi in its execution, which is to say understated in style and more focused on driver engagement, while embracing cutting-edge technology.
