style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Forward visibility is mostly unobstructed, but the rear view is somewhat hampered by thick roof pillars. Still, backing into a parking spot is relatively easy, especially with the optional rearview camera and parking sensors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Trunk capacity is a best-in-class 29.1 cu-ft., though the rear-seats-folded/max capacity space of 57.3 cu-ft is just average. Remote releases simplify seat folding. Interior bins and cupholders are adequate but not particularly generous.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Q5's interior follows Audi's austere yet tasteful design. The cabin has a more modern look and feel than most in the compact luxury SUV class. Features are plentiful and the quality of materials is superb.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Interior surfaces have nice textures for an upscale look and feel. Every knob and switch has a distinct heft and click, this car feels sturdy and extremely well built.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The base Q5 comes with all-wheel drive, leather upholstery and tri-zone climate control, most of which are are options on rivals. Even as options are added, its price advantage remains strong against its chief competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: With the Premium Plus and navigation options added, the Q5's as-tested price climbs to $45,645. A similarly equipped all-wheel-drive BMW X3 will cost about $1,500 more and a Mercedes GLK runs about $5,000 more.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: EPA estimates for the Q5 are 23 mpg Combined (20 City/28 Highway), comparable numbers to others in the class. On our highway-heavy evaluation loop we attained 26.2 mpg. Its overall average came to just 20.0 mpg, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Audi's 4-year/50,000-mile basic and powertrain warranties are similar to the competition. So is an extended warranty, at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Four years of roadside assistance, plus the first scheduled maintenance is free. BMW includes 4 years of free maintenance, which is the most generous in the class. Audi and Mercedes both offer a prepaid maintenance program.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $38,195, the Audi Q5 costs about $2,000 less than the all-wheel-drive BMW X3 or Mercedes-Benz GLK 4Matic. It also gains an advantage by having more standard features, and it maintains that savings as you check off options on the order sheet.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Whether you're road tripping, commuting or enjoying its potential for performance, the Q5 does it all with ease and confidence. As with many SUVs in this class, it drives much like the smaller sedan upon which it's based.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Audi Q5 is actually quite fun to toss around on a curvy road. With standard all-wheel drive, there's a considerable amount of grip, which further instills confidence. Even with the base 4-cylinder turbo engine, it should exceed expectations for most drivers.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: Q5
style.name: 2.0T Premium quattro 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The Q5 is unmistakably Audi in its execution, which is to say understated in style and more focused on driver engagement, while embracing cutting-edge technology.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Audi Q5 is actually quite fun to toss around on a curvy road. With standard all-wheel drive, there's a considerable amount of grip, which further instills confidence. Even with the base 4-cylinder turbo engine, it should exceed expectations for most drivers.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder feels stronger than 292 hp. Although it can be reluctant leaving the line, once it builds revs, it sprints forward, hitting 60 mph in just 4.6 sec. Six-speed automatic transmission is smooth, quick shifting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: What happens when you combine a fantastic engine with a sensational chassis? You get the incredibly capable S3. The turbo-four is smooth and eager to rev, with a wallop of mid-range torque. Handling is stunning, the steering near-perfect. Low-speed driveability could be improved.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Excellent braking abilities, stopping from 60 mph in 107 feet. Pedal was always firm, and the S3 stopped without any side-to-side squirm. A bit touchy at low speeds, but in most situations the brakes felt powerful and confidence-inspiring.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: What happens when you combine a fantastic engine with a sensational chassis? You get the incredibly capable S3. The turbo-four is smooth and eager to rev, with a wallop of mid-range torque. Handling is stunning, the steering near-perfect. Low-speed driveability could be improved.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Incredibly sharp steering, quick without being darty. More important, it gives good feedback to the driver, meaning the electric-assist steering doesn't completely isolate the road or the grip level of the tires from the driver.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: What happens when you combine a fantastic engine with a sensational chassis? You get the incredibly capable S3. The turbo-four is smooth and eager to rev, with a wallop of mid-range torque. Handling is stunning, the steering near-perfect. Low-speed driveability could be improved.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: This car is glued to the road, thanks to sticky tires but also the stiff suspension which keeps body roll nearly nonexistent. Aim this car at a corner, and it goes exactly where you point it. Some drivers might feel it's too planted.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: What happens when you combine a fantastic engine with a sensational chassis? You get the incredibly capable S3. The turbo-four is smooth and eager to rev, with a wallop of mid-range torque. Handling is stunning, the steering near-perfect. Low-speed driveability could be improved.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Driveability is marred slightly by touchy brakes in stop-and-go traffic, and some delay from the engine/transmission when leaving a stoplight. But it has great passing power, feels light and small and is generally an easy car to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: What happens when you combine a fantastic engine with a sensational chassis? You get the incredibly capable S3. The turbo-four is smooth and eager to rev, with a wallop of mid-range torque. Handling is stunning, the steering near-perfect. Low-speed driveability could be improved.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Front seats have stout cushions. Not uncomfortable, but far from plush. Wide and roomy with less lateral support than most sport seats. Door armrests have good cushioning. Rear seats provide good support but seatback is quite upright.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The S3 doesn't coddle you like a luxury sedan. The seats don't have an abundance of cushioning. The ride is firm, certainly not as supple as most BMWs, but the suspension is adjustable, and it never gets truly objectionable. Interior noise is kept to acceptable levels.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: If you like a floaty ride, this isn't your car. Even the suspension's Comfort mode can feel stiff over rough roads, Dynamic setting isn't tolerable on bumpy stuff. But it's considerably less jouncy than the Subaru STI or Mercedes CLA45 AMG.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The S3 doesn't coddle you like a luxury sedan. The seats don't have an abundance of cushioning. The ride is firm, certainly not as supple as most BMWs, but the suspension is adjustable, and it never gets truly objectionable. Interior noise is kept to acceptable levels.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Some tire hum over most surfaces thanks to performance tires, but wind noise is well controlled. You can hear the engine just slightly at highway speeds. Turbo-four makes exciting noises during acceleration, sounds like a 5-cylinder.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The S3 doesn't coddle you like a luxury sedan. The seats don't have an abundance of cushioning. The ride is firm, certainly not as supple as most BMWs, but the suspension is adjustable, and it never gets truly objectionable. Interior noise is kept to acceptable levels.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Despite the minimalist center stack, controls are where you expect them, easy to use. We always turn the MMI knob the wrong direction, though. Love the infinitely-swiveling circular dash vents. Optional finger-writing recognition is cool.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is an amped-up version of the A3, with sportier, S3-specific touches throughout. Most controls work well, although the boost gauge is gimmicky. Wider door sills hurt entry/exit a bit, and the trunk is small for the segment.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Front doors are relatively long and open wide. Roof isn't too low, only have to stoop a bit. Wide door sills are a hindrance, easy to brush your leg. Rear doors are small but entryway is reasonable, though foot gets hung up on way out.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is an amped-up version of the A3, with sportier, S3-specific touches throughout. Most controls work well, although the boost gauge is gimmicky. Wider door sills hurt entry/exit a bit, and the trunk is small for the segment.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Decent but not abundant front headroom, partly because seat height is higher than you'd expect. Door-side elbow room is excellent. Center console infringes on driver's right knee space. Rear headroom will be tight for most adults.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is an amped-up version of the A3, with sportier, S3-specific touches throughout. Most controls work well, although the boost gauge is gimmicky. Wider door sills hurt entry/exit a bit, and the trunk is small for the segment.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Windshield pillars are exceptionally narrow, though side pillars obstruct lane changes. Rear pillars are also thick and rear window is short. Test car had optional rearview camera and front/rear parking sensors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is an amped-up version of the A3, with sportier, S3-specific touches throughout. Most controls work well, although the boost gauge is gimmicky. Wider door sills hurt entry/exit a bit, and the trunk is small for the segment.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Decent-sized door pockets but tiny sliver of a front bin. Center armrest bin is just large enough to be useful. Cupholders have good anti-tip. The 10.0-cu-ft trunk is small but opening is wide. Rear seats fold down, pass-through is large.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is an amped-up version of the A3, with sportier, S3-specific touches throughout. Most controls work well, although the boost gauge is gimmicky. Wider door sills hurt entry/exit a bit, and the trunk is small for the segment.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: High-quality materials, and they look good, too. Beautiful thick-rimmed steering wheel. Knobs and buttons have heft, car feels sturdy. We did notice a squeak from the plastic center console if we we rubbed our knee against it.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good, though a rearview camera doesn't come standard.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: At its starting price of around $42k, the S3 comes with AWD, a 6-sp. automatic, panoramic sunroof, leather, dual-zone climate control, a 10-spkr audio system and Audi Drive Select (parameters for transmission, steering and engine sound).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good, though a rearview camera doesn't come standard.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Prestige level (as with our test car) tacks on $5,900, gets you navigation with voice control and handwriting recognition, rearview camera with parking senors, blind-spot warning and 14-spkr audio. Perf. pkg brings magnetic suspension.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good, though a rearview camera doesn't come standard.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The EPA rates the S3 at 26 mpg combined (23 city/31 highway), nearly identical to the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and BMW 328i xDrive. Due to the S3's fun-to-drive nature, we averaged just 20.5 mpg overall, but 24.1 mpg on our evaluation loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good, though a rearview camera doesn't come standard.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The bumper-to-bumper and powertrain warranties are 4 years/50,000 miles, matching Mercedes. The Subaru STI has shorter basic coverage but longer powertrain. The S3 is protected against rust for 12 years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good, though a rearview camera doesn't come standard.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Unlike Mercedes, the Audi's first scheduled maintenance is free. Of course, BMW offers free maintenance for 4 years/50,000 miles. Audi gives you free roadside assistance for four years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good, though a rearview camera doesn't come standard.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: If you want a subcompact sport sedan, look no further. The interior is upscale, the suspension is adjustable and other than size, it doesn't remind you it's a small car. There's always plenty of power at your disposal. It feels special.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The S3 is a fantastic driving machine. It may not be the best tourer ever, thanks to firm seats and a ride that's on the stiff side, but on a twisty road you'll be wowed by the level of precision and driver feedback. You'll revel in the turbo engine's mid-range punch.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Although it would be nice if a manual transmission were available (it's not), this S3 is plenty character-ful. You can adjust several parameters between sporty and sedate, and the styling isn't in-your-face about its intentions.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive

ratings.summary: The interior is an amped-up version of the A3, with sportier, S3-specific touches throughout. Most controls work well, although the boost gauge is gimmicky. Wider door sills hurt entry/exit a bit, and the trunk is small for the segment.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: High-quality materials, and they look good, too. Beautiful thick-rimmed steering wheel. Knobs and buttons have heft, car feels sturdy. We did notice a squeak from the plastic center console if we we rubbed our knee against it.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good and now comes standard with a rearview camera and parking sensors.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: At its starting price of around $42k, the S3 comes with AWD, a 6-sp. automatic, panoramic sunroof, leather, dual-zone climate control, a 10-spkr audio system and Audi Drive Select (parameters for transmission, steering and engine sound).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good and now comes standard with a rearview camera and parking sensors.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Prestige level (as with our test car) tacks on about $6,000, gets you navigation with voice control and handwriting recognition, blind spot warning and 14-speaker audio. Performance package includes magnetic suspension.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good and now comes standard with a rearview camera and parking sensors.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The EPA rates the S3 at 26 mpg combined (23 city/31 highway), nearly identical to the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and BMW 328i xDrive. Due to the S3's fun-to-drive nature, we averaged just 20.5 mpg overall, but 24.1 mpg on our evaluation loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good and now comes standard with a rearview camera and parking sensors.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The bumper-to-bumper and powertrain warranties are 4 years/50,000 miles, matching Mercedes. The Subaru STI has shorter basic coverage but longer powertrain. The S3 is protected against rust for 12 years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good and now comes standard with a rearview camera and parking sensors.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Unlike Mercedes, the Audi's first scheduled maintenance is free. Of course, BMW offers free maintenance for 4 years/50,000 miles. Audi gives you free roadside assistance for four years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S3's base price comes in a few thousand dollars less than the Mercedes CLA45 AMG and the BMW M235i. The Subaru STI is thousands less, but at the cost of much refinement. S3 feature content is good and now comes standard with a rearview camera and parking sensors.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: If you want a subcompact sport sedan, look no further. The interior is upscale, the suspension is adjustable and other than size, it doesn't remind you it's a small car. There's always plenty of power at your disposal. It feels special.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The S3 is a fantastic driving machine. It may not be the best tourer ever, thanks to firm seats and a ride that's on the stiff side, but on a twisty road you'll be wowed by the level of precision and driver feedback. You'll revel in the turbo engine's mid-range punch.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: S3
style.name: 2.0T Prestige quattro 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Although it would be nice if a manual transmission were available (it's not), this S3 is plenty character-ful. You can adjust several parameters between sporty and sedate, and the styling isn't in-your-face about its intentions.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The S3 is a fantastic driving machine. It may not be the best tourer ever, thanks to firm seats and a ride that's on the stiff side, but on a twisty road you'll be wowed by the level of precision and driver feedback. You'll revel in the turbo engine's mid-range punch.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Don't fret the loss of the last S5's throaty V8, because this new 333-hp supercharged 3.0-liter V6 is quicker, with 0-60 mph in just 4.6 seconds. The 7-speed automated manual transmission's built-in launch mode certainly helps.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Audi S5 is one of the most well-rounded sport coupes available today, offering blistering performance and, here's the tricky part, everyday driveability. It's quicker than the previous V8-powered S5 coupe, as well as its arch-rival, the BMW 435i.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: The S5's brakes are ideal for everyday use as well as extreme occasions. The pedal is reassuringly firm and easy to modulate, making for jerk-free stops around town. Our best 60-0 mph panic-stop distance was 108 feet, which is excellent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Audi S5 is one of the most well-rounded sport coupes available today, offering blistering performance and, here's the tricky part, everyday driveability. It's quicker than the previous V8-powered S5 coupe, as well as its arch-rival, the BMW 435i.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: The S5 turns in confidently and precisely, yet it's relaxed and never darty when driving straight down the highway. This is steering done right.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Audi S5 is one of the most well-rounded sport coupes available today, offering blistering performance and, here's the tricky part, everyday driveability. It's quicker than the previous V8-powered S5 coupe, as well as its arch-rival, the BMW 435i.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Only outright sports cars offer similar grip or agility. The S5's standard multi-mode sport suspension system makes it one of the best-handling sport/luxury coupes we've ever tested. All-wheel drive helps it feel secure  through turns.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Audi S5 is one of the most well-rounded sport coupes available today, offering blistering performance and, here's the tricky part, everyday driveability. It's quicker than the previous V8-powered S5 coupe, as well as its arch-rival, the BMW 435i.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: One might expect a rapid and agile coupe to be high-strung, but the S5's dual-personality engine, smooth-shifting transmission and 3-way adjustable suspension and steering make it easy to drive, whether you're feeling calm or aggressive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Audi S5 is one of the most well-rounded sport coupes available today, offering blistering performance and, here's the tricky part, everyday driveability. It's quicker than the previous V8-powered S5 coupe, as well as its arch-rival, the BMW 435i.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: The front seats provide a wide range of adjustability. Rear passengers (only two) will have to make do with reduced headroom, but they get their own temperature controls and legroom is decent.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The exceptional S Line front seats combine with adaptive suspension and above-average road/wind isolation to offer an uncommonly comfortable car. Especially so considering this is a dedicated sport coupe.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Better than most sport coupes in this regard thanks to the S5's standard 3-way adjustable adaptive suspension that easily soaks up all manner of road imperfections.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The exceptional S Line front seats combine with adaptive suspension and above-average road/wind isolation to offer an uncommonly comfortable car. Especially so considering this is a dedicated sport coupe.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Wind- and road-noise are well isolated. Coarse surfaces, however, sometimes cause the aggressive tires to hum and sizzle at highway speeds.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The exceptional S Line front seats combine with adaptive suspension and above-average road/wind isolation to offer an uncommonly comfortable car. Especially so considering this is a dedicated sport coupe.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Audi's MMI multi-controller and menu structure lack intuitive operation. The presentation also looks a bit antiquated and clumsy in comparison to newer Audi models. Music-storage devices must be connected through the glovebox. Silly.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Because there's only so much volume and real estate in a two-door coupe, some ergonomic and access issues are to be expected. Also, this generation of Audi's infotainment system is in need of an update.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Tight parking spots will be a problem with these long coupe doors, causing difficult entry/exit. Especially if you're trying to squeeze out of the back seats, which do without roof-mounted grab handles.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Because there's only so much volume and real estate in a two-door coupe, some ergonomic and access issues are to be expected. Also, this generation of Audi's infotainment system is in need of an update.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: As with most coupes, the S5 accommodates front-seat passengers better than those in the rear. Dimensions and roominess are noticeably tight in back.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Because there's only so much volume and real estate in a two-door coupe, some ergonomic and access issues are to be expected. Also, this generation of Audi's infotainment system is in need of an update.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Unlike many coupes, the S5's large side rear windows and slender pillars afford good visibility. A rearview camera, parking sensors, blind-spot monitor and adaptive cruise control are optional bonuses.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Because there's only so much volume and real estate in a two-door coupe, some ergonomic and access issues are to be expected. Also, this generation of Audi's infotainment system is in need of an update.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: A large glovebox and robust cupholders (plus bottle holders in the doors) are helpful because the S5 otherwise lacks interior storage with its small center-armrest bin and no cubbies. Rear seats fold, but trunk is just 12.2 cubic-feet.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Because there's only so much volume and real estate in a two-door coupe, some ergonomic and access issues are to be expected. Also, this generation of Audi's infotainment system is in need of an update.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: There isn't a seam, surface or knob that doesn't exude exacting assembly or top-tier quality. Solid-feeling and impeccable to look at. Clearly, this is where a good portion of your money goes.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S5's base MSRP of $54,295 is midpack among rivals also equipped with all-wheel drive. Luckily there are few options available or even needed to fully appreciate the S5. Build quality is superb, but fuel economy, not surprisingly, isn't exactly a strong suit.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Standard equipment includes all-wheel drive, xenon headlamps, LED running- and taillights, tilt-only glass roof, Bluetooth, tri-zone climate control, heated leather sport seats, satellite radio and a single-CD/SD-card player.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S5's base MSRP of $54,295 is midpack among rivals also equipped with all-wheel drive. Luckily there are few options available or even needed to fully appreciate the S5. Build quality is superb, but fuel economy, not surprisingly, isn't exactly a strong suit.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: We could live without most of our test car's cosmetic options, and maybe even the MMI multi-controller and navigation, so the $61,345 as-tested price is a little inflated. We'd be plenty happy with the base car. You will be, too.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S5's base MSRP of $54,295 is midpack among rivals also equipped with all-wheel drive. Luckily there are few options available or even needed to fully appreciate the S5. Build quality is superb, but fuel economy, not surprisingly, isn't exactly a strong suit.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: The S5 is rated by the EPA at 21 mpg Combined (18 City/28 Highway). We managed 23.2 mpg on the 116-mile Edmunds evaluation loop. However, a BMW 435i got 28.4 mpg on the same route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S5's base MSRP of $54,295 is midpack among rivals also equipped with all-wheel drive. Luckily there are few options available or even needed to fully appreciate the S5. Build quality is superb, but fuel economy, not surprisingly, isn't exactly a strong suit.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Both the basic warranty and drivetrain coverage last for 4 years/50,000 miles. That's average for this segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S5's base MSRP of $54,295 is midpack among rivals also equipped with all-wheel drive. Luckily there are few options available or even needed to fully appreciate the S5. Build quality is superb, but fuel economy, not surprisingly, isn't exactly a strong suit.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Roadside assistance is covered for 4 years/unlimited miles, but only the first scheduled maintenance visit is free.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The S5's base MSRP of $54,295 is midpack among rivals also equipped with all-wheel drive. Luckily there are few options available or even needed to fully appreciate the S5. Build quality is superb, but fuel economy, not surprisingly, isn't exactly a strong suit.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: Driving the S5 is a remarkably low-impact experience considering its performance potential and capabilities. Easy to live with everyday, just right for road trips and thrilling when you need it to be.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: This is a shockingly-quick coupe, aided by the nearly effortless rapid-fire automated-manual transmission (which operates pretty much like a traditional automatic). Add to this the S5's thrilling sports-car handling and sophisticated styling and you've got a winning combination.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: S5
style.name: Premium Plus quattro 2dr Coupe AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 7AM)
summary: So many cars purport to have a Jekyll and Hyde personality, but the S5 is the archetype for the claim. There's a supercharged monster lurking beneath the sleek, unadorned exterior. Yet if you drive it normally, you'd never know.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: This is a shockingly-quick coupe, aided by the nearly effortless rapid-fire automated-manual transmission (which operates pretty much like a traditional automatic). Add to this the S5's thrilling sports-car handling and sophisticated styling and you've got a winning combination.
title: Personality

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: What an engine! A 3.0-liter supercharged V6 with 354 hp, combined with all-wheel drive and quick-shifting 8-speed automatic. The SQ5 blisters to 60 mph in just 5.0 sec., with plenty of power for any passing maneuver. Sounds great, too.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The SQ5 performs pretty much as it should. It's sneaky quick, thanks to a powerful engine which puts a grin on your face every time you hit the gas pedal. We recorded a downright amazing panic-stop distance. Stiff suspension and sticky tires help it take corners with ease.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Our measured panic-stop distance was just 103 feet, thanks in part to summer performance tires. Stopping distances were super-consistent with zero pedal fade. Around town the brakes provided smooth, strong power with no touchiness.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The SQ5 performs pretty much as it should. It's sneaky quick, thanks to a powerful engine which puts a grin on your face every time you hit the gas pedal. We recorded a downright amazing panic-stop distance. Stiff suspension and sticky tires help it take corners with ease.
title: Braking

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: The steering is adjustable, via Audi Drive Select, between Auto, Comfort and Dynamic. We preferred the higher-effort feel of the Dynamic setting in testing. It turns in sharply but it doesn't deliver a whole lot of feel to the driver.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The SQ5 performs pretty much as it should. It's sneaky quick, thanks to a powerful engine which puts a grin on your face every time you hit the gas pedal. We recorded a downright amazing panic-stop distance. Stiff suspension and sticky tires help it take corners with ease.
title: Steering

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: An intrusive stability control system adversely affected our instrumented handling numbers. But on back roads the SQ5 was superb, devouring turns with ease. Although the ride is stiff, it remained composed over bumps.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The SQ5 performs pretty much as it should. It's sneaky quick, thanks to a powerful engine which puts a grin on your face every time you hit the gas pedal. We recorded a downright amazing panic-stop distance. Stiff suspension and sticky tires help it take corners with ease.
title: Handling

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Supple gas pedal action, easy-to-modulate brakes, a smart and smooth-shifting transmission and a nice, small overall size. Instant power from the supercharged engine. The stiff ride can be annoying on pothole-strewn streets.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The SQ5 performs pretty much as it should. It's sneaky quick, thanks to a powerful engine which puts a grin on your face every time you hit the gas pedal. We recorded a downright amazing panic-stop distance. Stiff suspension and sticky tires help it take corners with ease.
title: Driveability

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: All-wheel drive will only get you so far off-road with the SQ5's stiff suspension and low-profile summer tires. This vehicle was designed with on-road driving in mind.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The SQ5 performs pretty much as it should. It's sneaky quick, thanks to a powerful engine which puts a grin on your face every time you hit the gas pedal. We recorded a downright amazing panic-stop distance. Stiff suspension and sticky tires help it take corners with ease.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Well-padded leather sport seats are firm but stay comfortable all day. Big side bolsters hold you in place during cornering. Door and center armrests are minimally padded. Rear seats are firm and you'll want them reclined to maximum rake.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although the leather-covered sports seats are comfortable for all-day touring, the aggressively-tuned suspension will prove too harsh for anyone looking for a luxurious daily driver. Despite its sporty intentions, the SQ5 is pretty quiet inside thanks to good sound deadening materials.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: The SQ5 rides pretty harsh on its sport suspension, and it can get quite jouncy around town. You feel every bump and pothole, and they shake the car enough that you hear them too. Even bumpy highways can turn things jiggly.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although the leather-covered sports seats are comfortable for all-day touring, the aggressively-tuned suspension will prove too harsh for anyone looking for a luxurious daily driver. Despite its sporty intentions, the SQ5 is pretty quiet inside thanks to good sound deadening materials.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: The engine is so quiet when cruising that you barely notice it. Not intrusive at full throttle, either, though turning the engine sound setting to Dynamic brings a wonderfully throaty roar. There is noticeable tire hum over coarse surfaces.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although the leather-covered sports seats are comfortable for all-day touring, the aggressively-tuned suspension will prove too harsh for anyone looking for a luxurious daily driver. Despite its sporty intentions, the SQ5 is pretty quiet inside thanks to good sound deadening materials.
title: Quietness

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Most controls are well placed, gauges easy to read. MMI infotainment system works well for audio use, but climate control functions require extra steps. Lacks USB port. If you move the center armrest forward, it'll crush your drink.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We had some minor ergonomic issues related to the climate controls, but overall the SQ5 is a nice place to be, with easy entry/exit and surprisingly good headroom front and rear. The anti-tip tabs on the cupholders are a necessity for a vehicle with such cornering prowess.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Pretty easy to get in/out up front with a natural step-in height, but seats do have bigger bolsters than most. Short doors open nice and wide. Rear entryway is small even though doors open wide; leg will contact wheelwell.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We had some minor ergonomic issues related to the climate controls, but overall the SQ5 is a nice place to be, with easy entry/exit and surprisingly good headroom front and rear. The anti-tip tabs on the cupholders are a necessity for a vehicle with such cornering prowess.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: No shortage of front headroom, even with standard sunroof. Door cutouts give generous elbow room. Rear headroom only a problem for tall adults, but door-side elbow room is cramped. Narrow foot space under front seats thanks to seat rails.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We had some minor ergonomic issues related to the climate controls, but overall the SQ5 is a nice place to be, with easy entry/exit and surprisingly good headroom front and rear. The anti-tip tabs on the cupholders are a necessity for a vehicle with such cornering prowess.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Overall pretty good sightlines, with narrow roof pillars, tall side windows and wide rear glass. Optional backup camera screen isn't large, but does have parking lines. Large side mirrors can be hard to see around.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We had some minor ergonomic issues related to the climate controls, but overall the SQ5 is a nice place to be, with easy entry/exit and surprisingly good headroom front and rear. The anti-tip tabs on the cupholders are a necessity for a vehicle with such cornering prowess.
title: Visibility

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Decent-sized center bin, large door pockets, but no front bin. Cupholders have anti-tip tabs. Rear seats fold easily from trunk with one-touch levers. Standard power tailgate opens high to 29.1 cu-ft trunk, or 57.3 cu-ft with seats down.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We had some minor ergonomic issues related to the climate controls, but overall the SQ5 is a nice place to be, with easy entry/exit and surprisingly good headroom front and rear. The anti-tip tabs on the cupholders are a necessity for a vehicle with such cornering prowess.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Interior surfaces have nice textures for an upscale look/feel. Controls have a distinct heft and click, it's sturdy and well built. We did notice an occasional trim piece rattle over sharp bumps, partially because this car is so stiff.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The truest competitor to the SQ5 is Porsche's all-new Macan, with which it shares some components. The Macan S is a little down on horsepower, but is also a bit cheaper. BMW's X3 xDrive35i also costs less than the SQ5, but doesn't offer the Audi's blistering straight-line speed.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: At its $51,900 base price the SQ5 comes with all-wheel drive, a sunroof, power tailgate, leather/Alcantra front sport seats with heat and 8-way power and three-zone climate control. Notably absent is a standard reaview camera.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The truest competitor to the SQ5 is Porsche's all-new Macan, with which it shares some components. The Macan S is a little down on horsepower, but is also a bit cheaper. BMW's X3 xDrive35i also costs less than the SQ5, but doesn't offer the Audi's blistering straight-line speed.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Our test car had the $7,500 Prestige package, which adds blind-spot monitoring, adaptive headlights, manual rear sunshades, a Thermo cupholder, a fantastic Bang & Olufsen sound system, navigation and rearview camera. But it costs $7,500!
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The truest competitor to the SQ5 is Porsche's all-new Macan, with which it shares some components. The Macan S is a little down on horsepower, but is also a bit cheaper. BMW's X3 xDrive35i also costs less than the SQ5, but doesn't offer the Audi's blistering straight-line speed.
title: Cost

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: The EPA rates the SQ5 at 19 mpg Combined (16 City/23 Highway), nearly identical to the Porsche Macan S but below the BMW X3 xDrive35i and Volvo XC60 T6 Drive-E. We averaged 19.0 mpg, including 20.9 mpg on our 116-mile evaluation loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The truest competitor to the SQ5 is Porsche's all-new Macan, with which it shares some components. The Macan S is a little down on horsepower, but is also a bit cheaper. BMW's X3 xDrive35i also costs less than the SQ5, but doesn't offer the Audi's blistering straight-line speed.
title: MPG

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Audi's 4-year/50,000-mile basic and powertrain warranties are similar to the BMW X3 and Porsche Macan.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The truest competitor to the SQ5 is Porsche's all-new Macan, with which it shares some components. The Macan S is a little down on horsepower, but is also a bit cheaper. BMW's X3 xDrive35i also costs less than the SQ5, but doesn't offer the Audi's blistering straight-line speed.
title: Warranty

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: The SQ5 offers four years of roadside assistance plus the first scheduled maintenance is free. BMWs, though, come with free maintenance for 4 years/50,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The truest competitor to the SQ5 is Porsche's all-new Macan, with which it shares some components. The Macan S is a little down on horsepower, but is also a bit cheaper. BMW's X3 xDrive35i also costs less than the SQ5, but doesn't offer the Audi's blistering straight-line speed.
title: Ownership

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: The ride quality (or lack thereof) will be a problem for anyone who isn't an enthusiastic driver. And even for some that are. Still, mostly this is a good driving experience, thanks largely to the sweet and smooth supercharged V6.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: In the right setting, most particularly a back road or any on-ramp, the Audi SQ5 is a blast to drive. It handles twisty two-lanes superbly, with sharp turn-in and a suspension tuned for aggressive driving. The quick-shifting paddle-shift transmission adds to the fun.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Audi
model.name: SQ5
style.name: 3.0T Premium Plus quattro 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl S/C 8A)
summary: Unlike humans, you can change the SQ5's personality via the Audi Drive Select function, which lets you alter the mapping of the engine/transmission, the steering effort and the engine sound between Dynamic, Auto and Comfort.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: In the right setting, most particularly a back road or any on-ramp, the Audi SQ5 is a blast to drive. It handles twisty two-lanes superbly, with sharp turn-in and a suspension tuned for aggressive driving. The quick-shifting paddle-shift transmission adds to the fun.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The 240-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged engine is fast for the segment and incomparably smooth with torque everywhere. Shifts from the 8-speed automatic are quick and smooth.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even as a mid-range 3-Series model, it's a joy to really drive the 328i. There's plenty of seat-of-the-pants feel and all systems combine to instill unparalleled confidence.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Predictably linear, highly effective and no detectable fade after hard driving. No grabbiness in daily driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even as a mid-range 3-Series model, it's a joy to really drive the 328i. There's plenty of seat-of-the-pants feel and all systems combine to instill unparalleled confidence.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Good feedback and weighting. Less precise than previous BMWs, but still at the top of the class. M Sport wheel is near-perfectly sized.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even as a mid-range 3-Series model, it's a joy to really drive the 328i. There's plenty of seat-of-the-pants feel and all systems combine to instill unparalleled confidence.
title: Steering

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Excellent manners in hard driving with predictable limits. Stability control is smart and non-intrusive. Dislikes the rapid transitions of our slalom, though. Very good grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even as a mid-range 3-Series model, it's a joy to really drive the 328i. There's plenty of seat-of-the-pants feel and all systems combine to instill unparalleled confidence.
title: Handling

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Start/stop feature is jarring and it defaults to "On" after shutdown. It's the only liability in an otherwise great setup. Score would be much higher without this feature.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even as a mid-range 3-Series model, it's a joy to really drive the 328i. There's plenty of seat-of-the-pants feel and all systems combine to instill unparalleled confidence.
title: Driveability

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Firm, well-shaped seats with adjustable bolsters, headrests, thigh-support and lumbar. Leather looks good and feels more durable than soft. Seats lack ventilation.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Suspension, seats and insulation are deftly balanced between comfort and driving performance. Even with the M Sport suspension and 18-inch wheels, passengers will not object to the added stiffness.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: M Sport suspension and 18-inch wheels add a lot of stiffness, but manage to avoid being harsh. Rear can get bouncy over successive bumps.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Suspension, seats and insulation are deftly balanced between comfort and driving performance. Even with the M Sport suspension and 18-inch wheels, passengers will not object to the added stiffness.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Road noise is detectable thanks to grippy summer tires, but not at all intrusive. At higher revs, light engine noise creeps into the cabin. An expected performance for a car in the luxury class.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Suspension, seats and insulation are deftly balanced between comfort and driving performance. Even with the M Sport suspension and 18-inch wheels, passengers will not object to the added stiffness.
title: Quietness

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Well-organized controls (cruise on stalk) are within a short reach. Frequently-used features like HVAC and audio controls are given redundant hard buttons on dash.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Admirable materials, thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The lack of interior storage could be a concern.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Short doors allow access in confined parking spots, Good seat height doesn't require squatting or climbing. Rear seat access is similarly easy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Admirable materials, thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The lack of interior storage could be a concern.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Open and typical German sedan with ample room for taller people up front. Rear seats comfortably fit two adults.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Admirable materials, thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The lack of interior storage could be a concern.
title: Space/Room

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Excellent all-around visibility with low belt lines. A rare instance in modern cars where camera and/or parking sensors are not a necessity. Thin pillars help forward visibility.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Admirable materials, thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The lack of interior storage could be a concern.
title: Visibility

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Trunk space is adequate. Handy pulls to fold down the split-folding rear seats located helpfully in trunk. Interior storage is lacking with a small center bin and small cupholders.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Admirable materials, thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The lack of interior storage could be a concern.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Solidly built from the ground up with excellent materials and precise engineering. No gimmicks. After a decade, iDrive is finally clean, fast and simple enough to be a benefit.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This $45,000 328 may come up a little short in features compared to some rivals, but in terms of overall quality and performance, few can compete.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: For a car priced in the mid $40k-range, this 328 doesn't have navigation or parking sensors. (These would add $2,675.) Instead, you get driving performance and a great engine.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This $45,000 328 may come up a little short in features compared to some rivals, but in terms of overall quality and performance, few can compete.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Equally outfitted, the 328i falls right into line with other entry-level luxury sedans.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This $45,000 328 may come up a little short in features compared to some rivals, but in terms of overall quality and performance, few can compete.
title: Cost

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: EPA estimate of 23/33/26 mpg is good for the class, but we exceeded that figure on our 116-mile mixed evaluation loop with an impressive 33.6 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This $45,000 328 may come up a little short in features compared to some rivals, but in terms of overall quality and performance, few can compete.
title: MPG

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: BMW's warranty is 4 years/50,000 miles on the 2013 328i.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This $45,000 328 may come up a little short in features compared to some rivals, but in terms of overall quality and performance, few can compete.
title: Warranty

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Free scheduled maintenance is included for 4 years/50,000 miles and includes oil services, wiper blades, brakes, belts and more.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This $45,000 328 may come up a little short in features compared to some rivals, but in terms of overall quality and performance, few can compete.
title: Ownership

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The 3-Series remains the true sports luxury sedan, delicately balancing performance and comfort. It begs to be driven.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Impressive power, sharp handling, smart stability control and communicative steering combine to instill a high level of driver confidence.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 328i 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The 3-Series is notable for its subtlety, not its splash, as the slow-to-evolve design tends to blend in. From behind the wheel, the BMW 3 Series continues to prove its worth.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Impressive power, sharp handling, smart stability control and communicative steering combine to instill a high level of driver confidence.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Shockingly, the 335i's turbo inline-6 with a 6-sp manual yields the same 0-60 mph time of 5.4 sec. as the 328i's turbo inline-4 with an automatic (5.9 with a manual). This says more about the 328i, as big-engined competitors are similar.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Test numbers might tell you there's little performance difference between the 240-hp 328i and 300-hp 335i. But the 335i's 3.0-liter turbo inline-6 is a sweet engine (in sound and feel) with an alluring mid-range the 328i can't match. Other 3 Series dynamic gifts are excellent as expected.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: A stop of 112 feet from 60 mph is excellent, but expected when shod with summer tires. Powerful brakes didn't fade despite repeated hard stops. Medium-firm brake pedal lines up perfectly so you can perform easy heel-and-toe downshifts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Test numbers might tell you there's little performance difference between the 240-hp 328i and 300-hp 335i. But the 335i's 3.0-liter turbo inline-6 is a sweet engine (in sound and feel) with an alluring mid-range the 328i can't match. Other 3 Series dynamic gifts are excellent as expected.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Perhaps it's not as communicative as BMWs past, but still highly informative and precise. Effort in Comfort is too light and incongruous for a BMW. Normal is just right in most situations, but Sport is the way to go for exuberant driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Test numbers might tell you there's little performance difference between the 240-hp 328i and 300-hp 335i. But the 335i's 3.0-liter turbo inline-6 is a sweet engine (in sound and feel) with an alluring mid-range the 328i can't match. Other 3 Series dynamic gifts are excellent as expected.
title: Steering

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: It feels like there's a thin veneer of padding added to everything for the sake of comfort and isolation, yet the responsive steering and brilliant chassis with predictable limits when driven hard nevertheless shine through.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Test numbers might tell you there's little performance difference between the 240-hp 328i and 300-hp 335i. But the 335i's 3.0-liter turbo inline-6 is a sweet engine (in sound and feel) with an alluring mid-range the 328i can't match. Other 3 Series dynamic gifts are excellent as expected.
title: Handling

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The optional (no-cost) 6-sp. manual transmission is a gem, with precise, medium-length throws and a light, easily modulated clutch. More people should get this. Auto stop/start system is reasonably unobtrusive, stays off when you turn it off.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Test numbers might tell you there's little performance difference between the 240-hp 328i and 300-hp 335i. But the 335i's 3.0-liter turbo inline-6 is a sweet engine (in sound and feel) with an alluring mid-range the 328i can't match. Other 3 Series dynamic gifts are excellent as expected.
title: Driveability

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: These are hard-to-beat front seats. Firm and supportive with an enormous range of power adjustability, plenty comfortable. Perfect for long distances or taking corners hard. Optional sport seats add thigh extension and power bolsters.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: One might think to categorize BMW as an overly performance-minded car builder, prioritizing sportiness over comfort. However, even the sport-tuned BMW 335i M Sport is proof that you can live in both worlds. This is a very comfortable and quiet car despite its dynamic talents.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: M Sport trim includes an adjustable suspension that soaks up bumps with varying degress of excellence. Even Sport, which is firmer and more typically BMW-like, is never harsh. Not much need for Comfort, as Normal is always comfy.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: One might think to categorize BMW as an overly performance-minded car builder, prioritizing sportiness over comfort. However, even the sport-tuned BMW 335i M Sport is proof that you can live in both worlds. This is a very comfortable and quiet car despite its dynamic talents.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: With only six speeds, manual transmission-equipped cars run at a higher rpm and are thus somewhat louder on the highway than the 8-speed auto-equipped 335i. Not objectionably so, just louder. Road and wind noise are kept to a minimum.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: One might think to categorize BMW as an overly performance-minded car builder, prioritizing sportiness over comfort. However, even the sport-tuned BMW 335i M Sport is proof that you can live in both worlds. This is a very comfortable and quiet car despite its dynamic talents.
title: Quietness

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Basic controls for lights, wipers, etc., are well-placed and easy to use. Cruise controls on steering wheel are excellent. The iDrive controller is complicated, but you acclimate quickly. The iDrive screen is smaller without navigation.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The space for people and luggage is what you'd expect for this segment, but small item storage is definitely lacking.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Short doors allow access in confined parking spots. Seat height doesn't require squatting down or climbing up, but note the sport seats have larger (albeit adjustable) bolsters. Rear seat access is similarly easy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The space for people and luggage is what you'd expect for this segment, but small item storage is definitely lacking.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Rear seats fit two adults comfortably, although a tall driver up front will eat into rear legroom. This 3 Series would've been considered a mid-size sedan a decade ago. Abundantly adjustable driver seat is a benefit for space as well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The space for people and luggage is what you'd expect for this segment, but small item storage is definitely lacking.
title: Space/Room

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The rearview camera is an option, and it shouldn't be at this price point. Visibility is otherwise excellent in all directions, as pillars are reasonable in size and side windows are relatively tall. Side mirrors are of average size.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The space for people and luggage is what you'd expect for this segment, but small item storage is definitely lacking.
title: Visibility

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The 13.0 cu-ft trunk is adequate. Handy pulls to fold down the rear seats are helpfully located in trunk. Interior storage is lacking, with a tiny center bin and small cupholders. Many competitors have more useful small item storage.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Thoughtful, if plain, design and overall usability earn this car top scores. The space for people and luggage is what you'd expect for this segment, but small item storage is definitely lacking.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Solidly built from the ground up with excellent materials, solid switchgear and precise engineering. No gimmicks. This is clearly worth a price premium, but is it worth $2,000-$3,000 more than its competitors? We feel it is.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You'll have to place a premium value on superior engineering and interior craftsmanship because you won't be getting a lot of features for your money. Fuel economy is lower than the 328i, despite negligible performance differences. BMW's warranty and free maintenance are commendable.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Many optional features on the 335i are standard on other cars (rearview camera, leather, heated seats). This alone isn't a problem, but the price is also higher than most. In other words, you don't get a lot of stuff for your money.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You'll have to place a premium value on superior engineering and interior craftsmanship because you won't be getting a lot of features for your money. Fuel economy is lower than the 328i, despite negligible performance differences. BMW's warranty and free maintenance are commendable.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: As-tested, the 335i is priced similarly to the Mercedes-Benz C-Class, but other competitors of similar performance potential tend to be cheaper. It comes down to how much value you place on BMW's name, engineering and driving dynamics.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You'll have to place a premium value on superior engineering and interior craftsmanship because you won't be getting a lot of features for your money. Fuel economy is lower than the 328i, despite negligible performance differences. BMW's warranty and free maintenance are commendable.
title: Cost

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The EPA estimates the 335i 6-sp manual should acieve 24 mpg Combined (20 City/30 Highway), or 25 Combined (21/32) with the 8-speed auto. We returned 28.7 mpg on a highway-heavy driving route, which is impressive given its performance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You'll have to place a premium value on superior engineering and interior craftsmanship because you won't be getting a lot of features for your money. Fuel economy is lower than the 328i, despite negligible performance differences. BMW's warranty and free maintenance are commendable.
title: MPG

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Both the basic warranty and drivetrain coverage last for 4 years/50,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You'll have to place a premium value on superior engineering and interior craftsmanship because you won't be getting a lot of features for your money. Fuel economy is lower than the 328i, despite negligible performance differences. BMW's warranty and free maintenance are commendable.
title: Warranty

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Free scheduled maintenance is included for 4 years/50,000 miles, which includes oil services, wiper blades, brakes, belts and more. The money you save here versus competitors should be considered.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You'll have to place a premium value on superior engineering and interior craftsmanship because you won't be getting a lot of features for your money. Fuel economy is lower than the 328i, despite negligible performance differences. BMW's warranty and free maintenance are commendable.
title: Ownership

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: It offers the kind of rewarding and engaging driving experience one expects of a sport-minded BMW sedan, while still being comfortable and easy to drive. This is an extremely capable sport sedan, and it makes every drive a joy.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The BMW 3 Series has made concessions to improved comfort over the years, but through the extra isolation and cushiness there still resides a dynamic driver's car that will have you eagerly anticipating the next time you get behind the wheel. The manual transmission only increases this.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: BMW
model.name: 3 Series
style.name: 335i 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Does it have the visual flair of competitors, or even the related 4 Series Gran Coupe? No, but it has honest, no-gimmick styling with just-right proportions, a handsome interior plus those perpetually engaging driving dynamics.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The BMW 3 Series has made concessions to improved comfort over the years, but through the extra isolation and cushiness there still resides a dynamic driver's car that will have you eagerly anticipating the next time you get behind the wheel. The manual transmission only increases this.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: 4 Series
style.name: 428i 2dr Coupe (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The 8-speed automatic makes good use of the base 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder's 241 hp with rapid upshifts and matched-rev downshifts, getting up to 60 mph in 5.4 seconds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With brisk acceleration and our test car's M Sport suspension, brakes and aerodynamic kit, the 428i's performance far exceeds expectations of a "base" model BMW. It bests the performance of comparable entries from Mercedes-Benz and Audi.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: 4 Series
style.name: 428i 2dr Coupe (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Highly effective and fade-free in our panic brake tests. It stopped from 60 mph in a short 110 ft. The optional M Sport brakes lack some feel and are touchy, but still good for the class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With brisk acceleration and our test car's M Sport suspension, brakes and aerodynamic kit, the 428i's performance far exceeds expectations of a "base" model BMW. It bests the performance of comparable entries from Mercedes-Benz and Audi.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: 4 Series
style.name: 428i 2dr Coupe (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
