summary: Many choose a BMW purely for the status of the badge. But those who can appreciate the 428i's inherently good dynamics will endure the stigma because it's worth it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Impressive power, sharp handling, precise steering and an enthusiast-friendly automatic transmission combine to instill a high level of driver confidence. And, therefore, fun.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The 3.0-liter inline-6 produces 413 lb-ft of torque. Paired with a near-seamless 8-speed automatic transmission, the 535d hits 60 mph in a scant 5.8 seconds, making it as quick as a gasoline 535i.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 535d's terrific turbodiesel six-cylinder performs as well or better than most of its V6 gasoline competitors. The 5 Series' handling numbers aren't fantastic, and the car is heavy, but the well-tuned suspension helps it drive smaller than it is.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: With its summer tires, the 535d stopped from 60 mph in just 110 feet, excellent for the segment. The brake pedal delivered a nice, consistent firmness and they were never touchy around town.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 535d's terrific turbodiesel six-cylinder performs as well or better than most of its V6 gasoline competitors. The 5 Series' handling numbers aren't fantastic, and the car is heavy, but the well-tuned suspension helps it drive smaller than it is.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The 535d's nicely-weighted steering is fed through a thick-rimmed, leather-wrapped steering wheel. The steering has a nice turn-in, and the driver can choose between three different settings.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 535d's terrific turbodiesel six-cylinder performs as well or better than most of its V6 gasoline competitors. The 5 Series' handling numbers aren't fantastic, and the car is heavy, but the well-tuned suspension helps it drive smaller than it is.
title: Steering

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The 535d feels lighter on its feet than its 4,080 pounds suggest. Point it toward a turn and it's a willing partner -- you'll forget all about it being a low-revving diesel. Stable and driver-friendly at all times.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 535d's terrific turbodiesel six-cylinder performs as well or better than most of its V6 gasoline competitors. The 5 Series' handling numbers aren't fantastic, and the car is heavy, but the well-tuned suspension helps it drive smaller than it is.
title: Handling

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The auto start/stop system (which can be shut off) is annoying in stop-and-go traffic. It even turns off at quick stops like stop signs. No standard backup camera. Otherwise, supple throttle and a lurch-free automatic.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 535d's terrific turbodiesel six-cylinder performs as well or better than most of its V6 gasoline competitors. The 5 Series' handling numbers aren't fantastic, and the car is heavy, but the well-tuned suspension helps it drive smaller than it is.
title: Driveability

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Wide front seats offer tons of adjustments to fit all body styles. The padding is firm yet comfortable, with supple leather. Wide center armrest. The rear seat cushions are plush, though the seatback is a bit hard and could use more rake.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite run-flat summer tires, which typically deliver a harsh ride, we found the 535d to be comfortable and amazingly quiet relative to both other diesels and gasoline sedans. The non-reclining rear seatbacks need more rake.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The ride is never ultra-plush, but also never harsh. Some vibrations make their way into the cabin on certain surfaces, probably due to the sidewall stiffness of the summer runflat tires on our test car.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite run-flat summer tires, which typically deliver a harsh ride, we found the 535d to be comfortable and amazingly quiet relative to both other diesels and gasoline sedans. The non-reclining rear seatbacks need more rake.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: So quiet inside, you forget you're driving a diesel. Even at highway speeds you can't hear the engine, and it's the quietest car in the class at full throttle. Wind noise is near nil, though some minor tire hum.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite run-flat summer tires, which typically deliver a harsh ride, we found the 535d to be comfortable and amazingly quiet relative to both other diesels and gasoline sedans. The non-reclining rear seatbacks need more rake.
title: Quietness

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Superb driving position. All controls have a quality, damped action. Good detents on the climate control knobs, steering wheel is a tactile delight. Super-wide display screen, though some nav icons are small.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a well-built and elegantly-styled interior. The controls deliver a quality feel. Amazingly wide-opening doors allow easy entry/exit. The trunk is oddly narrow, and some of the navigation system's icons are too small.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Front doors open almost 90 degrees, making entry/exit a snap. The rear doors open almost as wide, though entry is compromised slightly by the rear wheelwell. Footbox is on the smaller side back there, too.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a well-built and elegantly-styled interior. The controls deliver a quality feel. Amazingly wide-opening doors allow easy entry/exit. The trunk is oddly narrow, and some of the navigation system's icons are too small.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Decent front headroom, despite standard sunroof. Nice, wide center armrest. Plenty of room for driver's right knee against the center console. Rear headroom is fine, but the front seat compromises rear foot room.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a well-built and elegantly-styled interior. The controls deliver a quality feel. Amazingly wide-opening doors allow easy entry/exit. The trunk is oddly narrow, and some of the navigation system's icons are too small.
title: Space/Room

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Excellent view out the front, but thick side pillars require extra care (and looks) for lane changes. Rearmost pillars are surprisingly narrow and rear window is tall and wide. But no standard backup camera or sensors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a well-built and elegantly-styled interior. The controls deliver a quality feel. Amazingly wide-opening doors allow easy entry/exit. The trunk is oddly narrow, and some of the navigation system's icons are too small.
title: Visibility

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Ssmall center armrest bin and big points for the anti-tip front cupholders. Narrow door pockets have a nice felt lining. The useable part of the 14.0 cu-ft trunk is narrow, though deep.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a well-built and elegantly-styled interior. The controls deliver a quality feel. Amazingly wide-opening doors allow easy entry/exit. The trunk is oddly narrow, and some of the navigation system's icons are too small.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Pricey, yes, but it gets high marks for the superb look and feel of the materials. Everything about this car exudes quality, from the fine leather to the tight trim pieces to the beautiful, huge display screen.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The $57,525 BMW 535d is several thousand dollars more than most midsize luxury competitors, including about $1,500 more than a gasoline BMW 535i. That said, its impressive fuel economy will quickly make up for the initial higher cost.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The 535d lacks a few features we'd expect to be standard at this price, the most noticeable being a backup camera. Standard items include a sunroof, adaptive headlights, navigation and Nappa leather seats.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The $57,525 BMW 535d is several thousand dollars more than most midsize luxury competitors, including about $1,500 more than a gasoline BMW 535i. That said, its impressive fuel economy will quickly make up for the initial higher cost.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Our test model had the $3,150 M Sport package, largely a trim and appearance upgrade. The $1,500 Premium pack includes a power trunk and smart key. The total price was $66,425. Without a backup camera.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The $57,525 BMW 535d is several thousand dollars more than most midsize luxury competitors, including about $1,500 more than a gasoline BMW 535i. That said, its impressive fuel economy will quickly make up for the initial higher cost.
title: Cost

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The EPA rates the 535d at 30 mpg Combined (26 City/38 Highway). We easily managed 34.7 mpg on our 116-mile evaluation loop. Only the less powerful Mercedes-Benz E250 BlueTec can beat these numbers in the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The $57,525 BMW 535d is several thousand dollars more than most midsize luxury competitors, including about $1,500 more than a gasoline BMW 535i. That said, its impressive fuel economy will quickly make up for the initial higher cost.
title: MPG

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Both the basic and drivetrain warranties last for 4 years/50,000 miles. These are pretty much standard for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The $57,525 BMW 535d is several thousand dollars more than most midsize luxury competitors, including about $1,500 more than a gasoline BMW 535i. That said, its impressive fuel economy will quickly make up for the initial higher cost.
title: Warranty

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: Maintenance is covered for 4 years/50,000 miles, including oil changes, drive belts, wiper blades, brake pads and discs, and brake fluid.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The $57,525 BMW 535d is several thousand dollars more than most midsize luxury competitors, including about $1,500 more than a gasoline BMW 535i. That said, its impressive fuel economy will quickly make up for the initial higher cost.
title: Ownership

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The driving experience is superb whether compared to other diesels or traditional gasoline engines. It's incredibly quiet, never rattly and has plenty of power for passing. Fewer trips to the pump are helpful, too.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Considering the 535d is a rather heavy diesel sedan, it performs exceptionally well. Everyday driving is a breeze. Point it toward the twisties and it reacts like a proper sport sedan. The diesel's instant-on torque makes corner exits a hoot.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: BMW
model.name: 5 Series
style.name: 535d 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl Turbodiesel 8A)
summary: The 535d does so many things well, and it does them all easily. You'll forget it's a diesel. If you want to get sporty with it, you can shift the automatic transmission manually and it blips the throttle on downshifts.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Considering the 535d is a rather heavy diesel sedan, it performs exceptionally well. Everyday driving is a breeze. Point it toward the twisties and it reacts like a proper sport sedan. The diesel's instant-on torque makes corner exits a hoot.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: 3.0-liter turbo inline-6 feels eager, alert and powerful. Sharp at low revs, has a strong midrange and is willing to rev. With manual transmission, hit 60 mph in 4.4 sec and the quarter-mile in 12.4 sec at 116 mph. Great throttle response.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The M4 is a coupe that thinks it's a sports car. It accelerates with potency, turns sharply and stops quickly. There's little reason to crave more performance, though the steering is more lifeless than we'd like. Still, this is a car that does an impressive number of things very well.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Powerful carbon ceramic brakes with excellent modulation, a firm pedal and great stopping power. 60-0 mph in 106 feet, an excellent result. Outstanding fade resistance. Some groans at slow speeds. Smaller steel brakes are standard.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The M4 is a coupe that thinks it's a sports car. It accelerates with potency, turns sharply and stops quickly. There's little reason to crave more performance, though the steering is more lifeless than we'd like. Still, this is a car that does an impressive number of things very well.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Well-weighted and precise steering. Feel is curiously lacking for a car of this class, which is something you notice even more when exercising the car's elevated handling limits. Lack of feel is becoming more common in modern BMWs.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The M4 is a coupe that thinks it's a sports car. It accelerates with potency, turns sharply and stops quickly. There's little reason to crave more performance, though the steering is more lifeless than we'd like. Still, this is a car that does an impressive number of things very well.
title: Steering

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Lots of grip, excellent agility. More confidence-inspiring than the outgoing car, which was impressive in its own right. Rewards a driver who is attentive in managing weight transfer. We measured 0.98 g and a 72.9-mph slalom result.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The M4 is a coupe that thinks it's a sports car. It accelerates with potency, turns sharply and stops quickly. There's little reason to crave more performance, though the steering is more lifeless than we'd like. Still, this is a car that does an impressive number of things very well.
title: Handling

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: This car is a great example of cohesive integration of the primary driving controls. Most notable among them is its manual gearbox. Shifts are slick, bright and fast. It's obvious that this car's nuances were fussed over.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The M4 is a coupe that thinks it's a sports car. It accelerates with potency, turns sharply and stops quickly. There's little reason to crave more performance, though the steering is more lifeless than we'd like. Still, this is a car that does an impressive number of things very well.
title: Driveability

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Outstanding front seat comfort no matter whether you are exploring a mountain road or just cruising. The combination of leather and cloth is unusual but effective. Backseat has reasonable comfort for adults.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Everyday use is no problem for this car. It's properly sporting but totally user-friendly. The ride is supple enough for your commute, and noise will never wear you down. Its seats in particular stand out for their ability to do it all.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: This is a firm-riding car, no doubt, but there's a suppleness to the standard dampers that rounds the edges off. Nobody will mistake its ride quality for a Bentley, but for a sporting vehicle it is quite good. Variable shocks are optional.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Everyday use is no problem for this car. It's properly sporting but totally user-friendly. The ride is supple enough for your commute, and noise will never wear you down. Its seats in particular stand out for their ability to do it all.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Some road noise is evident from the low-profile tires on optional 20-inch wheels. Very little engine noise at a cruise. Prod the throttle and the engine perks up nicely, augmented by the stereo. Wind noise is not an issue.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Everyday use is no problem for this car. It's properly sporting but totally user-friendly. The ride is supple enough for your commute, and noise will never wear you down. Its seats in particular stand out for their ability to do it all.
title: Quietness

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Familiar BMW cabin is easy to use. The iDrive screen is large, bright and crisp, as are the simple gauges. Climate controls consist of temperature knobs and buttons for the rest. Limited brightwork prevents distracting reflections.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The M4 has a practical driving position and intuitive cabin. Rear-seat access and rear vision are acceptable considering this is a two-door. There's a good amount of cargo space, too. It's easy to use and live with on a daily basis.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Being based on a sedan has its benefits. Door openings are easy to navigate gracefully. Stepover height is low, and the seat is higher than in a sports car. Backseat access is a bit more awkward, of course, but not bad as coupes go.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The M4 has a practical driving position and intuitive cabin. Rear-seat access and rear vision are acceptable considering this is a two-door. There's a good amount of cargo space, too. It's easy to use and live with on a daily basis.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: This is a larger car than you might guess. Ample width allows plenty of shoulder and elbow room in front, and reasonable backseat space for limited trips. Headroom is no problem for 6-footers in our no-sunroof test car.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The M4 has a practical driving position and intuitive cabin. Rear-seat access and rear vision are acceptable considering this is a two-door. There's a good amount of cargo space, too. It's easy to use and live with on a daily basis.
title: Space/Room

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Forward and side visibility is good, thanks to the relatively upright seating position and greenhouse. Like most modern cars there are large blind spots at the C-pillars, and the deck is high-ish.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The M4 has a practical driving position and intuitive cabin. Rear-seat access and rear vision are acceptable considering this is a two-door. There's a good amount of cargo space, too. It's easy to use and live with on a daily basis.
title: Visibility

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Cargo room is adequately sized for four passengers. Cabin storage is unremarkable, consisting of large door pockets, a shallow console bin and a glove box. Split folding backseat. In total, very good for a sporting car.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The M4 has a practical driving position and intuitive cabin. Rear-seat access and rear vision are acceptable considering this is a two-door. There's a good amount of cargo space, too. It's easy to use and live with on a daily basis.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Excellent fit and finish. Cabin controls and features move smoothly and with precision. Materials are rich and appear to have been chosen to minimize distraction. The mixed-material seats are unusual but very effective.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Considering its performance, features, cabin quality and everyday usability, the M4 has a lot to offer. A lot of equipment is standard, and the manual gearbox and no compulsory sunroof are welcome features. The optional brakes are exceedingly costly.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: With standard navigation, adaptive headlights,10-way heated power front seats and automatic climate control, the M4 is well equipped. A sunroof is thankfully optional (adds weight, reduces headroom), as is a dual-clutch gearbox.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Considering its performance, features, cabin quality and everyday usability, the M4 has a lot to offer. A lot of equipment is standard, and the manual gearbox and no compulsory sunroof are welcome features. The optional brakes are exceedingly costly.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The M4's optional carbon ceramic brakes are absurdly expensive ($8,150) and require larger 19" wheels that add another $1,200. Are the base steel brakes inadequate? Possibly. But the optional brakes are certainly too expensive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Considering its performance, features, cabin quality and everyday usability, the M4 has a lot to offer. A lot of equipment is standard, and the manual gearbox and no compulsory sunroof are welcome features. The optional brakes are exceedingly costly.
title: Cost

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: On the EPA cycle the M4 achieves 20 mpg combined (17city/26 highway). We measured it at 19.2 mpg in 1,000 miles of mixed driving. It netted 25.1 mpg on our standard evaluation loop. This is respectable for a car of this sort.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Considering its performance, features, cabin quality and everyday usability, the M4 has a lot to offer. A lot of equipment is standard, and the manual gearbox and no compulsory sunroof are welcome features. The optional brakes are exceedingly costly.
title: MPG

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Basic coverage is 4 years/50,000 miles, and so is the drivetrain warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Considering its performance, features, cabin quality and everyday usability, the M4 has a lot to offer. A lot of equipment is standard, and the manual gearbox and no compulsory sunroof are welcome features. The optional brakes are exceedingly costly.
title: Warranty

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: There's a 4-year/unlimited-mileage roadside assistance program, along with free scheduled maintenance for 4 years/50,000 miles, which includes oil services, wiper blades, brakes and belts.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Considering its performance, features, cabin quality and everyday usability, the M4 has a lot to offer. A lot of equipment is standard, and the manual gearbox and no compulsory sunroof are welcome features. The optional brakes are exceedingly costly.
title: Ownership

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: BMW has done a fine job of fussing over the nuances of the M4's control interfaces. It has polish and is more engaging and lighter than the Lexus RC F. The Mercedes C63 coupe is automatic only. BMW wins.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The M4 has agility and performance in spades. It's eager and inspires confidence. If the steering were better, this car's dynamics would be nearly unimpeachable. It's physically a bit larger than we'd like, but in nearly every measure the M4 is the leader of the segment.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: BMW
model.name: M4
style.name: 2dr Coupe (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The M4 has an enviable combination of prowess, refinement and out-and-out thrust. It's too big to be classified as tossable, though it does change direction eagerly. This car is the standout of the class to date.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The M4 has agility and performance in spades. It's eager and inspires confidence. If the steering were better, this car's dynamics would be nearly unimpeachable. It's physically a bit larger than we'd like, but in nearly every measure the M4 is the leader of the segment.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Power delivery is smooth and refined from the 2.0-liter turbo-4 during routine driving and there's good punch under hard acceleration, too. The eight-speed automatic is decisive, and helps the X1 accelerate to 60 mph in a class-leading 6.5 seconds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Dynamics is where the X1 excels. It is quicker than the Audi Q3 and M-B GLA250 to 60 mph, posts some of the shortest stopping distances in its class and sets a high bar in handling prowess. Yet, it is the ease of driving this compact SUV in everyday situations that leaves the deepest impression.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The brake pedal provides a smooth and progressive feel that is easy to manage in stop-and-go driving. In a simulated panic stop from 60 mph, the X1 needed just 109 feet to stop, one of the best in its segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Dynamics is where the X1 excels. It is quicker than the Audi Q3 and M-B GLA250 to 60 mph, posts some of the shortest stopping distances in its class and sets a high bar in handling prowess. Yet, it is the ease of driving this compact SUV in everyday situations that leaves the deepest impression.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The steering requires a little more effort in Comfort mode than some competitors, but not oppressively so. It is still easy to direct through low-speed maneuvers. The level of assist varies with Drive modes and is heaviest in the Sport setting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Dynamics is where the X1 excels. It is quicker than the Audi Q3 and M-B GLA250 to 60 mph, posts some of the shortest stopping distances in its class and sets a high bar in handling prowess. Yet, it is the ease of driving this compact SUV in everyday situations that leaves the deepest impression.
title: Steering

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X1's AWD system makes it feel more agile around corners rather than being a detriment. There's more grip than we expected from the all-season tires, generating 0.85g around the skid pad, which comparable to its similarly equipped peers.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Dynamics is where the X1 excels. It is quicker than the Audi Q3 and M-B GLA250 to 60 mph, posts some of the shortest stopping distances in its class and sets a high bar in handling prowess. Yet, it is the ease of driving this compact SUV in everyday situations that leaves the deepest impression.
title: Handling

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: If you're looking to suddenly overtake a car, there's a slight delay between pressing the accelerator and starting the pass. In all other scenarios, we couldn't find any other faults in how the X1 squirts around town.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Dynamics is where the X1 excels. It is quicker than the Audi Q3 and M-B GLA250 to 60 mph, posts some of the shortest stopping distances in its class and sets a high bar in handling prowess. Yet, it is the ease of driving this compact SUV in everyday situations that leaves the deepest impression.
title: Driveability

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The driver seat bottom is hard, narrow and offers minimal lateral support. Its seatback has better bolstering. Despite its deficiencies it remains reasonably comfortable on long drives. The rear seats are similarly shaped and cushioned.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Many will find the X1 offers suitable levels of comfort, though some may take exception to its higher noise levels and the firmness of its standard sport suspension. Although the interior noise is worth a mention, we'd add it is no louder than others in the class.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The ride is firm, more so than other competitors. It can be harsh over road imperfections, as it doesn't tend to absorb them well. The average person may find the ride too busy and choppy over anything but smooth asphalt.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Many will find the X1 offers suitable levels of comfort, though some may take exception to its higher noise levels and the firmness of its standard sport suspension. Although the interior noise is worth a mention, we'd add it is no louder than others in the class.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The cabin is loud. Road and tire noise are prominent while the engine note remains tucked quietly away. Some may find this unpleasant, yet this problem is shared across brands in this segment and can be considered the norm.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Many will find the X1 offers suitable levels of comfort, though some may take exception to its higher noise levels and the firmness of its standard sport suspension. Although the interior noise is worth a mention, we'd add it is no louder than others in the class.
title: Quietness

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: A highly adjustable driver seat and steering column will suit a wide range of driving positions. The central display screen is well positioned and all climate and entertainment system controls are laid out clearly and logical to operate.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior cargo area and ease of cabin access set the X1 apart from the pack. A smart use of under-floor compartments maximizes storage in the back, while the size of the door openings and seat placement makes it easy to move in and out of the cabin.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X1 may offer the easiest entry of any in its class. Its combination of low door sills, taller seat bottom and mild side bolsters work together to simplify the process. Small doors help in parking spots but are somewhat heavy for their size.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior cargo area and ease of cabin access set the X1 apart from the pack. A smart use of under-floor compartments maximizes storage in the back, while the size of the door openings and seat placement makes it easy to move in and out of the cabin.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The front seats offer a lot of adjustment for as much leg-, elbow and headroom as you'll need to be comfortable. The rear seat accommodations are also the largest in class, particularly in leg- and headroom, and are easily suitable for adults.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior cargo area and ease of cabin access set the X1 apart from the pack. A smart use of under-floor compartments maximizes storage in the back, while the size of the door openings and seat placement makes it easy to move in and out of the cabin.
title: Space/Room

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: A tall windshield and reasonably low cowl/hood promotes good forward sight lines. Wide rear D-pillars limit over-the-shoulder visibility to a degree, but the optional rearview camera helps and comes as part of the Driver Assistance package.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior cargo area and ease of cabin access set the X1 apart from the pack. A smart use of under-floor compartments maximizes storage in the back, while the size of the door openings and seat placement makes it easy to move in and out of the cabin.
title: Visibility

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X1 sports the highest cargo capacity and lowest liftover height in its class. The cargo volume advantage is mainly due to the large underfloor storage where a spare tire might be otherwise. 40/20/40-split second row folds flat for flexible options.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior cargo area and ease of cabin access set the X1 apart from the pack. A smart use of under-floor compartments maximizes storage in the back, while the size of the door openings and seat placement makes it easy to move in and out of the cabin.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Tight tolerances between panels, quality leather-wrapped seats and surfaces and sleek-looking brushed aluminum trim give the X1 the high-quality feel we've come to expect from BMW.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Ownership experience is another area where BMW stands out. Its four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance plan tops all, build quality is impeccable, and although options packages are pricey, so are the competitions' in this class.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X1 starts at $35,000 and includes standard features that are comparable to the class, like an eight-speed automatic transmission, all-wheel drive, roof rails, power front seats and tailgate, automatic climate control and a sport suspension.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Ownership experience is another area where BMW stands out. Its four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance plan tops all, build quality is impeccable, and although options packages are pricey, so are the competitions' in this class.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The options stack up quickly. Adding popular features/packages that most would want, like heated seats (Cold Weather), a rearview camera (Driver Assistance), keyless access (Premium) and navigation (Technology) brings our tally up to $47,170.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Ownership experience is another area where BMW stands out. Its four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance plan tops all, build quality is impeccable, and although options packages are pricey, so are the competitions' in this class.
title: Cost

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: 89 octane can be used, but 91 recommended. The EPA projected fuel economy is 26 mpg combined (22 city/32 highway) which is better than most, save for the Mercedes-Benz CLA250. We averaged 23.7 mpg in mixed driving situations.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Ownership experience is another area where BMW stands out. Its four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance plan tops all, build quality is impeccable, and although options packages are pricey, so are the competitions' in this class.
title: MPG

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: BMW provides a four-year/50,000-mile basic, four-year/50,000-mile drivetrain and 12-year/unlimited corrosion warranty. Although Infiniti provides better coverage, BMW's is comparable to all others in this segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Ownership experience is another area where BMW stands out. Its four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance plan tops all, build quality is impeccable, and although options packages are pricey, so are the competitions' in this class.
title: Warranty

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: BMW still offers a four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance program while other OEMs offer nothing. A four-year/unlimited mile roadside assistance program is also standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Ownership experience is another area where BMW stands out. Its four-year/50,000-mile free scheduled maintenance plan tops all, build quality is impeccable, and although options packages are pricey, so are the competitions' in this class.
title: Ownership

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: If you can deal with a stiffer ride, the X1 adds considerable spunk and fun to what might otherwise be just a daily workhorse/commuter vehicle. Selectable drive modes provide varying levels of response suited to your driving mood.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The X1 has enough punch from its peppy engine to add some excitement to the errand-heavy life led by most CUVs. It's this entertaining character that gives the BMW an advantage over some of its less sporty peers. Practical doesn't have to be boring.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: BMW
model.name: X1
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X1 is that small crossover perfect for a city-dwelling lifestyle, with a healthy balance of luxury and sport. It offers a more useful cabin than its competition but also maintains an athletic advantage. It's a likable overachiever.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The X1 has enough punch from its peppy engine to add some excitement to the errand-heavy life led by most CUVs. It's this entertaining character that gives the BMW an advantage over some of its less sporty peers. Practical doesn't have to be boring.
title: Personality

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The 240-horsepower turbocharged 2.0-liter 4-cylinder gets the X4 to 60 mph in 6.0 seconds, which is darn quick. The 8-speed automatic has sport and manual shift options, the latter controlled by the shift lever or wheel-mounted paddles.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The wide powerband of the X4's turbo 4-cylinder makes for stress-free passing maneuvers and effortless climbing, even at elevation. The 8-speed automatic transmission is sporty when you want it to be, smooth all other times. Less agility than was expected from the M suspension.
title: Acceleration

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Pedal feel is reassuringly firm, yet easy to modulate for around-town duty. It stopped from 60 mph in 122 feet, which is average. Brake drying, stand-by, hill-hold, hill descent control and fade compensation are standard.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The wide powerband of the X4's turbo 4-cylinder makes for stress-free passing maneuvers and effortless climbing, even at elevation. The 8-speed automatic transmission is sporty when you want it to be, smooth all other times. Less agility than was expected from the M suspension.
title: Braking

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The steering didn't exhibit the kind of precision we normally associate with BMWs. Still pretty accurate and it turns into corners quickly. But the X4, at just over 4,100 pounds, feels heavy through corners.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The wide powerband of the X4's turbo 4-cylinder makes for stress-free passing maneuvers and effortless climbing, even at elevation. The 8-speed automatic transmission is sporty when you want it to be, smooth all other times. Less agility than was expected from the M suspension.
title: Steering

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Considerable body roll around turns, a bit more than we expected considering our test car had the M Sport pkg. Still, the xDrive all-wheel drive system puts the power down effectively to all four tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The wide powerband of the X4's turbo 4-cylinder makes for stress-free passing maneuvers and effortless climbing, even at elevation. The 8-speed automatic transmission is sporty when you want it to be, smooth all other times. Less agility than was expected from the M suspension.
title: Handling

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Dynamically the X4 is not as light on its feet as other BMW SUVs, but it should still deliver enough sport for most. Great stability at speed on the highway.  All-wheel drive components do hamper low-speed maneuvering somewhat.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The wide powerband of the X4's turbo 4-cylinder makes for stress-free passing maneuvers and effortless climbing, even at elevation. The 8-speed automatic transmission is sporty when you want it to be, smooth all other times. Less agility than was expected from the M suspension.
title: Driveability

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: We like the M Sport package's front seats. They are highly adjustable while offering appropriate lumbar and lateral support for most body types. Some may find the large bolstering intrusive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: We found the optional sport seats to be highly adjustable and comfortable. Precious little noise creeps into the cabin, which makes the X4 a nice place to spend time. Over rougher surfaces, though, the X4's firm ride gets old quick.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The optional M Sport suspension gives a sporty-firm ride, which isn't helped by the stiff sidewalls of the 19-inch Goodyear Eagle LS2 run-flat tires.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: We found the optional sport seats to be highly adjustable and comfortable. Precious little noise creeps into the cabin, which makes the X4 a nice place to spend time. Over rougher surfaces, though, the X4's firm ride gets old quick.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Sound isolation is excellent. Hardly any noise of any kind reaches the cabin, whether tire, wind or road. The only exception is the growl from the turbo 4-cylinder when the tachometer gets near redline.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: We found the optional sport seats to be highly adjustable and comfortable. Precious little noise creeps into the cabin, which makes the X4 a nice place to spend time. Over rougher surfaces, though, the X4's firm ride gets old quick.
title: Quietness

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: All primary and secondary controls are within easy reach of the driver. A manual tilt/telescopic wheel helps with the driving position. Those new to BMWs will need a course in iDrive, though it has become a much more intuitive system.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall this is a nice interior, holding to the most current BMW mold of design. Once the nuances of its infotainment system are learned, everything makes sense. Access to the cabin is pretty easy, same goes for the cargo area. Hatchback versatility is a plus.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Step-in height is 1.5 feet from the ground, reasonable even for shorter drivers. The door opening height of 4.75 feet means the roof is high enough for taller drivers to avoid hitting heads. The doors open wide and aren't too heavy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall this is a nice interior, holding to the most current BMW mold of design. Once the nuances of its infotainment system are learned, everything makes sense. Access to the cabin is pretty easy, same goes for the cargo area. Hatchback versatility is a plus.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X4 is built to technically seat five, but three people across the back seat will be tight, unless they are kids. Up front accomodations can be called "comfortably snug."
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall this is a nice interior, holding to the most current BMW mold of design. Once the nuances of its infotainment system are learned, everything makes sense. Access to the cabin is pretty easy, same goes for the cargo area. Hatchback versatility is a plus.
title: Space/Room

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Forward visibility is average for a small SUV and enhanced at night thanks to standard xenon adaptive headlights. Rearward sightlines are similar to the larger X5, about the norm for this segment. A rearview camera is available.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall this is a nice interior, holding to the most current BMW mold of design. Once the nuances of its infotainment system are learned, everything makes sense. Access to the cabin is pretty easy, same goes for the cargo area. Hatchback versatility is a plus.
title: Visibility

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X4 delivers hatchback versatility, with a 40/20/40 folding second-row. The cargo area holds 2 full-size suitcases or 4 golf bags behind the second row. Door pockets are wide. Usable space in the center armrest bin is minimal.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall this is a nice interior, holding to the most current BMW mold of design. Once the nuances of its infotainment system are learned, everything makes sense. Access to the cabin is pretty easy, same goes for the cargo area. Hatchback versatility is a plus.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: We enountered zero build quality issues. The X4 exhibited the high level of fitment we've come to expect from BMW. Everything about the X4 feels solid and like it will last a long time.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent, both in terms of materials and construction. Comes with lots of standard equipment and more popular options can be purchased individually, or nearly-so, rather than grouped into pricey packages. We averaged 20.6 mpg. Warranty terms are competitive.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Pricing starts at $44,700. Notable standard features include xenon adaptive headlights, power liftgate, dynamic cruise control, roof rails, auto-dimming mirrors, heated front seats, auto climate control and auto engine start-stop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent, both in terms of materials and construction. Comes with lots of standard equipment and more popular options can be purchased individually, or nearly-so, rather than grouped into pricey packages. We averaged 20.6 mpg. Warranty terms are competitive.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Our X4 cost $54,550 as-tested. Options included special paint ($550), M Sport pkg ($2,300), Driver Assist pkg ($700), Premium pkg ($2,200), heated front seats ($500), navigation ($2,150) and enhanced Bluetooth ($500).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent, both in terms of materials and construction. Comes with lots of standard equipment and more popular options can be purchased individually, or nearly-so, rather than grouped into pricey packages. We averaged 20.6 mpg. Warranty terms are competitive.
title: Cost

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The EPA estimates the X4 at 23 mpg Combined (20 City/28 Highway). The engine auto start/stop feature comes standard. We averaged 20.6 mpg overall, including 28.1 mpg on the Edmunds evaluation loop. Premium fuel is required.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent, both in terms of materials and construction. Comes with lots of standard equipment and more popular options can be purchased individually, or nearly-so, rather than grouped into pricey packages. We averaged 20.6 mpg. Warranty terms are competitive.
title: MPG

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X4 is covered for 4 years/50,000 miles by both the bumper-to-bumper and drivetrain warranties. These are matched by the Ranger Rover Evoque. There's also a 12-year rust perforation warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent, both in terms of materials and construction. Comes with lots of standard equipment and more popular options can be purchased individually, or nearly-so, rather than grouped into pricey packages. We averaged 20.6 mpg. Warranty terms are competitive.
title: Warranty

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Roadside assistance is covered for 4 years/unlimited miles, along with free scheduled maintenance for 4 years/50,000 miles. BMW Assist eCall 10-year subscription is also included.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent, both in terms of materials and construction. Comes with lots of standard equipment and more popular options can be purchased individually, or nearly-so, rather than grouped into pricey packages. We averaged 20.6 mpg. Warranty terms are competitive.
title: Ownership

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: Even with the M Sport package on our test vehicle, the X4 felt less sporty than BMW SUVs before it. It's fine for shorter journeys provided the roads you're traveling are on the smooth side.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: We wouldn't call the new X4 especially fun to drive. The ride is firm, but the handling is only negligibly sharper with the M suspension. The X4 is more of a style statement than it is a sporty SUV alternative.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: BMW
model.name: X4
style.name: xDrive28i 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 8A)
summary: The X4's squished, low-roof design doesn't appeal to everyone. It's a bit of a redheaded stepchild between BMW's own X3 and X5 siblings. The peppy turbo 4-cylinder and lively automatic provide some personality at least.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: We wouldn't call the new X4 especially fun to drive. The ride is firm, but the handling is only negligibly sharper with the M suspension. The X4 is more of a style statement than it is a sporty SUV alternative.
title: Personality

make.name: Buick
model.name: Verano
style.name: Premium Group 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: With the exception of a manually adjusted driver's seatback, seating for four is comfortable and very supportive. The center slot in the rear seat isn't intended for sitting, though.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Ride comfort and quietness are clearly priorities for the Verano.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Buick
model.name: Verano
style.name: Premium Group 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: This car rides like a much larger car with excellent road isolation and good damping characteristics -- as a luxury car should.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Ride comfort and quietness are clearly priorities for the Verano.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Buick
model.name: Verano
style.name: Premium Group 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Verano is noticeably quiet -- unusual for a small car but expected for a luxury car. Very little engine or wind noise; some tire noise depending on tire selection.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Ride comfort and quietness are clearly priorities for the Verano.

style.name: Premium Group 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The center stack offers a complete inventory of controls, yet the array of buttons invites confusion. The standard touchscreen works well, but is a long reach away.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Verano's interior has all the ingredients of a luxury car, but they're all just slightly shy of expectations for the segment.

summary: Typical compact-car-sized doors mean front seats are easily accessed, but rears require a little wiggling.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Verano's interior has all the ingredients of a luxury car, but they're all just slightly shy of expectations for the segment.

make.name: Buick
model.name: Verano
style.name: Premium Group 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Priority was given to a roomy up-front accommodations. Rear seats truly meant for two only and a little tight on head- and leg-room.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Verano's interior has all the ingredients of a luxury car, but they're all just slightly shy of expectations for the segment.

summary: Slightly problematic C-pillar, but optional blind-spot monitor and rear parking sensors help. No rearview camera available.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Verano's interior has all the ingredients of a luxury car, but they're all just slightly shy of expectations for the segment.

summary: At about 14 cu-ft, the truck is a good size (and regular shape) for a compact car. Standard 60/40 split-fold rear seats are appreciated.

ratings.summary: The Verano's interior has all the ingredients of a luxury car, but they're all just slightly shy of expectations for the segment.

summary: The turbocharged Verano Premium is quick, especially with the optional manual transmission. The naturally aspirated base engine is noticeably underpowered in comparison.

make.name: Cadillac
model.name: XTS
style.name: Vsport Premium 4dr Sedan AWD (3.6L 6cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The 410-horsepower, turbocharged 3.6-liter V6 needed just 5.1 seconds to reach 60 mph. This is nearly 2 full seconds quicker than the normally-aspirated V6. All-wheel drive helps it dig out from a stop. Very quick shifts, but a bit rough.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The standard XTS adequately straddles the sport/luxury line. With this new turbocharged V6 under the hood it leans heavily toward sport. All-wheel-drive and a slick 8-speed transmission really amplify its athleticism.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Cadillac
model.name: XTS
style.name: Vsport Premium 4dr Sedan AWD (3.6L 6cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The XTS stopped from 60 mph in 124 feet, about average for this class. Its pedal exhibited somewhat long travel while remaining fairly firm. Around town it was perfectly suited.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The standard XTS adequately straddles the sport/luxury line. With this new turbocharged V6 under the hood it leans heavily toward sport. All-wheel-drive and a slick 8-speed transmission really amplify its athleticism.
title: Braking

make.name: Cadillac
model.name: XTS
style.name: Vsport Premium 4dr Sedan AWD (3.6L 6cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The power steering assist is excessive for our tastes. Disconcertingly light at low speeds. It stiffens up at speed, but even then lacks the confidence we expect from a sedan with its sporting intentions.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The standard XTS adequately straddles the sport/luxury line. With this new turbocharged V6 under the hood it leans heavily toward sport. All-wheel-drive and a slick 8-speed transmission really amplify its athleticism.
title: Steering

make.name: Cadillac
model.name: XTS
style.name: Vsport Premium 4dr Sedan AWD (3.6L 6cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The XTS handles well for its size with quick turn-in. Despite noticeable body roll, even with the sport suspension selected, and some understeer, this Cadillac can be quick. AWD helps with corner exit.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The standard XTS adequately straddles the sport/luxury line. With this new turbocharged V6 under the hood it leans heavily toward sport. All-wheel-drive and a slick 8-speed transmission really amplify its athleticism.
title: Handling

model.name: XTS
style.name: Vsport Premium 4dr Sedan AWD (3.6L 6cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Lots of power available at low rpm, but some turbo/transmission lag. Compliant throttle calibration and easy steering keeps the XTS very manageable around town. Its 8-speed automatic is extremely smooth.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The standard XTS adequately straddles the sport/luxury line. With this new turbocharged V6 under the hood it leans heavily toward sport. All-wheel-drive and a slick 8-speed transmission really amplify its athleticism.

summary: The touchscreen features of CUE should be simple enough to operate. But it is the system's sluggishness, lack of knobs and reliance upon soft-touch sliders and dials that we found frustrating.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: CUE is the most polarizing feature of the XTS interior. Even with practice, the system can never quite be mastered. Still, many find its smartphone-like interaction appealing. All other interior hot-spots rank as slightly above average.
title: Ergonomics

model.name: XTS
style.name: Vsport Premium 4dr Sedan AWD (3.6L 6cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Front doors open wide and the roofline is high enough that we had no trouble climbing in and out. The rear doors don't open as far and the roofline is lower. Watch your head.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: CUE is the most polarizing feature of the XTS interior. Even with practice, the system can never quite be mastered. Still, many find its smartphone-like interaction appealing. All other interior hot-spots rank as slightly above average.

summary: Lots of shoulder room for front passengers with a bit less for those riding in the back. Rear headroom is adequate. Angled seatbacks allow plenty of space for knees.

ratings.summary: CUE is the most polarizing feature of the XTS interior. Even with practice, the system can never quite be mastered. Still, many find its smartphone-like interaction appealing. All other interior hot-spots rank as slightly above average.

summary: Its stylish design comes somewhat at the expense of visibility. Both front and rear roof-pillars are thick and limiting, despite the extra window cut-outs. A rearview camera is standard.

summary: Front passenger storage consists of a small center armrest bin, average door pockets and a modest glovebox. The trunk is deep yet narrow. Rear seatbacks fold to expand cargo space.

summary: Build quality was excellent. Top-tier materials feel more luxurious than Cadillac's done before. No squeaks or rattles in our test car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The XTS is a large car with the sort of performance and price we expect from the midsize luxury segment. Its extensive list of optional equipment raises its value to a level higher than most competitors.

ratings.summary: The XTS is a large car with the sort of performance and price we expect from the midsize luxury segment. Its extensive list of optional equipment raises its value to a level higher than most competitors.

summary: With an as-tested price of $65,415, the XTS is hugely competitive for the segment. It's is larger than the Audi A6, BMW 5 Series and Mercedes-Benz E-Class to boot.

summary: Acceleration from the turbocharged four-cylinder is on the higher side of average at 9.2 seconds to 60 mph. The automatic transmission can be resistant to downshifting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Despite its Eco-intended low-rolling-resistance tires, the Cruze still exhibited reasonable panic stopping distances, and the pedal has a firm, confidence-inspiring feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.

model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Good steering. Has a natural and responsive feel to it. Surprisingly sprightly turn-in for a car with less-than-spectacular tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.

summary: Even with its mpg-intended tires, the Eco showed similar agility to the LTZ model. It's that final bit of grip that's missing, but a 66.4-mph slalom run is still respectable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.

model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze's daily drivability is hurt by the engine's turbo lag and lack of power below 3,000 rpm, along with the aforementioned automatic's poor performance.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.

model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Front seats are wide and supportive and offer plenty of comfort. Rear seat also is decent for the segment.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Within its class, the Cruze ranks as one of the more comfortable cars, with the Ford Focus being the notable leader. The Cruze is quiet, has fairly plush seats and the little turbo-four is hardly thrashy.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Despite its good handling, the Cruze is a relaxed and comfortable car in normal driving, soaking up rough road surfaces almost as well as the majority of full-size sedans.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Within its class, the Cruze ranks as one of the more comfortable cars, with the Ford Focus being the notable leader. The Cruze is quiet, has fairly plush seats and the little turbo-four is hardly thrashy.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze is exceptionally quiet for a compact car. It's clear GM paid considerable attention to sound-deadening materials. Minimal wind and road noise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Within its class, the Cruze ranks as one of the more comfortable cars, with the Ford Focus being the notable leader. The Cruze is quiet, has fairly plush seats and the little turbo-four is hardly thrashy.

model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze features knobs where there should be knobs (HVAC, stereo volume) and liberal usage of large, well-labeled buttons for everything else.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze's interior is a significant step up from the Cobalt it replaced. There's still too many hard-touch surfaces, but it should be remembered this is an economy car--especially so the Eco version. In general, it's very livable.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Ingress/egress is easy in the Cruze, especially the front seats (a little less so in the rear seat).

summary: Rear outward vision is a problem in the Cruze, admittedly as it is in the majority of cars these days, what with wide B- and C-pillars restricting view and causing blind spots.

summary: We're giving the Cruze Eco high marks here. Not because its quality is so good (it's only fair), but because its price is so reasonable.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.

model.name: Cruze

summary: Bluetooth, USB and aux-in jacks, cruise control, satellite radio and floor mats all come standard at the Eco's $19,245 base price. But the automatic transmission costs $995.

model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze's 3 years/36,000 miles basic warranty and 5 year/100,000 mile drivetrain coverage are about equal to the Ford Focus, but well below that of the rival Hyundai Elantra.
ratings.title: Value

summary: The Cruze has roadside assistance 5 years/100,000 miles. This is slightly better than the Ford Focus, which is only covered to 60,000 miles. The Cruze does not have free scheduled maintenance.
ratings.title: Value

model.name: Cruze

summary: Overall the Cruze, even the Eco version, is a pretty decent-driving machine for an economy compact. We especially like the sporty handling manners.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you're not expecting much in terms of driving dynamics from your economy car, you'll be pleasantly surprised by the Cruze Eco. Between its turbo four-cylinder and lively handling manners, the car is, dare we say, a bit fun to drive.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: How much personality are you expecting here from a car with an automatic transmission? But, shocker, the auto blips the throttle on manual downshifts. Cool.

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Diesel 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6A)
summary: There's some hesitation from a standstill, but once you're moving, power is plentiful for merging and passing. Sixty mph is reached in 8.6 seconds, which is decent for compact sedans, diesel or gasoline.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 151 hp and 264 lb-ft from the 2.0-liter turbodiesel, the Cruze makes zero sacrifices in the name of efficiency. In fact, it's quicker than the conventional gasoline Cruze models. Handling also proved surprisingly capable.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Diesel 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6A)
summary: There was significant nosedive during our panic braking test, but the pedal remained firm and confidence-inspiring, and the car tracked straight. It needed 120 feet to stop from 60 mph, which is average.
ratings.title: Performance

summary: Steering feel is direct and appropriately weighted whether negotiating parking lots or the highway. Gives a natural response, and we found it predictably precise on winding roads.

summary: While we wouldn't consider it sporty, the Cruze is plenty capable on twisting mountain passes. Body roll is noticeable, but the Cruze remains confident and composed even when pushed enthusiastically.

model.name: Cruze

summary: A compact footprint makes the Cruze easy to maneuver in tight spaces. The 6-speed automatic transmission allows too much backward roll starting out on uphills, and shifts could be smoother.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 151 hp and 264 lb-ft from the 2.0-liter turbodiesel, the Cruze makes zero sacrifices in the name of efficiency. In fact, it's quicker than the conventional gasoline Cruze models. Handling also proved surprisingly capable.

model.name: Cruze
style.name: Diesel 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6A)
summary: The front seats remain comfortable for hours, but the hard plastic armrest annoys. Rear seats have acceptable headroom but the low cushion height sacrifices legroom, makes it suitable only for smaller folk.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Cruze scores with comfortable front seats and an agreeable ride quality, but points were deducted for a hard plastic armrest, lack of rear legroom, noticeable diesel engine clatter and a wind hiss coming from the driver's window.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Diesel 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6A)
summary: The Cruze is relaxed and comfortable in normal driving, soaking up rough surfaces almost as well as most full-size sedans. It feels confidently attached to the road.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Cruze scores with comfortable front seats and an agreeable ride quality, but points were deducted for a hard plastic armrest, lack of rear legroom, noticeable diesel engine clatter and a wind hiss coming from the driver's window.

summary: There's no getting around the diesel engine clatter, particularly prevalent when the engine is cold. We experienced a hissing near the windshield pillar, but otherwise road noise insulation was acceptable.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Cruze scores with comfortable front seats and an agreeable ride quality, but points were deducted for a hard plastic armrest, lack of rear legroom, noticeable diesel engine clatter and a wind hiss coming from the driver's window.

summary: Unlike previous experiences, we found the MyLink infotainment interface acceptably responsive to inputs. Most other controls are within easy reach, though not always in the most logical location.

ratings.summary: Interior design is pleasingly modern but material quality trails other compact sedans. The diesel version gives up about 2 cu-ft of trunk space to the conventional gas-powered Cruze. The lack of rear seat room should also be kept in mind.

summary: Front seat access is made easy with tall doors that aren't too long. Rear passengers may have to stoop some to clear the sloping rear roof.

ratings.summary: Interior design is pleasingly modern but material quality trails other compact sedans. The diesel version gives up about 2 cu-ft of trunk space to the conventional gas-powered Cruze. The lack of rear seat room should also be kept in mind.

ratings.summary: Interior design is pleasingly modern but material quality trails other compact sedans. The diesel version gives up about 2 cu-ft of trunk space to the conventional gas-powered Cruze. The lack of rear seat room should also be kept in mind.
