summary: Two years of free scheduled maintenance and six months of OnStar telematics are included. The Jetta TDI features similar programs as standard, too.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price of $25,695, the Chevrolet Cruze Diesel is only about $700 more than the base VW Jetta TDI with an automatic transmission. Fuel economy and performance are a virtual tie, but the Jetta benefits from better refinement.
title: Ownership

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Diesel 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6A)
summary: The Cruze's few flaws are easily overlooked, as it's generally a comfortable car that places few demands on the driver. Admirable fuel economy further enahnces the car's appeal.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: While fun may not be the operative word, the Cruze Diesel offers slightly better driving dynamics than most economy cars. You'll find its lively handling manners surprising, and since it's a diesel it has plenty of low-end torque.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Diesel 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6A)
summary: We think of the Cruze as a step or so above basic transportation. It's understated, bordering on bland, while other compact sedans offer a bit more personality.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: While fun may not be the operative word, the Cruze Diesel offers slightly better driving dynamics than most economy cars. You'll find its lively handling manners surprising, and since it's a diesel it has plenty of low-end torque.
title: Personality

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Acceleration from the turbocharged four-cylinder is on the higher side of average at 9.2 seconds to 60 mph. The automatic transmission can be resistant to downshifting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Despite its Eco-intended low-rolling-resistance tires, the Cruze still exhibited reasonable panic stopping distances, and the pedal has a firm, confidence-inspiring feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.
title: Braking

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Good steering. Has a natural and responsive feel to it. Surprisingly sprightly turn-in for a car with less-than-spectacular tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.
title: Steering

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Even with its mpg-intended tires, the Eco showed similar agility to the LTZ model. It's that final bit of grip that's missing, but a 66.4-mph slalom run is still respectable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.
title: Handling

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze's daily drivability is hurt by the engine's turbo lag and lack of power below 3,000 rpm, along with the aforementioned automatic's poor performance.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Cruze Eco is certainly not intended as a performance machine, but because the regular Cruze is at the top of the compact segment, the Eco is competent as well. Acceleration is only about average, but handling is a strong suit.
title: Driveability

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Front seats are wide and supportive and offer plenty of comfort. Rear seat also is decent for the segment.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Within its class, the Cruze ranks as one of the more comfortable cars, with the Ford Focus being the notable leader. The Cruze is quiet, has fairly plush seats and the little turbo-four is hardly thrashy.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Despite its good handling, the Cruze is a relaxed and comfortable car in normal driving, soaking up rough road surfaces almost as well as the majority of full-size sedans.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Within its class, the Cruze ranks as one of the more comfortable cars, with the Ford Focus being the notable leader. The Cruze is quiet, has fairly plush seats and the little turbo-four is hardly thrashy.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze is exceptionally quiet for a compact car. It's clear GM paid considerable attention to sound-deadening materials. Minimal wind and road noise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Within its class, the Cruze ranks as one of the more comfortable cars, with the Ford Focus being the notable leader. The Cruze is quiet, has fairly plush seats and the little turbo-four is hardly thrashy.
title: Quietness

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze features knobs where there should be knobs (HVAC, stereo volume) and liberal usage of large, well-labeled buttons for everything else.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze's interior is a significant step up from the Cobalt it replaced. There's still too many hard-touch surfaces, but it should be remembered this is an economy car--especially so the Eco version. In general, it's very livable.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Ingress/egress is easy in the Cruze, especially the front seats (a little less so in the rear seat).
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze's interior is a significant step up from the Cobalt it replaced. There's still too many hard-touch surfaces, but it should be remembered this is an economy car--especially so the Eco version. In general, it's very livable.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Drivers and passengers with wide shoulders will find little place to put their arms, as the door panels encroach into the seat space more than other cars in the class.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze's interior is a significant step up from the Cobalt it replaced. There's still too many hard-touch surfaces, but it should be remembered this is an economy car--especially so the Eco version. In general, it's very livable.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Rear outward vision is a problem in the Cruze, admittedly as it is in the majority of cars these days, what with wide B- and C-pillars restricting view and causing blind spots.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze's interior is a significant step up from the Cobalt it replaced. There's still too many hard-touch surfaces, but it should be remembered this is an economy car--especially so the Eco version. In general, it's very livable.
title: Visibility

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze has a decent-size trunk along with a 60/40-split rear seat that folds nearly flat. Door pockets, center console and cupholders are all on the small size.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze's interior is a significant step up from the Cobalt it replaced. There's still too many hard-touch surfaces, but it should be remembered this is an economy car--especially so the Eco version. In general, it's very livable.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We're giving the Cruze Eco high marks here. Not because its quality is so good (it's only fair), but because its price is so reasonable.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Bluetooth, USB and aux-in jacks, cruise control, satellite radio and floor mats all come standard at the Eco's $19,245 base price. But the automatic transmission costs $995.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze, whether Eco model or otherwise, offers quite a bit of stylish car for the money, with plenty of handy standard features.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.
title: Cost

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze Eco is rated at 26 city/39 highway/31 mpg combined. We averaged 24.8 mpg in varied driving. The problem with turbos is that a heavy right foot hurts mileage greatly.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.
title: MPG

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze's 3 years/36,000 miles basic warranty and 5 year/100,000 mile drivetrain coverage are about equal to the Ford Focus, but well below that of the rival Hyundai Elantra.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.
title: Warranty

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cruze has roadside assistance 5 years/100,000 miles. This is slightly better than the Ford Focus, which is only covered to 60,000 miles. The Cruze does not have free scheduled maintenance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze offers a lot of features for its price point, similar to the Hyundai Elantra, better than the Ford Focus. But the Focus and Elantra have higher-quality interiors. The Cruze's real-world mileage doesn't live up to its EPA rating.
title: Ownership

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Overall the Cruze, even the Eco version, is a pretty decent-driving machine for an economy compact. We especially like the sporty handling manners.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you're not expecting much in terms of driving dynamics from your economy car, you'll be pleasantly surprised by the Cruze Eco. Between its turbo four-cylinder and lively handling manners, the car is, dare we say, a bit fun to drive.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Eco 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: How much personality are you expecting here from a car with an automatic transmission? But, shocker, the auto blips the throttle on manual downshifts. Cool.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you're not expecting much in terms of driving dynamics from your economy car, you'll be pleasantly surprised by the Cruze Eco. Between its turbo four-cylinder and lively handling manners, the car is, dare we say, a bit fun to drive.
title: Personality

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Acceleration feels sluggish from rest; the dash from zero to 60 mph took 9.6 seconds at the track. But it responds reasonably well when moving — such as passing maneuvers on the highway — because you don't have to floor the gas pedal to trigger a downshift.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 153 horsepower and 177 pound-feet of torque, the Cruze's turbocharged 1.4-liter engine should be competitive. But the power doesn't come on strong until high in the rev range, which blunts acceleration. Everything else, from the strong brakes to the adept chassis, is very well-sorted.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Cruze has a nice, firm brake pedal feel, and the brakes apply as soon as you press the pedal. But they aren't touchy; they're just responsive. The Cruze needed only 110 feet to come to a stop from 60 mph, a very short distance for a compact sedan.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 153 horsepower and 177 pound-feet of torque, the Cruze's turbocharged 1.4-liter engine should be competitive. But the power doesn't come on strong until high in the rev range, which blunts acceleration. Everything else, from the strong brakes to the adept chassis, is very well-sorted.
title: Braking

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Steering effort is fairly light, a typical characteristic in this class. The car feels sporty thanks to its quick reactions to steering inputs and the amount of feedback transmitted through the steering wheel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 153 horsepower and 177 pound-feet of torque, the Cruze's turbocharged 1.4-liter engine should be competitive. But the power doesn't come on strong until high in the rev range, which blunts acceleration. Everything else, from the strong brakes to the adept chassis, is very well-sorted.
title: Steering

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Feels balance and coordinated. The optional 18-inch tires provide good grip, so you can take turns reasonably quickly before the tires begin to howl. Driver confidence is further enhanced by a surprisingly low amount of body roll.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 153 horsepower and 177 pound-feet of torque, the Cruze's turbocharged 1.4-liter engine should be competitive. But the power doesn't come on strong until high in the rev range, which blunts acceleration. Everything else, from the strong brakes to the adept chassis, is very well-sorted.
title: Handling

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Cruze doesn't immediately jump to the highest gear when pulling away from a stop, and it is smart enough to hold on to lower gears on uphill climbs. While mostly unintrusive, the automatic engine stop-start feature cannot be disabled.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With 153 horsepower and 177 pound-feet of torque, the Cruze's turbocharged 1.4-liter engine should be competitive. But the power doesn't come on strong until high in the rev range, which blunts acceleration. Everything else, from the strong brakes to the adept chassis, is very well-sorted.
title: Driveability

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Front seats allow plenty of travel for tall drivers, while wider occupants might feel somewhat confined by the narrow seatbacks. There's no lumbar adjustment, the seat belt is not height-adjustable, and the headrests feel as if they are angled too far forward.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Given the relative lack of seat adjustments and the forward-angled headrest, it might take some fiddling to feel truly comfortable behind the wheel. The ride is pleasant, even with our tester's 18-inch wheels (the largest the Cruze offers). Mandatory engine stop-start is far from seamless.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Cruze expertly soaks up bumps and imperfections. Road feel is more pronounced with the RS package's 18-inch wheels, but the ride is rarely choppy or harsh. If you prize comfort over sportiness, lower trims (or even the standard Premier) are more compliant.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Given the relative lack of seat adjustments and the forward-angled headrest, it might take some fiddling to feel truly comfortable behind the wheel. The ride is pleasant, even with our tester's 18-inch wheels (the largest the Cruze offers). Mandatory engine stop-start is far from seamless.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Premier's automatic single-zone climate control works well to keep the interior at a comfortable temperature. In heavy traffic, the stop-start system frequently turns the engine off and reduces fan speed, causing cabin tempartures to rise while stationary.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Given the relative lack of seat adjustments and the forward-angled headrest, it might take some fiddling to feel truly comfortable behind the wheel. The ride is pleasant, even with our tester's 18-inch wheels (the largest the Cruze offers). Mandatory engine stop-start is far from seamless.
title: Climate Control

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: At highway speeds, wind and engine noise is kept to a minimum, while road noise is present but not overwhelming. A mild shock through the cabin can be felt when the Cruze's stop-start feature turns the engine off and on.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Given the relative lack of seat adjustments and the forward-angled headrest, it might take some fiddling to feel truly comfortable behind the wheel. The ride is pleasant, even with our tester's 18-inch wheels (the largest the Cruze offers). Mandatory engine stop-start is far from seamless.
title: Noise & Vibration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Clear gauges, intuitive steering-mounted controls. Most of the switches and knobs on the center stack are within the driver's reach; only the temperature knob requires a stretch to reach and rotate. Manual gear selector buttons are awkwardly located on top of the shifter.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze might be classified as a compact car, but few will find the cabin confining. There's plenty of shoulder room for all outboard passengers (the raised center tunnel limits the usefulness of the narrow middle seat). Controls and gauges are mostly easy to get along with.
title: Ease of Use

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: With a wide door opening, high roof and minimal seat bolstering, it is extremely easy to get into and out of the front seats. The slope of the roof makes back row access a bit more difficult.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze might be classified as a compact car, but few will find the cabin confining. There's plenty of shoulder room for all outboard passengers (the raised center tunnel limits the usefulness of the narrow middle seat). Controls and gauges are mostly easy to get along with.
title: Getting In/Out

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The steering wheel and driver seat both have a good range of motion, so most people will be able to find an agreeable seating position. The seat bottom doesn't tilt back as much as we'd like, but this is common for this class.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze might be classified as a compact car, but few will find the cabin confining. There's plenty of shoulder room for all outboard passengers (the raised center tunnel limits the usefulness of the narrow middle seat). Controls and gauges are mostly easy to get along with.
title: Driving Position

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The cabin has enough legroom to seat four 6-footers with minimal complaints. And there's cabin width to prevent occupants from rubbing elbows. But the sloping roof could compel tall rear passengers to slouch despite headliner cutouts above their heads.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze might be classified as a compact car, but few will find the cabin confining. There's plenty of shoulder room for all outboard passengers (the raised center tunnel limits the usefulness of the narrow middle seat). Controls and gauges are mostly easy to get along with.
title: Roominess

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Good forward and side visibility thanks to a low hood, tall windows and relatively narrow rear pillars. High-mounted shelf reduces rearward visibility, but a standard backup camera and optional parking sensors and cross-traffic alert make this a nonissue.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Cruze might be classified as a compact car, but few will find the cabin confining. There's plenty of shoulder room for all outboard passengers (the raised center tunnel limits the usefulness of the narrow middle seat). Controls and gauges are mostly easy to get along with.
title: Visibility

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Chevrolet's MyLink system is exceptionally easy to use. Presets can be programmed with destinations for the navigation system or channels from any radio band. It seems quicker to react to user inputs than earlier versions of MyLink.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: Other than the subpar performance of its voice recognition software, the Chevrolet MyLink infotainment system is one of the best in the business. The interface is attractive, uncluttered and, most important, easy to learn and operate. Standard Apple CarPlay/Android Auto is a major plus.
title: Audio & Navigation

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Pairing a phone to the Bluetooth system is simple and quick. Apple CarPlay and Android Auto functionality are included on every Cruze, as are an auxiliary input and a USB port. Our tester's Enhanced Convenience package also adds wireless smartphone charging.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: Other than the subpar performance of its voice recognition software, the Chevrolet MyLink infotainment system is one of the best in the business. The interface is attractive, uncluttered and, most important, easy to learn and operate. Standard Apple CarPlay/Android Auto is a major plus.
title: Device Integration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The MyLink system is good at recognizing names in your phonebook, but attempting to navigate to an address is an exercise in frustration. Press and hold the voice button for longer, however, and you can do it via Siri or Google Voice on your paired smartphone.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: Other than the subpar performance of its voice recognition software, the Chevrolet MyLink infotainment system is one of the best in the business. The interface is attractive, uncluttered and, most important, easy to learn and operate. Standard Apple CarPlay/Android Auto is a major plus.
title: Voice Controls

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Standard and optional safety features are in line with the rest of the class, which is a testament to how much tech is available in this segment. Premier-only Driver Confidence II package adds lane departure warning, lane keeping assist and a blind-spot monitor.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: Other than the subpar performance of its voice recognition software, the Chevrolet MyLink infotainment system is one of the best in the business. The interface is attractive, uncluttered and, most important, easy to learn and operate. Standard Apple CarPlay/Android Auto is a major plus.
title: Driver Aids

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The generous trunklid opens to reveal a deep well that feels big. But the volume shrinks from 14.9 to a more typical 13.8 cubic feet (less than a Civic, more than a Mazda 3) if you buy an LT or Premier because they come with a spare tire that takes up cargo space.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: Like many compact sedans, the Cruze has a sizable cargo area with a flat load floor and little intruison from the wheel wells. The 60/40-split rear seats fold down should you need extra space. Inside, there are numerous cubbies for you and your friends to store various small items.
title: Cargo Space

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Storage cubbies in each door can hold a water bottle and a few small items. There are two regular cupholders in the front row and two more in the fold-down rear armrest. Optional wireless charging slot eats up a significant amount of front console storage.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: Like many compact sedans, the Cruze has a sizable cargo area with a flat load floor and little intruison from the wheel wells. The 60/40-split rear seats fold down should you need extra space. Inside, there are numerous cubbies for you and your friends to store various small items.
title: Small Item Storage

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The outboard rear seats each have a pair of LATCH anchors hidden under clearly marked covers that are easily pushed aside. The three upper anchors are located on top of the rear shelf and are similarly accessible.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: Like many compact sedans, the Cruze has a sizable cargo area with a flat load floor and little intruison from the wheel wells. The 60/40-split rear seats fold down should you need extra space. Inside, there are numerous cubbies for you and your friends to store various small items.
title: Car Seat Accommodation

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: With a glossy black trim center console, leatherette surfaces on the dash and contrast-color stitching throughout, the Cruze's cabin looks and feels premium. Excessive chrome trim blinds in bright sunlight, and our tester's squeaky brake pedal was irksome.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze looks great on paper: free scheduled maintenance, a well-dressed cabin and good fuel economy estimates at a decent price. Try as we might, though, we were unable to come close to the Cruze's EPA fuel economy rating, and a few interior trim pieces failed to impress.
title: Build Quality

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Cruze Premier starts at $23,995; with every option package and premium paint, our tester rings in at $29,035. A fully loaded Mazda 3 costs about $1,000 more, while the top-trim Honda Civic costs roughly $1,500 less.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze looks great on paper: free scheduled maintenance, a well-dressed cabin and good fuel economy estimates at a decent price. Try as we might, though, we were unable to come close to the Cruze's EPA fuel economy rating, and a few interior trim pieces failed to impress.
title: Cost

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Premier's EPA-estimated fuel economy is 34 mpg combined (30 city/40 highway), which is average. But we managed just 26.7 mpg in mixed driving and 31.8 mpg on our 115-mile test loop, a poor result considering its slow acceleration and mandatory stop-start system.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze looks great on paper: free scheduled maintenance, a well-dressed cabin and good fuel economy estimates at a decent price. Try as we might, though, we were unable to come close to the Cruze's EPA fuel economy rating, and a few interior trim pieces failed to impress.
title: MPG

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Chevrolet offers a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and a drivetrain warranty at 5 years/60,000 miles. Both are average for the class but less than Hyundai and Kia. Rust protection stands at 6 years/100,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze looks great on paper: free scheduled maintenance, a well-dressed cabin and good fuel economy estimates at a decent price. Try as we might, though, we were unable to come close to the Cruze's EPA fuel economy rating, and a few interior trim pieces failed to impress.
title: Warranty

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The first two scheduled maintenance visits (up to two years/24,000 miles) are complimentary; Toyota is the only competitor that also offers free maintenance. Roadside assistance is available for five years/60,000 miles, lengthier than most competitors offer.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Cruze looks great on paper: free scheduled maintenance, a well-dressed cabin and good fuel economy estimates at a decent price. Try as we might, though, we were unable to come close to the Cruze's EPA fuel economy rating, and a few interior trim pieces failed to impress.
title: Ownership

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Unlike most cars in this segment, the Cruze is actually fairly fun. Thank the predictable steering, ready grip from the 18-inch tires and low amount of body roll. The powertrain isn't snappy off the line, but it is willing enough once the car is underway.
ratings.title: Wild Card
ratings.summary: The Cruze proves to be an interesting alternative to most compact cars. It provides a sporty driving experience similar to the Mazda 3 with the ride comfort afforded by the Honda Civic. Unfortunately, the engine's lack of power keeps the Cruze from being a standout.
title: Fun-to-Drive

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Cruze
style.name: Premier 4dr Sedan (1.4L 4cyl 6A)
summary: A lot of the Cruze's personality shines through in its playful handling characteristics. Otherwise, it's a comfortable compact sedan with a classy interior that is held back somewhat by an underpowered engine.
ratings.title: Wild Card
ratings.summary: The Cruze proves to be an interesting alternative to most compact cars. It provides a sporty driving experience similar to the Mazda 3 with the ride comfort afforded by the Honda Civic. Unfortunately, the engine's lack of power keeps the Cruze from being a standout.
title: Personality

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: This is a very small turbo-four, and yes, it does have lag. That said, it's a smooth, reasonably quiet piece. The 6-speed manual has longish throws, clunky action.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: As far as spirited economy cars, you can do worse than the Sonic RS. We were impressed with its steering and handling feel on some of our favorite back roads. The turbo engine doesn't have a lot of sauce, and drivability could be better.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The brake pedal was nicely firm, both at the test track during panic stops and out on some back roads. Good power. Stops were fairly short, too, and that's with all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: As far as spirited economy cars, you can do worse than the Sonic RS. We were impressed with its steering and handling feel on some of our favorite back roads. The turbo engine doesn't have a lot of sauce, and drivability could be better.
title: Braking

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The steering feels quicker in this RS version of the Sonic. Has great, right-now turn-in and it's nice and precise. Perfect for wicking up the pace on your favorite two-lane.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: As far as spirited economy cars, you can do worse than the Sonic RS. We were impressed with its steering and handling feel on some of our favorite back roads. The turbo engine doesn't have a lot of sauce, and drivability could be better.
title: Steering

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Between the lower, stiffened suspension and the quick steering, the Sonic RS is a fine little handler. Good grip and minimal understeer, it's a real hoot on a back road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: As far as spirited economy cars, you can do worse than the Sonic RS. We were impressed with its steering and handling feel on some of our favorite back roads. The turbo engine doesn't have a lot of sauce, and drivability could be better.
title: Handling

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Drivability is hurt by the on-again, off-again turbo. Short 1st gear, clunky gearbox. Not easy to get the whole clutch takeup, throttle, shifter operation smooth every time.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: As far as spirited economy cars, you can do worse than the Sonic RS. We were impressed with its steering and handling feel on some of our favorite back roads. The turbo engine doesn't have a lot of sauce, and drivability could be better.
title: Driveability

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The front seats are well stuffed with grippy bolsters for cornering. Good driver seat center armrest, but rock-hard door armrests. The rear seats were just average.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The front sport seats are very comfortable while providing excellent lateral support for taking corners with verve. The ride is definitely on the harsh side, and we were a bit surprised by the boomy tires.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Not surprisingly, since this is a sport-oriented model, the Sonic RS has a busy ride. The thickly padded seats help, but get it on a rough road and you'll really feel the bumps.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The front sport seats are very comfortable while providing excellent lateral support for taking corners with verve. The ride is definitely on the harsh side, and we were a bit surprised by the boomy tires.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The turbocharged four isn't loud, even at full throttle, but it also never sounds inspired. Wind noise is low, but there's a fair amount of boomy tire noise on coarse surfaces.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The front sport seats are very comfortable while providing excellent lateral support for taking corners with verve. The ride is definitely on the harsh side, and we were a bit surprised by the boomy tires.
title: Quietness

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Took awhile for the Bluetooth to figure out if our phone had been previously paired. Radio touchscreen has some oddities. Nice large HVAC knobs, but the detents are undefined.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a cheap economy that feels, well, kinda cheap, especially the controls and the yards of hard-touch surfaces. But there's a decent amount of room inside and good storage. And the cupholders actually have anti-tip.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Large front doors that open wide, easy entry/exit, no problems hitting head on roof. Rear doors also open wide, but foot box entry/exit is a bit cramped.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a cheap economy that feels, well, kinda cheap, especially the controls and the yards of hard-touch surfaces. But there's a decent amount of room inside and good storage. And the cupholders actually have anti-tip.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Elbow room is tight up front, but headroom is excellent. Driver's right knee doesn't bump center console. Rear door-side elbow room is cramped, but good head-, foot and knee room.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a cheap economy that feels, well, kinda cheap, especially the controls and the yards of hard-touch surfaces. But there's a decent amount of room inside and good storage. And the cupholders actually have anti-tip.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The long, sloping A-pillars make it difficult to look deep through turns. Average-size B-pillars, but huge C-pillars, and smallish rear window. No back-up camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a cheap economy that feels, well, kinda cheap, especially the controls and the yards of hard-touch surfaces. But there's a decent amount of room inside and good storage. And the cupholders actually have anti-tip.
title: Visibility

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Small front bin works for cell phone. No center console bin. Door pockets are reasonably wide. Cupholders have anti-tip. No storage in rear-seat area, but seats do fold down.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This is a cheap economy that feels, well, kinda cheap, especially the controls and the yards of hard-touch surfaces. But there's a decent amount of room inside and good storage. And the cupholders actually have anti-tip.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Doors need to be slammed to close properly. Hard-touch plastic throughout cabin, dash, door panels, hand brake lever. Steering wheel and shift knob have a nice feel though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Interior quality is a bit lacking, and the RS model is on the expensive side for the class. But the fuel economy we achieved was reasonable, especially considering we picked up the pace on some curvy roads.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Sonic RS comes with cruise control, Bluetooth, satellite radio, heated mirrors, heated seats, suede-like seat inserts and a hill-hold feature all standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Interior quality is a bit lacking, and the RS model is on the expensive side for the class. But the fuel economy we achieved was reasonable, especially considering we picked up the pace on some curvy roads.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Our Sonic RS test vehicle had no options. It cost $20,995, including the $795 destination fee.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Interior quality is a bit lacking, and the RS model is on the expensive side for the class. But the fuel economy we achieved was reasonable, especially considering we picked up the pace on some curvy roads.
title: Cost

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The EPA rates the Sonic RS at 27 city/34 highway/30 mpg combined. We averaged 30.6 mpg on our highly-varied Edmunds test route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Interior quality is a bit lacking, and the RS model is on the expensive side for the class. But the fuel economy we achieved was reasonable, especially considering we picked up the pace on some curvy roads.
title: MPG

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The basic warranty of 3 years/36,000 miles is average, but the 5 year/100,000 mile drivetrain coverage is slightly above average, though well below that of the Hyundai Accent.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Interior quality is a bit lacking, and the RS model is on the expensive side for the class. But the fuel economy we achieved was reasonable, especially considering we picked up the pace on some curvy roads.
title: Warranty

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Sonic's 5 year/100,000-mile roadside assistance is again just slightly above cars like the Ford Fiesta. The Sonic does not have free free maintenance. The Toyota Yaris does.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Interior quality is a bit lacking, and the RS model is on the expensive side for the class. But the fuel economy we achieved was reasonable, especially considering we picked up the pace on some curvy roads.
title: Ownership

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Sonic RS's driving experience is marred somewhat by its laggy turbo engine and a difficult-to-make-smooth clutch/throttle/shifter collaboration in traffic.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Unlike the majority of its small-car competitors, the Sonic RS is actually fun to drive, especially when traffic clears and the road gets curvy. We like the sharp, quick steering, stiffer suspension and ample roadholding.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Sonic
style.name: RS 4dr Hatchback (1.4L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The turbo engine isn't inspiring in terms of its exhaust note, but at least it isn't loud. The handling of the RS package and the car's unique interior give it some sporty mojo.

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The Volt offers enough speed for safe freeway merges. It's quicker to 60 mph with the engine helping after the battery runs down, but its 9.5-second all-electric time is respectable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: It's not terribly fast, but driving quickly isn't how you maximize range anyway. It handles and brakes well but it would be nice if the steering felt connected to something. It feels artificial.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Unlike most hybrids, the brakes feel normal, even though slowing is a blend of mechanical and magnetic regenerative braking. Its panic stop of 117 feet is shorter than many of its peers.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: It's not terribly fast, but driving quickly isn't how you maximize range anyway. It handles and brakes well but it would be nice if the steering felt connected to something. It feels artificial.
title: Braking

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Steering effort is just about right. But it changes little as cornering forces ebb and flow, which makes the steering feel numb and detached. The Volt goes where it's pointed, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: It's not terribly fast, but driving quickly isn't how you maximize range anyway. It handles and brakes well but it would be nice if the steering felt connected to something. It feels artificial.
title: Steering

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: There isn't a lot of body roll and the chassis is well balanced through corners. This allowed it to cut a respectable time through our slalom despite modest tire grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: It's not terribly fast, but driving quickly isn't how you maximize range anyway. It handles and brakes well but it would be nice if the steering felt connected to something. It feels artificial.
title: Handling

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Seamless electric-drive feeling extends after the engine kicks in to generate juice to extend the range and lend a helping hand in high-demand situations.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: It's not terribly fast, but driving quickly isn't how you maximize range anyway. It handles and brakes well but it would be nice if the steering felt connected to something. It feels artificial.
title: Driveability

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Good sculpting and support. Our resident tall guy felt right at home during an extended 4-hour test. But the minimal adjustments are manual, not power. Try before you buy.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Volt rides like many other nicely-tuned sedans intended for daily duty, and in electric mode it's extremely quiet, too. Seats are good if you fit them, but the manual adjustments are fairly basic.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Rides smoothly over ripply pavement and patched asphalt, but it's not floaty. Strikes a good balance between too soft and too hard; Goldilocks would approve.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Volt rides like many other nicely-tuned sedans intended for daily duty, and in electric mode it's extremely quiet, too. Seats are good if you fit them, but the manual adjustments are fairly basic.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The powertrain is utterly silent in electric mode and the engine is mostly quiet when it comes on. Unless you're climbing a hill, when it revs high. Wind and tire noise are unobtrusive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Volt rides like many other nicely-tuned sedans intended for daily duty, and in electric mode it's extremely quiet, too. Seats are good if you fit them, but the manual adjustments are fairly basic.
title: Quietness

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: This is where it all falls apart. That touch-sensitive center stack is maddening. The buttons give no feedback, they're randomly arranged and some climate functions require the touchscreen.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Volt only has four seats, and the rear ones definitely won't pass power lunch standards. More than anything, though, the interior is compromised by an awful touch-sensitive button array that is more trouble than its worth.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Not bad up front, where the roof is reasonbly high. But the roofline slopes down toward the back and becomes a real noggin knocker for anyone whose height begins with a six.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Volt only has four seats, and the rear ones definitely won't pass power lunch standards. More than anything, though, the interior is compromised by an awful touch-sensitive button array that is more trouble than its worth.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: No problem up front where headroom and legroom are ample. But the sloping roofline cuts into rear headroom, and rear legroom isn't generous. Plus there are only two seats back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Volt only has four seats, and the rear ones definitely won't pass power lunch standards. More than anything, though, the interior is compromised by an awful touch-sensitive button array that is more trouble than its worth.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Mostly good, except the rear three-quarter blind spot is a bit large. The view out the back is reasonable, if somewhat narrow.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Volt only has four seats, and the rear ones definitely won't pass power lunch standards. More than anything, though, the interior is compromised by an awful touch-sensitive button array that is more trouble than its worth.
title: Visibility

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The hatchback layout means the cargo area isn't affected by the battery like other plug-ins. Still, the Volt's styling limits cargo space, and that rubber-band cargo cover is embarassing.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Volt only has four seats, and the rear ones definitely won't pass power lunch standards. More than anything, though, the interior is compromised by an awful touch-sensitive button array that is more trouble than its worth.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The build quality is good for something priced at the $25,000 Chevy Malibu level, but the interior materials and presentation start to feel underwhelming for $40 grand.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volt is pricey because you're paying for two powertrains. Plug-in range is generous, but you need to maximize electric running to avoid fuel cost creep. Especiallly since the Volt's gasoline mpg trails the competiton, and it needs premium.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: Heated seats and leather don't come standard at the $39,995 base price. Neither does a back-up camera or navigation system. Seats are manually adjustable, even at an as-tested $43,950.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volt is pricey because you're paying for two powertrains. Plug-in range is generous, but you need to maximize electric running to avoid fuel cost creep. Especiallly since the Volt's gasoline mpg trails the competiton, and it needs premium.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The powertrain represents the bulk of the cost, which crosses into $40,000 territory easily. The Volt does qualify for a $7,500 tax credit, but that doesn't come off the price when you buy.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volt is pricey because you're paying for two powertrains. Plug-in range is generous, but you need to maximize electric running to avoid fuel cost creep. Especiallly since the Volt's gasoline mpg trails the competiton, and it needs premium.
title: Cost

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The revised 2013 Volt can go 38 miles on electricity, three more than last year. After that it runs on gasoline to the tune of 37 mpg Combined (35 city/40 hwy). The Prius is better on gas.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volt is pricey because you're paying for two powertrains. Plug-in range is generous, but you need to maximize electric running to avoid fuel cost creep. Especiallly since the Volt's gasoline mpg trails the competiton, and it needs premium.
title: MPG

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The basic warranty is a middling 3 years/36,000 miles, but the powertrain is covered for 5 years/100,000 miles and the hybrid components are set for 8 years/100,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volt is pricey because you're paying for two powertrains. Plug-in range is generous, but you need to maximize electric running to avoid fuel cost creep. Especiallly since the Volt's gasoline mpg trails the competiton, and it needs premium.
title: Warranty

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The Volt's large battery needs 14-plus hours to recharge on a standard 120V outlet. If you drain it daily you'll need to install a 240V Level 2 charger at home. Needs premium gas, too.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volt is pricey because you're paying for two powertrains. Plug-in range is generous, but you need to maximize electric running to avoid fuel cost creep. Especiallly since the Volt's gasoline mpg trails the competiton, and it needs premium.
title: Ownership

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: You get enough range to stay in EV mode for most, if not all, of your commute. Plus, there's absolutely zero range anxiety because the gas engine has your back.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Volt has more electric range than other plug-in hybrids, enough to make it behave as a true EV for some folks. Those with long commutes or road trip aspirations can use it, too, which makes it unique. It's more self-satisfying than fun, though.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Chevrolet
model.name: Volt
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (gas/electric hybrid DD)
summary: The Volt's Jekyll-and-Jekyll split personality performs equally well in all-electric and gasoline hybrid modes.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Volt has more electric range than other plug-in hybrids, enough to make it behave as a true EV for some folks. Those with long commutes or road trip aspirations can use it, too, which makes it unique. It's more self-satisfying than fun, though.
title: Personality

make.name: Chrysler
style.name: Limited 2dr Convertible (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: With the standard 283-hp V6, this convertible is at or near the top of the sub-$35,000 convertible pack in terms of acceleration.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Equipped with the standard V6, this 4-seat convertible is remarkably quick, has ample brakes and is a pleasure to drive.
title: Acceleration

style.name: Limited 2dr Convertible (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Midpack braking performance with medium-soft pedal feel and some nose dive but always straight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Equipped with the standard V6, this 4-seat convertible is remarkably quick, has ample brakes and is a pleasure to drive.
title: Braking

style.name: Limited 2dr Convertible (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: For its class, the 200 Convertible offers good steering feel and exceptional response.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Equipped with the standard V6, this 4-seat convertible is remarkably quick, has ample brakes and is a pleasure to drive.
title: Steering

make.name: Chrysler
style.name: Limited 2dr Convertible (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Unexpected class-topping handling (proven at our test facility). The car leans in the corners, but provides enormous grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Equipped with the standard V6, this 4-seat convertible is remarkably quick, has ample brakes and is a pleasure to drive.
title: Handling

style.name: Limited 2dr Convertible (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The smooth shifting automatic, effortless V6 power, and good steering, make the 200 a very pleasant car to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Equipped with the standard V6, this 4-seat convertible is remarkably quick, has ample brakes and is a pleasure to drive.

summary: Standard heated seats of the Limited are otherwise unremarkable: four buckets slightly better (looking) than those of the 200 Sedan.

ratings.summary: The 200 offers exceptionally good ride comfort and quietness, however, seats are merely adequate and are limited to just four places in total.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Chrysler
style.name: Limited 2dr Convertible (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Ride comfort is remarkable because it walks the narrow (and rarely achieved) line between too soft and too firm. Clearly better than most convertibles at this price.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The 200 offers exceptionally good ride comfort and quietness, however, seats are merely adequate and are limited to just four places in total.

summary: Nearly as quiet as the sedan, sound-deadening glass and hardtop convertible do a very good job quelling wind noise, but occasional tire/road noise does find its way into the cabin.

summary: Simple knobs for HVAC and other basic functions. Limited (and above) standard touchscreen controller (with or without navigation) unnecessarily complicates things. Poor interface.

ratings.summary: This is where the old Sebring shines through, yet, basic controls are done faithfully, and there's plenty of room under a hardtop convertible (unique at this price).

ratings.summary: In ways that the Sebring never was, the Chrysler 200 is actually fun to drive with a powerful V6, big-car ride, but also with nimble handling. It might remind you of a rental car, but every top-down drive could feel like a vacation day.

summary: At 8.1 sec. to 60 mph, the T&C lags just slightly behind rivals, though the 283-hp 3.6-liter V6 feels eager enough. The 6-sp automatic's manual gear selection, though awkward, is a nice feature.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Dynamically the front-wheel-drive T&C is merely adequate. Though it does little that feels truly wrong from behind the wheel, it lacks refinement in its powertrain and suspension tuning relative to the Japanese competition.
title: Acceleration

model.name: Town and Country
style.name: Touring-L 4dr Minivan (3.6L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The T&C's stopping distance of 120 feet from 60-0 is far better than its competitors. Pedal feel and response were awkward during panic stops, but not a problem in normal driving.
