make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: XLT 4dr SuperCab 6.5 ft. SB (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Front cabin has decent space. Rear seats are tight, as expected for a SuperCab. They sell a SuperCrew for those that need full-size rear seat accomodations.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This truck feels dated inside, and it's not just the styling. Certain controls feel outmoded, and it turns out reverse-hinged doors were never that great of an idea to begin with. Now that GM canned them, Ford is alone here.

model.name: F-150

summary: Good to the sides and front, and the mirrors are big. Rear three-quarter view a bit tough due to fat passenger headrest and small windows in the back door. Needs a back-up camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This truck feels dated inside, and it's not just the styling. Certain controls feel outmoded, and it turns out reverse-hinged doors were never that great of an idea to begin with. Now that GM canned them, Ford is alone here.

model.name: F-150
style.name: XLT 4dr SuperCab 6.5 ft. SB (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Optional center console is big, but has no audio jacks or power. Flip down bin with those is small. Good door pockets up front. Seat brackets and jack eat into rear floor storage. Bed is 6'6".

summary: Good exterior build quality, but the interior materials in our XLT come across as plasticky. The lack of engine noise supression seems like a cost-saving move.

ratings.summary: The F-150 is still a good truck, but it's no longer the strong value player in the segment, at the XLT level anyway.

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: XLT 4dr SuperCab 6.5 ft. SB (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Roadside assistance is provided for 5 yrs/60,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150 is still a good truck, but it's no longer the strong value player in the segment, at the XLT level anyway.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: XLT 4dr SuperCab 6.5 ft. SB (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Drives bigger than it is and the constant back-and-forth shifting is not what you want in a truck. Needs more gears or more cylinders.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Gets the job done, but the chassis doesn't really connect with the driver.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: XLT 4dr SuperCab 6.5 ft. SB (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Ford trucks have always played the tough truck theme to the hilt. That said, there's so many of these on the road that you'll be invisible.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Gets the job done, but the chassis doesn't really connect with the driver.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Ford's EcoBoost V6 engine isn't kidding around. This is one powerful motor, and it deserves to sit atop the options list. The loaded King Ranch 4x4 stomps to 60 mph in 6.7 seconds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Even though our test sample weighed 3 tons (!), the brake system was still able to haul it down from 60 mph in just 120-122 feet. Pedal felt firm and steady in normal use on public roads, too.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Like other F-150s we've tested, this one ultimately goes where it's pointed. The long wheelbase and slow steering lead to busy hands. This is offset somewhat by light steering effort.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Not what we'd call light on its feet. The F-150's considerable size and weight are noticeable when turning. That said, it feels stable and steady on back roads, with moderate lean.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The EcoBoost V6 churns out plenty of torque, so it easily bridges the gaps between the gears in the 6-speed automatic transmission. This engine is smooth and seamless at all times.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The 3.5-liter twin-turbo V6 carries the highest tow rating in the F-150 lineup. Our crew cab 4x4 with optional 3.73 axles is good for 11,200 pounds. Hard to argue with that.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Towing

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The 4x4 system in this long-wheelbase truck is intended for rocky fire roads, pole line roads and muddy ranch work. Lots of clearance, but it's too big for Jeep-style boulder-hopping.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Truck performance comes down to engine capability, and the EcoBoost V6 delivers. Brakes work well in daily use and have enough capacity for loaded scenarios. The F-150 is a steady and predictable handler, but it steers a bit slower than the competition.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Leather-encrusted buckets are nicely supportive in a sit-down sense. We still wish for more lateral support on twisty roads, but the King Ranch seats do a better job than the XLT's cloth ones.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The King Ranch SuperCrew offers comfort in all seating positions. Background noise is low enough for everyone to engage in casual conversation. Ford engineers have done an admirable job of taming the ride despite the use of traditional leaf springs.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Similar to other F-150's we've tested. The ride isn't hard, but the aftershake from small ripples and cracks can make for a near-constant low-grade jiggle. This is typical leaf spring truck behavior.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The King Ranch SuperCrew offers comfort in all seating positions. Background noise is low enough for everyone to engage in casual conversation. Ford engineers have done an admirable job of taming the ride despite the use of traditional leaf springs.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Tire and wind noise are low-to-moderate. The Ecoboost V6 isn't as noisy or thrashy as the entry-level low-cost V6, but it doesn't deliver the classic 5.0-liter V8 burble, either.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The King Ranch SuperCrew offers comfort in all seating positions. Background noise is low enough for everyone to engage in casual conversation. Ford engineers have done an admirable job of taming the ride despite the use of traditional leaf springs.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Good driving position, and we like the information display between the gauges. Built-in brake controller is a huge plus. Improved MyFord Touch navi and infotainment system still a bit clunky to use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The SuperCrew cab is big and comfy, and the rear seat is much easier to access and live with than the smaller SuperCab. Every occupant will feel like they're in the best seat in the house. In-cab storage and cargo potential is strong.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Unlike the smaller SuperCab, front and rear seat access is equally good in the SuperCrew cab. It sits a bit high, but both doors open wide and each has a handy grab handle.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The SuperCrew cab is big and comfy, and the rear seat is much easier to access and live with than the smaller SuperCab. Every occupant will feel like they're in the best seat in the house. In-cab storage and cargo potential is strong.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The front half of the cabin offers more than enough space for our tallest testers, and there's even more room in the SuperCrew's rear seat area. There isn't a bad seat in the house.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The SuperCrew cab is big and comfy, and the rear seat is much easier to access and live with than the smaller SuperCab. Every occupant will feel like they're in the best seat in the house. In-cab storage and cargo potential is strong.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Good views out the front and sides, and the extendable tow mirrors are huge. Rear-quarter view is decent through the large rear windows. The back-up camera helps with low objects directly behind.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The SuperCrew cab is big and comfy, and the rear seat is much easier to access and live with than the smaller SuperCab. Every occupant will feel like they're in the best seat in the house. In-cab storage and cargo potential is strong.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Good-sized multi-level door pockets up front, and the ones in back hold a lot, too. Rear seat bottoms fold straight up to reveal a large flat load floor.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The SuperCrew cab is big and comfy, and the rear seat is much easier to access and live with than the smaller SuperCab. Every occupant will feel like they're in the best seat in the house. In-cab storage and cargo potential is strong.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Reasonable exterior build quality, and the King Ranch leather interior is particularly nice. Some interior trim panels feel dated compared to newly redesigned Ram and GM trucks.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150's top-dog sales status is puzzling in the face of revamped trucks from GM and Ram. Pricing is similar. The design and features are consistent with a truck at the end of its lifecycle. The 60,000-mile powertrain warranty is no longer competitive.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: It's not that the Ford lacks critical features. It's just that the newer competiton has upped the ante in execution. The content and size of the instrument panel display screen is a good example of this.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150's top-dog sales status is puzzling in the face of revamped trucks from GM and Ram. Pricing is similar. The design and features are consistent with a truck at the end of its lifecycle. The 60,000-mile powertrain warranty is no longer competitive.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: No doubt about it, this F-150 crew cab 4x4 with the top-line King Ranch package is pricey at $54,000. But, you can get the capability of this cab/engine combo in much less expensive trims.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150's top-dog sales status is puzzling in the face of revamped trucks from GM and Ram. Pricing is similar. The design and features are consistent with a truck at the end of its lifecycle. The 60,000-mile powertrain warranty is no longer competitive.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The EcoBoost's mpg numbers are solid. The EPA rates it at a respectable 17 mpg Combined (15 City/21 Highway). But work the throttle and the turbos and it's easy to undershoot these numbers.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150's top-dog sales status is puzzling in the face of revamped trucks from GM and Ram. Pricing is similar. The design and features are consistent with a truck at the end of its lifecycle. The 60,000-mile powertrain warranty is no longer competitive.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The F-150's powertrain is covered for 5 yrs/60,000 miles, which lags behind the 100,000-mile coverage offered by GM and Ram. Bumper-to-bumper warranty lasts for 3 yrs/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150's top-dog sales status is puzzling in the face of revamped trucks from GM and Ram. Pricing is similar. The design and features are consistent with a truck at the end of its lifecycle. The 60,000-mile powertrain warranty is no longer competitive.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Roadside assistance is provided for 5 yrs/60,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The F-150's top-dog sales status is puzzling in the face of revamped trucks from GM and Ram. Pricing is similar. The design and features are consistent with a truck at the end of its lifecycle. The 60,000-mile powertrain warranty is no longer competitive.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The EcoBoost engine delivers plenty of thrust and is great for towing and hauling (both kinds). Fairly quiet and comfortable, too. Not well-suited to twisty roads or places with tight parking.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: This truck likes going straight more than anything else, and it's good at performing true truck duties. Capable, comfortable, but not really fun. But that's not really its point. Buy the Raptor if you're looking for that.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: F-150
style.name: King Ranch 4dr SuperCrew 4WD 5.5 ft. SB (5.0L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Ford trucks have always played up the tough truck theme. That said, there's so many of these on the road that you'll be nearly invisible, even with the King Ranch edition.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: This truck likes going straight more than anything else, and it's good at performing true truck duties. Capable, comfortable, but not really fun. But that's not really its point. Buy the Raptor if you're looking for that.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: A near 18-second quarter-mile isn't going to break any records. Sixty mph requires 10.6 seconds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Not much extra power in the Fiesta, and its automated manual transmission does little to capitalize on what is there. Handling is OK and largely limited by low-grip tires.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Brake feel isn't great and 60-0 requires 136 feet, which is long for an SUV let alone a subcompact.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Not much extra power in the Fiesta, and its automated manual transmission does little to capitalize on what is there. Handling is OK and largely limited by low-grip tires.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Decent precision and response. Feedback is minimal, but it matters little with the low limits that the tires provide.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Not much extra power in the Fiesta, and its automated manual transmission does little to capitalize on what is there. Handling is OK and largely limited by low-grip tires.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Overall balance is decent, but we were surprised to find that the stability control threshhold is low enough to be discovered during street driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Not much extra power in the Fiesta, and its automated manual transmission does little to capitalize on what is there. Handling is OK and largely limited by low-grip tires.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford's choice to fit the Fiesta with an automated manual instead of a traditional automatic is an odd one. This system is slow to respond and isn't as smooth as a true automatic.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Not much extra power in the Fiesta, and its automated manual transmission does little to capitalize on what is there. Handling is OK and largely limited by low-grip tires.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta's seats provide average comfort. Honestly, no car in this class offers the seat adjustability we'd like.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta isn't comfortable enough, especially the ride quality. Still, it appears more thought was put into making the Fiesta functional than comfortable.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Some attempt was clearly made in the Fiesta's suspension tuning at sportiness, which marginalizes ride comfort to a small extent.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta isn't comfortable enough, especially the ride quality. Still, it appears more thought was put into making the Fiesta functional than comfortable.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is quieter than many of its competitors. Ford does a decent job of damping road and tire noise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta isn't comfortable enough, especially the ride quality. Still, it appears more thought was put into making the Fiesta functional than comfortable.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Most controls are well placed and easy to use. The three-knob HVAC controls are simple and easy to understand. Sometimes, simple is best.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Nothing inside the Fiesta looks or feels particularly expensive, but it seems well assembled and the interior is functional.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The rather upright Fiesta makes entry/exit fairly easy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Nothing inside the Fiesta looks or feels particularly expensive, but it seems well assembled and the interior is functional.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Most cars in this class use their space well and the Fiesta is no exception. But its narrowness means the two front occupants are bound to bump elbows on occasion.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Nothing inside the Fiesta looks or feels particularly expensive, but it seems well assembled and the interior is functional.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Great sight lines all around due to the large glass area and sloping waistline.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Nothing inside the Fiesta looks or feels particularly expensive, but it seems well assembled and the interior is functional.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The hinged rear seats don't fold flat. In terms of cargo space, the Fiesta doesn't stand a chance against the Honda Fit. Good small-item storage though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Nothing inside the Fiesta looks or feels particularly expensive, but it seems well assembled and the interior is functional.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Interior materials are not as nice as some competitors, but the Fiesta seems to be assembled well.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: An ultra-low base price is a good starting point. Still, it's easy to option a Fiesta to $20,000. But this is also true of most competitors. We think the Fiesta offers good value.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford's SYNC infotainment system gets you most of the tech features you'll find in other cars in the class. But the Fiesta's interior isn't as flexible as some others.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: An ultra-low base price is a good starting point. Still, it's easy to option a Fiesta to $20,000. But this is also true of most competitors. We think the Fiesta offers good value.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Stripper models start in the high $13K range, so the Fiesta is competive pricewise.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: An ultra-low base price is a good starting point. Still, it's easy to option a Fiesta to $20,000. But this is also true of most competitors. We think the Fiesta offers good value.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The EPA rates the Fiesta at 29 city/39 highway/33 mpg combined. A few competitors are marginally better, but these figures are attainable if you drive reasonably easy.

ratings.summary: An ultra-low base price is a good starting point. Still, it's easy to option a Fiesta to $20,000. But this is also true of most competitors. We think the Fiesta offers good value.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta's basic warranty covers the car for 3 years/36,000 miles. Drivetrain coverage lasts for 5 years/60,000 miles, both of which are right around average.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta

summary: The Fiesta comes with roadside assistance for 5 years/60,000 miles. Plus, Ford has improved the overall quality of its cars in recent years.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: As city transportation, the Fiesta will prove more than adequate. It's quiet out on the open road, but it lacks power. Plan ahead for passing maneuvers.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With sporty suspension tuning the Fiesta wants to be playful, but its low-grip tires and stability control tuning let it down.
title: Driving Experience

model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is a little bipolar. It wants to be fun, but there are some fundamentals lacking. Still, this is a fine machine for those seeking basic, affordable transportation.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta comes with roadside assistance for 5 years/60,000 miles. Plus, Ford has improved the overall quality of its cars in recent years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: An ultra-low base price is a good starting point. Still, it's easy to option a Fiesta to $20,000. But this is also true of most competitors. We think the Fiesta offers good value.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: As city transportation, the Fiesta will prove more than adequate. It's quiet out on the open road, but it lacks power. Plan ahead for passing maneuvers.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With sporty suspension tuning the Fiesta wants to be playful, but its low-grip tires and stability control tuning let it down.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is a little bipolar. It wants to be fun, but there are some fundamentals lacking. Still, this is a fine machine for those seeking basic, affordable transportation.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With sporty suspension tuning the Fiesta wants to be playful, but its low-grip tires and stability control tuning let it down.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: With 0-60 mph in 9.4 seconds, the Fiesta is average for the segment. The 120-hp 1.6-liter 4-cylinder never feels strong, though it's aided by the twin-clutch PowerShift transmission's launch control.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Both the panic stop distance of 122 feet and brake feel were improved versus the last Fiesta we tested. Consistent results at the track, and perfectly intuitive operation out on the road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Nice and quick with good feedback. Makes you relish any corner or freeway onramp. The Fiesta's sportiness factor is aided by a grippy, thick-rimmed steering wheel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Track handling numbers proved competitive, despite an overly-active stability control system. It's out on the road where the Fiesta separates itself, with a well-tuned suspension and responsive chassis.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford's twin-clutch PowerShift transmission continues to annoy with slow reactions at low speeds, though we appreciate the throttle blips on manual downshifts. The engine is smooth but never peppy.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Not a lot of padding, and the cloth material feels scratchy when you're wearing shorts. Minimal adjustability, plus the seatback lever is a poor design, hidden by the seatbelt.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta's comfort lags behind a few competitors, mostly in terms of ride quality and the seats. But it's one of the quietest cars in the class.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Not overly surprising since Ford leaned toward sportiness with the Fiesta, the ride quality can be a bit choppy, compounded by the short wheelbase. Better seat padding would help, too.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta's comfort lags behind a few competitors, mostly in terms of ride quality and the seats. But it's one of the quietest cars in the class.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is one of the quietest cars in the class at 70 mph cruising speed. Good for this class, but not compared to a bigger car. The tires are quiet, but you can always hear the little 4-cyl. working.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta's comfort lags behind a few competitors, mostly in terms of ride quality and the seats. But it's one of the quietest cars in the class.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The optional navigation touchscreen has a convex base, making it difficult to press low-mounted icons. Otherwise, interior systems are labeled well and easy to use, especially the cruise control.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is a fairly upright car with a tall roof and wide-opening front doors, making entry easy. But the rear doors don't open nearly as far, making it difficult to enter what is already a small space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Lots of front headroom but the car's narrowness means front occupants will bump elbows. Driver's right knee contends with hard center console. Tight rear head- and elbow room and no center armrest.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Great sight lines all around due to the large glass area, narrow roof pillars and decently-large rear window. Our test car did not have a backup camera, but it didn't matter.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Excellent small item storage up front with four cupholders and plenty of bins. No door pockets in rear though. The 12.8 cu-ft trunk is small for the class. Rear seats fold, but not flat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Build quality is decent for the class. We don't expect a whole lot of soft-touch in a car that starts around $14,000. Shifter feels substantial, controls work well, no squeaks or rattles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta SE sedan starts around $16,000, comes with leather-wrapped steering wheel, cruise control, power mirrors, air conditioning, a six-speaker stereo and split/folding rear seat.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Our SE test car had options like the 6-speed PowerShift transmission, Sync with MyFord Touch, satellite radio, navigation and Kermit the Frog-esque special green paint for $19,725.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta SE Sedan has an EPA rating of 32 mpg Combined (29 City/39 Highway). We averaged 31.9 mpg overall, and 33.4 mpg on the Edmunds evaluation loop. Respectable but not stupdendous.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mile drivetrain warranty. The Hyundai Accent and Chevrolet Sonic offer better coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta

summary: Ford gives you complimentary roadside assistance for 5 years/60,000 miles, but no free maintenance like the Sonic.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: As city transportation, the Fiesta will prove more than adequate. It's relatively quiet on the open road, but it lacks power. Plan ahead for passing maneuvers.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's sporty suspension tune and quick steering make it a playful runabout. The transmission can be shifted manually via a rocker switch on the console lever.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta's agile handling make it more fun than most in this class, as does the throttle blipping on manual downshifts. It's a fine machine for people seeking affordable yet fun transportation.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's sporty suspension tune and quick steering make it a playful runabout. The transmission can be shifted manually via a rocker switch on the console lever.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The 197-hp turbocharged 1.6-liter pulls the ST to 60 mph in 7.1 seconds (6.8 with rollout). Abundant torque spins the front tires easily, but once it finds grip it moves out.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fiesta is rich with fun-to-drive traits. Its chassis and powertrain come together to make it the most rewarding performance-oriented subcompact when it comes to driving hard.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: An immediate, responsive pedal and minimal dive yield confidence under braking. A short 112-foot 60 mph-0 distance is among the best in the class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fiesta is rich with fun-to-drive traits. Its chassis and powertrain come together to make it the most rewarding performance-oriented subcompact when it comes to driving hard.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Sharp turn-in response, a neutral chassis and lots of grip make the Focus ST one of the most rewarding small cars to drive fast. Its steering might be its biggest strength.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fiesta is rich with fun-to-drive traits. Its chassis and powertrain come together to make it the most rewarding performance-oriented subcompact when it comes to driving hard.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Though it will oversteer, the Fiesta isn't as tail-happy as the Focus ST. Still, it's nearly as fun. The neutral balance makes it a very capable handler overall.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fiesta is rich with fun-to-drive traits. Its chassis and powertrain come together to make it the most rewarding performance-oriented subcompact when it comes to driving hard.
title: Handling

model.name: Fiesta
style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Driveability is a Fiesta ST strength. It's torque-rich power delivery and quick response make it easy to get moving from a standstill, and it's equally capable shooting gaps in traffic.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fiesta is rich with fun-to-drive traits. Its chassis and powertrain come together to make it the most rewarding performance-oriented subcompact when it comes to driving hard.

style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Larger occupants may find the Fiesta's optional Recaro sport seats too confining. But they offer ample lateral support, something which the base seats lack.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Though ride quality is on the stiff side, the Fiesta is reasonably comfortable for a subcompact. Plus, it's primarily designed for sporty driving anyway, not comfort.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: ST 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Comfort is sacrificed for performance, although the Fiesta ST's ride is preferable to the jittery Mini Cooper S. Enthusiasts won't be troubled, as the payoff in handling is worthwhile.
