ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Both the panic stop distance of 122 feet and brake feel were improved versus the last Fiesta we tested. Consistent results at the track, and perfectly intuitive operation out on the road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Nice and quick with good feedback. Makes you relish any corner or freeway onramp. The Fiesta's sportiness factor is aided by a grippy, thick-rimmed steering wheel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Track handling numbers proved competitive, despite an overly-active stability control system. It's out on the road where the Fiesta separates itself, with a well-tuned suspension and responsive chassis.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford's twin-clutch PowerShift transmission continues to annoy with slow reactions at low speeds, though we appreciate the throttle blips on manual downshifts. The engine is smooth but never peppy.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like other subcompacts, the Fiesta isn't blessed with extra power, and it's not helped by the twin-clutch PowerShift automatic-like transmission in normal driving. Enthusiasts will enjoy the sportily-tuned chassis.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Not a lot of padding, and the cloth material feels scratchy when you're wearing shorts. Minimal adjustability, plus the seatback lever is a poor design, hidden by the seatbelt.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta's comfort lags behind a few competitors, mostly in terms of ride quality and the seats. But it's one of the quietest cars in the class.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Not overly surprising since Ford leaned toward sportiness with the Fiesta, the ride quality can be a bit choppy, compounded by the short wheelbase. Better seat padding would help, too.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta's comfort lags behind a few competitors, mostly in terms of ride quality and the seats. But it's one of the quietest cars in the class.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is one of the quietest cars in the class at 70 mph cruising speed. Good for this class, but not compared to a bigger car. The tires are quiet, but you can always hear the little 4-cyl. working.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As subcompacts go, the Fiesta's comfort lags behind a few competitors, mostly in terms of ride quality and the seats. But it's one of the quietest cars in the class.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The optional navigation touchscreen has a convex base, making it difficult to press low-mounted icons. Otherwise, interior systems are labeled well and easy to use, especially the cruise control.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta is a fairly upright car with a tall roof and wide-opening front doors, making entry easy. But the rear doors don't open nearly as far, making it difficult to enter what is already a small space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Lots of front headroom but the car's narrowness means front occupants will bump elbows. Driver's right knee contends with hard center console. Tight rear head- and elbow room and no center armrest.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Great sight lines all around due to the large glass area, narrow roof pillars and decently-large rear window. Our test car did not have a backup camera, but it didn't matter.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Excellent small item storage up front with four cupholders and plenty of bins. No door pockets in rear though. The 12.8 cu-ft trunk is small for the class. Rear seats fold, but not flat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fiesta has a few small touches here and there that let you know Ford was at least trying to make you feel special. It's assembled well and, other than some minor MyFord Touch annoyances, the interior is functional and easy to use.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Build quality is decent for the class. We don't expect a whole lot of soft-touch in a car that starts around $14,000. Shifter feels substantial, controls work well, no squeaks or rattles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta SE sedan starts around $16,000, comes with leather-wrapped steering wheel, cruise control, power mirrors, air conditioning, a six-speaker stereo and split/folding rear seat.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Our SE test car had options like the 6-speed PowerShift transmission, Sync with MyFord Touch, satellite radio, navigation and Kermit the Frog-esque special green paint for $19,725.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta SE Sedan has an EPA rating of 32 mpg Combined (29 City/39 Highway). We averaged 31.9 mpg overall, and 33.4 mpg on the Edmunds evaluation loop. Respectable but not stupdendous.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mile drivetrain warranty. The Hyundai Accent and Chevrolet Sonic offer better coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford gives you complimentary roadside assistance for 5 years/60,000 miles, but no free maintenance like the Sonic.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's base price of around $14,000 is a good starting point, but it wasn't too hard to option our SE test car to almost $20,000. Still, that's similar to most competitors, and we think the Fiesta offers excellent value.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: As city transportation, the Fiesta will prove more than adequate. It's relatively quiet on the open road, but it lacks power. Plan ahead for passing maneuvers.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's sporty suspension tune and quick steering make it a playful runabout. The transmission can be shifted manually via a rocker switch on the console lever.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fiesta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (1.6L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fiesta's agile handling make it more fun than most in this class, as does the throttle blipping on manual downshifts. It's a fine machine for people seeking affordable yet fun transportation.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fiesta's sporty suspension tune and quick steering make it a playful runabout. The transmission can be shifted manually via a rocker switch on the console lever.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Abundant low-end torque prevents the Focus Electric from feeling sluggish around town. But don't expect a lot of speed if you floor it. You'll reach 60 mph in 9.6 seconds, which is par for the EV course. Top speed is 85 mph.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Nicely balanced and rewarding to drive in daily driving. Has enough acceleration for most people, but won't feel responsive enough for leadfoot-types. This is not surprising because the Focus EV's prodigious curb weight of 3,597 pounds represents over 600 pounds more than the normal one.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Pedal feel is fine in daily use but went soggy at the track. Panic stops from 60 mph require 126 feet on the Focus Electric's low-rolling resistance tires -- about the same as a regular gasoline Focus on all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Nicely balanced and rewarding to drive in daily driving. Has enough acceleration for most people, but won't feel responsive enough for leadfoot-types. This is not surprising because the Focus EV's prodigious curb weight of 3,597 pounds represents over 600 pounds more than the normal one.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Smooth, predictable response and nice feel through the steering wheel. Effort is neither too heavy nor too light. Hard to distinguish from any other Focus, which is saying something.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Nicely balanced and rewarding to drive in daily driving. Has enough acceleration for most people, but won't feel responsive enough for leadfoot-types. This is not surprising because the Focus EV's prodigious curb weight of 3,597 pounds represents over 600 pounds more than the normal one.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: The Focus EV retains the good balance and nimble nature of the regular Focus. But the tires have to deal with over 600 pounds of extra vehicle weight, which inhibits ultimate grip and dulls cornering response if you drive it hard.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Nicely balanced and rewarding to drive in daily driving. Has enough acceleration for most people, but won't feel responsive enough for leadfoot-types. This is not surprising because the Focus EV's prodigious curb weight of 3,597 pounds represents over 600 pounds more than the normal one.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Smooth and effortless. No-shift direct drive and lots of low-speed torque make the Focus Electric feel far more refined and seamless than its gas-powered siblings. Shifter's "L" position increases default level of regenerative braking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Nicely balanced and rewarding to drive in daily driving. Has enough acceleration for most people, but won't feel responsive enough for leadfoot-types. This is not surprising because the Focus EV's prodigious curb weight of 3,597 pounds represents over 600 pounds more than the normal one.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Comfortable seats offer a good basic shape and plenty of adjustments. Rear seats have supportive contours. You can easily stay comfortable for the duration of a full charge.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The basic Focus starts off life as a comfortable car thanks to a smooth ride, tight cabin and nice-shaped seats. The Focus Electric adds to this a blanket of eerie quiet thanks to the inherent silence of an eletric powertrain and the seamlessness of a zero-shift transmission.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: The Focus Electric offers a smooth and settled ride that stays composed on a variety of surfaces. Does not exhibit typical small-car traits such as skittishness and busyness. The extra weight seems to be helping in this regard.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The basic Focus starts off life as a comfortable car thanks to a smooth ride, tight cabin and nice-shaped seats. The Focus Electric adds to this a blanket of eerie quiet thanks to the inherent silence of an eletric powertrain and the seamlessness of a zero-shift transmission.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Utterly silent powertrain delivers the sensation of coasting all the time due to a lack of engine noise and zero shifting. Wind noise and road noise are minimal and relegated to the dim background.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The basic Focus starts off life as a comfortable car thanks to a smooth ride, tight cabin and nice-shaped seats. The Focus Electric adds to this a blanket of eerie quiet thanks to the inherent silence of an eletric powertrain and the seamlessness of a zero-shift transmission.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Tilt-telescope wheel pulls back more than most, making it easy for drivers of all statures to find a good driving position. Control stalks and switches easy to operate, and this latest version of the MyFord touch system is more intuitive.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Focus Electric benefits from the solid ergonomics and thoughtful people-packaging found in the regular Focus hatchback. And many of the optional convenience features of the base car are standard here. Its one drawback is reduced cargo space due to the intrusion of the battery pack.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Door openings are generous and the front seat height is in the Goldilocks zone, neither too low nor too high. Rear seat feels lower by comparison and could benefit from some grab handles.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Focus Electric benefits from the solid ergonomics and thoughtful people-packaging found in the regular Focus hatchback. And many of the optional convenience features of the base car are standard here. Its one drawback is reduced cargo space due to the intrusion of the battery pack.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Cabin feels open and airy thanks to low dash and good-sized windows. Abundant front headroom and legroom for tall drivers. Rear seat is a bit tight if tall people are sitting up front.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Focus Electric benefits from the solid ergonomics and thoughtful people-packaging found in the regular Focus hatchback. And many of the optional convenience features of the base car are standard here. Its one drawback is reduced cargo space due to the intrusion of the battery pack.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Good to the front and sides. Rear side windows do a good job of minimizing the blind spots, too. Backup camera and rear proximity sensors come standard.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Focus Electric benefits from the solid ergonomics and thoughtful people-packaging found in the regular Focus hatchback. And many of the optional convenience features of the base car are standard here. Its one drawback is reduced cargo space due to the intrusion of the battery pack.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Batteries intrude into hatch area and take a big bite out of cargo space; 14.5 cubic feet of the original 23.8 cubic feet remain. Not ideal for big grocery runs. Useful cabin area bins and small-item storage but the cupholders are so-so.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Focus Electric benefits from the solid ergonomics and thoughtful people-packaging found in the regular Focus hatchback. And many of the optional convenience features of the base car are standard here. Its one drawback is reduced cargo space due to the intrusion of the battery pack.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: There's nothing wrong with the Ford Focus Electric; it's built as you'd expect for a volume-selling compact. Thing is, the EV powertrain drives its price into the high $30,000 range, a cost strata that sets higher expectations.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There are a lot of plusses here. EV range is easy to meet or exceed. Not much to go wrong. Few service items. The big negative is the price. The federal tax credit helps, but that's an after-the-fact credit, not a rebate; you still have to finance the bigger number.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Everything that's optional on a Focus comes standard on the Ford Focus Electric including navigation, automatic climate control and MyFord touch, to name a few. By far the biggest and most costly "feature" is the electric powertrain itself.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There are a lot of plusses here. EV range is easy to meet or exceed. Not much to go wrong. Few service items. The big negative is the price. The federal tax credit helps, but that's an after-the-fact credit, not a rebate; you still have to finance the bigger number.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: High price of $36,990 can be offset by $7,500 federal tax credit. Other state-specific credits possible. California example: $2,500 rebate. Leather seats ($995) are the only option. And add another $1,500 (or more) for charging equipment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There are a lot of plusses here. EV range is easy to meet or exceed. Not much to go wrong. Few service items. The big negative is the price. The federal tax credit helps, but that's an after-the-fact credit, not a rebate; you still have to finance the bigger number.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Decent-sized battery is good for an EPA-rated driving range of 76 miles. Can be readily exceeded with reasonably prudent driving. We managed 99.8 miles in our suburban drive-to-empty test. Rated consumption is 32 kWh over 100 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There are a lot of plusses here. EV range is easy to meet or exceed. Not much to go wrong. Few service items. The big negative is the price. The federal tax credit helps, but that's an after-the-fact credit, not a rebate; you still have to finance the bigger number.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: The Focus Electric's 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties are typical of Ford products and closely match those of its competitiors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There are a lot of plusses here. EV range is easy to meet or exceed. Not much to go wrong. Few service items. The big negative is the price. The federal tax credit helps, but that's an after-the-fact credit, not a rebate; you still have to finance the bigger number.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: Little maintenance required, and the brake pads could last years. And like all pure-electric vehicles, you'd best plan on installing a 240V Level 2 charge station at home. 5-year/60,000-mile roadside assistance is there if you need it.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There are a lot of plusses here. EV range is easy to meet or exceed. Not much to go wrong. Few service items. The big negative is the price. The federal tax credit helps, but that's an after-the-fact credit, not a rebate; you still have to finance the bigger number.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: The Focus Electric feels smooth, effortless and more refined than its siblings. Freedom from gasoline and gas stations is easy to get used to, and carpool lane access is a great perk if your local authorites do that sort of thing.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Satisfying is a better term than fun in this case. That said, the Focus Electric retains the poise and coordination of its gasoline-powered siblings. The main thing you're giving up by going electric is the ability to take spontaneous road trips, but you knew that.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Electric 4dr Hatchback (electric DD)
summary: All Ford Focus variants are sprightly and well-mannered compacts that deliver more than just basic transportation. The electrified Focus gives little of that up in the name of its "green" performance.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Satisfying is a better term than fun in this case. That said, the Focus Electric retains the poise and coordination of its gasoline-powered siblings. The main thing you're giving up by going electric is the ability to take spontaneous road trips, but you knew that.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: A 2.0L 160hp engine and 6-speed automated-manual (automatic) transmission provide merely adequate everyday acceleration. Meets the compact segment's average at 8.6 seconds to 60 mph. The Focus ST is the enthusiasts' choice here.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 160 hp engine merely meets compact-segment expectations. The addition of our car's Handling Package paid dividends in both braking and handling, effectively elevating it to hot-hatch status by beating the performance-oriented Focus ST in our track evaluations.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Excellent brake pedal feel and intuitive response in stop-and-go traffic as well as at highway speeds. Our simulated panic stop of 108 feet is considered a very short distance from 60 mph but was aided by optional summer tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 160 hp engine merely meets compact-segment expectations. The addition of our car's Handling Package paid dividends in both braking and handling, effectively elevating it to hot-hatch status by beating the performance-oriented Focus ST in our track evaluations.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Sporty, not-too-heavy weight and commendable road feel through the wheel. Excellent precision and straight stability on the open highway as well.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 160 hp engine merely meets compact-segment expectations. The addition of our car's Handling Package paid dividends in both braking and handling, effectively elevating it to hot-hatch status by beating the performance-oriented Focus ST in our track evaluations.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Our car's Handling Package ($595 for suspension, wheels, summer tires) is a legit option that broke the front-drive slalom record at our track. Ultra-confident poise and grip that doesn't compromise everyday driveability or comfort.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 160 hp engine merely meets compact-segment expectations. The addition of our car's Handling Package paid dividends in both braking and handling, effectively elevating it to hot-hatch status by beating the performance-oriented Focus ST in our track evaluations.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Clearly, Ford has recalibrated the auto-clutch manual transmission since last we tested a Focus. Parking-lot creep is good, stop-and-go is seamless and it feels like an altogether better-driving car as a result.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 160 hp engine merely meets compact-segment expectations. The addition of our car's Handling Package paid dividends in both braking and handling, effectively elevating it to hot-hatch status by beating the performance-oriented Focus ST in our track evaluations.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: The Titanium model's heated 6-way adjustable driver and 4-way passenger seats are excellent for long-haul comfort as well as holding steady during enthusiastic driving. We've seen better vinyl than this subpar leather, however.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Focus Titanium features heated leather front seats that provide better-than-average comfort and support. Rear seats come up short on head- and leg-room compared to Mazda and VW hatchbacks. Ride comfort and quietness, however, are better than average.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Despite our car's optional Handling Package, the Focus Titanium's ride comfort remained plush and compliant over local road and highway surfaces. There were some grooved-highway wiggle and tracking issues thanks to the summer tires.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Focus Titanium features heated leather front seats that provide better-than-average comfort and support. Rear seats come up short on head- and leg-room compared to Mazda and VW hatchbacks. Ride comfort and quietness, however, are better than average.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: In line with compact-car expectations for quietness. In fact, the Focus is slightly better than average, with little road or wind noise reaching the interior.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Focus Titanium features heated leather front seats that provide better-than-average comfort and support. Rear seats come up short on head- and leg-room compared to Mazda and VW hatchbacks. Ride comfort and quietness, however, are better than average.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Six-way seat plus tilt-telescope wheel allows for an easy driving position. Dash layout, especially with MyFord Touch touchscreen head-unit, shows signs of continual improvement and has grown more responsive and intuitive.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a compact car, the Focus Titanium's interior is ergonomically sound, easy to enter and exit, offers plenty of room for passengers and cargo and even has good outward visibility aided by a standard rearview camera.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Generously sized doors and reasonable seat height provide good entry and exit. Rear passengers would benefit from roof-mounted grab handles, however.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a compact car, the Focus Titanium's interior is ergonomically sound, easy to enter and exit, offers plenty of room for passengers and cargo and even has good outward visibility aided by a standard rearview camera.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Despite being about average in terms of interior volume, the 5-seat Focus Hatchback manages to feel larger on the inside than a typical compact hatchback. Generously sized windows and low dashboard help.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a compact car, the Focus Titanium's interior is ergonomically sound, easy to enter and exit, offers plenty of room for passengers and cargo and even has good outward visibility aided by a standard rearview camera.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Because of the extra sail-panel windows on the rear quarter of the car, blind spots are better than most. The Titanium comes with rear parking sensors and a camera. Automated parking is optional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a compact car, the Focus Titanium's interior is ergonomically sound, easy to enter and exit, offers plenty of room for passengers and cargo and even has good outward visibility aided by a standard rearview camera.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: At 23.8 cu-ft, the nominal cargo area is one of the largest in the segment. Fold down the 60/40 rear seats to expand to 44.8 cu-ft of maximum cargo volume. Near SUV-size hatch is a plus. Barely adequate front and rear cup holders.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a compact car, the Focus Titanium's interior is ergonomically sound, easy to enter and exit, offers plenty of room for passengers and cargo and even has good outward visibility aided by a standard rearview camera.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: For the money, the Focus Titanium meets expectations for the compact segment. However, it doesn't rise to the top. Some interior panel buzz and vibration, substandard leather, but dazzlingly good (optional metallic) paint.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base MSRP of $24,890, our mildly optioned Focus Titanium hatchback totaled $26,185. This is a highly competitive price compared to hatchbacks from Mazda and VW. Also, some Focus equipment isn't even available elsewhere.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Titanium standards: alloy wheels, leather, heated front seats, keyless entry/ignition, touchscreen with satellite radio, iPod connection, parking sensors and camera. Options: Handling Package, navigation and metallic paint. Good value.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base MSRP of $24,890, our mildly optioned Focus Titanium hatchback totaled $26,185. This is a highly competitive price compared to hatchbacks from Mazda and VW. Also, some Focus equipment isn't even available elsewhere.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: The Focus Titanium's base MSRP of $24,890 is right in the middle of hatchback prices, but its standard equipment is far more generous than competitors' offerings at this or even higher prices.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base MSRP of $24,890, our mildly optioned Focus Titanium hatchback totaled $26,185. This is a highly competitive price compared to hatchbacks from Mazda and VW. Also, some Focus equipment isn't even available elsewhere.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Estimated by the EPA to earn 31 mpg Combined (27 City/37 Highway). A comparable Mazda 3i rates better (33/29/40). What's more, the Focus earned 32.5 mpg on our 120-mile evaluation loop where that Mazda managed 39.4 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base MSRP of $24,890, our mildly optioned Focus Titanium hatchback totaled $26,185. This is a highly competitive price compared to hatchbacks from Mazda and VW. Also, some Focus equipment isn't even available elsewhere.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: With a 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty, the Ford Focus is right in line with its main competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base MSRP of $24,890, our mildly optioned Focus Titanium hatchback totaled $26,185. This is a highly competitive price compared to hatchbacks from Mazda and VW. Also, some Focus equipment isn't even available elsewhere.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: With 5-year/50,000-mile roadside assistance, but no free scheduled maintenance program, the Ford Focus offers modest peace of mind.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base MSRP of $24,890, our mildly optioned Focus Titanium hatchback totaled $26,185. This is a highly competitive price compared to hatchbacks from Mazda and VW. Also, some Focus equipment isn't even available elsewhere.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Were the engine livelier, the driving experience of the Focus Titanium with the optional Handling Package would be downright thrilling. As is, it feels like an excellent urban hatch with curvy-road cravings and good highway manners.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: When the right kinds of roads present themselves, the Focus Titanium hatch with the optional Handling Package is a hot hatch on a budget, albeit with a pokey engine. So if the high-performance Focus ST cannot be justified, then this fun-to-drive hatchback will fit the bill.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: Titanium 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl 6AM)
summary: Hot hatch on a budget for those who crave the racy Focus ST, but cannot justify the price or sub-optimal fuel economy. This frugal Titanium hatch with its ST-shaming Handling Package is an excellent alternative.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: When the right kinds of roads present themselves, the Focus Titanium hatch with the optional Handling Package is a hot hatch on a budget, albeit with a pokey engine. So if the high-performance Focus ST cannot be justified, then this fun-to-drive hatchback will fit the bill.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The 2.0-liter 160-hp 4-cylinder gets the Focus to 60 mph in 8.3 seconds, matching the Mazda 3. Helping the Focus is a quick-shifting 6-speed dual-clutch PowerShift transmission with launch control.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Focus shines in all performance categories save driveability, where the transmission is plagued by some low-speed jerkiness. Once at speed the transmission works well, and steering and handling remain competitive with the new Mazda 3.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The brake pedal offers a nice firm feel, but the best panic stop was an unimpressive 131 feet. The SE model has drum rear brakes instead of discs, but they still felt plenty powerful on the road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Focus shines in all performance categories save driveability, where the transmission is plagued by some low-speed jerkiness. Once at speed the transmission works well, and steering and handling remain competitive with the new Mazda 3.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Quick and precise turn-in with excellent feel through the thick and grippy steering wheel. You always know what the front tires are doing. Only the Mazda 3 steers as well in this class.Â
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Focus shines in all performance categories save driveability, where the transmission is plagued by some low-speed jerkiness. Once at speed the transmission works well, and steering and handling remain competitive with the new Mazda 3.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Sporty suspension tuning makes the Focus fun to drive, whether on backroads or freeway on-ramps. Precise through corners with a slightly tail-happy manner when you really push it.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Focus shines in all performance categories save driveability, where the transmission is plagued by some low-speed jerkiness. Once at speed the transmission works well, and steering and handling remain competitive with the new Mazda 3.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The PowerShift transmission gets confused/jerky during rolling stops and thick traffic. But the steering is precise, the brakes are intuitive and the cruise control never overshoots.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Focus shines in all performance categories save driveability, where the transmission is plagued by some low-speed jerkiness. Once at speed the transmission works well, and steering and handling remain competitive with the new Mazda 3.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The front seats are covered with cheap-looking cloth but are comfortable and hold you in place. Door armrests are hard. No center armrest for the rear, but seats have plenty of padding.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its taut ride, the Focus is a comfortable car with well-padded seats front and rear. The four-cylinder engine is not only one of the strongest in the class, but it sounds good, too.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Those comfortable seats help soften things here. The Focus' ride is German-taut but supple enough to handle small bumps with ease. Larger bumps cause the occasional big bounce.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its taut ride, the Focus is a comfortable car with well-padded seats front and rear. The four-cylinder engine is not only one of the strongest in the class, but it sounds good, too.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Our sound measurements say the Focus is one of the noisier cars in this class, but we wouldnâ€™t call it loud. The engine doesn't get thrashy at high rpm like some fours. Minor whistling at rear doors.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its taut ride, the Focus is a comfortable car with well-padded seats front and rear. The four-cylinder engine is not only one of the strongest in the class, but it sounds good, too.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The SE's center stack suffers from a small screen and unlabeled mystery buttons -- we'd actually opt for the controversial MyFordTouch system. Climate control dials are easy to use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although the interior is well-made, the design is a little over the top, with priority on form over function, and the center stack is a bit confusing. The front seats are simple to get in/out of, the rear requires more contortion. Storage cubbies are skimpy.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The front doors open wide making for easy ingress/egress. Getting into the back seat requires ducking your head dramatically. Feet can also get hung up, and your leg will brush the wheel well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although the interior is well-made, the design is a little over the top, with priority on form over function, and the center stack is a bit confusing. The front seats are simple to get in/out of, the rear requires more contortion. Storage cubbies are skimpy.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Excellent headroom up front but the dramatic center stack makes things feel confined versus competitors. Rear headroom is tight, with cramped door-side elbow room and scrunched foot space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although the interior is well-made, the design is a little over the top, with priority on form over function, and the center stack is a bit confusing. The front seats are simple to get in/out of, the rear requires more contortion. Storage cubbies are skimpy.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The windshield is large but heavily slanted. Roof pillars get thick toward the bottom making it difficult to see through corners. Side glass area is chopped but rear window is large. No backup camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although the interior is well-made, the design is a little over the top, with priority on form over function, and the center stack is a bit confusing. The front seats are simple to get in/out of, the rear requires more contortion. Storage cubbies are skimpy.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Weak versus competitors. No front bin and small center armrest storage. Cupholders incapable of holding drinks in place. The 13.2 cubic-foot trunk has a wide but short opening, nice square load area.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although the interior is well-made, the design is a little over the top, with priority on form over function, and the center stack is a bit confusing. The front seats are simple to get in/out of, the rear requires more contortion. Storage cubbies are skimpy.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Considering the price and level of materials, the Focus remains right at the top of the class. Plenty of soft-touch areas, solid-feeling controls. We did notice one intermittent dash rattle.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by Ford's quality. The automatic-like dual-clutch transmission costs extra and the SE doesn't come with disc rear brakes, but the Focus provides strong value plus rare sporty driving characteristics for the segment.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: At the SE's base price of $19,310, it comes with a 6-speaker stereo, Bluetooth, cruise control, alloy wheels, fold-flat rear seat and front floor mats. Rear disc brakes and an automatic cost extra.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by Ford's quality. The automatic-like dual-clutch transmission costs extra and the SE doesn't come with disc rear brakes, but the Focus provides strong value plus rare sporty driving characteristics for the segment.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The 6-speed PowerShift transmission is a $1,095 option. Satellite radio costs a further $195 for a total price of $20,600 as-tested. You're getting a well-made car for people who like driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by Ford's quality. The automatic-like dual-clutch transmission costs extra and the SE doesn't come with disc rear brakes, but the Focus provides strong value plus rare sporty driving characteristics for the segment.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The EPA rates the Focus SE with the 6-speed dual-clutch PowerShift transmission at 31 mpg Combined (27 City/37 Highway). We averaged 30.2 mpg overall, about mid-pack for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by Ford's quality. The automatic-like dual-clutch transmission costs extra and the SE doesn't come with disc rear brakes, but the Focus provides strong value plus rare sporty driving characteristics for the segment.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Focus' 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage are competitive. Well short of the Kia Forte's 10-year/100,000-mile drivetrain coverage, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by Ford's quality. The automatic-like dual-clutch transmission costs extra and the SE doesn't come with disc rear brakes, but the Focus provides strong value plus rare sporty driving characteristics for the segment.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford offers roadside assistance for 5 years/60,000 miles, which is better than most rivals. It should be factored in that Ford has seriously stepped up its quality in the last several years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by Ford's quality. The automatic-like dual-clutch transmission costs extra and the SE doesn't come with disc rear brakes, but the Focus provides strong value plus rare sporty driving characteristics for the segment.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Low-speed transmission clunkiness and strange center stack controls aside, the Focus offers a fun, sporty and thoroughly comfortable driving experience.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Not quite as exciting as the new Mazda 3, but with its quick steering and sharp handling the Focus will make you smile anytime you take a corner with vigor. That the Focus' transmission can't be manually shifted hurts its fun factor.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The engine has more sauce than most rivals, and sounds good. The taut ride is why the Focus can attack curves. The quick-shifting transmisison has launch control. Now that's personality.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Not quite as exciting as the new Mazda 3, but with its quick steering and sharp handling the Focus will make you smile anytime you take a corner with vigor. That the Focus' transmission can't be manually shifted hurts its fun factor.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Focus sedan reaches 60 mph in 9.0 seconds, which is slow for the class. Both light and heavy throttle inputs are predictable, but we found moderate pressure often resulted in unexpected lurches and power surges.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: A retuned transmission and suspension correct some of the previous-year Focus' missteps. The 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine's 160 hp and 146 lb-ft of torque is unchanged but it ended up being slightly slower than its predecessor. Still, this Focus is a competent compact sedan.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Stopping from 60 mph required a class-average 120 feet. After several passes, the distances remained remarkably consistent, as did the reassuringly firm pedal. Nosedive is well managed and the car is very controllable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: A retuned transmission and suspension correct some of the previous-year Focus' missteps. The 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine's 160 hp and 146 lb-ft of torque is unchanged but it ended up being slightly slower than its predecessor. Still, this Focus is a competent compact sedan.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Steering effort is light and there isn't a lot of feedback reaching the driver. It is at least accurate, predictable and easy to quickly spin from lock-to-lock when making multiple-point turns.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: A retuned transmission and suspension correct some of the previous-year Focus' missteps. The 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine's 160 hp and 146 lb-ft of torque is unchanged but it ended up being slightly slower than its predecessor. Still, this Focus is a competent compact sedan.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Body roll is noticeable, but once the suspension is loaded there's no residual rebounding. The tires howl loudly, but this Focus is surprisingly capable. While  it certainly isn't sporty, it can still provide some entertainment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: A retuned transmission and suspension correct some of the previous-year Focus' missteps. The 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine's 160 hp and 146 lb-ft of torque is unchanged but it ended up being slightly slower than its predecessor. Still, this Focus is a competent compact sedan.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The automatic transmission has been improved, but can still lurch or hunt for the correct gear at low speeds. Although the Focus isn't quick, it doesn't feel as slow as the numbers suggest. Overall it's a pretty easy car to live with.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: A retuned transmission and suspension correct some of the previous-year Focus' missteps. The 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine's 160 hp and 146 lb-ft of torque is unchanged but it ended up being slightly slower than its predecessor. Still, this Focus is a competent compact sedan.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Front seat offers plenty of support for both small and large drivers. After several hours there was no noticeable fatigue. The thinly padded armrests and hard plastic center console did create some discomfort for elbows and knees, though.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus sedan provides an exceptionally smooth ride compared to other cars in this class. Factor in the quiet cabin, and spending many hours on a road trip won't seem like a penalty. Too many hard touch points are among our minor complaints.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Rutted and bumpy surfaces are smoothed over by the Focus' compliant suspension. It rarely gets busy or shakes over road imperfections, and the car remained composed and largely unaffected by mid-corner bumps.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus sedan provides an exceptionally smooth ride compared to other cars in this class. Factor in the quiet cabin, and spending many hours on a road trip won't seem like a penalty. Too many hard touch points are among our minor complaints.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: At highway speeds and even on coarse asphalt, road and wind noises are silenced to luxury car levels. What you're left with is a quiet cabin that lets in just enough engine and exhaust note to sound halfway sporty.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus sedan provides an exceptionally smooth ride compared to other cars in this class. Factor in the quiet cabin, and spending many hours on a road trip won't seem like a penalty. Too many hard touch points are among our minor complaints.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The new layout for audio buttons makes operation easier. The display screen is small, but the placement is good and it has sharp graphics. Other primary controls are in logical locations and intuitive to use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Inside, the Focus features materials that are slightly above average for the compact sedan class. Improvements to the standard audio interface make control easier than before. Cargo capacity is only average and the pervasive sour "new car smell" may be too strong for some.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Front and rear doors are short in length and tall in height, making seat access easy in tight parking spaces. Rear passengers will need to duck  dramatically to clear the rear roof pillar, but not much more than with rivals.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Inside, the Focus features materials that are slightly above average for the compact sedan class. Improvements to the standard audio interface make control easier than before. Cargo capacity is only average and the pervasive sour "new car smell" may be too strong for some.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: There's plenty of space for larger passengers up front, but headroom is quite tight in the rear for adults. On the other hand, the elevated rear seats provide a stadium seating-like forward view over the front passengers' shoulders.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Inside, the Focus features materials that are slightly above average for the compact sedan class. Improvements to the standard audio interface make control easier than before. Cargo capacity is only average and the pervasive sour "new car smell" may be too strong for some.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Forward visibilty is quite good, thanks to roof pillars that barely obstruct the view through turns. The optional rear spoiler gives the driver a good indication of where the corners are, as does the standard rearview camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Inside, the Focus features materials that are slightly above average for the compact sedan class. Improvements to the standard audio interface make control easier than before. Cargo capacity is only average and the pervasive sour "new car smell" may be too strong for some.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Trunk capacity is average for the class at 13.2 cu-ft. The wide opening makes loading easy but the narrow pass-through limits maximum capacity. Interior storage is limited to small bins and pockets, weak versus most competitiors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Inside, the Focus features materials that are slightly above average for the compact sedan class. Improvements to the standard audio interface make control easier than before. Cargo capacity is only average and the pervasive sour "new car smell" may be too strong for some.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: For the most part the Focus sedan compares favorably against other compact sedans. There's a lot of plastic throughout the interior, but it's sturdy and squeak-free. Buttons and knobs also feel solid.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus in base S trim starts right around $18,000, which is a few hundred dollars less than rivals. But it's worth noting that Ford and Honda charge more for upgraded rear disc brakes. A similarly equipped Focus sedan will cost a bit more than rivals.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Compared to the Mazda 3 and Kia Forte, the Focus sedan comes up a little short in regard to standard features. As options are added to the Ford, the price gap widens further compared to its slightly more affordable rivals.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus in base S trim starts right around $18,000, which is a few hundred dollars less than rivals. But it's worth noting that Ford and Honda charge more for upgraded rear disc brakes. A similarly equipped Focus sedan will cost a bit more than rivals.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: With the SE Sport package and power driver seat, the as-tested price rose to almost $22,000. That's about $1,000 more than a similarly or better-equipped Mazda 3 or Honda Civic. The Kia is a further $1,000 cheaper.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus in base S trim starts right around $18,000, which is a few hundred dollars less than rivals. But it's worth noting that Ford and Honda charge more for upgraded rear disc brakes. A similarly equipped Focus sedan will cost a bit more than rivals.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: EPA estimates of 30 mpg combined (26 city/38 highway) are low for the segment, but our real-world results of 29.4 mpg overall and an impressive 42 mpg on our highway-heavy evaluation loop even the playing field somewhat.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus in base S trim starts right around $18,000, which is a few hundred dollars less than rivals. But it's worth noting that Ford and Honda charge more for upgraded rear disc brakes. A similarly equipped Focus sedan will cost a bit more than rivals.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Ford's 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage are competitive for the compact segment, but Kia's generous 10-year/100,000-mile drivetrain warranty is still the class leader.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus in base S trim starts right around $18,000, which is a few hundred dollars less than rivals. But it's worth noting that Ford and Honda charge more for upgraded rear disc brakes. A similarly equipped Focus sedan will cost a bit more than rivals.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Roadside assistance is offered for 5 years/60,000 miles, which is generous for the class. As is typical with these vehicles, free scheduled maintenance is not available, nor is a pre-paid program.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Ford Focus in base S trim starts right around $18,000, which is a few hundred dollars less than rivals. But it's worth noting that Ford and Honda charge more for upgraded rear disc brakes. A similarly equipped Focus sedan will cost a bit more than rivals.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Focus places minimal demands on the driver, and in daily commutes it performs just as you'd expect. The lurches from moderate throttle application do take some getting used to, though.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite its rather humble positioning as a basic compact sedan, our Focus SE with the SE Sport package was surprisingly fun to drive. Its all-season tires howl loudly, but the car reacts well to driver inputs. It may be slower than rivals, but that doesn't mean it feels weak or anemic.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Focus
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The latest styling refresh brings the Focus in line with the larger Fusion, but compared to other cars in this class, it looks a bit plain inside and out. The hatchback version and the sporty ST are better choices if you crave personality.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite its rather humble positioning as a basic compact sedan, our Focus SE with the SE Sport package was surprisingly fun to drive. Its all-season tires howl loudly, but the car reacts well to driver inputs. It may be slower than rivals, but that doesn't mean it feels weak or anemic.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The standard SE driver seat is 8-way adjustable. All seats are well-contoured and offer excellent support and comfort.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Remarkably large inside, plus top-notch NVH isolation deliver a very comfortable cabin.
title: Seating Comfort

model.name: Fusion
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Well-controlled suspension soaks up bumps without being unnecessarily floaty or too harsh.

summary: Remarkably quiet at freeway speeds. Engine noise is present under hard acceleration, but not objectionable.

summary: While MyFordTouch and SYNC continue to improve, the overall placement and functions of other controls is very good.

summary: Typical sedan sight lines plus available rear-view camera, blind-spot monitoring, and parking sensors.

summary: A 16 cu-ft trunk is slightly above average. Standard 60/40 split-fold rear seatbacks augment maximum cargo capacity. Interior storage is also clever and slightly above average.
ratings.title: Interior

ratings.summary: While performance might not be the paramount to the family sedan segment, the all-new Ford Fusion sets the bar with an almost casual effortlessness.

summary: Average stopping distances for its class in track testing, yet brake pedal feel and response are good in everyday driving.

summary: Light effort yet precise action from steering provides excellent response and adequate road feel.

make.name: Ford

summary: Confident, competent handling go hand-in-hand with the responsive steering. Better than average; perhaps best-in-class.

summary: Drives more like a European car than an American sedan. Solid open-road manners plus just-right size for urban or suburban duties.

ratings.summary: While performance might not be the paramount to the family sedan segment, the all-new Ford Fusion sets the bar with an almost casual effortlessness.

summary: It wasn't very long ago that American cars and quality were mutually exclusive. The new Ford Fusion proves we can do it, and for a fair price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A solid value in a sea of competitors, the Ford Fusion sets a new benchmark for an American midsize sedan in terms of quality and dynamics for the dollar.

summary: Maintenance and ownership costs should be faily tame, and extensive the Ford dealer network means that service will never be far away.

make.name: Ford

summary: The Fusion combines a solid struction, sophisticated chassis, and class-leading powertrains to provide a class-leading driving experience.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The average family sedan sets a low standard in this respect, yet the Fusion exceeds expections by a magin that's unexpected.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There's a reason the 2013 Fusion feels like a European car: Much of it was developed there and that's a good thing.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The average family sedan sets a low standard in this respect, yet the Fusion exceeds expections by a magin that's unexpected.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: With 188 total system horsepower, acceleration is adequate around town and there's enough passing power for most situations. It feels more normal than other hybrids. Still, 0-60-mph in 8.4 seconds makes it slightly slower than some rivals.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Better handling than many competing hybrids, and the Fusion keeps the driver involved. Acceleration is unremarkable, but the hybrid system thankfully doesn't draw that much attention to itself.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Improvements have been made to the Fusion Hybrid's brakes since it was introduced. Pedal feels linear and more normal in its movement and response. It stopped from 60 mph in a class-average 123 feet.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Better handling than many competing hybrids, and the Fusion keeps the driver involved. Acceleration is unremarkable, but the hybrid system thankfully doesn't draw that much attention to itself.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Ford has done a nice job tuning the Fusion Hybrid's electric power steering. Effort is a bit light, but feedback is good. Clearly better than most hybrids.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Better handling than many competing hybrids, and the Fusion keeps the driver involved. Acceleration is unremarkable, but the hybrid system thankfully doesn't draw that much attention to itself.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Very well behaved for a hybrid. Adequate steering feel combined with a stable chassis through transitions, despite relatively low limits. Better than most cars with which it competes.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Better handling than many competing hybrids, and the Fusion keeps the driver involved. Acceleration is unremarkable, but the hybrid system thankfully doesn't draw that much attention to itself.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Feels more like its non-hybrid version than any other hybrid sedan. Brakes and engine do not draw attention to themselves, nor are there odd transmission shifters or gauge layouts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Better handling than many competing hybrids, and the Fusion keeps the driver involved. Acceleration is unremarkable, but the hybrid system thankfully doesn't draw that much attention to itself.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: These seats wrap you like a warm hug, offering both long-range and corner-taking support, as well as a bit of squish. Almost Volvo-like. Driver's seat is 8-way power including lumbar.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Fusion Hybrid really stands out in this area, offering noticeably less road, wind and engine noise than other hybrid sedans (especially compared to the Toyota Prius). Its ride quality and seats are also excellent.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Fusion's compromise between body control and ride smoothness is the best in the segment. Those seeking coach-like comfort or sporty sedan engagement should find it equally appealing.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Fusion Hybrid really stands out in this area, offering noticeably less road, wind and engine noise than other hybrid sedans (especially compared to the Toyota Prius). Its ride quality and seats are also excellent.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Driven back-to-back with its hybrid competitors, the Fusion has the least road, wind and engine noise. There are also fewer of the overt electrical system noises usually common in hybrids.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Fusion Hybrid really stands out in this area, offering noticeably less road, wind and engine noise than other hybrid sedans (especially compared to the Toyota Prius). Its ride quality and seats are also excellent.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Major controls are close at hand and operate intuitively. MyFord Touch screen controls are hardly ideal, but you get used to them. Touch-operated climate buttons can be unresponsive. Not good.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The MyFord Touch controls, especially the touch-operated climate "buttons," are the Fusion's biggest drawback. We wouldn't call it a dealbreaker, though, given the cabin's other virtues.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Fusion's large doors open wide for easy access. The seat height makes entry/exit pretty easy. The sloping roofline means you need to take more care than in an Accord or Camry.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The MyFord Touch controls, especially the touch-operated climate "buttons," are the Fusion's biggest drawback. We wouldn't call it a dealbreaker, though, given the cabin's other virtues.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Spacious back seat is on par with the segment's best, despite the sleek and stylish exterior shape. The eight-way power driver's seat is hugely adjustable (and tall-person friendly).
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The MyFord Touch controls, especially the touch-operated climate "buttons," are the Fusion's biggest drawback. We wouldn't call it a dealbreaker, though, given the cabin's other virtues.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Outward visibility is generally good, although a rear three-quarter blind spot requires extra attention for passing maneuvers. Rearview camera, parking sensors and auto parking system were on our test car, but are optional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The MyFord Touch controls, especially the touch-operated climate "buttons," are the Fusion's biggest drawback. We wouldn't call it a dealbreaker, though, given the cabin's other virtues.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Hybrid batteries significantly reduce the available cargo space versus the regular Fusion, but the remaining space is more useful than in other hybrid sedans. Folding 60/40 split rear seat is a plus.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The MyFord Touch controls, especially the touch-operated climate "buttons," are the Fusion's biggest drawback. We wouldn't call it a dealbreaker, though, given the cabin's other virtues.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Excessive tech options elevated our tester's price to $35,270, but the Fusion's cabin feels like it belongs in a car that costs that much. Materials and construction are top notch and a step above most.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Base price of $27,200 and as-tested of $35,270 are similar to other hybrid sedans, but you get more in terms of both equipment and perceived quality. Fuel economy is excellent, but your driving will determine how much it ultimately saves you.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Offers more available features than other family sedans, including auto parking, adaptive cruise control and a lane-keeping system. Even the base car includes a power driver's seat, auto climate control and Sync.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Base price of $27,200 and as-tested of $35,270 are similar to other hybrid sedans, but you get more in terms of both equipment and perceived quality. Fuel economy is excellent, but your driving will determine how much it ultimately saves you.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The price is signficantly more than that of a similarly equipped, non-hybrid Fusion. Still, it offers slightly more value than its hybrid competitors. Plus, the options structure gives you choices.

ratings.summary: Base price of $27,200 and as-tested of $35,270 are similar to other hybrid sedans, but you get more in terms of both equipment and perceived quality. Fuel economy is excellent, but your driving will determine how much it ultimately saves you.

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: We achieved 52.9 mpg during our 102-mile suburban driving test, with 44 mpg in Interstate driving. Overall it averaged 43.9 mpg, which is a neglible gallon/cost difference from EPA Combined rating of 47 mpg.

ratings.summary: Base price of $27,200 and as-tested of $35,270 are similar to other hybrid sedans, but you get more in terms of both equipment and perceived quality. Fuel economy is excellent, but your driving will determine how much it ultimately saves you.

summary: "Ford's warranties are about average for the industry: 5 years/60,000 miles for the drivetrain and 3 years/36,000 miles bumper-to-bumper. "
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Base price of $27,200 and as-tested of $35,270 are similar to other hybrid sedans, but you get more in terms of both equipment and perceived quality. Fuel economy is excellent, but your driving will determine how much it ultimately saves you.
