make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Ford offers roadside assistance for 5 years/60,000 miles. There is no free scheduled maintenance program.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Base price of $27,200 and as-tested of $35,270 are similar to other hybrid sedans, but you get more in terms of both equipment and perceived quality. Fuel economy is excellent, but your driving will determine how much it ultimately saves you.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: All Fusions, hybrid or not, drive smaller than they look. Impressive, considering how large this car is. Definitely not the isolating transport pod you might expect a hybrid to be.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The driving experience is more engaging than other hybrid sedans, but few will go so far as to actually call the Fusion Hybrid fun to drive. Some may find the challenge of driving as efficiently as possible to be engaging and even fun.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Fusion Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The most compelling part about this hybrid's personality is that it's hard to tell it's a hybrid at all, whether you're looking at it or driving it. And that's a good thing.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The driving experience is more engaging than other hybrid sedans, but few will go so far as to actually call the Fusion Hybrid fun to drive. Some may find the challenge of driving as efficiently as possible to be engaging and even fun.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: This engine punches well below its 310-hp rating. Lumpy power delivery, with abrupt midrange punch that tapers off at higher rpm. Never feels fast. We used 87 octane vs. 91 with the EcoBoost Coupe, but 0-60 mph was similar, at 6.1 sec.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With less weight up front than the V8-powered GT, this Mustang EcoBoost feels responsive and light on its feet. Braking is excellent and there's plenty of grip from the meaty tires. However, the four-cylinder engine is a letdown with its lame soundtrack and unimpressive thrust.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Who needs the Performance Pack and its grabby brakes? This standard-spec car stopped in an astonishing 104 feet from 60 mph, shortest of any 2015 Mustang we've tested. Firm pedal feel with progressive engagement. Well done.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With less weight up front than the V8-powered GT, this Mustang EcoBoost feels responsive and light on its feet. Braking is excellent and there's plenty of grip from the meaty tires. However, the four-cylinder engine is a letdown with its lame soundtrack and unimpressive thrust.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Light and somewhat artificial at low speeds, reassuringly precise in enthusiastic driving, if a bit short on feel. A good showing for the segment. The adjustable effort levels don't make a huge difference, all give the same basic character.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With less weight up front than the V8-powered GT, this Mustang EcoBoost feels responsive and light on its feet. Braking is excellent and there's plenty of grip from the meaty tires. However, the four-cylinder engine is a letdown with its lame soundtrack and unimpressive thrust.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Although this drop-top Mustang slalomed 1 mph slower than a GT coupe with the same suspension/tire configuration, it feels more responsive due to its lighter engine. Also, 0.93g on the skidpad is good grip. It's a capable car.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With less weight up front than the V8-powered GT, this Mustang EcoBoost feels responsive and light on its feet. Braking is excellent and there's plenty of grip from the meaty tires. However, the four-cylinder engine is a letdown with its lame soundtrack and unimpressive thrust.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Clutch is light but not totally intuitive, and the shifter sometimes feels a bit crunchy through the gates. Easy enough to operate, but not that rewarding. Engine's agricultural noises and non-linear performance disappoint.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With less weight up front than the V8-powered GT, this Mustang EcoBoost feels responsive and light on its feet. Braking is excellent and there's plenty of grip from the meaty tires. However, the four-cylinder engine is a letdown with its lame soundtrack and unimpressive thrust.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Standard front seats are rather sporty, with ample lateral bolstering. Rear seats are nicely shaped and, unlike in the coupe, adult-friendly when the top is dropped. Rear legroom is tight but workable. No rear armrests (side or center).
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: We noticed less front-end "bounciness" than in the GT coupe, perhaps due in part to the lighter engine. Supple ride despite big 20-inch wheels. Good rigidity for a four-seat convertible, cowl shake is present but minimal. Reasonably quiet with the top up. Impressive overall.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Feels more composed than the GT, with less busyness over bumps. Ford has done a remarkable job of taming the low-profile 20-inch tires, there's rarely any impact harshness. Laudable ride compliance for this level of handling ability.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: We noticed less front-end "bounciness" than in the GT coupe, perhaps due in part to the lighter engine. Supple ride despite big 20-inch wheels. Good rigidity for a four-seat convertible, cowl shake is present but minimal. Reasonably quiet with the top up. Impressive overall.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: For a soft-top convertible, this Mustang is quite civilized with the top up. Talk radio is loud and clear at highway speeds. With the top down, rear occupants get blasted with wind, but the front cockpit stays pretty serene.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: We noticed less front-end "bounciness" than in the GT coupe, perhaps due in part to the lighter engine. Supple ride despite big 20-inch wheels. Good rigidity for a four-seat convertible, cowl shake is present but minimal. Reasonably quiet with the top up. Impressive overall.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Buttons and knobs are sensibly laid out for the most part, though the eye-catching toggle switches feel less robust than they look. MyFord Touch system is capable and perhaps unfairly maligned, but it will be replaced by Sync 3 for 2016.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by the new Mustang's interior. A sensible control layout combines with the classic dual-cowl dashboard design to create a stylish yet ergonomic environment. Excessive use of chrome-look plastic trim is one of the few missteps. Nicest Mustang cabin in decades.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Long doors can be a pain in tight parking spots, but the front seats aren't sports-car low, so it's easy enough to get in and out. Rear egress is facilitated by nifty flip-handles on the front seatbacks that make for quick getaways.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by the new Mustang's interior. A sensible control layout combines with the classic dual-cowl dashboard design to create a stylish yet ergonomic environment. Excessive use of chrome-look plastic trim is one of the few missteps. Nicest Mustang cabin in decades.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Given the Mustang's substantial footprint, the lack of rear legroom is surprising. Still, this is a genuine four-seater if taller folks in front are willing to slide their seats forward a bit. Popular with tourists for good reason.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by the new Mustang's interior. A sensible control layout combines with the classic dual-cowl dashboard design to create a stylish yet ergonomic environment. Excessive use of chrome-look plastic trim is one of the few missteps. Nicest Mustang cabin in decades.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Nothing like a convertible to enhance rearward visibility. The Mustang is also aided by its relatively low beltline, as well as windshield pillars that aren't too thick. But as with the coupe, the backup camera is nice to have.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by the new Mustang's interior. A sensible control layout combines with the classic dual-cowl dashboard design to create a stylish yet ergonomic environment. Excessive use of chrome-look plastic trim is one of the few missteps. Nicest Mustang cabin in decades.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The drop-top Mustang's trunk measures an adequate 11.4 cubic feet, but our test car's optional Shaker stereo included a hefty subwoofer that takes up some of that space. Interior storage is so-so: Why are the door pockets so shallow?
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by the new Mustang's interior. A sensible control layout combines with the classic dual-cowl dashboard design to create a stylish yet ergonomic environment. Excessive use of chrome-look plastic trim is one of the few missteps. Nicest Mustang cabin in decades.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mustang Convertible's soft top is power-retractable, but the center latch must be manually released (and re-latched) via a twist handle above the rearview mirror. Very quick operation -- 8.5 seconds to lower and 8.0 to raise.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: We continue to be impressed by the new Mustang's interior. A sensible control layout combines with the classic dual-cowl dashboard design to create a stylish yet ergonomic environment. Excessive use of chrome-look plastic trim is one of the few missteps. Nicest Mustang cabin in decades.
title: Convertible Top

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: As satisfying as the Mustang's cabin is in most respects, it's still got industrial-grade hard plastic in places. An optional Premier Trim package replaces the standard hard-plastic door panels with soft surfaces, but it should be standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The current Mustang is generally a strong value, but the EcoBoost engine gives us pause. Why pay extra dough for the four? The Mustang's base V6 is more satisfying. Unfortunately, the V6 convertible only comes in standard trim, so if you want the Premium trim, it's EcoBoost or GT.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The EcoBoost Premium Convertible starts around $36,000 but easily crests $40,000 with a few options, as with our $41,865 test car. You get a lot of features for the money, though, including the Shaker stereo and navigation.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The current Mustang is generally a strong value, but the EcoBoost engine gives us pause. Why pay extra dough for the four? The Mustang's base V6 is more satisfying. Unfortunately, the V6 convertible only comes in standard trim, so if you want the Premium trim, it's EcoBoost or GT.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We're fully on board with a $40,000-plus Mustang as long as it's got the right engine under the hood. The underwhelming EcoBoost four-cylinder throws a wrench into things. It neither sounds nor performs like it should for the price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The current Mustang is generally a strong value, but the EcoBoost engine gives us pause. Why pay extra dough for the four? The Mustang's base V6 is more satisfying. Unfortunately, the V6 convertible only comes in standard trim, so if you want the Premium trim, it's EcoBoost or GT.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The EPA doesn't specifically rate the 2015 EcoBoost Convertible with the six-speed manual, but it rates the manual coupe at 26 mpg combined (22 city/31 highway). We averaged a solid 26.3 mpg on our real-world driving loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The current Mustang is generally a strong value, but the EcoBoost engine gives us pause. Why pay extra dough for the four? The Mustang's base V6 is more satisfying. Unfortunately, the V6 convertible only comes in standard trim, so if you want the Premium trim, it's EcoBoost or GT.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Ford's warranty is average for the industry, consisting of 3-year/36,000-mile comprehensive and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage. Chevrolet and Dodge both provide 5-year/100,000-mile powertrain coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The current Mustang is generally a strong value, but the EcoBoost engine gives us pause. Why pay extra dough for the four? The Mustang's base V6 is more satisfying. Unfortunately, the V6 convertible only comes in standard trim, so if you want the Premium trim, it's EcoBoost or GT.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mustang does not include a free maintenance program. Free roadside assistance is included for 5 years/60,000 miles, Chevrolet and Dodge sweeten the deal with roadside assistance for 5 years/100,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The current Mustang is generally a strong value, but the EcoBoost engine gives us pause. Why pay extra dough for the four? The Mustang's base V6 is more satisfying. Unfortunately, the V6 convertible only comes in standard trim, so if you want the Premium trim, it's EcoBoost or GT.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: What's the point of a manual-transmission Mustang if there's no thrill in running it through the gears? The turbo four offers zero aural excitement, for one thing, and the GT's organ-displacing torque is absent, even at full throttle.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: It's all about the engine. We love driving the Mustang GT, but the EcoBoost takes much of the fun away. There's no doubt that this is a sharp, athletic car on winding roads, but without a proper V8 under the hood, or even the base V6, it just feels like there's something missing.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: EcoBoost Premium 2dr Convertible (2.3L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mustang SVO from the '80s had a decent enthusiast following, and there are plenty of tuners trying to get the most out of this EcoBoost Mustang. From the factory, though, it's a bore. We mostly just found ourselves missing the V8.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: It's all about the engine. We love driving the Mustang GT, but the EcoBoost takes much of the fun away. There's no doubt that this is a sharp, athletic car on winding roads, but without a proper V8 under the hood, or even the base V6, it just feels like there's something missing.
title: Personality

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: The 435-hp Mustang GT with the 6-sp manual transmission accelerated to 60 mph in 4.7 sec., which is 0.1 seconds quicker than a Chevy Camaro SS. The short-throw shifter is praiseworthy and gears are well spaced for consistent power.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a new independent rear suspension, the 2015 Ford Mustang GT no longer requires the driver to work around the old solid rear axle's idiosyncrasies. Power from the 5.0-liter V8 is up from last year, though acceleration is identical. The new 'Stang feels lighter and smaller than it is.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Braking from 60 mph required 108 feet, which is identical to the Camaro SS. The pedal remained firm, distances were consistent and the car was very composed. In everyday driving, we found the optional Brembo brakes to be overly sensitive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a new independent rear suspension, the 2015 Ford Mustang GT no longer requires the driver to work around the old solid rear axle's idiosyncrasies. Power from the 5.0-liter V8 is up from last year, though acceleration is identical. The new 'Stang feels lighter and smaller than it is.
title: Braking

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Driver-selectable steering effort is standard on all Mustangs and weights up appropriately in Comfort, Normal and Sport settings. The wheel itself feels good in your hands but feedback from the tires is more subtle than we'd like.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a new independent rear suspension, the 2015 Ford Mustang GT no longer requires the driver to work around the old solid rear axle's idiosyncrasies. Power from the 5.0-liter V8 is up from last year, though acceleration is identical. The new 'Stang feels lighter and smaller than it is.
title: Steering

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: In our testing the Mustang GT with the Perf. pkg came up short against the Camaro SS 1LE, but out on the road the Ford felt more competent and confidence-inspiring. Mid-corner bumps now have little effect, thanks to new rear suspension.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a new independent rear suspension, the 2015 Ford Mustang GT no longer requires the driver to work around the old solid rear axle's idiosyncrasies. Power from the 5.0-liter V8 is up from last year, though acceleration is identical. The new 'Stang feels lighter and smaller than it is.
title: Handling

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: In everyday driving the Mustang GT isn't overly demanding. Clutch pedal effort is appropriate and overall refinement and good visibility make it easy to live with. If it weren't for the touchy optional brakes, it'd get an A here.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a new independent rear suspension, the 2015 Ford Mustang GT no longer requires the driver to work around the old solid rear axle's idiosyncrasies. Power from the 5.0-liter V8 is up from last year, though acceleration is identical. The new 'Stang feels lighter and smaller than it is.
title: Driveability

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: The optional Recaro seats provide a ton of lateral support without being completely confining. The seat cushion could use more angle adjustment range, though. As with the rival Camaro, rear seats are useless, even for small children.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The added refinement for 2015 greatly improves the Mustang's overall comfort score. It's now extraordinarily quiet on the highway and the smarter interior design and better materials further reduce long-distance fatigue. Unfortunately, the back seats are comically small.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Even with the stiffer Performance pkg, the Mustang GT provides an adequately compliant ride quality. Larger bumps and potholes were well damped and the trademark Mustang shimmy is now thankfully absent, making the car far more composed.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The added refinement for 2015 greatly improves the Mustang's overall comfort score. It's now extraordinarily quiet on the highway and the smarter interior design and better materials further reduce long-distance fatigue. Unfortunately, the back seats are comically small.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Wind and road noise are quieted to surprising levels, resulting in a calm cabin. Engine and exhaust noises are also low, perhaps too tame for our enthusiast tastes. On a long road trip, however, the silence pays dividends.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The added refinement for 2015 greatly improves the Mustang's overall comfort score. It's now extraordinarily quiet on the highway and the smarter interior design and better materials further reduce long-distance fatigue. Unfortunately, the back seats are comically small.
title: Quietness

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Switches, buttons and knobs now have a premium heft to them and controls on the center stack and steering wheel are logically placed. Sadly, the MyFord Touch infotainment interface is still problematic, with sporadic outages.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang's new interior is a vast improvement over its predecessor. Shapes are more rounded and touch points are padded, while materials are praiseworthy for this class. Points are deducted for the still-frustrating MyFord Touch infotainment interface.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: The long coupe doors do make seat acces a little tricky in tight spaces and you have to stoop to clear the low roof, though not much more than other coupes in this class. Access to the rear seats is difficult, if we're being generous.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang's new interior is a vast improvement over its predecessor. Shapes are more rounded and touch points are padded, while materials are praiseworthy for this class. Points are deducted for the still-frustrating MyFord Touch infotainment interface.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Front seats are afforded ample space, but lanky drivers may find their elbows bump the optional Recaro seat bolsters. Rear seat head- and legroom are nearly non-existent. You're better off thinking of them as a cargo shelf.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang's new interior is a vast improvement over its predecessor. Shapes are more rounded and touch points are padded, while materials are praiseworthy for this class. Points are deducted for the still-frustrating MyFord Touch infotainment interface.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Narrow windshield pillars and a large rear window give the Mustang a comparably expansive outward view. Backing into parking spaces is much easier than rivals and the standard rearview camera takes any guesswork out.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang's new interior is a vast improvement over its predecessor. Shapes are more rounded and touch points are padded, while materials are praiseworthy for this class. Points are deducted for the still-frustrating MyFord Touch infotainment interface.
title: Visibility

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Interior bins and cupholders are large and plentiful enough to adequately carry your personal items. The 13.5 cu-ft trunk is average for the class, but the large opening makes loading easy. The optional subwoofer eats up space, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang's new interior is a vast improvement over its predecessor. Shapes are more rounded and touch points are padded, while materials are praiseworthy for this class. Points are deducted for the still-frustrating MyFord Touch infotainment interface.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Interior materials are much improved for 2015, with more soft-touch elements and well-textured plastics. Creaks are nonexistent and the only cheap looking part in the car is the glovebox.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Muscle cars are known for delivering performance on a budget and the 2015 Mustang maintains this tradition. With a small class comprised of the Chevy Camaro and Dodge Challenger, the pricing structure has them pretty much in lock step with each other.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: The new Mustang adds standard features that were either optional or not available previously. For performance-minded shoppers, the $2,495 GT Performance pkg might seem pricey, but it's justified by the added athleticism.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Muscle cars are known for delivering performance on a budget and the 2015 Mustang maintains this tradition. With a small class comprised of the Chevy Camaro and Dodge Challenger, the pricing structure has them pretty much in lock step with each other.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: A base Mustang GT costs $32,925. The GT Premium starts at $36,925. Our lavishly appointed test car rang in at $45,885, with extraneous options (adaptive cruise control, Recaro seats, interior trim, etc) responsible for the uptick.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Muscle cars are known for delivering performance on a budget and the 2015 Mustang maintains this tradition. With a small class comprised of the Chevy Camaro and Dodge Challenger, the pricing structure has them pretty much in lock step with each other.
title: Cost

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: EPA estimates of 19 mpg Combined (15 City/25 Highway) are comparable to other cars in the class. We managed 21 mpg on our highway-heavy evaluation loop, but only 13.9 mpg in overall (though quite enthusiastic) driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Muscle cars are known for delivering performance on a budget and the 2015 Mustang maintains this tradition. With a small class comprised of the Chevy Camaro and Dodge Challenger, the pricing structure has them pretty much in lock step with each other.
title: MPG

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Ford offers a typical 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty. Chevrolet and Dodge best the Mustang with 5-year/100,000-mile powertrain coverages.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Muscle cars are known for delivering performance on a budget and the 2015 Mustang maintains this tradition. With a small class comprised of the Chevy Camaro and Dodge Challenger, the pricing structure has them pretty much in lock step with each other.
title: Warranty

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: As with rivals, no free maintenenace is offered on the Mustang. Roadside assistance is covered for 5 years/60,000 miles but Chevrolet and Dodge extend theirs to 100,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Muscle cars are known for delivering performance on a budget and the 2015 Mustang maintains this tradition. With a small class comprised of the Chevy Camaro and Dodge Challenger, the pricing structure has them pretty much in lock step with each other.
title: Ownership

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: Despite its high levels of performance, the Mustang GT makes few sacrifices when it comes to comfort or refinement. It's as equally at home on a racetrack as it is in the daily commute, and it will make the commute less of a chore.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang GT delivers thrills aplenty without many of the previous shortcomings that hampered its overall performance and refinement. It's far more predictable and well-mannered when driven hard, which encourages adventurous drivers to push even harder. Fun? You betcha.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Ford
model.name: Mustang
style.name: GT Premium 2dr Coupe (5.0L 8cyl 6M)
summary: You're buying 50 years of history with the Mustang. The improvements are many and significant, but at its core, its spirit is alive and well. Besides owning a big chunk of Americana, you're also getting a lot of car for the money.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The 2015 Mustang GT delivers thrills aplenty without many of the previous shortcomings that hampered its overall performance and refinement. It's far more predictable and well-mannered when driven hard, which encourages adventurous drivers to push even harder. Fun? You betcha.
title: Personality

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: 6.2-liter V8 sounds good and allows the Yukon to hit 60 in 6.4 seconds. There's ample yank for passing at freeway speeds, too. Our tester had the 6-speed trans, which will be replaced. 8-speed should help accel as well as economy.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Acceleration

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Stopping from 60 mph required 134 feet, which is average, if not long, for the class. In regular use, the brakes feel only OK with a relatively soft, long-travel pedal. Many competitors will perform better.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Braking

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Steering weight is adequate if not a bit light. Feel is minimal, but response is decent. Keep the Yukon on open roads and steering is predictable and easy. Don't plan on any quick reactions, however.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Steering

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Body roll, pitch and dive are all better controlled than in previous-generation Yukons and better than the less-costly Suburban. The Yukon's size and weight are there, but it manages pretty well considering those drawbacks. It's big, but it's easy.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Handling

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Though its reactions are slow by the standard of smaller SUVs, the Yukon exhibits decent road manners. No drivability gaffes worth mentioning.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Driveability

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Concealed receiver hitch standard 4x4 tow rating is 7,900 lbs with trailering pkg with standard 3.42 axle ratio. Comes standard with trailer brake controller and sway control. Tow rating is not SAE-compliant like that of the Toyota Sequoia.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Towing

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Standard equipment with the 4x4 is a two-speed transfer case, though this isn't the kind of SUV you'll take off-road. Big wheels, a long wheelbase and running boards relegate the 4WD to being an all-weather tool only.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 6.2-liter direct-injected V8 is powerful, and it's paired with an 8-speed automatic beginning in the late fall of 2014. There's enough power to move the Yukon rapidly, and its adaptive suspension manages the solid-axle suspension well.
title: Off-Road

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Front seats are both heated and ventilated and offer ample adjustability and good support. Second-row seats are more than adequate for large passengers. Even the third row will accommodate adults. This is a big SUV. Space is its strength.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Yukon XL Denali is a luxury SUV, and it treats its occupants accordingly. It is both quiet and comfortable. Independent rear suspension would further improve ride, but tuning is still good. Heated wheel is standard. Entertainment features are abundant.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Body motions are well-controlled in the Yukon, though there's no denying the presence of big heavy wheels and a solid axle. Even so, most drivers probably won't notice, given the suspension's adaptability.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Yukon XL Denali is a luxury SUV, and it treats its occupants accordingly. It is both quiet and comfortable. Independent rear suspension would further improve ride, but tuning is still good. Heated wheel is standard. Entertainment features are abundant.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Admirably quiet inside. Active noise cancellation works effectively in the Yukon to deaden interior noise. Wind and road noise are insignificant. This isn't Lexus-quiet, but it's close.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Yukon XL Denali is a luxury SUV, and it treats its occupants accordingly. It is both quiet and comfortable. Independent rear suspension would further improve ride, but tuning is still good. Heated wheel is standard. Entertainment features are abundant.
title: Quietness

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Power tilt-and-telescope steering column is standard, as are power-adjustable pedals. New audio and climate control buttons/knobs are generously sized.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A new interior design is the Yukon's biggest strength. Materials and build quality are quite high, and there are many comfort and entertainment features. Navigation is standard on Denali. Second- and third-row entertainment screens are available.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The central door post is 2 in forward from last year, giving extra foot clearance and longer rear doors. Power fold-and-tumble second row makes for excellent third-row access.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A new interior design is the Yukon's biggest strength. Materials and build quality are quite high, and there are many comfort and entertainment features. Navigation is standard on Denali. Second- and third-row entertainment screens are available.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Abundant front and rear leg- and headroom. Depending on seat position, driver's elbow may make contact with large center armrest when steering. Otherwise, both second and third rows are on par or ahead of the competition.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A new interior design is the Yukon's biggest strength. Materials and build quality are quite high, and there are many comfort and entertainment features. Navigation is standard on Denali. Second- and third-row entertainment screens are available.
title: Space/Room

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Good view out of the front and sides, thin windshield pillars. Standard rearview camera, front and rear parking sensors, blind-spot monitoring and cross-traffic alert.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A new interior design is the Yukon's biggest strength. Materials and build quality are quite high, and there are many comfort and entertainment features. Navigation is standard on Denali. Second- and third-row entertainment screens are available.
title: Visibility

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: A flat load floor is a much-needed feature. However, compromising lift-over height to do it hurts usability. Even so, with a 130-in wheelbase, space is abundant, just not as good as before.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A new interior design is the Yukon's biggest strength. Materials and build quality are quite high, and there are many comfort and entertainment features. Navigation is standard on Denali. Second- and third-row entertainment screens are available.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Any Denali-trim GMC is, with the exception of Cadillac, the best-built vehicle to come from GM in recent memory. Perforated stitched leather seats are a nice touch. We witnessed no quality problems.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A generous list of standard features (heated/cooled front seats, heated second-row seats, power everything), many safety technologies and a powerful engine add to the Denali's appeal. But at this cost there are many other options worth exploring.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Content is ample, as it should be on an SUV in this price range (our tester was $78K), but not significantly better than competitors. Better cargo flexibility could be achieved if GM rid the Yukon of its solid-axle rear suspension.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A generous list of standard features (heated/cooled front seats, heated second-row seats, power everything), many safety technologies and a powerful engine add to the Denali's appeal. But at this cost there are many other options worth exploring.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: You'll need to bring more money to buy a 2015 Yukon. The $69,375 base price of our 4WD Denali  is $4,310 higher than last year. Base SLE pricing increase is only about $1,100.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A generous list of standard features (heated/cooled front seats, heated second-row seats, power everything), many safety technologies and a powerful engine add to the Denali's appeal. But at this cost there are many other options worth exploring.
title: Cost

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: At 16 mpg combined from the EPA, the Yukon is not a picture of efficiency. We measured 15 mpg in mixed driving in the Yukon. It produced 15.9 mpg on our 116-mile test loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A generous list of standard features (heated/cooled front seats, heated second-row seats, power everything), many safety technologies and a powerful engine add to the Denali's appeal. But at this cost there are many other options worth exploring.
title: MPG

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The powertrain is covered for 5 years/100,000 miles, which is great. The bumper-to-bumper warranty is rather ordinary at 3 years/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A generous list of standard features (heated/cooled front seats, heated second-row seats, power everything), many safety technologies and a powerful engine add to the Denali's appeal. But at this cost there are many other options worth exploring.
title: Warranty

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Scheduled maintenance (oil changes, tire rotation) is included for the first 2 years/24,000 miles. 24-hour roadside assistance lasts for 5 years/100,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A generous list of standard features (heated/cooled front seats, heated second-row seats, power everything), many safety technologies and a powerful engine add to the Denali's appeal. But at this cost there are many other options worth exploring.
title: Ownership

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Plenty of power and good sound to go with it. Only average brakes. Modest big-truck handling.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Though the Yukon XL isn't designed to be fun to drive, it handles the tasks of moving people and stuff well enough that we were able to appreciate the experience. And it's well-mannered enough to not be embarrassing.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: GMC
model.name: Yukon XL
style.name: SLE 4dr SUV 4WD (5.3L 8cyl 6A)
summary: There's no hiding the Yukon XL's size -- especially with the big chrome grille and massive wheels. But it's more subtle than the Escalade, and its overall shape is easy on the eyes.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Though the Yukon XL isn't designed to be fun to drive, it handles the tasks of moving people and stuff well enough that we were able to appreciate the experience. And it's well-mannered enough to not be embarrassing.
title: Personality

model.name: Accord
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: CVT still feels weak off the line, but its 0-60 and quarter-mile performance is at the top of the segment (among 4-cyl models).
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Accord EX is among the best performing four-cylinder midsize sedans in dynamic tests. Fuel economy is on par for the segment.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Customarily weak Honda brakes. No significant distance fade in our test, but an uninspiring pedal.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Accord EX is among the best performing four-cylinder midsize sedans in dynamic tests. Fuel economy is on par for the segment.

style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)

ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Accord EX is among the best performing four-cylinder midsize sedans in dynamic tests. Fuel economy is on par for the segment.

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Vastly improved over 2012 Accord, which had awkward lower back support.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As comfortable as it needs to be -- comparable to Camry SE, which offers real damping. Never sloppy or soft in its suspension movements or creature comforts.

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Comfortable, but the Accord does not live on the plush end of the scale.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As comfortable as it needs to be -- comparable to Camry SE, which offers real damping. Never sloppy or soft in its suspension movements or creature comforts.
title: Ride Comfort

ratings.summary: Better-than-average dynamics help the Accord be more fun than many competitors, but it's still a family car and not a sports car.

style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
