ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Better-than-average dynamics help the Accord be more fun than many competitors, but it's still a family car and not a sports car.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The four-cylinder engine delivers smooth but average acceleration for the segment (0-60 mph in 8.1 seconds) and is paired to a nice responsive CVT. For more thrust, the optional V6 engine's silky power returns class-leading acceleration.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is a top-performing family sedan. Acceleration and braking are among the segment best with the V6 model being quicker than many base model luxury sedans. Handling is responsive and composed, and its easy-to-drive nature makes it accessible to any driver.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Hondas used to have some of the worst stopping distances. Not any more. The EX-L we tested stopped from 60 mph in 117 feet, which is commendable for the class. The brake pedal is easy to modulate and isn't overly grabby even at full effort.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is a top-performing family sedan. Acceleration and braking are among the segment best with the V6 model being quicker than many base model luxury sedans. Handling is responsive and composed, and its easy-to-drive nature makes it accessible to any driver.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Steering is light in effort but feels precise and fluid in its movement. It doesn't offer as much feedback as Hondas of the past, but it feels natural to the point that you won't be thinking about the steering, which is a good thing.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is a top-performing family sedan. Acceleration and braking are among the segment best with the V6 model being quicker than many base model luxury sedans. Handling is responsive and composed, and its easy-to-drive nature makes it accessible to any driver.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There's body roll for sure, but the suspension keeps its composure over mid-corner bumps. The car rotates and pivots through corners if coaxed and the front tires won't simply give up if you start to lean on them a little.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is a top-performing family sedan. Acceleration and braking are among the segment best with the V6 model being quicker than many base model luxury sedans. Handling is responsive and composed, and its easy-to-drive nature makes it accessible to any driver.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A paragon of being easy and pleasant to drive. The four-cylinder and CVT pairing, usually a sore spot in other cars, is responsive to your demands. Sport shift mode will even maintain proper "gear" ratios as you'd expect.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is a top-performing family sedan. Acceleration and braking are among the segment best with the V6 model being quicker than many base model luxury sedans. Handling is responsive and composed, and its easy-to-drive nature makes it accessible to any driver.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The optional leather-covered front seats are firm and supportive during long drives. The cloth seat cushions are a touch softer, but still provide good support. Modest side bolstering seems appropriate here and non-confining for larger folks.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Accord's comfort, quietness and overall refinement is a standout in the segment, and may even give a few entry-level luxury cars a run for their money. The only area that it comes up a little short is the strength of its A/C system. Otherwise it's likely to surpass many expectations.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Accord rides very comfortably and composed, especially with the Touring model's upgraded reactive dampers. Even on the notoriously jagged and jarring L.A. highway system, the suspension feels at ease.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Accord's comfort, quietness and overall refinement is a standout in the segment, and may even give a few entry-level luxury cars a run for their money. The only area that it comes up a little short is the strength of its A/C system. Otherwise it's likely to surpass many expectations.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Air-conditioning proved weak on a hot day, or at least we found ourselves setting the automatic climate control about 7 degrees cooler to achieve the same level of comfort as we did during back-to-back drives in a Chevrolet Malibu.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Accord's comfort, quietness and overall refinement is a standout in the segment, and may even give a few entry-level luxury cars a run for their money. The only area that it comes up a little short is the strength of its A/C system. Otherwise it's likely to surpass many expectations.
title: Climate Control

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Wind and road noise are impressively subdued, and even the four-cylinder's CVT doesn't develop the common droning noises they're typically known for. The V6 is smooth and quiet, with pleasingly sporty sounds at high rpm.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Accord's comfort, quietness and overall refinement is a standout in the segment, and may even give a few entry-level luxury cars a run for their money. The only area that it comes up a little short is the strength of its A/C system. Otherwise it's likely to surpass many expectations.
title: Noise & Vibration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The touchscreen interface found on most trims isn't very user friendly, and the abundance of steering wheel buttons can be overwhelming on upper trims. Otherwise, the more basic controls are easy to figure out.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Accord's cabin is an example of how to do it right. There's plenty of space, it's easy to get in and out, and the airy greenhouse provides a good view out for the driver and a roomy environment for passengers.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: It's easier to access the Accord's rear seats than in some competitors that have sleeker, lower rooflines. The doors are large and light and the seats feel a little tall and upright for a sedan.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Accord's cabin is an example of how to do it right. There's plenty of space, it's easy to get in and out, and the airy greenhouse provides a good view out for the driver and a roomy environment for passengers.
title: Getting In/Out

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Eight-way power seats don't have as much rearward travel as in some other sedans, but only the tallest drivers will notice. The seat is mounted on the high side, provides good visibility and the steering column tilts and telescopes for good positioning.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Accord's cabin is an example of how to do it right. There's plenty of space, it's easy to get in and out, and the airy greenhouse provides a good view out for the driver and a roomy environment for passengers.
title: Driving Position

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Accord has a large, airy cabin with plenty of room. A 6-foot tall driver could sit behind himself with legroom to spare, and copious headroom. The rear seats also have a nice reclined seatback angle.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Accord's cabin is an example of how to do it right. There's plenty of space, it's easy to get in and out, and the airy greenhouse provides a good view out for the driver and a roomy environment for passengers.
title: Roominess

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The LaneWatch camera is a unique approach to the blind-spot issue, though not everyone finds it useful. Thin upright pillars and large windows make forward visibility easy, even if some of the interior trim reflects glare. A rearview camera is standard.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Accord's cabin is an example of how to do it right. There's plenty of space, it's easy to get in and out, and the airy greenhouse provides a good view out for the driver and a roomy environment for passengers.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The touchscreen found on most trim levels can be frustrating to use. Commonly used menu buttons are too small, and navigation between menus is confusing. There's no volume knob or direct radio tuning method, which means most rivals are much better.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: The number of electronic features available on most Accord trim levels is commendable, but the execution of those features needs work. In particular, the Honda Sensing package's various driver aids and the frustrating touchscreen found on most trim levels.
title: Audio & Navigation

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are present, but transitioning between their controls and those of the Honda-controlled systems is frustrating and confusing. Bluetooth pairing is easy for audio and phone.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: The number of electronic features available on most Accord trim levels is commendable, but the execution of those features needs work. In particular, the Honda Sensing package's various driver aids and the frustrating touchscreen found on most trim levels.
title: Device Integration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The superior voice controls at least serve as a good work-around for some of the other shortcomings. We successfully and easily entered two navigation addresses on the first try, called up a satellite radio station and made a phone call.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: The number of electronic features available on most Accord trim levels is commendable, but the execution of those features needs work. In particular, the Honda Sensing package's various driver aids and the frustrating touchscreen found on most trim levels.
title: Voice Controls

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Unrefined adaptive cruise control is too quick to slam on the brakes, too slow to speed up and doesn't come to a complete stop by itself. The collision warning is overly sensitive to the point we prefer it off. The lane departure systems function properly, without being overly intrusive or ping-ponging between lines.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: The number of electronic features available on most Accord trim levels is commendable, but the execution of those features needs work. In particular, the Honda Sensing package's various driver aids and the frustrating touchscreen found on most trim levels.
title: Driver Aids

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 15.5-cubic-foot trunk and its wide opening are average for the segment, meaning they are both really big. All Accords have a 60/40 split-folding rear seat, with the exception of the base LX that has a one-piece.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is among the class leaders in terms of utility, boasting a nice-sized trunk, abundant small item storage and a big back seat for car seats and whatever else doesn't fit in back.
title: Cargo Space

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Two bins under the center stack are perfect for keeping a smartphone of whatever jumbo-size proportions Apple or Samsung comes up with next. Large, square cupholders hold a variety of containers but could benefit from better grip.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is among the class leaders in terms of utility, boasting a nice-sized trunk, abundant small item storage and a big back seat for car seats and whatever else doesn't fit in back.
title: Small Item Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: LATCH points in outboard positions with three upper tether anchors. You may have to uncomfortably move the passenger seat up for some rear-facing seats, but most will fit well. Better than most cars, but some midsize sedans are better.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord is among the class leaders in terms of utility, boasting a nice-sized trunk, abundant small item storage and a big back seat for car seats and whatever else doesn't fit in back.
title: Child Safety Seats

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Interior materials are of solid quality compared to the best in the class, and it's all screwed together so well that it feels like it'll last for 100 years. There's even good value in top-level trims.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Accord is similarly priced to most rivals which makes it attractive considering its competitive equipment levels, quality interior materials, thrifty fuel economy and a well-earned reputation for reliability.
title: Build Quality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Accord's starting price of around $22,000 is average for the segment, but comes with generous features, the reassurance of Honda ownership and general vehicular excellence. Similar value proposition even as prices and trim levels rise.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Accord is similarly priced to most rivals which makes it attractive considering its competitive equipment levels, quality interior materials, thrifty fuel economy and a well-earned reputation for reliability.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Four-cylinder base engine and CVT achieved 33.5 mpg on our 116-mile evaluation route versus an EPA-estimated 31 mpg combined. The V6 returned 26.4 on our evaluation route versus an EPA-estimated 26 mpg combined.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Accord is similarly priced to most rivals which makes it attractive considering its competitive equipment levels, quality interior materials, thrifty fuel economy and a well-earned reputation for reliability.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Basic warranty of 3 years/36,000 miles and drivetrain warranty of 5 years/60,000 miles are typical for the segment. Only Hyundai and Kia offer more -- but significantly so.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Accord is similarly priced to most rivals which makes it attractive considering its competitive equipment levels, quality interior materials, thrifty fuel economy and a well-earned reputation for reliability.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Superior reliability according to multiple sources. Standard roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles is average for the segment. Doesn't offer free-scheduled maintenance like Toyota, Volkswagen and Chevrolet offer in this segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Accord is similarly priced to most rivals which makes it attractive considering its competitive equipment levels, quality interior materials, thrifty fuel economy and a well-earned reputation for reliability.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Accord may not provide driving thrills on your way to work, dropping the kids off at school or making a run to the grocery store, but encounter a curvy road and it'll reveal some surprisingly sharp reflexes, with lively response.
ratings.title: Wild Card
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord has a long reputation for being well-rounded; a prudent buying decision rather than one you'd make out of emotion. With its updated styling it maintains a clean look and is instantly recognizable as an Accord, but it doesn't do much to push the envelope.
title: Fun-to-Drive

make.name: Honda
model.name: Accord
style.name: EX-L 4dr Sedan (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Despite Honda jazzing up the Accord with some distinctive styling elements, it doesn't quite strike the same visual-emotional chord as a Mazda 6 or even the newly rebodied Chevrolet Malibu. It's easy on the eyes, but there's nothing new here.
ratings.title: Wild Card
ratings.summary: The Honda Accord has a long reputation for being well-rounded; a prudent buying decision rather than one you'd make out of emotion. With its updated styling it maintains a clean look and is instantly recognizable as an Accord, but it doesn't do much to push the envelope.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The 140-horsepower, 1.8-liter four-cylinder has just enough power for most commuting action. The automatic makes do with 5 gears in an era of 6-speeds, and can't be shifted manually.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 3 has long been the driver's choice in the compact segment. But this iteration of Civic gives it the most challenge it's seen in some time.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The Civic required 130 feet to reach a stop from 60 mph. That's a bit below average for the compact class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 3 has long been the driver's choice in the compact segment. But this iteration of Civic gives it the most challenge it's seen in some time.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Steering effort is appropriately light and precise, but doesn't offer much in the way of feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 3 has long been the driver's choice in the compact segment. But this iteration of Civic gives it the most challenge it's seen in some time.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The Honda is playful and surprisingly capable in transitions. The Continental ContiProContact tires are its limiting factor here.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 3 has long been the driver's choice in the compact segment. But this iteration of Civic gives it the most challenge it's seen in some time.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Around town, the Civic met all of our needs as a comfy daily driver. The sportily tuned steering and suspension added a dash of fun to the mix, even though it's low on usable power.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 3 has long been the driver's choice in the compact segment. But this iteration of Civic gives it the most challenge it's seen in some time.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Most will find the wide seats welcoming. It's easy to find a comfortable position, even for all-day traveling. The rear seats offer adequate leg- and headroom.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic sets the bar for ride comfort and quietness among compact sedans. Overall seat comfort is nearly as remarkable.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Honda clearly paid a lot of attention to the Civic's suspension in this refresh. It displays none of the busy, sometimes rough ride quality of other compacts.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic sets the bar for ride comfort and quietness among compact sedans. Overall seat comfort is nearly as remarkable.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Honda used sound-deadening to elevate the Civic to the top of the class in noise suppression. Road, wind and tire noise are all significantly muted.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic sets the bar for ride comfort and quietness among compact sedans. Overall seat comfort is nearly as remarkable.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Displays are oriented slightly toward the driver, which is an ergonomic plus. The combination of buttons and dials simplifies the use of all center stack controls.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: While it's not visually stunning, the Civic's redesigned interior is ergonomically excellent. The combination of buttons and dials is logically arranged and an example of how to do it right.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Wide, flat seat bottoms ensured we had no trouble sliding in and out of the Civic. Step-in height is average.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: While it's not visually stunning, the Civic's redesigned interior is ergonomically excellent. The combination of buttons and dials is logically arranged and an example of how to do it right.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: For the Civic's size, the cabin feels spacious. We found enough pockets and bins for all of our loose items. There's decent room for 6-footers in the backseat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: While it's not visually stunning, the Civic's redesigned interior is ergonomically excellent. The combination of buttons and dials is logically arranged and an example of how to do it right.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: A high parcel shelf limits rearward visibility, but no more than competitors. Standard rearview camera eliminates most blind spots. Forward visibility is good.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: While it's not visually stunning, the Civic's redesigned interior is ergonomically excellent. The combination of buttons and dials is logically arranged and an example of how to do it right.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Cargo capacity is average. The rear seat folds in a 60/40 split to allow for larger items. But the narrow pass-through puts some limitations on what you can squeeze through there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: While it's not visually stunning, the Civic's redesigned interior is ergonomically excellent. The combination of buttons and dials is logically arranged and an example of how to do it right.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Build quality is back up to the Honda standards we're accustomed to. The use of hard plastics on high-traffic surfaces is minimal.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality and use of materials are areas where the Civic really sets itself apart from the pack. A long list of standard features gives it an edge in this value-driven segment.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Standard Bluetooth, rearview camera, iPod integration and apps such as Pandora give the Civic an edge over other compacts.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality and use of materials are areas where the Civic really sets itself apart from the pack. A long list of standard features gives it an edge in this value-driven segment.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The MSRP for the four-door EX was $20,815 at the time of our test. This is about average in the segment, considering its long list of standard equipment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality and use of materials are areas where the Civic really sets itself apart from the pack. A long list of standard features gives it an edge in this value-driven segment.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: EPA estimates rank the Civic at 28 mpg around town and 39 mpg on the highway, which is average for the class. We averaged 29 mpg over 1,000 miles of combined driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality and use of materials are areas where the Civic really sets itself apart from the pack. A long list of standard features gives it an edge in this value-driven segment.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The Civic comes with three-year/36,000-mile basic, five-year/60,000-mile drivetrain and five-year/unlimited miles rust and corrosion warranties.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality and use of materials are areas where the Civic really sets itself apart from the pack. A long list of standard features gives it an edge in this value-driven segment.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: No complimentary maintenance or roadside assistance are offered. But Honda has a long-standing reputation for reliability.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality and use of materials are areas where the Civic really sets itself apart from the pack. A long list of standard features gives it an edge in this value-driven segment.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The Civic's steering and suspension are up to the task of keeping things fun. New offerings from Dodge and Kia have noticeably quicker acceleration in the real world.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Steering and suspension tweaks from the previous Civic really show in the sense that they make this Honda fun to drive. It's a quality rare to this breed of car.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Lively handling breathes personality into the Civic, keeping it from being just another run-of-the-mill compact sedan. A more powerful engine would be icing on the cake.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Steering and suspension tweaks from the previous Civic really show in the sense that they make this Honda fun to drive. It's a quality rare to this breed of car.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Civic Si has always felt strong when driven hard, and a 6.8-second dash to 60 mph is pretty sporty at this price. The 205-hp 2.4-liter engine also makes good low-end torque, which means the Civic Si is willing even when driven casually.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Confidence-inspiring pedal is firm and easy to modulate in traffic. The optional summer tires (3-season is a better term) produce a 112-foot panic stop from 60 mph, perhaps a dozen feet shorter than we'd expect on all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Small-diameter steering wheel feels great in our hands, and the response is suitably sporty and direct. The sticky tires help it change directions quickly, but the Si also feels settled while driving straight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Si coupe is stable and composed through corners, and the optional summer tires produce plenty of grip. It feels light on its feet and changes direction readily, yet doesn't get tossed offline in bumpier corners. Good suspension tuning.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: 6-speed manual is easy and satisfying to shift thanks to good clutch feel and an accurate shifter. It's a true close-ratio gearbox that prioritizes performance, yet the 2.4-liter engine's ample torque lessens the need for frequent shifts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Great support and basic shape, and the attractive cloth is grippy. The side bolstering holds the driver nicely in place in corners, but on long hauls the seats might be a bit narrow and confining for anyone whose weight begins with a "2."
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Ride is compliant and well damped. Certain bumps can cause side-to-side head toss, but it's far from objectionable. Credit Honda for resisting the allure of ultra-low profile tires. The 225/40R18 rubber strikes a good balance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: There's a little road noise, but it doesn't draw much attention compared to the engine sound. That engine note is pleasing, but the 6-speed manual's close-ratio gearing doesn't allow for low revs even in 6th. A 7th gear would be nice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Two-screen center stack is harder to use than a traditional interface, and the ridiculously fat HDMI cord looks wretched. Most other controls and stalks work well, but tall drivers will wish the telescopic steering wheel pulled back more.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Sloping roofline and door frame ask taller drivers to stoop a little, but the coupe's long doors are quite welcoming. It's a tight squeeze into the back seat, but that's a coupe for you. They offer the Si in a sedan for those that care.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Front seat room isn't terribly generous, and this is compounded by insufficent seat travel and the Si's standard headroom-robbing sunroof. Backseat lacks headroom and legroom and is suitable for short trips and short people only.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Easy to see forward, and the long coupe doors allow for a meaningful head-check. But the rear pillars are pretty thick, making for a massive passenger-side blind spot. Honda's available Lane Watch camera system offsets this somewhat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Door pockets and glovebox are good-sized, but it's too bad the HDMI jack and oversized cord aren't concealed in the large center console. The 11.7-cubic-foot trunk holds a decent amount and the opening is sufficiently large.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Well built for a sporty compact that costs in the mid $20,000 range. Tight gaps and nice materials and the Si-specific seats, though made of fabric as opposed to leather, look and feel well-made.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The base 2014 Honda Civic Si coupe costs $23,580 and our top-dog Si with navigation and summer tires is priced at $25,280. Those two options are available separately, too. A sunroof and sport seats are standard on all of them.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Cheaper than the Ford Focus ST and the Volkswagen GTI, the Civic Si is a pretty good performance bargain even before you factor in how well it does the job and how long it holds value.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Lacking a cruising gear, the Si's close-ratio 6-speed transmission isn't the best for highway fuel economy. That said, 25 mpg Combined (22 City/31 Highway) isn't shabby and we managed 33.5 mpg on our test loop. Requires premium, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Nothing special here. Like all Hondas, the Si comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty and a 5-year/unlimited-miles rust and corrosion warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: There's nothing in the way of complimentary maintenance or roadside assistance here. But you will enjoy good resale value, which will be worth at least as much, if not more, in the long run.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Only available with a manual transmission, the Honda Civic Si was designed for drivers who like to be involved. And it delivers with crisp handling, engaging steering, a great shifter and that signature Honda VTEC growl.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's no denying that the Honda Civic Si is fun to drive. After all, that's what it's for, that's why it's in the lineup. The fact that you can't buy one with an automatic should be your first clue. And it has the right mix of ingredients to deliver the goods.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: This generation of Honda Civic isn't particularly engaging in a visual sense, but has that ever been the case? As ever, the Civic Si's personality comes from the way it drives and the way it sounds.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's no denying that the Honda Civic Si is fun to drive. After all, that's what it's for, that's why it's in the lineup. The fact that you can't buy one with an automatic should be your first clue. And it has the right mix of ingredients to deliver the goods.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A 0-60 time of 9.1 seconds from the 143-horsepower four-cylinder is at least a half-second slower than other compacts. CVT's sport mode maximizes what power there is, but no manual control.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Stopping distance from 60 mph in 118 feet is excellent for a compact car equipped with all-season tires. Minimum brake fade, unlike past Hondas. Car maintained control in panic stop.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Perhaps not the runaway benchmark in steering feel it once was, but still more responsive than most. Tiny go-kart steering wheel makes the car feel a bit sportier than it is.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Feels lightweight, goes where it's pointed, but limited by grip (0.83g on skidpad). The chassis is a home run, always demonstrating the utmost control, especially on mid-corner bumps.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Around town, the Civic met all of our needs as a comfy daily driver. The sportily tuned steering and suspension added a dash of fun to the mix, even though it's low on usable power.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Height-adjustable driver seat could go down lower and slide rearward more. Some found unadjustable lumbar overly aggressive. Still, firm seats were supportive during four-hour drive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Honda Civic Sedan is an impressively comfortable and quiet car, displaying a refinement that most other compact cars cannot match. Cabin noise is nicely quelled, unlike in past Civics.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Though certainly on the firm side of the spectrum, everything is perfectly damped, and undulations that set some other cars bobbing about are instead met with reassuring control.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Honda Civic Sedan is an impressively comfortable and quiet car, displaying a refinement that most other compact cars cannot match. Cabin noise is nicely quelled, unlike in past Civics.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Honda used sound-deadening to elevate the Civic to the top of the class in noise suppression. Road, wind and tire noise are all significantly muted, but CVT drones under heavy throttle.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Honda Civic Sedan is an impressively comfortable and quiet car, displaying a refinement that most other compact cars cannot match. Cabin noise is nicely quelled, unlike in past Civics.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Civic's new touchscreen feels hit-or-miss. Functions are buried in sub-menus, but the response is fast and the folders are logical. All other controls are very simple.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Wide, flat seat bottoms make sliding in and out easy. Step-in height is average; size of rear doors and roof line decreases the chance of your clonking your head.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The driver seat could use more aft travel and tilt adjustment. Not especially tall-person-friendly. The back seat does, however, offer an abundance of space for the segment.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A tall greenhouse and thin pillars create an airy cabin that's tough to beat. A rearview camera is standard on all Civics; the EX and above get the LaneWatch blind spot camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Decent-sized bins around the cabin, cupholders are big, trunk is average in overall size but generously wide in its opening. The 60/40 pass-through opening is narrow, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Materials are matched by other compact cars, but construction is beyond reproach. Buttons and knobs operate with a solid, high-class fluidity. Quality definitely matches the price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Honda hasn't always provided as much equipment as competitors, but that's no longer the case. Even the base model is well equipped. Fuel economy is excellent and the Honda reputation for reliability is hard to ignore.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: $18,190 base Civic standard with rearview camera, Bluetooth phone/audio, USB audio. EX trim adds touchscreen, App-based features, LaneWatch camera, auto climate control, push-button start.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Honda hasn't always provided as much equipment as competitors, but that's no longer the case. Even the base model is well equipped. Fuel economy is excellent and the Honda reputation for reliability is hard to ignore.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: As-tested price of $21,880 includes a lot of standard equipment on top of the Civic's commendable practicality, driving experience and build quality. You get a lot for your money.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Honda hasn't always provided as much equipment as competitors, but that's no longer the case. Even the base model is well equipped. Fuel economy is excellent and the Honda reputation for reliability is hard to ignore.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: EPA estimates 33 mpg Combined (30 City/39 Highway) with CVT. We achieved 34.8 on the 116-mile Edmunds evaluation route. This is equal to a Toyota Corolla, but less than a Mazda 3i.

model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: No complimentary maintenance or roadside assistance are offered. But Honda has a long-standing reputation for reliability.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Honda hasn't always provided as much equipment as competitors, but that's no longer the case. Even the base model is well equipped. Fuel economy is excellent and the Honda reputation for reliability is hard to ignore.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Civic's nimble feel make up for its lack of power, and sets it apart from compact cars like the Toyota Corolla and Hyundai Elantra. Still, the Mazda 3 and Ford Focus are more engaging.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Civic is very much a definitive Honda: competent and involving to drive without superfluous flair. It's a car you appreciate and respect rather than fall in love with.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Civic lacks the exterior and interior styling flourishes of most competitors, and even the previous-generation Civic, and instead offers a neutral space. Besides its driving experience, it's just not that interesting.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Civic is very much a definitive Honda: competent and involving to drive without superfluous flair. It's a car you appreciate and respect rather than fall in love with.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Civic Si has always felt strong when driven hard, and a 6.8-second dash to 60 mph is pretty sporty at this price. The 205-hp 2.4-liter engine also makes good low-end torque, which means the Civic Si is willing even when driven casually.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Confidence-inspiring pedal is firm and easy to modulate in traffic. The optional summer tires (3-season is a better term) produce a 112-foot panic stop from 60 mph, perhaps a dozen feet shorter than we'd expect on all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Small-diameter steering wheel feels great in our hands, and the response is suitably sporty and direct. The sticky tires help it change directions quickly, but the Si also feels settled while driving straight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Si coupe is stable and composed through corners, and the optional summer tires produce plenty of grip. It feels light on its feet and changes direction readily, yet doesn't get tossed offline in bumpier corners. Good suspension tuning.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: 6-speed manual is easy and satisfying to shift thanks to good clutch feel and an accurate shifter. It's a true close-ratio gearbox that prioritizes performance, yet the 2.4-liter engine's ample torque lessens the need for frequent shifts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Great support and basic shape, and the attractive cloth is grippy. The side bolstering holds the driver nicely in place in corners, but on long hauls the seats might be a bit narrow and confining for anyone whose weight begins with a "2."
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Ride is compliant and well damped. Certain bumps can cause side-to-side head toss, but it's far from objectionable. Credit Honda for resisting the allure of ultra-low profile tires. The 225/40R18 rubber strikes a good balance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: There's a little road noise, but it doesn't draw much attention compared to the engine sound. That engine note is pleasing, but the 6-speed manual's close-ratio gearing doesn't allow for low revs even in 6th. A 7th gear would be nice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Two-screen center stack is harder to use than a traditional interface, and the ridiculously fat HDMI cord looks wretched. Most other controls and stalks work well, but tall drivers will wish the telescopic steering wheel pulled back more.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Sloping roofline and door frame ask taller drivers to stoop a little, but the coupe's long doors are quite welcoming. It's a tight squeeze into the back seat, but that's a coupe for you. They offer the Si in a sedan for those that care.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Front seat room isn't terribly generous, and this is compounded by insufficent seat travel and the Si's standard headroom-robbing sunroof. Backseat lacks headroom and legroom and is suitable for short trips and short people only.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Easy to see forward, and the long coupe doors allow for a meaningful head-check. But the rear pillars are pretty thick, making for a massive passenger-side blind spot. Honda's available Lane Watch camera system offsets this somewhat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Door pockets and glovebox are good-sized, but it's too bad the HDMI jack and oversized cord aren't concealed in the large center console. The 11.7-cubic-foot trunk holds a decent amount and the opening is sufficiently large.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Well built for a sporty compact that costs in the mid $20,000 range. Tight gaps and nice materials and the Si-specific seats, though made of fabric as opposed to leather, look and feel well-made.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The base 2014 Honda Civic Si coupe costs $23,580 and our top-dog Si with navigation and summer tires is priced at $25,280. Those two options are available separately, too. A sunroof and sport seats are standard on all of them.

title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Civic Si has always felt strong when driven hard, and a 6.8-second dash to 60 mph is pretty sporty at this price. The 205-hp 2.4-liter engine also makes good low-end torque, which means the Civic Si is willing even when driven casually.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Confidence-inspiring pedal is firm and easy to modulate in traffic. The optional summer tires (3-season is a better term) produce a 112-foot panic stop from 60 mph, perhaps a dozen feet shorter than we'd expect on all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.

model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Small-diameter steering wheel feels great in our hands, and the response is suitably sporty and direct. The sticky tires help it change directions quickly, but the Si also feels settled while driving straight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Si coupe is stable and composed through corners, and the optional summer tires produce plenty of grip. It feels light on its feet and changes direction readily, yet doesn't get tossed offline in bumpier corners. Good suspension tuning.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: 6-speed manual is easy and satisfying to shift thanks to good clutch feel and an accurate shifter. It's a true close-ratio gearbox that prioritizes performance, yet the 2.4-liter engine's ample torque lessens the need for frequent shifts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Great support and basic shape, and the attractive cloth is grippy. The side bolstering holds the driver nicely in place in corners, but on long hauls the seats might be a bit narrow and confining for anyone whose weight begins with a "2."
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Ride is compliant and well damped. Certain bumps can cause side-to-side head toss, but it's far from objectionable. Credit Honda for resisting the allure of ultra-low profile tires. The 225/40R18 rubber strikes a good balance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: There's a little road noise, but it doesn't draw much attention compared to the engine sound. That engine note is pleasing, but the 6-speed manual's close-ratio gearing doesn't allow for low revs even in 6th. A 7th gear would be nice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Two-screen center stack is harder to use than a traditional interface, and the ridiculously fat HDMI cord looks wretched. Most other controls and stalks work well, but tall drivers will wish the telescopic steering wheel pulled back more.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Sloping roofline and door frame ask taller drivers to stoop a little, but the coupe's long doors are quite welcoming. It's a tight squeeze into the back seat, but that's a coupe for you. They offer the Si in a sedan for those that care.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Front seat room isn't terribly generous, and this is compounded by insufficent seat travel and the Si's standard headroom-robbing sunroof. Backseat lacks headroom and legroom and is suitable for short trips and short people only.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.

summary: Easy to see forward, and the long coupe doors allow for a meaningful head-check. But the rear pillars are pretty thick, making for a massive passenger-side blind spot. Honda's available Lane Watch camera system offsets this somewhat.
ratings.title: Interior

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Door pockets and glovebox are good-sized, but it's too bad the HDMI jack and oversized cord aren't concealed in the large center console. The 11.7-cubic-foot trunk holds a decent amount and the opening is sufficiently large.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Well built for a sporty compact that costs in the mid $20,000 range. Tight gaps and nice materials and the Si-specific seats, though made of fabric as opposed to leather, look and feel well-made.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.

style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The base 2014 Honda Civic Si coupe costs $23,580 and our top-dog Si with navigation and summer tires is priced at $25,280. Those two options are available separately, too. A sunroof and sport seats are standard on all of them.

summary: Cheaper than the Ford Focus ST and the Volkswagen GTI, the Civic Si is a pretty good performance bargain even before you factor in how well it does the job and how long it holds value.

summary: Lacking a cruising gear, the Si's close-ratio 6-speed transmission isn't the best for highway fuel economy. That said, 25 mpg Combined (22 City/31 Highway) isn't shabby and we managed 33.5 mpg on our test loop. Requires premium, though.

title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A 0-60 time of 9.1 seconds from the 143-horsepower four-cylinder is at least a half-second slower than other compacts. CVT's sport mode maximizes what power there is, but no manual control.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Stopping distance from 60 mph in 118 feet is excellent for a compact car equipped with all-season tires. Minimum brake fade, unlike past Hondas. Car maintained control in panic stop.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Perhaps not the runaway benchmark in steering feel it once was, but still more responsive than most. Tiny go-kart steering wheel makes the car feel a bit sportier than it is.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Feels lightweight, goes where it's pointed, but limited by grip (0.83g on skidpad). The chassis is a home run, always demonstrating the utmost control, especially on mid-corner bumps.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Around town, the Civic met all of our needs as a comfy daily driver. The sportily tuned steering and suspension added a dash of fun to the mix, even though it's low on usable power.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Civic isn't quick, but the well-executed continuously variable transmission (CVT) is a benefit, not a hindrance. Handling is hampered by tires, but this is still a nimble and responsive car with a good braking distance.

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Height-adjustable driver seat could go down lower and slide rearward more. Some found unadjustable lumbar overly aggressive. Still, firm seats were supportive during four-hour drive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Honda Civic Sedan is an impressively comfortable and quiet car, displaying a refinement that most other compact cars cannot match. Cabin noise is nicely quelled, unlike in past Civics.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Though certainly on the firm side of the spectrum, everything is perfectly damped, and undulations that set some other cars bobbing about are instead met with reassuring control.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Honda Civic Sedan is an impressively comfortable and quiet car, displaying a refinement that most other compact cars cannot match. Cabin noise is nicely quelled, unlike in past Civics.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Honda used sound-deadening to elevate the Civic to the top of the class in noise suppression. Road, wind and tire noise are all significantly muted, but CVT drones under heavy throttle.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Honda Civic Sedan is an impressively comfortable and quiet car, displaying a refinement that most other compact cars cannot match. Cabin noise is nicely quelled, unlike in past Civics.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Civic's new touchscreen feels hit-or-miss. Functions are buried in sub-menus, but the response is fast and the folders are logical. All other controls are very simple.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Wide, flat seat bottoms make sliding in and out easy. Step-in height is average; size of rear doors and roof line decreases the chance of your clonking your head.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Though we have mixed feelings about the functionality of Honda's new touchscreen interface, the rest of the Civic's cabin is the epitome of simplicity and functionality. A spacious back seat and useful trunk are clear benefits in this segment.

model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The driver seat could use more aft travel and tilt adjustment. Not especially tall-person-friendly. The back seat does, however, offer an abundance of space for the segment.
ratings.title: Interior

model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Decent-sized bins around the cabin, cupholders are big, trunk is average in overall size but generously wide in its opening. The 60/40 pass-through opening is narrow, though.
