model.name: Civic
style.name: EX 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Materials are matched by other compact cars, but construction is beyond reproach. Buttons and knobs operate with a solid, high-class fluidity. Quality definitely matches the price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Honda hasn't always provided as much equipment as competitors, but that's no longer the case. Even the base model is well equipped. Fuel economy is excellent and the Honda reputation for reliability is hard to ignore.

summary: The Civic's nimble feel make up for its lack of power, and sets it apart from compact cars like the Toyota Corolla and Hyundai Elantra. Still, the Mazda 3 and Ford Focus are more engaging.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive

summary: The Civic lacks the exterior and interior styling flourishes of most competitors, and even the previous-generation Civic, and instead offers a neutral space. Besides its driving experience, it's just not that interesting.

summary: The Civic Si has always felt strong when driven hard, and a 6.8-second dash to 60 mph is pretty sporty at this price. The 205-hp 2.4-liter engine also makes good low-end torque, which means the Civic Si is willing even when driven casually.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Confidence-inspiring pedal is firm and easy to modulate in traffic. The optional summer tires (3-season is a better term) produce a 112-foot panic stop from 60 mph, perhaps a dozen feet shorter than we'd expect on all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Small-diameter steering wheel feels great in our hands, and the response is suitably sporty and direct. The sticky tires help it change directions quickly, but the Si also feels settled while driving straight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The Si coupe is stable and composed through corners, and the optional summer tires produce plenty of grip. It feels light on its feet and changes direction readily, yet doesn't get tossed offline in bumpier corners. Good suspension tuning.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: 6-speed manual is easy and satisfying to shift thanks to good clutch feel and an accurate shifter. It's a true close-ratio gearbox that prioritizes performance, yet the 2.4-liter engine's ample torque lessens the need for frequent shifts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The new 2.4-liter 4-cylinder has 174 lb-ft of torque, much more than the 2.0-liter of old, making the Si a more driveable machine in all moods and conditions. Handling and steering are as sharp as ever, and the option of factory summer tires (or standard all seasons) is a nice touch.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Great support and basic shape, and the attractive cloth is grippy. The side bolstering holds the driver nicely in place in corners, but on long hauls the seats might be a bit narrow and confining for anyone whose weight begins with a "2."
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Ride is compliant and well damped. Certain bumps can cause side-to-side head toss, but it's far from objectionable. Credit Honda for resisting the allure of ultra-low profile tires. The 225/40R18 rubber strikes a good balance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: There's a little road noise, but it doesn't draw much attention compared to the engine sound. That engine note is pleasing, but the 6-speed manual's close-ratio gearing doesn't allow for low revs even in 6th. A 7th gear would be nice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Civic Si is comfortable considering its performance mission, and it's even comfortable on an overall basis. Its one shortcoming is engine sound during highway cruising, but we fully accept the trade-off. We'd rather have the Si's close-ratio manual gearbox than less noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Two-screen center stack is harder to use than a traditional interface, and the ridiculously fat HDMI cord looks wretched. Most other controls and stalks work well, but tall drivers will wish the telescopic steering wheel pulled back more.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Sloping roofline and door frame ask taller drivers to stoop a little, but the coupe's long doors are quite welcoming. It's a tight squeeze into the back seat, but that's a coupe for you. They offer the Si in a sedan for those that care.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Front seat room isn't terribly generous, and this is compounded by insufficent seat travel and the Si's standard headroom-robbing sunroof. Backseat lacks headroom and legroom and is suitable for short trips and short people only.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Easy to see forward, and the long coupe doors allow for a meaningful head-check. But the rear pillars are pretty thick, making for a massive passenger-side blind spot. Honda's available Lane Watch camera system offsets this somewhat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Door pockets and glovebox are good-sized, but it's too bad the HDMI jack and oversized cord aren't concealed in the large center console. The 11.7-cubic-foot trunk holds a decent amount and the opening is sufficiently large.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Not as spacious as other compacts, and we're not just talking about the usual coupe backseat deficit. The front half of the car feels tight, too. Two-screen infotainment interface is a step backward in ease-of-use, and the smartphone HDMI interface is more than a little unsightly.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Well built for a sporty compact that costs in the mid $20,000 range. Tight gaps and nice materials and the Si-specific seats, though made of fabric as opposed to leather, look and feel well-made.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: The base 2014 Honda Civic Si coupe costs $23,580 and our top-dog Si with navigation and summer tires is priced at $25,280. Those two options are available separately, too. A sunroof and sport seats are standard on all of them.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Cheaper than the Ford Focus ST and the Volkswagen GTI, the Civic Si is a pretty good performance bargain even before you factor in how well it does the job and how long it holds value.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Lacking a cruising gear, the Si's close-ratio 6-speed transmission isn't the best for highway fuel economy. That said, 25 mpg Combined (22 City/31 Highway) isn't shabby and we managed 33.5 mpg on our test loop. Requires premium, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Nothing special here. Like all Hondas, the Si comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty and a 5-year/unlimited-miles rust and corrosion warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: There's nothing in the way of complimentary maintenance or roadside assistance here. But you will enjoy good resale value, which will be worth at least as much, if not more, in the long run.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Si's value is apparent when it comes to price versus performance. The intangible fun-per-dollar factor is here, but so is cold, hard resale value. Fuel economy isn't stellar, but neither is it disappointing considering how much fun is derived from the tightly-geared transmission.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: Only available with a manual transmission, the Honda Civic Si was designed for drivers who like to be involved. And it delivers with crisp handling, engaging steering, a great shifter and that signature Honda VTEC growl.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's no denying that the Honda Civic Si is fun to drive. After all, that's what it's for, that's why it's in the lineup. The fact that you can't buy one with an automatic should be your first clue. And it has the right mix of ingredients to deliver the goods.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires 2dr Coupe (2.4L 4cyl 6M)
style.submodel.modelName: Civic Si w/Navigation and Summer Tires
summary: This generation of Honda Civic isn't particularly engaging in a visual sense, but has that ever been the case? As ever, the Civic Si's personality comes from the way it drives and the way it sounds.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's no denying that the Honda Civic Si is fun to drive. After all, that's what it's for, that's why it's in the lineup. The fact that you can't buy one with an automatic should be your first clue. And it has the right mix of ingredients to deliver the goods.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Perky 1.5-liter turbocharged engine accelerates like few others in the class as it pulls seamlessly to cruising speed. It feels strong when you roll on to the gas to execute a pass, too. At the track it scooted to 60 mph in 6.9 seconds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: EX and above Civics come with a spunky 1.5-liter turbocharged engine, and it works great with Honda's smooth and polished continuously variable automatic transmission. Composed and eager chassis is complimented by reassuringly strong brakes and accurate, steady steering.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Whether it's a casual suburban stop or heavy braking at a surprise red light, stops are sure and straight with a firm pedal that's easy to modulate. A 60 mph panic stop only covered 113 feet, a strong performance for any car on all-season tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: EX and above Civics come with a spunky 1.5-liter turbocharged engine, and it works great with Honda's smooth and polished continuously variable automatic transmission. Composed and eager chassis is complimented by reassuringly strong brakes and accurate, steady steering.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Variable ratio steering combines supreme steadiness when cruising straight with quick reflexes in corners and tight turning in parking lots. It's very communicative, too, with just-right effort and a delicate feel through a thick-rimmed wheel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: EX and above Civics come with a spunky 1.5-liter turbocharged engine, and it works great with Honda's smooth and polished continuously variable automatic transmission. Composed and eager chassis is complimented by reassuringly strong brakes and accurate, steady steering.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Turns in smoothly and doesn't exhibit much body roll as it arcs through turns. Feels balanced, agile, coordinated and willing whether you're driving to the grocery store or carving your way through the mountains. Solid.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: EX and above Civics come with a spunky 1.5-liter turbocharged engine, and it works great with Honda's smooth and polished continuously variable automatic transmission. Composed and eager chassis is complimented by reassuringly strong brakes and accurate, steady steering.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Continuously Variable Transmission (a type of automatic) completely eliminates shift shock and transmission indecisiveness because it never shifts in the traditional sense. Throttle pedal action is smooth and predictable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: EX and above Civics come with a spunky 1.5-liter turbocharged engine, and it works great with Honda's smooth and polished continuously variable automatic transmission. Composed and eager chassis is complimented by reassuringly strong brakes and accurate, steady steering.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Well-shaped seats accommodate a wide range of shapes and sizes, and the padding offers the right balance of give and support. And they remain comfortable on longer drives, too. Backseat is comfy as well; not an afterthought.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Seats are comfortable and supportive withough being too agressive or confining, and that applies equally to the backseat. Ride is smooth and controlled without being too cushy. Road noise and engine sound are never far away, but neither is obnoxious enough to be distracting.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The overall feel of the coupe tends toward the sporty side when compared to the sedan -- fractionally firmer, slightly busier -- but it doesn't go too far. Feels taut and controlled without feeling unduly harsh or brittle. Appropriate for a coupe.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Seats are comfortable and supportive withough being too agressive or confining, and that applies equally to the backseat. Ride is smooth and controlled without being too cushy. Road noise and engine sound are never far away, but neither is obnoxious enough to be distracting.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: There are quieter choices, particularly among compact sedans, but that doesn't make the Civic Coupe unpleasant. Expect some road noise, especially or coarse roads and concrete, along with a restrained growl from the 1.5-liter turbo engine.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Seats are comfortable and supportive withough being too agressive or confining, and that applies equally to the backseat. Ride is smooth and controlled without being too cushy. Road noise and engine sound are never far away, but neither is obnoxious enough to be distracting.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: We're a big fan of most of the controls and how they work. But the audio system keeps this from being an A. The touchscreen volume and tune tap/slide controls are annoying and the mode-swap touch areas are distractingly tiny and easy to miss.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Impressive interior space, and the greatly-enlarged backseat is now habitable on long road trips. Ideally-shaped trunk maximizes the available cargo capacity. Logical and easy to use interior control layout is marred by terrible touch-sensitive audio volume and tuning controls.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Easy entry up front is aided by long coupe doors, and the roof isn't so low you must duck. Rear seat access is best through passenger/curb side because of foot-operated seat exit release on that side.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Impressive interior space, and the greatly-enlarged backseat is now habitable on long road trips. Ideally-shaped trunk maximizes the available cargo capacity. Logical and easy to use interior control layout is marred by terrible touch-sensitive audio volume and tuning controls.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Generous leg and headroom up front, but even the backseat can comfortably seat full-grown adults up to six feet tall. With five inches more rear legroom than the outgoing Civic Coupe, this one is actually on par with last year's sedan.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Impressive interior space, and the greatly-enlarged backseat is now habitable on long road trips. Ideally-shaped trunk maximizes the available cargo capacity. Logical and easy to use interior control layout is marred by terrible touch-sensitive audio volume and tuning controls.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Good view out the front and sides, and the mirrors are nice and big. Honda lane-watch right-side camera system totally eliminates the blind spot. Standard back-up camera fills in what you can't see through the decent-sized rear window.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Impressive interior space, and the greatly-enlarged backseat is now habitable on long road trips. Ideally-shaped trunk maximizes the available cargo capacity. Logical and easy to use interior control layout is marred by terrible touch-sensitive audio volume and tuning controls.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Surprisingly accommodating 11.9-cubic foot trunk is easy to load through a generous opening. Split 60/40 rear seats fold down via remote release handles to open up even more room. Clever center console box, good-sized door pockets.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Impressive interior space, and the greatly-enlarged backseat is now habitable on long road trips. Ideally-shaped trunk maximizes the available cargo capacity. Logical and easy to use interior control layout is marred by terrible touch-sensitive audio volume and tuning controls.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Impressive interior materials make it hard to believe this is a Civic, a compact-class car and one of the lower-rung models in Honda's lineup. Admirable exterior panel alignment and paint quality also represent good value-for-money.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot for your compact-class money here as it's exceedingly well built from nice-looking materials. Honda's no-option grade strategy removes the guesswork from choosing which one to buy, and the spunky and desireable 1.5-liter engine also happens to be the thriftiest choice.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Base 2.0-liter manual is $19,985 with destination included. Lowest-priced 1.5-liter turbo is the EX-T at $23,135, with the leather-clad EX-L version at $24,260. A lot of car for the money. Touring with class-exclusive driver aids costs $26,960.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot for your compact-class money here as it's exceedingly well built from nice-looking materials. Honda's no-option grade strategy removes the guesswork from choosing which one to buy, and the spunky and desireable 1.5-liter engine also happens to be the thriftiest choice.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Stout 1.5-liter turbo engine is also the thriftier option, offering a remarkable 35 mpg combined (31 city/41 highway), which easily tops the competition. We averaged 34.3 mpg on our evaluation loop and achieved 40.5 mpg on a highway run.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot for your compact-class money here as it's exceedingly well built from nice-looking materials. Honda's no-option grade strategy removes the guesswork from choosing which one to buy, and the spunky and desireable 1.5-liter engine also happens to be the thriftiest choice.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Basic warranty is 3 years/36,000 miles and powertrain coverage lasts for 5 years/60,000 miles. Average for the segment. Only Hyundai and Kia offer significantly more.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot for your compact-class money here as it's exceedingly well built from nice-looking materials. Honda's no-option grade strategy removes the guesswork from choosing which one to buy, and the spunky and desireable 1.5-liter engine also happens to be the thriftiest choice.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Roadside assistance lasts for 3 years/36,000 miles. No free scheduled maintenance, but only Toyota offers that in this segment. Civics have traditionally been exceptionally reliable, and this one promises to continue that tradition.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot for your compact-class money here as it's exceedingly well built from nice-looking materials. Honda's no-option grade strategy removes the guesswork from choosing which one to buy, and the spunky and desireable 1.5-liter engine also happens to be the thriftiest choice.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: For a low-priced mainstream compact, the new Civic Coupe is a poised and capable coupe that is both engaging and quick. It's also thrifty and accommodating.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: It's hard to find fault with the way this coupe steers and handles, and the 1.5-liter engine makes plenty of power and torque. The CVT automatic is expertly tuned and offers impressive smoothness. Want to shift it yourself? The 1.5T will be available with a 6-speed manual in the coming months.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: EX-L 2dr Coupe (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The new Civic sedan is quite a strong product in its own right, but this new Civic coupe keeps all that's good about that car and wraps it in a sporty-looking package with much better coupe proportions than the car it replaces.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: It's hard to find fault with the way this coupe steers and handles, and the 1.5-liter engine makes plenty of power and torque. The CVT automatic is expertly tuned and offers impressive smoothness. Want to shift it yourself? The 1.5T will be available with a 6-speed manual in the coming months.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Some may dislike the behavior of the gear-less CVT, but it contributes to a best-in-class (by a full second) 0-60 time of 6.7 seconds. Engine feels quick in real-world driving thanks to ample, consistent low-end power throughout rev range.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: New 1.5-liter turbo-4 (175 hp, 162 lb-ft) available or standard on all but base LX trim is unusual in its sound and power delivery for a Honda engine, but it delivers best-in-class power and fuel economy. Worth the extra money. Other performance elements top notch.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The days of underpowered, quickly fading Honda brakes seems to be over. Best emergency stop from 60 mph in a short 117 feet. Subsequent stops in low 120 range. Firm, easily modulated and confidence-inspiring pedal.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: New 1.5-liter turbo-4 (175 hp, 162 lb-ft) available or standard on all but base LX trim is unusual in its sound and power delivery for a Honda engine, but it delivers best-in-class power and fuel economy. Worth the extra money. Other performance elements top notch.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: There's less feel and feedback here than with past Honda steering, but by current class standards, it is very good. Precise with spot-on, consistent weighting. Feels natural. Only Mazda 3 is clearly better.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: New 1.5-liter turbo-4 (175 hp, 162 lb-ft) available or standard on all but base LX trim is unusual in its sound and power delivery for a Honda engine, but it delivers best-in-class power and fuel economy. Worth the extra money. Other performance elements top notch.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Body roll is controlled and left-right transitions are handled nicely. It feels playful and there's lots of freedom and control for the driver -- its well-tuned stability system doesn't quash the fun. Grippier tires would make it even better.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: New 1.5-liter turbo-4 (175 hp, 162 lb-ft) available or standard on all but base LX trim is unusual in its sound and power delivery for a Honda engine, but it delivers best-in-class power and fuel economy. Worth the extra money. Other performance elements top notch.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: CVT simulates gears only in foot-to-floor acceleration (didn't feel it otherwise) and its Sport mode could hold revs better up/down hill. Honda Sensing's collision warning system is hyperactive, adaptive cruise control is irritating. Otherwise easy to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: New 1.5-liter turbo-4 (175 hp, 162 lb-ft) available or standard on all but base LX trim is unusual in its sound and power delivery for a Honda engine, but it delivers best-in-class power and fuel economy. Worth the extra money. Other performance elements top notch.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Available eight-way power driver seat offers huge range of motion, making it very comfortable for a wide range of driver heights. We're not sure about manual seats. Leather seats are firm, hold you in place well, good over distance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Previous Civics were known for their loud cabins, firm rides and less-than-friendly seats for tall folks. This changes for the 2016 Civic, which suddenly feels like a shrunken Accord. Contributes to the Civic being more well-rounded and as well-suited to long trips as short ones.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Like a German car, you feel every road imperfection, but impacts are very well damped. Big undulations, especially mid-corner, are handled with impeccable control. Not one iota of float. Feels like a bigger, more refined car.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Previous Civics were known for their loud cabins, firm rides and less-than-friendly seats for tall folks. This changes for the 2016 Civic, which suddenly feels like a shrunken Accord. Contributes to the Civic being more well-rounded and as well-suited to long trips as short ones.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The turbocharged engine has a very un-Honda-like growl to it and the CVT causes a light drone when accelerating. Otherwise, wind and road noise are kept in check far better than the overly loud Hondas of the not-so-distant past.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Previous Civics were known for their loud cabins, firm rides and less-than-friendly seats for tall folks. This changes for the 2016 Civic, which suddenly feels like a shrunken Accord. Contributes to the Civic being more well-rounded and as well-suited to long trips as short ones.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The 7-inch touchscreen on most trims is easily reached (as all controls are) but can be maddening. Confusing menus, too-small buttons, slow response times. Transition between Apple/Android controls and Honda system is convoluted.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Honda's touchscreen interface can be annoying to use and those of most competitors are better. Beyond that, the 2016 Civic delivers a large, versatile cabin for both people and their things. The front center console design is extremely clever.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The rear doors are wide and open wide, making it easy to climb in -- or install a child seat. More of a sloped roof than before, so be mindful of your head. No issues up front. All doors very light.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Honda's touchscreen interface can be annoying to use and those of most competitors are better. Beyond that, the 2016 Civic delivers a large, versatile cabin for both people and their things. The front center console design is extremely clever.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Large back seat. A 6-foot-3 rear passenger sat behind a like-heighted driver with sufficient leg and headroom. Available eight-way power driver seat aides front seat room tremendously. Plenty of headroom in front even with sunroof.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Honda's touchscreen interface can be annoying to use and those of most competitors are better. Beyond that, the 2016 Civic delivers a large, versatile cabin for both people and their things. The front center console design is extremely clever.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Less boxy than before and downward roof slant reduces rear quarter views slightly. Still a great view ahead with thin pillars. Big mirrors and standard rearview camera. Debateable usefulness of LaneWatch blind spot camera on all but base LX.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Honda's touchscreen interface can be annoying to use and those of most competitors are better. Beyond that, the 2016 Civic delivers a large, versatile cabin for both people and their things. The front center console design is extremely clever.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: 15.1-cu-ft. trunk is very wide and deep. Opening is wide too, but not tall -- not ideal for bulky items. Clever, multi-level and configurable center console has moveable cupholders (sadly not anti-tip) and a smartly designed area for smartphones.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Honda's touchscreen interface can be annoying to use and those of most competitors are better. Beyond that, the 2016 Civic delivers a large, versatile cabin for both people and their things. The front center console design is extremely clever.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: This is a Honda Civic? $27,335 Touring trim actually looks/feels more expensive and challenges Acura quality. All trims have top-notch materials everywhere (plus cloth or stitched sim leather on center console) and typically tight Honda construction.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Apart from an unremarkable warranty, what's not to like here? For a competitive price, you get expected equipment plus build quality, fuel economy, performance and space that's superior to most competitors. Plus, we can't ignore the Civic's excellent reliability history.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Like most rivals, even a base trim includes ample equipment (auto climate control, all the entertainment choices you'd want). Value gets better in higher trim levels. High-tech safety systems uniquely available on most trims.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Apart from an unremarkable warranty, what's not to like here? For a competitive price, you get expected equipment plus build quality, fuel economy, performance and space that's superior to most competitors. Plus, we can't ignore the Civic's excellent reliability history.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Base Civic with CVT ($20,275) pricier than many like-equipped rivals (Mazda 3 is $1,400 less, Toyota Corolla is $775 less), but is less expensive than Mazda 3 and VW Jetta when equally loaded. Its general superiority in most areas warrants any premium.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Apart from an unremarkable warranty, what's not to like here? For a competitive price, you get expected equipment plus build quality, fuel economy, performance and space that's superior to most competitors. Plus, we can't ignore the Civic's excellent reliability history.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: EPA estimate is 35 mpg combined with either base engine or 1.5-liter turbo. That's best in class as of this writing (Mazda 3i is close). We achieved excellent 36.8 mpg with the turbo on our evaluation route. Fantastic given best-in-class acceleration.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Apart from an unremarkable warranty, what's not to like here? For a competitive price, you get expected equipment plus build quality, fuel economy, performance and space that's superior to most competitors. Plus, we can't ignore the Civic's excellent reliability history.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: 3-year/36,000-mile limited warranty and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage. This is typical for the segment. Only Hyundai and Kia offer more -- but significantly so.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Apart from an unremarkable warranty, what's not to like here? For a competitive price, you get expected equipment plus build quality, fuel economy, performance and space that's superior to most competitors. Plus, we can't ignore the Civic's excellent reliability history.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Standard roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles. This is also typical for the segment. No free scheduled maintenance, but then, only Toyota offers that. The Civic has been one of the most reliable cars on the road.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Apart from an unremarkable warranty, what's not to like here? For a competitive price, you get expected equipment plus build quality, fuel economy, performance and space that's superior to most competitors. Plus, we can't ignore the Civic's excellent reliability history.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: Want to lazily accelerate and putter about town? The Civic will do that with the utmost refinement. Want to zip through a back road and have some fun behind the wheel? It'll do that too. It's a jack of both trades.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CVT's behavior and resulting noises do sap some of the fun out of the Civic, but it's hard to argue with the acceleration (or better-than-expected handling). It's not quite as engaging to drive as a Mazda 3 or Ford Focus, nor as refined as a VW Golf, but it's close on both fronts.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Civic
style.name: Touring 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl Turbo CVT)
summary: The Civic no longer gives off the impression of simply being sensible, dependable transportation. Its unique style, high-class cabin and ample driving verve (especially in Touring trim) provide more than is expected in this class.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CVT's behavior and resulting noises do sap some of the fun out of the Civic, but it's hard to argue with the acceleration (or better-than-expected handling). It's not quite as engaging to drive as a Mazda 3 or Ford Focus, nor as refined as a VW Golf, but it's close on both fronts.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Modestly powered, expect 9-10 seconds to reach 60 mph with the all-wheel-drive model. With a simple PRNDL shifter, there are no options (paddles or otherwise) for manual-shifting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Our testing of many CR-Vs over the years often has revealed merely adequate brakes. The tradition continues.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Light and precise steering matches the demeanor of the CR-V. It has a good sense of straight ahead, too.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Offers slightly more athleticism than some compact SUVs, and it doesn't go all soggy with a full load. Keeps its poise on dirt roads, as well.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The 5-speed automatic holds the CR-V back more than anything else. It makes the 4-banger work that much harder, and gear hunting can occur on uphill grades, especially when loaded.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Rated at just 1,500 pounds, towing is not the CR-V's strong suit.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Towing

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Available all-wheel drive is intended for light off-road duty and weather-fouled roads. For that it works well, and the unpainted lower body surfaces hide scuffs and scratches.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Overall, good seat comfort and adjustability: ample headroom, shoulder room is slightly tight, but legroom is especially generous for the rear seats.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although it doesn't pamper per se, the CR-V is a comfortable vehicle for four, a little tight for five. Some might complain of road noise on long highway trips.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The CR-V is for those who prefer control and poise over outright softness. Mostly the ride is well-mannered and composed, but certain choppy-road surfaces can telegraph through.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although it doesn't pamper per se, the CR-V is a comfortable vehicle for four, a little tight for five. Some might complain of road noise on long highway trips.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The ongoing complaint that the CR-V was not quiet has been improved with this latest redesign. But a bit too much tire noise still finds its way into the cabin.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although it doesn't pamper per se, the CR-V is a comfortable vehicle for four, a little tight for five. Some might complain of road noise on long highway trips.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: If there's one thing the CR-V EX nailed, it's ergonomics: deep center console with roll-top lid, dual-zone climate control, rear-seat release lever from the cargo area, and so on.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Getting in and out of the CR-V is easy with large front doors, reasonably low seat height, and rear doors that swing open nearly 90 degrees.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The CR-V has always been known for an open/airy cabin. While it lost its "open floor plan" in the redesign, it still offers one of the roomiest cabins for a compact SUV.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: With its available rearview camera, parking chores are made easier and the D-pillar blind spots mitigated. No parking sensors or blind-spot monitor available.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: There are larger cargo capacities in its class, but not many and the CR-V's 37 cu-ft nominal and 71 cu-ft max is at the top of the range. We managed to transport an 8-foot table.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Tight seams, even gaps, and not a single interior trim piece out of place. The quality of the CR-V is one of its strong points and for the money, hard to beat.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Features have been steadily added to the CR-V's portfolio, but connectivity isn't leading-edge and our Bluetooth connection was sometimes finicky.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: priced between $22K-$27K, the CR-V is moving farther away from the entry-level status it once enjoyed. Still, what you get works, and retained value is strong.
ratings.title: Value

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Rated by the EPA at 26 mpg combined (25 for the AWD), the CR-V performs well in its class. But a 6-speed automatic might have done better.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: With just a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, there are many other choices with better coverage.

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Edmunds actually owned a 2012 CR-V EX-L Navi for a year. Other than some quibbles with Bluetooth and nav operations, we loved it and continue to recommend it without hesitation.
ratings.title: Value

title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Driving the CR-V is far from a taxing or frustrating experience. Once in a while, we wish for more power or a smarter transmission with more gears, but it always gets the job done.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CR-V was once and standout "run-about" in this burgeoning compact SUV class, but now that there are so many from which to choose, the fun-to-drive experience has been applied more broadly throughout the segment.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Overall it's perky and pleasant and larger on the inside than you might imagine. It's sort of the perfect urban compact SUV that can visit the ski slopes if it needs to.
