ratings.summary: With modest gains in output and efficiency for 2012, the CR-V continues on with a lone 4-cylinder engine and 5-speed automatic transmission. It's not particularly quick, but handling is solid and it delivers mpg near the top of its class.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Overall, good seat comfort and adjustability: ample headroom, shoulder room is slightly tight, but legroom is especially generous for the rear seats.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although it doesn't pamper per se, the CR-V is a comfortable vehicle for four, a little tight for five. Some might complain of road noise on long highway trips.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The CR-V is for those who prefer control and poise over outright softness. Mostly the ride is well-mannered and composed, but certain choppy-road surfaces can telegraph through.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although it doesn't pamper per se, the CR-V is a comfortable vehicle for four, a little tight for five. Some might complain of road noise on long highway trips.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The ongoing complaint that the CR-V was not quiet has been improved with this latest redesign. But a bit too much tire noise still finds its way into the cabin.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Although it doesn't pamper per se, the CR-V is a comfortable vehicle for four, a little tight for five. Some might complain of road noise on long highway trips.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: If there's one thing the CR-V EX nailed, it's ergonomics: deep center console with roll-top lid, dual-zone climate control, rear-seat release lever from the cargo area, and so on.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Getting in and out of the CR-V is easy with large front doors, reasonably low seat height, and rear doors that swing open nearly 90 degrees.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: The CR-V has always been known for an open/airy cabin. While it lost its "open floor plan" in the redesign, it still offers one of the roomiest cabins for a compact SUV.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: With its available rearview camera, parking chores are made easier and the D-pillar blind spots mitigated. No parking sensors or blind-spot monitor available.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: There are larger cargo capacities in its class, but not many and the CR-V's 37 cu-ft nominal and 71 cu-ft max is at the top of the range. We managed to transport an 8-foot table.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A redesigned interior did not sacrifice the CR-V's historically good design, ample space, or comfort to add frivolous function. It retains sound ergonomics but is now available with, among other new features, Bluetooth and rear-seat DVD.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Tight seams, even gaps, and not a single interior trim piece out of place. The quality of the CR-V is one of its strong points and for the money, hard to beat.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Features have been steadily added to the CR-V's portfolio, but connectivity isn't leading-edge and our Bluetooth connection was sometimes finicky.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: priced between $22K-$27K, the CR-V is moving farther away from the entry-level status it once enjoyed. Still, what you get works, and retained value is strong.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Rated by the EPA at 25 mpg combined (26 for the AWD), the CR-V performs well in its class. But a 6-speed automatic might have done better.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: With just a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, there are many other choices with better coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Edmunds actually owned a 2012 CR-V EX-L Navi for a year. Other than some quibbles with Bluetooth and nav operations, we loved it and continue to recommend it without hesitation.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CR-V is a good value. Build quality, price, features are strong. MPG is among is near the top of its class, and we've been able to match the window sticker estimates in the real world. Too bad the warranty is only so-so.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Driving the CR-V is far from a taxing or frustrating experience. Once in a while, we wish for more power or a smarter transmission with more gears, but it always gets the job done.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CR-V was once and standout "run-about" in this burgeoning compact SUV class, but now that there are so many from which to choose, the fun-to-drive experience has been applied more broadly throughout the segment.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: EX-L 4dr SUV AWD w/Navigation (2.4L 4cyl 5A)
summary: Overall it's perky and pleasant and larger on the inside than you might imagine. It's sort of the perfect urban compact SUV that can visit the ski slopes if it needs to.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CR-V was once and standout "run-about" in this burgeoning compact SUV class, but now that there are so many from which to choose, the fun-to-drive experience has been applied more broadly throughout the segment.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: All CR-Vs come with a 2.4-liter four-cylinder with 185 horsepower and a continuously variable transmission (CVT). As such, it's no speed demon, getting to 60 mph in a mid-pack 8.8 seconds. There's just enough power for most situations.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The brake pedal delivers a spongy feel most of the time, but it's easy to modulate for lurch-free stopping. We stopped in 119 feet from 60 mph in our panic-brake test, better than most rivals, though we did experience some pedal fade.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Not exactly precise or sharp, as it exhibits some of the syrupy feel electric-assist systems are known for. But there's a natural amount of effort required to turn the steering wheel. Easy around parking lots, firmer out on the road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Considerable body roll/lean through turns, but it's a totally manageable amount and the CR-V delivers a friendly and forgiving handling feel. It also shows a keen ability to keep the tires in contact with the pavement on rough roads.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Super easy to live with. Gas pedal, brakes and steering operate fluidly. CVT is one of the best out there, rarely hanging the revs up high. Adaptive cruise control can be erratic when following cars, and can overshoot set speed by 5 mph.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CR-V is rated to tow up to 1,500 pounds, which is equal to the Toyota RAV4 and Subaru Forester. The Hyundai Santa Fe Sport is rated at 1,650 pounds, the Mazda CX-5 at 2,000 pounds and the Ford Escape as much as 3,500.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Towing

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: All-wheel drive (tested here) is optional, but it's not so much for off-roading as it is for rainy/snowy road conditions. Light off-roading and rough dirt roads are about as much as the CR-V can handle, as with most in the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CR-V is mid-pack in nearly every performance category, but more importantly, it's never at or near the bottom. Handling improves versus competitors when the road gets bumpy, while driveability with the new CVT is superb. Unlike some competitors, though, there is no engine upgrade.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Front seats are wide and flat with soft cushions yet plenty of lower back support. Padded armrests keep elbows happy. Rear seatbacks are two-position reclining, excellent padding. Center seat is hard but could be passable for short trips.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a CR-V strong suit, whether you're talking seats, ride quality or interior cabin noise. The CR-V is simply a fuss-free vehicle for running errands around town or hitting the open road with the family.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A comfy-riding car, soaks up pretty much everything you throw at it, then asks for more. Can take 15-mph speed bumps at 30 mph without any wheel hop or loud suspension "crashing" noises.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a CR-V strong suit, whether you're talking seats, ride quality or interior cabin noise. The CR-V is simply a fuss-free vehicle for running errands around town or hitting the open road with the family.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Nice and quiet. Helps that the CVT doesn't wind the revs out often, but even when it does the engine isn't too loud. Only real wind noise came from the top of the windshield. Tires, despite looking off-roady, were for the most part quiet.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a CR-V strong suit, whether you're talking seats, ride quality or interior cabin noise. The CR-V is simply a fuss-free vehicle for running errands around town or hitting the open road with the family.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Controls make sense, are in the proper location and have a quality feel. Touchscreen (EX trim and above) icons are large, but there can be excessive menu hopping required and adjacent physical buttons are small and require a firm press.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is superbly engineered. Thanks to excellent interior and passenger room for the class, as well as easy-folding rear seats, the CR-V is a cinch to use. It's easier to see out of than most competitors, too. Any quibbles are so minor they're barely worth mentioning.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Large front doors open quite wide, and both step-in and seat height are near-perfect. Tall roof helps. High-perched rear seat means you have to duck more to avoid roof than up front, but also less bending to install car seats and kids.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is superbly engineered. Thanks to excellent interior and passenger room for the class, as well as easy-folding rear seats, the CR-V is a cinch to use. It's easier to see out of than most competitors, too. Any quibbles are so minor they're barely worth mentioning.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Despite high rear seat, head, leg and knee room are all good for a vehicle this size, as is space for a child seat. Wide, spacious front cabin, but tall drivers may want to opt for power driver seat and its greater adjustability.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is superbly engineered. Thanks to excellent interior and passenger room for the class, as well as easy-folding rear seats, the CR-V is a cinch to use. It's easier to see out of than most competitors, too. Any quibbles are so minor they're barely worth mentioning.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Slim pillars make for easy outward viewing. Only rearmost pillars are overly thick. Plenty of tall windows, side mirrors are also fairly large. Every CR-V has a rearview camera, EX and above get a larger screen.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is superbly engineered. Thanks to excellent interior and passenger room for the class, as well as easy-folding rear seats, the CR-V is a cinch to use. It's easier to see out of than most competitors, too. Any quibbles are so minor they're barely worth mentioning.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: One of the most cargo-friendly compact SUVs with the seats up or lowered flat by the handy one-pull mechanism. A very low load floor and boxy shape are good for dogs, too. Lots of small item storage up front, but not as good as past CR-Vs.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior is superbly engineered. Thanks to excellent interior and passenger room for the class, as well as easy-folding rear seats, the CR-V is a cinch to use. It's easier to see out of than most competitors, too. Any quibbles are so minor they're barely worth mentioning.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CR-V skimps on soft-touch materials, for instance the dash and window sills are hard, but everywhere else the cabin feels solidly constructed. The steering did make a strange rattling noise when turning while negotiating bumps at low speed.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Although the CR-V's warranty isn't award-winning, Honda now finally includes standard roadside assistance. The CR-V's interior is well constructed and there's an ample amount of luxury and tech features for the money. Fuel economy is excellent for the segment.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Base LX comes with a rearview camera, Bluetooth, iPod control and Pandora radio. Navigation only available on top EX-L and Touring trims. Latter also includes adaptive cruise, a power liftgate, forward collision and lane-departure warning.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Although the CR-V's warranty isn't award-winning, Honda now finally includes standard roadside assistance. The CR-V's interior is well constructed and there's an ample amount of luxury and tech features for the money. Fuel economy is excellent for the segment.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The base price starts lower than many (but not all) competitors, especially if you compare AWD models. Subaru Forester is by far the cheapest AWD rival, but the CR-V has a nicer, more thoughtful cabin and a superior standard powertrain.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Although the CR-V's warranty isn't award-winning, Honda now finally includes standard roadside assistance. The CR-V's interior is well constructed and there's an ample amount of luxury and tech features for the money. Fuel economy is excellent for the segment.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CR-V AWD gets an EPA-rated 28 mpg Combined (26 City/33 Highway), which is better than AWD versions of the Toyota RAV4, Ford Escape, Mazda CX-5 and Jeep Cherokee. We averaged 27.8 mpg on our evaluation loop and 25.5 mpg overall.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Although the CR-V's warranty isn't award-winning, Honda now finally includes standard roadside assistance. The CR-V's interior is well constructed and there's an ample amount of luxury and tech features for the money. Fuel economy is excellent for the segment.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CR-V's basic warranty lasts for 3 years/36,000 miles, drivetrain for 5 years/60,000 miles. That's equal to most rivals, with the Ford Escape offering longer drivetrain mileage and the Hyundai Santa Fe Sport offering longer everything.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Although the CR-V's warranty isn't award-winning, Honda now finally includes standard roadside assistance. The CR-V's interior is well constructed and there's an ample amount of luxury and tech features for the money. Fuel economy is excellent for the segment.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: For 2015 Honda finally added standard roadside assistance on all models for 3 years/36,000 miles, which is about average for the class. Honda, like most rivals, doesn't offer free maintenance, though Toyota does for 2 years/25,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Although the CR-V's warranty isn't award-winning, Honda now finally includes standard roadside assistance. The CR-V's interior is well constructed and there's an ample amount of luxury and tech features for the money. Fuel economy is excellent for the segment.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CR-V does so many things well. It's easy to drive, comfortable, quiet and has reasonably willing handling. We're also happy to report the new CVT doesn't ruin the driving experience. Is it fun? No, but for most, that won't matter.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Some competitors, like the Mazda CX-5 and Ford Escape, are more fun-to-drive in the traditional sense, while the Jeep Cherokee has more visual panache. Many offer a more powerful engine.  The CR-V isn't a "driver's machine" nor is it something to impress your friends.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: CR-V
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.4L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CR-V has never had a whole lot of personality, and that remains the case. We respect its well-designed interior and the nifty way the rear seats fold down in a one-touch/multi-movement action. It's also a pretty rugged vehicle.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Some competitors, like the Mazda CX-5 and Ford Escape, are more fun-to-drive in the traditional sense, while the Jeep Cherokee has more visual panache. Many offer a more powerful engine.  The CR-V isn't a "driver's machine" nor is it something to impress your friends.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Nobody's going to call the Fit "quick," although its 0-60 mph time of 8.9 sec. isn't exactly slow. It's happy to rev and the 5-speed manual transmission is slick. Noticeably less pep on the freeway due to the big rev drop from 4th-5th.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit is tossable with quick handling reflexes, even if its absolute limits are low. Steering and throttle behavior could benefit from a trip to finishing school. Even though its 1.5-liter 4-cylinder engine only makes 117 horsepower, the Fit's low weight makes it a nippy commuter.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Good modulation around town, easy to place the car during routine braking maneuvers. Panic-brake characteristics and fade resistance, as with most Hondas, could be better. The 60-0 panic-stop distance of 131 feet is rather long.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit is tossable with quick handling reflexes, even if its absolute limits are low. Steering and throttle behavior could benefit from a trip to finishing school. Even though its 1.5-liter 4-cylinder engine only makes 117 horsepower, the Fit's low weight makes it a nippy commuter.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Though quick and precise, the Fit's steering requires constant corrections around center in freeway driving. This nonlinear response is irritating, making the Fit feel unstable. It feels like old-school electric assist...because it is.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit is tossable with quick handling reflexes, even if its absolute limits are low. Steering and throttle behavior could benefit from a trip to finishing school. Even though its 1.5-liter 4-cylinder engine only makes 117 horsepower, the Fit's low weight makes it a nippy commuter.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Nimble and tossable, even if its limits aren't all that high. The Fit is quick on its feet when it comes to changing directions, making it fun to snake it around the cones on our slalom course.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit is tossable with quick handling reflexes, even if its absolute limits are low. Steering and throttle behavior could benefit from a trip to finishing school. Even though its 1.5-liter 4-cylinder engine only makes 117 horsepower, the Fit's low weight makes it a nippy commuter.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Sluggish throttle response and limited torque mar the Fit's driveability. Otherwise its tidy dimensions and outstanding visibility pay dividends in being able to place the car. The manual transmission's clutch takeup is intuitive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit is tossable with quick handling reflexes, even if its absolute limits are low. Steering and throttle behavior could benefit from a trip to finishing school. Even though its 1.5-liter 4-cylinder engine only makes 117 horsepower, the Fit's low weight makes it a nippy commuter.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Seat comfort is very good, with bolsters that land in all the right places for long-trip comfort. The driver has a high seating position, as if you're sitting on something else. You are: The fuel tank is below the front seats.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Great seats and a ride quality that never beats you up. It does feel a bit thin when it comes to isolation from road noise, however.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Honda has managed to finesse an agreeable ride quality out of the Fit's relatively basic suspension underpinnings. It avoids choppiness, and the rear axle does a good job of masking its humble twist-beam origins even on bad pavement.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Great seats and a ride quality that never beats you up. It does feel a bit thin when it comes to isolation from road noise, however.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Plenty of road noise finds its way into the cabin. This is one area where you're reminded of the Fit's price point. Its competition is generally better in this regard.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Great seats and a ride quality that never beats you up. It does feel a bit thin when it comes to isolation from road noise, however.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Outstanding access to cabin controls, and their locations make total sense. This is low-effort car. The control efforts are light and everything is simple and where you expect it to be.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fit nails the fundamentals of packaging. For a small car there is a surprising amount of useful space, from bins and nooks to the flexibility of its backseat and cargo area. Its outward visibility is a breath of fresh air, thanks to its low cowl and expansive glass area.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Large front door apertures and a low step-in height faciltate entry. The seats aren't very low, so it's only a short drop into the cabin. Rear seat access isn't quite as easy, but it still isn't bad.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fit nails the fundamentals of packaging. For a small car there is a surprising amount of useful space, from bins and nooks to the flexibility of its backseat and cargo area. Its outward visibility is a breath of fresh air, thanks to its low cowl and expansive glass area.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: For a subcompact car the Fit boasts miraculous space. Its command of packaging has the measure of the segment, with lots of head and leg room room up front. The rear seat can fit two adults in reasonable comfort for short trips.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fit nails the fundamentals of packaging. For a small car there is a surprising amount of useful space, from bins and nooks to the flexibility of its backseat and cargo area. Its outward visibility is a breath of fresh air, thanks to its low cowl and expansive glass area.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Huge windshield, a low beltline and a low cowl imbue the Fit with a panoramic outward view.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fit nails the fundamentals of packaging. For a small car there is a surprising amount of useful space, from bins and nooks to the flexibility of its backseat and cargo area. Its outward visibility is a breath of fresh air, thanks to its low cowl and expansive glass area.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Nothing in the Fit's class can touch the size and configurability of its cargo area. The rear seatback folds flat or the bottom cushion can swing. There's 20.3 cubic-feet behind the seats, a whopping 57.3 cu-ft with rear seats folded.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Fit nails the fundamentals of packaging. For a small car there is a surprising amount of useful space, from bins and nooks to the flexibility of its backseat and cargo area. Its outward visibility is a breath of fresh air, thanks to its low cowl and expansive glass area.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The cabin interfaces and appointments are substantial-feeling, and the panel gaps appear tight and consistent.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's not the star fuel sipper, nor does it offer all the features of its competition. Instead the Fit relies heavily on functionality, most specifically the size of its cargo area and the ingenious folding backseat that allows a level of versatility otherwise absent in this class.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Notable items missing from the options list are a backup camera and sunroof. However, the Fit's fundamental feature is the cleverness of its packaging, which is something you won't find on an options list.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's not the star fuel sipper, nor does it offer all the features of its competition. Instead the Fit relies heavily on functionality, most specifically the size of its cargo area and the ingenious folding backseat that allows a level of versatility otherwise absent in this class.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Competitively priced in its class. It's not the barest-bottom price tag in the segment, but for the utility it offers there is little that can touch it. Our Fit Sport tester had zero options with an as-tested price of $17,950.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's not the star fuel sipper, nor does it offer all the features of its competition. Instead the Fit relies heavily on functionality, most specifically the size of its cargo area and the ingenious folding backseat that allows a level of versatility otherwise absent in this class.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: With EPA ratings of 29 mpg Combined (27 City/33 Highway), the Fit's fuel economy doesn't stand out in its class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's not the star fuel sipper, nor does it offer all the features of its competition. Instead the Fit relies heavily on functionality, most specifically the size of its cargo area and the ingenious folding backseat that allows a level of versatility otherwise absent in this class.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fit's 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties are typical for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's not the star fuel sipper, nor does it offer all the features of its competition. Instead the Fit relies heavily on functionality, most specifically the size of its cargo area and the ingenious folding backseat that allows a level of versatility otherwise absent in this class.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The 2013 Fit has neither standard roadside assistance nor any kind of free maintenance program.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's not the star fuel sipper, nor does it offer all the features of its competition. Instead the Fit relies heavily on functionality, most specifically the size of its cargo area and the ingenious folding backseat that allows a level of versatility otherwise absent in this class.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Light, nimble and whippy, the Fit is a user-friendly car. All of the controls are effortless and precise, from the steering to the gearchange to the clutch.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't a star performer, but it's so easy to drive and see out of that you can place it with the utmost confidence. It's spry and spunky, encouraging drivers to use every bit of available power and grip.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: Sport 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Fit's eagerness to help you with virtually any task makes it a standout in the class. It's so incredibly versatile, yet it carries a compact footprint. It's a must-shop choice in the segment.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't a star performer, but it's so easy to drive and see out of that you can place it with the utmost confidence. It's spry and spunky, encouraging drivers to use every bit of available power and grip.
title: Personality

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Around town the 130 horsepower from the Fit's 1.5-liter 4-cylinder feels adequate. There's never a whole bunch of thrust. The continuously variable transmission (CVT) has somewhat slow responses, but the Fit did get to 60 mph in 8.8 sec.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't overly quick to accelerate, but it is nimble and tossable. It's far more stable at freeway speeds than the previous Fit. Though by no means what we would call a "hot hatch," the Fit is responsive and an easy car to live with on a daily basis.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Brake pedal action is reasonably firm and progressive in around-town driving, easy to modulate. It stopped from 60 mph in 127 feet, which is about average for the segment, with just a bit of side-to-side squirm.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't overly quick to accelerate, but it is nimble and tossable. It's far more stable at freeway speeds than the previous Fit. Though by no means what we would call a "hot hatch," the Fit is responsive and an easy car to live with on a daily basis.
title: Braking

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Far more linear action than the previous generation, and the odd feel of the old car's steering on freeways is nearly gone. It's still a bit numb and light, but it builds effort naturally.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't overly quick to accelerate, but it is nimble and tossable. It's far more stable at freeway speeds than the previous Fit. Though by no means what we would call a "hot hatch," the Fit is responsive and an easy car to live with on a daily basis.
title: Steering

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Nimble and light on its feet. Changes direction quickly, although the limits are not high. Still, the Fit has always been a nippy thing and the new one is no exception. More stable at freeway speeds than the old car.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't overly quick to accelerate, but it is nimble and tossable. It's far more stable at freeway speeds than the previous Fit. Though by no means what we would call a "hot hatch," the Fit is responsive and an easy car to live with on a daily basis.
title: Handling

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The lightness of the all the controls makes the Fit easy to place. The CVT is unobtrusive in day-to-day driving. Parking is dead-simple thanks to tiny overhangs and a standard backup camera.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Fit isn't overly quick to accelerate, but it is nimble and tossable. It's far more stable at freeway speeds than the previous Fit. Though by no means what we would call a "hot hatch," the Fit is responsive and an easy car to live with on a daily basis.
title: Driveability

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Seats are wide and allow plenty of leg movement. Bolsters are moderate, touching down at the ribs to provide good lateral support. Lower cushion is nearly horizontal but with little thigh support. The height adjustment is nice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good seats and decent ride quality. Honda has done a nice job with the Fit's simple suspension setup and short wheelbase. Feels more substantial than the outgoing Fit.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Although the Fit moves about a fair amount, the ride quality somehow doesn't feel too busy or fidgety. It's appropriately compliant and is comfortable enough for long road trips.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good seats and decent ride quality. Honda has done a nice job with the Fit's simple suspension setup and short wheelbase. Feels more substantial than the outgoing Fit.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The cabin feels about average in terms of wind and road noise. Neither are excessive, but they're there. Engine noise is not a factor when just cruising along, but it does drone at high revs.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good seats and decent ride quality. Honda has done a nice job with the Fit's simple suspension setup and short wheelbase. Feels more substantial than the outgoing Fit.
title: Quietness

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Fit's chunky temp knobs and cabin controls are well placed and easy to use. The optional multimedia interface is touchscreen-based. While sensitive, it lacks a volume knob, a small issue that will be an annoyance for many.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever packaging and ease of use are hallmarks of the Fit, and for this new model you can add backseat space to the list. This is a truly versatile cabin. Though luggage space behind the backseat has shrunk, the overall cargo space is still impressive.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Easy to get in and out. Wide door openings, sills are small and low to the ground. The flat seat bottom is located relatively high off the floor, aiding access. The roof is high, so you don't have to crane your neck to get in.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever packaging and ease of use are hallmarks of the Fit, and for this new model you can add backseat space to the list. This is a truly versatile cabin. Though luggage space behind the backseat has shrunk, the overall cargo space is still impressive.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: This is a small car with a shocking amount of space inside. Smart packaging. Backseat passengers have huge legroom and plenty of headroom. It's very airy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever packaging and ease of use are hallmarks of the Fit, and for this new model you can add backseat space to the list. This is a truly versatile cabin. Though luggage space behind the backseat has shrunk, the overall cargo space is still impressive.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Visibility is excellent, with a low beltline. Windshield pillar triangle windows and door-mounted side mirrors also help. A curved driver's mirror and camera on the passenger's mirror address blind spots. Backup camera is standard.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever packaging and ease of use are hallmarks of the Fit, and for this new model you can add backseat space to the list. This is a truly versatile cabin. Though luggage space behind the backseat has shrunk, the overall cargo space is still impressive.
title: Visibility

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Ingenious backseat allows for many loading options. The max cargo area is quite large, the rear seat folds nearly flat. Seat bottom flips up for tall, upright items. The Fit is unrivaled in its class here.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever packaging and ease of use are hallmarks of the Fit, and for this new model you can add backseat space to the list. This is a truly versatile cabin. Though luggage space behind the backseat has shrunk, the overall cargo space is still impressive.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There are some hard plastics, but the touch surfaces are generally soft. Controls have a slick action and there's no overriding sense that this is an inexpensive car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's a lot of car for the money here, and not just in terms of feature count. The Fit's inherent value is in its ability to be many cars in one, thanks to its versatile cabin. It also manages to deliver significantly better fuel economy than before.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A long features list on our test car ($21,590 with destination), a top-of-the-line trim level with navigation, keyless entry/ignition, leather, sunroof, heated seats and blind-spot camera. But even lesser trim levels are well equipped.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's a lot of car for the money here, and not just in terms of feature count. The Fit's inherent value is in its ability to be many cars in one, thanks to its versatile cabin. It also manages to deliver significantly better fuel economy than before.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Given the Fit's combination of packaging, fuel economy and features, it is attractively priced. Our test car is the most expensive version. The least expensive Fit starts at $16,315 with destination.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's a lot of car for the money here, and not just in terms of feature count. The Fit's inherent value is in its ability to be many cars in one, thanks to its versatile cabin. It also manages to deliver significantly better fuel economy than before.
title: Cost

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: An all-new engine and transmission have boosted the EPA ratings to 35 mpg Combined (32 City/38 Highway), better than most of its rivals. On our evaluation loop the Fit achieved 36.2 mpg. Overall it earned 29.9 mpg in its time with us.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's a lot of car for the money here, and not just in terms of feature count. The Fit's inherent value is in its ability to be many cars in one, thanks to its versatile cabin. It also manages to deliver significantly better fuel economy than before.
title: MPG

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Fit's warranty coverage is 3 years/36,000 miles bumper-to-bumper, 5 years/60,000 miles powertrain and 5 years/unlimited miles for corrosion. This is typical.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's a lot of car for the money here, and not just in terms of feature count. The Fit's inherent value is in its ability to be many cars in one, thanks to its versatile cabin. It also manages to deliver significantly better fuel economy than before.
title: Warranty

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Roadside assistance and free scheduled maintenance are not part of the deal. The lack of free scheduled maintenance is typical for the segment, but some rivals come with roadside assistance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's a lot of car for the money here, and not just in terms of feature count. The Fit's inherent value is in its ability to be many cars in one, thanks to its versatile cabin. It also manages to deliver significantly better fuel economy than before.
title: Ownership

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Control efforts are universally light and quick. Its overall limits are low, so the Fit is best when you drive it precisely. It's not a hot hatch, but its inherent lightness has rewards when driven enthusiastically.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fit feels less substantial than, say, a Mazda3, but it's whippy and eager nonetheless. It's an easy car to drive for nearly anyone, owing to its tidy dimensions and user-friendly controls. It's not fast, but it is responsive.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Honda
model.name: Fit
style.name: EX-L w/Navigation 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Fit is a car that's eager to please. Sure, its engine doesn't sound great when you drive it enthusiastically, but its handling is reasonably sharp and the car changes direction well. You can have fun with it at low speeds.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fit feels less substantial than, say, a Mazda3, but it's whippy and eager nonetheless. It's an easy car to drive for nearly anyone, owing to its tidy dimensions and user-friendly controls. It's not fast, but it is responsive.
