make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Proves the point that driving an economy car doesn't have to be boring and disconnected. The Mazda 3 is engaging and alive without being nervous, tiring or rough.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Hands-down the best car in its segment in terms of being fun to drive. It offers sport sedan handling and a standout personality in a pool of econoboxes.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Genuine personality: Stylish, fun, and engaging while others in this segment are as interesting as plain vanilla. This is the car you buy because you actually like driving.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Hands-down the best car in its segment in terms of being fun to drive. It offers sport sedan handling and a standout personality in a pool of econoboxes.
title: Personality

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The smaller 2.0-liter engine scoots the Mazda 3 hatchback to 60 mph in 8.3 seconds, while the 2.5-liter engine gets it done it in 7.8 seconds in our latest test. It's one of the quicker cars compared to similar compacts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3 is one of the quickest cars in the class, with excellent steering and handling to match. Yet it's still easy to drive every day, where it's as smooth and user-friendly as any of its less sporty competition.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The brake pedal feel is excellent, which helps with smoothness in traffic and confidence in heavy braking. Stopping distances for the 3 from 60 mph range from 120 feet (tested here) to 126 feet, which is better than average for the class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3 is one of the quickest cars in the class, with excellent steering and handling to match. Yet it's still easy to drive every day, where it's as smooth and user-friendly as any of its less sporty competition.
title: Braking

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Electric power steering can sometimes produce a numb steering feel, but not in the Mazda 3. It has great assist at slow speeds, but is direct and communicative on curvy roads. This is one of the best steering setups in the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3 is one of the quickest cars in the class, with excellent steering and handling to match. Yet it's still easy to drive every day, where it's as smooth and user-friendly as any of its less sporty competition.
title: Steering

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Mazda 3 is capable and confident, with sharp steering and suspension that feels lively and keeps body roll in check. There are several reasons this is one of our favorite cars in the segment, and the handling is one of them.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3 is one of the quickest cars in the class, with excellent steering and handling to match. Yet it's still easy to drive every day, where it's as smooth and user-friendly as any of its less sporty competition.
title: Handling

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Even with its performance slant, the Mazda 3 is a car everyone can live with. Both available transmissions are likable, and the 3's size makes it as easy to maneuver through town as it is around corners at speed.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3 is one of the quickest cars in the class, with excellent steering and handling to match. Yet it's still easy to drive every day, where it's as smooth and user-friendly as any of its less sporty competition.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The front seats have a good combination of long-distance comfort and firm support to counteract cornering forces. Mazda's leatherette material looks good, but doesn't feel as impressive. It's still better than most competitor materials.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good ride quality, comfortable seats and a quiet cabin all give the Mazda 3 above-average comfort. The front seats are well padded, but the rear seat area is on the tight side. The seat material is good, but is nothing special.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: What Mazda has done with the 3's ride quality is pretty impressive. The car handles well and is still extremely highway-friendly, isolating bumps and rough patches as best a compact car can.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good ride quality, comfortable seats and a quiet cabin all give the Mazda 3 above-average comfort. The front seats are well padded, but the rear seat area is on the tight side. The seat material is good, but is nothing special.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Climate control knobs are large, they feel good in your hand and they're easy to operate. Simple but upscale, with no need to hide the commands deep in some touchscreen menu. This is how climate control should be done.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good ride quality, comfortable seats and a quiet cabin all give the Mazda 3 above-average comfort. The front seats are well padded, but the rear seat area is on the tight side. The seat material is good, but is nothing special.
title: Climate Control

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The 2.0-liter engine sounds raspy under heavy acceleration, so we prefer the more powerful 2.5-liter engine. It's also less labored around town and on the highway. Wind and tire noise are minimal in the cabin, even at freeway speeds.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Good ride quality, comfortable seats and a quiet cabin all give the Mazda 3 above-average comfort. The front seats are well padded, but the rear seat area is on the tight side. The seat material is good, but is nothing special.
title: Noise & Vibration

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Everything you need is within reach, clearly marked and appropriately sized. Getting familiar with the Mazda 3's interior takes almost no time or effort. The central rotary knob/button for navigating the touchscreen works flawlessly.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Much of the Mazda 3's interior feels like an entry-level luxury car. High-quality materials, soft-touch surfaces and a classy/easy-to-understand infotainment interface all make for one of the better interiors in the class.
title: Ease of Use

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Large, lightweight doors open wide for easy front seat entry and exit. Even the rear seat access is good, which is not the norm in this class.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Much of the Mazda 3's interior feels like an entry-level luxury car. High-quality materials, soft-touch surfaces and a classy/easy-to-understand infotainment interface all make for one of the better interiors in the class.
title: Entry/Exit

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Most people will be able to find a comfortable driving position even with the manually adjustable front seats. A tilt-and-telescoping steering wheel is standard, but only the GT model gets the six-way power driver seat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Much of the Mazda 3's interior feels like an entry-level luxury car. High-quality materials, soft-touch surfaces and a classy/easy-to-understand infotainment interface all make for one of the better interiors in the class.
title: Driving Position

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The front seats are cozy but not too tight, and there's ample head- and legroom. Rear seat space is more limited, and falls short in comparison to rivals like the Toyota Corolla and Honda Civic.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Much of the Mazda 3's interior feels like an entry-level luxury car. High-quality materials, soft-touch surfaces and a classy/easy-to-understand infotainment interface all make for one of the better interiors in the class.
title: Roominess

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Great forward visibility, with a low dash and high seating position. The C-pillar in back blocks rear visibility a bit, but a rearview camera comes standard. Blind-spot monitoring with cross-traffic warning is optional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Much of the Mazda 3's interior feels like an entry-level luxury car. High-quality materials, soft-touch surfaces and a classy/easy-to-understand infotainment interface all make for one of the better interiors in the class.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: At 20.2 cubic feet, the hatchback cargo area is superior to its sedan counterparts. Fold down the 60/40 rear seats and you expand that area to 47.1 cubic feet of cargo volume. A low lift-over height for loading the hatch is a nice plus, too.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Much of the Mazda 3's interior feels like an entry-level luxury car. High-quality materials, soft-touch surfaces and a classy/easy-to-understand infotainment interface all make for one of the better interiors in the class.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Even compared to some great systems from luxury companies like Audi and BMW, the Mazda audio and navigation controls are extremely clean and pleasingly to the eye. Menu logic is simple and easy to use. Easily the best in its class.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: Some shoppers may not like the "tacked-on" appearance of Mazda's infotainment interface on the dashboard, but usability is top of its class. The rotary control knob is right where you need it, simple to understand and the system responds rapidly to all commands.
title: Audio & Navigation

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Apple CarPlay and Android Auto are not available, regardless of trim level, but devices work well with Mazda's systems nonetheless. USB, auxiliary and Bluetooth connections all come standard.
ratings.title: Technology
ratings.summary: Some shoppers may not like the "tacked-on" appearance of Mazda's infotainment interface on the dashboard, but usability is top of its class. The rotary control knob is right where you need it, simple to understand and the system responds rapidly to all commands.
title: Device Integration

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: At 20.2 cubic feet, the hatchback cargo area is superior to its sedan counterparts. Fold down the 60/40 rear seats and you expand that area to 47.1 cubic feet of cargo volume. A low lift-over height for loading the hatch is a nice plus, too.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: With so much available storage from the hatchback and a standard 60/40-split rear seat, the Mazda 3 nearly rivals some small crossovers for space. Small item storage isn't as great, though, and some car seats may be a bit of a squeeze in the backseat.
title: Cargo Space

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There's an average amount of small item storage in the doors, center console and glovebox. Soda cans and standard 16-ounce water bottles fit fine in the cupholders, but bigger bottles won't.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: With so much available storage from the hatchback and a standard 60/40-split rear seat, the Mazda 3 nearly rivals some small crossovers for space. Small item storage isn't as great, though, and some car seats may be a bit of a squeeze in the backseat.
title: Small Item Storage

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Two sets of LATCH anchors are located under an easily lifted part of the rear seat. Most seats will fit in the rear just fine, but rear-facing car seats will definitely impose on the front passenger's space.
ratings.title: Utility
ratings.summary: With so much available storage from the hatchback and a standard 60/40-split rear seat, the Mazda 3 nearly rivals some small crossovers for space. Small item storage isn't as great, though, and some car seats may be a bit of a squeeze in the backseat.
title: Car Seats

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Build quality wasn't as strong a suit for Mazda as it is now. All knobs and buttons feel solid, with positive action, though the seat material could be of better tactile quality.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It isn't the cheapest compact vehicle, but the Mazda 3 has a lot of value. It gets good fuel economy, has a low entry price and when you're choosing equipment options, you get a lot for the money.
title: Build Quality

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The base Mazda 3 i Sport five-door starts just under $19K, while a fully loaded Grand Touring example with leather will break the $27K mark. The equipment offered at either extreme makes the Mazda 3 highly competitive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It isn't the cheapest compact vehicle, but the Mazda 3 has a lot of value. It gets good fuel economy, has a low entry price and when you're choosing equipment options, you get a lot for the money.
title: Cost

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The 2.0-liter manual Mazda 3 we tested is rated at 33 mpg combined (30 city/40 highway) by the EPA. The 2.5-liter with the automatic gets 31 mpg combined (28/39), which is also good for the class. Our fuel numbers matched those estimates.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It isn't the cheapest compact vehicle, but the Mazda 3 has a lot of value. It gets good fuel economy, has a low entry price and when you're choosing equipment options, you get a lot for the money.
title: MPG

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: With a three-year/36,000-mile basic and a five-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty, Mazda is right in line with what other manufacturers in the class are offering.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It isn't the cheapest compact vehicle, but the Mazda 3 has a lot of value. It gets good fuel economy, has a low entry price and when you're choosing equipment options, you get a lot for the money.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Roadside assistance is available around the clock during the three-year/36,0000-mile basic warranty period. This matches what the competition offers.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It isn't the cheapest compact vehicle, but the Mazda 3 has a lot of value. It gets good fuel economy, has a low entry price and when you're choosing equipment options, you get a lot for the money.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: For years, the Mazda 3 has proved that driving an economy car doesn't have to be boring or disconnected. While it isn't a full-blown high-performance sport compact, it's still extremely rewarding to drive.
ratings.title: Wild Card
ratings.summary: In a class that sees fuel economy as a main priority, the Mazda 3 not only rises to meet those targets, but simultaneously offers one of the best cars in the segment in terms of being fun to drive. It's the kind of car that anyone will appreciate driving.
title: Fun-to-Drive

make.name: Mazda
style.name: s Grand Touring 4dr Hatchback (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: In a class where some cars don't have clear identities, the Mazda 3 really stands out and stays true to the brand. Its sleek styling, engaging dynamics and overall fun factor provides an extra benefit that other models miss.
ratings.title: Wild Card
ratings.summary: In a class that sees fuel economy as a main priority, the Mazda 3 not only rises to meet those targets, but simultaneously offers one of the best cars in the segment in terms of being fun to drive. It's the kind of car that anyone will appreciate driving.
title: Personality

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: With only 157 hp to work with, the Mazda 5 is easily burdened by a full load of passengers. It required 8.8 seconds to hit 60 mph. Slower than most minivans, as quick as most crossover SUVs. The 6-sp manual transmission is easy to use.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 5's handling offers more driving reward than any vehicle in this class needs to, but its 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine isn't powerful. The availability of a 6-speed manual transmission, which gives the driver full control over the powertrain, is unique among minivans.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Stopping from 60 mph requires 124 feet in the Mazda 5, which is average for crossovers and minivans. The 5's brake feel is nothing special, but its pedal is positioned well to accommodate using all three pedals with purpose.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 5's handling offers more driving reward than any vehicle in this class needs to, but its 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine isn't powerful. The availability of a 6-speed manual transmission, which gives the driver full control over the powertrain, is unique among minivans.
title: Braking

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Steering offers good weight and reasonable feedback yet it's light enough to accommodate the parking lot maneuvers for which the 5 will be used most often.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 5's handling offers more driving reward than any vehicle in this class needs to, but its 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine isn't powerful. The availability of a 6-speed manual transmission, which gives the driver full control over the powertrain, is unique among minivans.
title: Steering

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Few vehicles that can move this many people are as nimble as the Mazda 5. Like most Mazdas, there's sporting character here. Balance and cornering manners are good, even against unimpressive test numbers, especially relative to minivans.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 5's handling offers more driving reward than any vehicle in this class needs to, but its 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine isn't powerful. The availability of a 6-speed manual transmission, which gives the driver full control over the powertrain, is unique among minivans.
title: Handling

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Though the 5 is well mannered and produces no driveability gripes, its underpowered engine means it's just plain slow in many situations. You'll need to leave some space when pulling out into fast-moving traffic.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 5's handling offers more driving reward than any vehicle in this class needs to, but its 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine isn't powerful. The availability of a 6-speed manual transmission, which gives the driver full control over the powertrain, is unique among minivans.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Far from fancy, the Mazda 5's seats are adequately comfortable, even for long hauls. Height adjustability for the driver's seats is the only special feature you'll find. Otherwise, seat adjustments are basic.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Don't go looking for luxury levels of comfort in the Mazda 5. It's mostly about utility. Though its interior design is, for the most part, accommodating, there's nothing that stands out about it either.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Though its ride is marginally busier than most minivans, the Mazda 5 suffers no compromise in ride quality despite its capable handling.  Body motions are well controlled even when driven with purpose.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Don't go looking for luxury levels of comfort in the Mazda 5. It's mostly about utility. Though its interior design is, for the most part, accommodating, there's nothing that stands out about it either.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Wind and tire noise aren't as well damped as in most crossover SUVs and minivans. Though it's not significant over a short distance, the loud cabin will wear on occupants after several hours.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Don't go looking for luxury levels of comfort in the Mazda 5. It's mostly about utility. Though its interior design is, for the most part, accommodating, there's nothing that stands out about it either.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 5's tilt and telescoping steering wheel offers ample adjustability for many different driver sizes.  Knobs control both the audio and climate control systems, their straightforward nature making them simple to use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Mazda 5 is characterized by a highly flexible and utilitarian interior, with folding second and third row seats that offer a large amount of cargo space. There's little focus on presentation, and the 5 shows its age, as most of its interior dates to the first-generation model.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Lightweight manual sliding doors are easy to use, even for small children. Buyers who require automatic sliding doors are out of luck with the 5. Access to the third row is good. Front doors open amply wide.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Mazda 5 is characterized by a highly flexible and utilitarian interior, with folding second and third row seats that offer a large amount of cargo space. There's little focus on presentation, and the 5 shows its age, as most of its interior dates to the first-generation model.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Long-legged drivers will struggle with the 5's lack of front-seat legroom. Second-row seats are comfortable for adults, but only small folks will fit in the third row. Due to the Mazda 5's smaller size, there's isn't a 7-seat option.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Mazda 5 is characterized by a highly flexible and utilitarian interior, with folding second and third row seats that offer a large amount of cargo space. There's little focus on presentation, and the 5 shows its age, as most of its interior dates to the first-generation model.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: With a large glass area and relatively small pillars, visibility is better out of the 5 than it is from behind the wheel of many crossovers and minivans.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Mazda 5 is characterized by a highly flexible and utilitarian interior, with folding second and third row seats that offer a large amount of cargo space. There's little focus on presentation, and the 5 shows its age, as most of its interior dates to the first-generation model.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 5's biggest strength is its efficient use of space. It can carry four people and still have ample cargo room with the third row folded flat. It offers less total space than a regular minivan, but utility remains plenty capable.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Mazda 5 is characterized by a highly flexible and utilitarian interior, with folding second and third row seats that offer a large amount of cargo space. There's little focus on presentation, and the 5 shows its age, as most of its interior dates to the first-generation model.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Build quality is good in the 5. Our test car exemplified solid assembly quality and decent materials. We witnessed no squeaks or rattles, which are commmon in minivans.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a low cost of entry and high utility factor, we think the Mazda 5 is a good, if unique, value offering. It lacks several key features you'll find in many competitors, but still manages to shine if you need a compact vehicle with lots of interior room.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 5's lack of safety features, like a rearview camera and blind-spot monitor, are crucial missteps these days. Also, the lack of automatic sliding doors will be a deal breaker for some buyers. Still, there's lots of interior function here.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a low cost of entry and high utility factor, we think the Mazda 5 is a good, if unique, value offering. It lacks several key features you'll find in many competitors, but still manages to shine if you need a compact vehicle with lots of interior room.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: If you want a minivan, it's hard to spend less than this (though Dodge lets you do it by a tiny margin). Our Sport trim 5 cost $21,010. And if what you want is a small, nimble van then this is your only choice.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a low cost of entry and high utility factor, we think the Mazda 5 is a good, if unique, value offering. It lacks several key features you'll find in many competitors, but still manages to shine if you need a compact vehicle with lots of interior room.
title: Cost

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The lack of Mazda's latest powertrain puts the 5 at a disadvantage here. The EPA-rated 24 mpg Combined (21 City/28 Highway) means the 5 isn't much more efficient than a Honda Odyssey. The 5 garnered just 25.3 mpg on our 116-mile test loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a low cost of entry and high utility factor, we think the Mazda 5 is a good, if unique, value offering. It lacks several key features you'll find in many competitors, but still manages to shine if you need a compact vehicle with lots of interior room.
title: MPG

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 5's 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties give coverage that's average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a low cost of entry and high utility factor, we think the Mazda 5 is a good, if unique, value offering. It lacks several key features you'll find in many competitors, but still manages to shine if you need a compact vehicle with lots of interior room.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 3-year/36,000-mile roadside assistance plan the Mazda 5 comes with is nice but certainly not unheard of among family vehicles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a low cost of entry and high utility factor, we think the Mazda 5 is a good, if unique, value offering. It lacks several key features you'll find in many competitors, but still manages to shine if you need a compact vehicle with lots of interior room.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Like all Mazdas, the 5 excels at cornering. Though it's not as sporting as the company's latest creations (the 3 sedan/hatchback, CX-5 crossover), it's the best handling minivan on the market. But it could use more power.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: You probably never thought of a minivan as a corner carver, but you will when you drive the Mazda 5. Especially if it has the 6-speed manual transmission. Yes, small minivans can be fun to drive.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mazda
style.name: Sport 4dr Minivan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Certainly there's more personality (and less stigma) here than you'll get with other minivans. And there's this: It's fun to drive a car with a lot of utility and character.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: You probably never thought of a minivan as a corner carver, but you will when you drive the Mazda 5. Especially if it has the 6-speed manual transmission. Yes, small minivans can be fun to drive.
title: Personality

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 184-hp 2.5-liter inline-4 doesn't have big grunt at low rpm. You need to rev it for max acceleration, but it's fun up there. We enjoy the six-speed manual, but its 8.1-second 0-60 time was 0.5-second slower than class-leading time with auto.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 6 is the performance machine of the usually ho-hum midsize sedan segment. Superb steering, a responsive chassis and a willing engine mean this is a car for people who actually like to drive. The manual gearbox has precise gates but feels a bit rubbery. We still liked it.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Brakes were a bit grabby around town, but perfect and powerful on backroads. Pedals are spaced nicely for heel-and-toe downshifting but throttle needs a healthy stab for proper blipping. Stopped from 60 mph in 124 feet -- merely average.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 6 is the performance machine of the usually ho-hum midsize sedan segment. Superb steering, a responsive chassis and a willing engine mean this is a car for people who actually like to drive. The manual gearbox has precise gates but feels a bit rubbery. We still liked it.
title: Braking

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The steering exhibits excellent road feel and response, easily the best in the segment. The Mazda 6 goes exactly where you point it. We like the sporty size of the steering wheel, but the leather covering is too slippery.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 6 is the performance machine of the usually ho-hum midsize sedan segment. Superb steering, a responsive chassis and a willing engine mean this is a car for people who actually like to drive. The manual gearbox has precise gates but feels a bit rubbery. We still liked it.
title: Steering

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: No other car in this class gives this kind of steering feel or handling poise. The 6 feels glued to the road and it relishes corners. It's responsive to driver inputs and doesn't just plow the front end through turns like most rivals do.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 6 is the performance machine of the usually ho-hum midsize sedan segment. Superb steering, a responsive chassis and a willing engine mean this is a car for people who actually like to drive. The manual gearbox has precise gates but feels a bit rubbery. We still liked it.
title: Handling

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The interaction between gas pedal/clutch/shifter wasn't as spot-on intuitive as we expect from Mazda -- it takes some practice. Cruise control wasn't great at holding speeds. But in pretty much every other way this is an easy car to live with.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda 6 is the performance machine of the usually ho-hum midsize sedan segment. Superb steering, a responsive chassis and a willing engine mean this is a car for people who actually like to drive. The manual gearbox has precise gates but feels a bit rubbery. We still liked it.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Cushions are soft, yet there's good lateral support (wider folks may find them a tad narrow). Simulated leather is supple, grippy. Armrests have good padding. Rear seat is cushy, offers good back support, seatback isn't too upright.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The 6 isn't as cushy as several rivals in the segment. It has a firm ride thanks to the sporty suspension, but it's never objectionable. The standard 19-in. wheels aren't helping. Redesigned front seats are comfy and look sporty. Improved sound deadening has quieted the cabin down some.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The 6's ride can get a bit choppy when the going gets rough, especially compared to most rivals. It's never harsh, just feels like a sport sedan that's poised to tackle turns, which it is. Still, it handles big bumps with surprising aplomb.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The 6 isn't as cushy as several rivals in the segment. It has a firm ride thanks to the sporty suspension, but it's never objectionable. The standard 19-in. wheels aren't helping. Redesigned front seats are comfy and look sporty. Improved sound deadening has quieted the cabin down some.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: A quiet car, thanks to upgraded sound deadening. Tire noise is remarkably absent and there wasn't any suspension "crashing" over big bumps. Engine gets louder than most at high rpm, but is never obtrusive and sounds better than most.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The 6 isn't as cushy as several rivals in the segment. It has a firm ride thanks to the sporty suspension, but it's never objectionable. The standard 19-in. wheels aren't helping. Redesigned front seats are comfy and look sporty. Improved sound deadening has quieted the cabin down some.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: One of the better electronics interfaces with a large screen and central control knob (plus touchscreen functionality when parked). Gauges are big and easy to read. Steering wheel buttons feel a little cheap but climate controls are simple.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The aftermarket navigation screen is thankfully gone, replaced by a 7-inch screen and center console controls (called Mazda Connect). Much better. The car's swoopy lines don't affect ease of entry up front much, but do for the rear seat. Once inside, passenger space is surprisingly good.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Front doors are long and open wide; you only have to duck head slightly. Rear is a bit more of an issue. The elevated rear seat and sloping roofline means you have to duck to get in. But entryway is fairly wide thanks to long doors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The aftermarket navigation screen is thankfully gone, replaced by a 7-inch screen and center console controls (called Mazda Connect). Much better. The car's swoopy lines don't affect ease of entry up front much, but do for the rear seat. Once inside, passenger space is surprisingly good.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Front headroom is fantastic, especially considering the car's sporty shape. Center console has padding for driver's right knee. Good rear knee/legroom, though foot space is a bit cramped. Headroom will be tight only for really tall folk.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The aftermarket navigation screen is thankfully gone, replaced by a 7-inch screen and center console controls (called Mazda Connect). Much better. The car's swoopy lines don't affect ease of entry up front much, but do for the rear seat. Once inside, passenger space is surprisingly good.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The beltline sweeps upward toward the rear, but narrow front and side pillars make for decent outward views. Good-sized side mirrors help. Rearview camera standard. Lane departure warning on test car but not blind spot detection.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The aftermarket navigation screen is thankfully gone, replaced by a 7-inch screen and center console controls (called Mazda Connect). Much better. The car's swoopy lines don't affect ease of entry up front much, but do for the rear seat. Once inside, passenger space is surprisingly good.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Door pockets aren't as generous as some rivals, center armrest bin is just big enough. Cupholders have anti-tip. Rear seats fold down almost flat via release levers in 14.8 cu-ft trunk (slightly small for segment). Trunk opening is wide.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The aftermarket navigation screen is thankfully gone, replaced by a 7-inch screen and center console controls (called Mazda Connect). Much better. The car's swoopy lines don't affect ease of entry up front much, but do for the rear seat. Once inside, passenger space is surprisingly good.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Other than the slippery steering wheel and substandard steering wheel buttons, the 6 feels well put together, and there's more padded leatherette throughout the cabin now. Climate control temperature knobs have a solid heft.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Mazda 6 i Sport starts just a bit less than most of its rivals at around $22,500. The 6 i Touring tested here starts around $25k with a 6-sp. manual transmission (add $1,050 for the 6-sp. automatic). Build quality is good, fuel economy is fantastic, warranties are only average.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: For just less than $25,000, the 6 i Touring comes with Bluetooth, eight-way power driver seat, Mazda Connect, rearview camera, blind spot monitoring, rear cross-traffic alert, hill launch assist and 19-in. alloy wheels. Average for segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Mazda 6 i Sport starts just a bit less than most of its rivals at around $22,500. The 6 i Touring tested here starts around $25k with a 6-sp. manual transmission (add $1,050 for the 6-sp. automatic). Build quality is good, fuel economy is fantastic, warranties are only average.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: A handful of minor options raised as-tested price to $25,265. Seems like good value given class-competitive practicality and class-leading driver engagement. Popular features like satellite radio and navigation are only on loaded Grand Touring.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Mazda 6 i Sport starts just a bit less than most of its rivals at around $22,500. The 6 i Touring tested here starts around $25k with a 6-sp. manual transmission (add $1,050 for the 6-sp. automatic). Build quality is good, fuel economy is fantastic, warranties are only average.
title: Cost

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The EPA rates the Mazda 6 at the top of the segment with 29 mpg combined (25 city/37 highway) for the manual, 31 combined (26/38) for the automatic. It averaged 28.5 mpg overall, including an impressive 35.1 mpg on our evaluation route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Mazda 6 i Sport starts just a bit less than most of its rivals at around $22,500. The 6 i Touring tested here starts around $25k with a 6-sp. manual transmission (add $1,050 for the 6-sp. automatic). Build quality is good, fuel economy is fantastic, warranties are only average.
title: MPG

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: With a basic warranty of 3 years/36,000 miles and drivetrain coverage for 5 years/60,000 miles, the 6's warranty is only average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Mazda 6 i Sport starts just a bit less than most of its rivals at around $22,500. The 6 i Touring tested here starts around $25k with a 6-sp. manual transmission (add $1,050 for the 6-sp. automatic). Build quality is good, fuel economy is fantastic, warranties are only average.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Roadside assistance lasts for 3 years/36,000 miles, but the Mazda ownership experience is hampered some by fewer dealers than many rivals. It also doesn't come with free maintenance, while the Toyota Camry has it for 2 years/25,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Mazda 6 i Sport starts just a bit less than most of its rivals at around $22,500. The 6 i Touring tested here starts around $25k with a 6-sp. manual transmission (add $1,050 for the 6-sp. automatic). Build quality is good, fuel economy is fantastic, warranties are only average.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The driving experience is marred by a slight disconnect between gas, clutch and shifter at low speeds. Once moving, everything works in concert. Seats are comfy, controls look nice and the ride isn't too harsh given the handling abilities.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you want fun-to-drive in this class, the Mazda 6 is the top choice. The handling is superb. And unlike the majority of its rivals, you can still get it with a manual transmission. There's no V6 or turbo option, but the four-cylinder is strong, likes to rev high and sounds good doing it.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mazda
style.name: i Touring 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Arguably the best-looking car in the class, maybe even sexy. Midsize sedan and "sexy" usually don't go together. Add to that its sporty handling and excellent steering, and the 6 delivers a unique driving character in a sea of sameness.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you want fun-to-drive in this class, the Mazda 6 is the top choice. The handling is superb. And unlike the majority of its rivals, you can still get it with a manual transmission. There's no V6 or turbo option, but the four-cylinder is strong, likes to rev high and sounds good doing it.
title: Personality

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl 6A)
summary: With just 155 hp, the CX-5's acceleration is merely adequate for the class. The extra weight and driveline inertia of our AWD model makes it slower than its FWD counterpart.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda CX-5's brakes, suspension and steering are uncommonly capable. The want for more power is a small concession for class-leading fuel economy.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Reasonable panic braking results (121 ft from 60 mph) with exceptionally good pedal feel and fade resistance.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mazda CX-5's brakes, suspension and steering are uncommonly capable. The want for more power is a small concession for class-leading fuel economy.
title: Braking

make.name: Mazda

summary: The CX-5 reaches 60 mph in 7.9 seconds, which is quicker than chief competitors by almost a full second. Gear changes are quick and smooth, and the ratios make the most of all available power. It passes slower traffic with confidence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: When equipped with the larger 2.5-liter engine, the 2016 Mazda CX-5 is the quickest in the compact SUV class. To sweeten the deal, it's also the most engaging and capable on a winding road. If you're looking for a non-premium branded SUV with some excitement, the CX-5 is the best choice.

make.name: Mazda

style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-5 has an abundance of interior space compared to other SUVs in this class. There's enough headroom for taller adults in rear seats, but as is typical, the seat cushions are more appropriate for smaller passengers.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The CX-5 receives high scores for its intuitive infotainment system and spacious interior. Cargo capacity is marginally smaller than other compact SUVs, but it's not limiting by any means. Thoughtful design and placement of controls will likely mean that owners will rarely consult the manual.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: All-around visibility is good, with good indicators for the car's boundaries when backing into a space. Blind spots are relatively small and the standard blind spot monitor and cross traffic alerts largely eliminate them.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The CX-5 receives high scores for its intuitive infotainment system and spacious interior. Cargo capacity is marginally smaller than other compact SUVs, but it's not limiting by any means. Thoughtful design and placement of controls will likely mean that owners will rarely consult the manual.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Cargo capacity of 34 cu-ft (65 cu-ft max.) is smaller than competitors, but it should be enough for typical owners. 40/20/40 split-folding rear seats provide more flexibility. There are enough interior pockets and bins for personal items.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The CX-5 receives high scores for its intuitive infotainment system and spacious interior. Cargo capacity is marginally smaller than other compact SUVs, but it's not limiting by any means. Thoughtful design and placement of controls will likely mean that owners will rarely consult the manual.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-5's interior materials quality is average among other SUVs. There's nothing disappointing about it, but besides the infotainment controller, it's not all that impressive, either. Sturdy construction eliminates any noticeable squeaks.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price around $26,000, the Mazda CX-5 in Touring trim is comparable to rivals. It gains an advantage for its strong fuel economy and some standard safety features that are options on rivals. Considering its unusually favorable performance, it should be on your must-drive list.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: In mid-level Touring trim, the Mazda CX-5 is competitively priced against other compact SUVs. It does gain an advantage with its standard blind spot and rear cross traffic alerts, as well as the praiseworthy infotainment system.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price around $26,000, the Mazda CX-5 in Touring trim is comparable to rivals. It gains an advantage for its strong fuel economy and some standard safety features that are options on rivals. Considering its unusually favorable performance, it should be on your must-drive list.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Our as-tested price of over $27,000 includes optional moonroof and premium audio. Foregoing these add-ons drops the price right in there with comparably or slightly less equipped rivals. It remains competitive if you add navigation, too.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price around $26,000, the Mazda CX-5 in Touring trim is comparable to rivals. It gains an advantage for its strong fuel economy and some standard safety features that are options on rivals. Considering its unusually favorable performance, it should be on your must-drive list.
title: Cost

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: EPA estimates fuel economy at 29 mpg combined (26 city/33 hwy), which is good for SUVs in this class. On our highway-heavy evaluation loop, we achieved 32.6 mpg. In its time with us, we averaged only 23.6 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price around $26,000, the Mazda CX-5 in Touring trim is comparable to rivals. It gains an advantage for its strong fuel economy and some standard safety features that are options on rivals. Considering its unusually favorable performance, it should be on your must-drive list.
title: MPG

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Mazda's 3-year/36,000-mile bumper-to-bumper warranty and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty are typical for cars in this class. No factory extended warranty is available.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price around $26,000, the Mazda CX-5 in Touring trim is comparable to rivals. It gains an advantage for its strong fuel economy and some standard safety features that are options on rivals. Considering its unusually favorable performance, it should be on your must-drive list.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Roadside assistance is available for 3 years/36,000 miles, which is average for the class. No free scheduled or pre-paid maintenance is offered. Toyotas on the other hand, come with two years of free scheduled maintenance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price around $26,000, the Mazda CX-5 in Touring trim is comparable to rivals. It gains an advantage for its strong fuel economy and some standard safety features that are options on rivals. Considering its unusually favorable performance, it should be on your must-drive list.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-5 will easily meet the average driver's needs. For the more spirited drivers out there, it will also satisfy. No other compact SUV in this class has this kind of broad appeal. There are few, if any downsides.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Mazda CX-5 is a standout among compact SUVs for its quick acceleration and engaging handling. The difference between it and rivals is noticeable, even if performance is not one of your priorities. Without stepping up to more expensive premium SUVs, this is as fun-to-drive as it gets.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-5
style.name: Touring 4dr SUV w/Prod. End 01/16 (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Besides the already documented performance, the CX-5 also gets high marks for its stylish exterior and inviting interior. It looks different enough from other SUVs without looking gimmicky or overstyled.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Mazda CX-5 is a standout among compact SUVs for its quick acceleration and engaging handling. The difference between it and rivals is noticeable, even if performance is not one of your priorities. Without stepping up to more expensive premium SUVs, this is as fun-to-drive as it gets.
title: Personality

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Considering the CX-9's weight, the 273-hp 3.7-liter V6 does an adequate job, and helps reach 60 mph in 7.5 seconds. The six-speed automatic shifts smoothly, but can be hesitant to kick down.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-9's panic stop distances were a little shorter than average, at 120 feet from 60 mph. Although pedal feel wasn't as crisp around town as we would've liked, it's easy to modulate.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Braking

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Direct steering that makes this Mazda feel nimble in a way that most large SUVs do not. It's not brimming with feel, but is quick and weighted on the light side.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Steering

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-9 feels more athletic than most of its competitors in regular driving. But track handling numbers showed it's not as dominant over its competition as we thought.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Handling

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Easy-to-drive vehicle with supple throttle delivery. The automatic transmission always tells you the gear you're in, and it downshifts in cruise control to stay at the set speed.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-9 has a maximum towing capacity of 3,500 pounds. Conversely, the Ford Flex can tow up to 4,500 pounds, the Hyundai Santa Fe 5,000 lb. and the Chevy Traverse 5,200 lb.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Towing

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Like its competitors, the CX-9 is a soft-roader. Smooth fire roads are about as adventurous as you're going to want to get. Especially the front-wheel-drive version we tested.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: More verve than your typical SUV. In instrumented testing some competitors can out-accelerate and just barely out-handle the CX-9. In the real world, though, it's more involving and reassuring to drive.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Front seats are extremely plush with perfect lumbar but mild bolstering. One foot is always resting on the seat rail in the second row. Comfy third row has headroom for adults.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The CX-9 is a quiet, comfortable cruiser. Surprisingly, the third row actually has enough headroom for moderately sized adults. If the ride is too firm on rough roads, reconsider whether the Grand Touring's 20-inch wheels are for you.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: This is among the firmer-riding SUVs, but it's not harsh. A good amount of body control. If you're looking for a smother-everything ride, though, look elsewhere.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The CX-9 is a quiet, comfortable cruiser. Surprisingly, the third row actually has enough headroom for moderately sized adults. If the ride is too firm on rough roads, reconsider whether the Grand Touring's 20-inch wheels are for you.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Well hushed. Tires are quiet, even on concrete freeways. Wind noise is nearly nonexistent. You almost never notice the V6. Even under full throttle it's pretty subdued.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The CX-9 is a quiet, comfortable cruiser. Surprisingly, the third row actually has enough headroom for moderately sized adults. If the ride is too firm on rough roads, reconsider whether the Grand Touring's 20-inch wheels are for you.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Overall the cabin controls are well-sorted and placed. The glaring exception is the multimedia screen, the interface of which is slow, cumbersome and not intuitive.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's little to fault in the cabin beyond the small, fiddly navigation screen and a few low-rent plastic pieces. There's loads of room, easy access and nice outward visibility.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Easy to get in/out up front, perfect step-in height. If second-row seats are moved rearward, third-row seatbacks can't be raised. But nice one-touch mechanism for accessing third row.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's little to fault in the cabin beyond the small, fiddly navigation screen and a few low-rent plastic pieces. There's loads of room, easy access and nice outward visibility.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Good front headroom, generous elbow room with cut-out doors and individual center armrests. Second-row headroom is excellent. Third-row foot room is poor, but sliding second row improves legroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's little to fault in the cabin beyond the small, fiddly navigation screen and a few low-rent plastic pieces. There's loads of room, easy access and nice outward visibility.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Despite sloping roof, side windows are large. Most pillars are narrow, other than the rearmost. Blind-spot monitor standard on this model. Standard back-up camera has small screen.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's little to fault in the cabin beyond the small, fiddly navigation screen and a few low-rent plastic pieces. There's loads of room, easy access and nice outward visibility.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Small but handy front bin. Cup holders lack anti-tip. Second largest cargo area in the segment. Hatch doesn't rise high enough, easy to hit head. Door pockets too low.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's little to fault in the cabin beyond the small, fiddly navigation screen and a few low-rent plastic pieces. There's loads of room, easy access and nice outward visibility.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The shifter surround plastic feels cheap and the dash is hard-touch, but most materials look and feel substantial. High marks for the seat/door suede inserts. Wood trim is classy.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CX-9 combines a well-stocked feature list, plenty of space and a pleasant driving acuity in day-to-day maneuvers that is missing in most SUVs. Its fuel economy does not distinguish, but it offers adequate features for the money.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The top-level Grand Touring starts at $34,785. That price brings blind-spot monitoring, a rearview camera, back-up sensors and Bluetooth standard. Nav and a sunroof cost extra.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CX-9 combines a well-stocked feature list, plenty of space and a pleasant driving acuity in day-to-day maneuvers that is missing in most SUVs. Its fuel economy does not distinguish, but it offers adequate features for the money.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The as-tested price of $38,115 includes navigation, sunroof, tranny cooler and heavy-duty fan. Considering the size, people-hauling ability and quality, this is a reasonable sum.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CX-9 combines a well-stocked feature list, plenty of space and a pleasant driving acuity in day-to-day maneuvers that is missing in most SUVs. Its fuel economy does not distinguish, but it offers adequate features for the money.
title: Cost

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The EPA rates the CX-9 at 19 mpg combined (17 city/24 highway). We averaged 17.7 mpg overall, and 19.7 mpg on our standard evaluation route. Middling fuel economy for the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CX-9 combines a well-stocked feature list, plenty of space and a pleasant driving acuity in day-to-day maneuvers that is missing in most SUVs. Its fuel economy does not distinguish, but it offers adequate features for the money.
title: MPG

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The basic warranty is 3 years/36,000 miles with the drivetrain covered for 5 years/60,000 miles. Both are about average for the class, but well below that of the Hyundai Santa Fe.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CX-9 combines a well-stocked feature list, plenty of space and a pleasant driving acuity in day-to-day maneuvers that is missing in most SUVs. Its fuel economy does not distinguish, but it offers adequate features for the money.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The CX-9 has roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles, which is less than some competitors. It doesn't have free maintenance, but then neither do its rivals.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CX-9 combines a well-stocked feature list, plenty of space and a pleasant driving acuity in day-to-day maneuvers that is missing in most SUVs. Its fuel economy does not distinguish, but it offers adequate features for the money.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: No large SUV will drive like a sports car, but the CX-9 comes closest to embodying those principles in terms of steering, routine handling and lack of slop.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If the time has come to trade in your sporty car for a big-old family vehicle, the Mazda CX-9 should make the transition less painful. It's responsive and comparatively fun to drive, and even looks sportier than most.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mazda
model.name: CX-9
style.name: Grand Touring 4dr SUV (3.7L 6cyl 6A)
summary: With its raked windshield, car-like seating position, sleeker styling and involving driving experience, the CX-9 isn't a typical, staid family hauler.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If the time has come to trade in your sporty car for a big-old family vehicle, the Mazda CX-9 should make the transition less painful. It's responsive and comparatively fun to drive, and even looks sportier than most.
title: Personality

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The new Miata reaches 60 mph in 6.3 seconds, which is a half second quicker than the last Miata. With linear power, an intuitive clutch and a near-perfect shifter, strong acceleration is as pleasurable as it is easy.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata makes less horsepower than before (now 155 hp), but gets an increase in torque (148 pound-feet). However, it's also 195 pounds lighter, which benefits overall performance. Those figures may not impress enthusiasts, but power is appropriate for a car of this size and weight.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Stopped from 60 mph in 111 feet, which is slightly longer than we'd expect given the optional Brembo brake package. The distances and pedal firmness remained consistent, though, and it remained composed in full panic braking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata makes less horsepower than before (now 155 hp), but gets an increase in torque (148 pound-feet). However, it's also 195 pounds lighter, which benefits overall performance. Those figures may not impress enthusiasts, but power is appropriate for a car of this size and weight.
title: Braking

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Steering effort is lighter than we're used to from a Miata, and feedback is a little muted, too. Even still, it remains one of the best steering examples available today. It reacts with immediacy and is very accurate.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata makes less horsepower than before (now 155 hp), but gets an increase in torque (148 pound-feet). However, it's also 195 pounds lighter, which benefits overall performance. Those figures may not impress enthusiasts, but power is appropriate for a car of this size and weight.
title: Steering

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Precise and predictable are the operative words here. It reacts best to smooth and deliberate commands, but is stil supremely fun to toss into a corner with aggression. There's more body roll than expected, but it doesn't hurt handling.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata makes less horsepower than before (now 155 hp), but gets an increase in torque (148 pound-feet). However, it's also 195 pounds lighter, which benefits overall performance. Those figures may not impress enthusiasts, but power is appropriate for a car of this size and weight.
title: Handling

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Even though the Miata is capable of entertaining performance, it is still easy to drive in everyday commuting situations (yes, even with a manual). The small footprint is well-suited to tight city confines and parking spaces.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata makes less horsepower than before (now 155 hp), but gets an increase in torque (148 pound-feet). However, it's also 195 pounds lighter, which benefits overall performance. Those figures may not impress enthusiasts, but power is appropriate for a car of this size and weight.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: A new mesh suspension seat construction cradles occupants with just the right amount of support. Side bolsters provide ample lateral support without being intrusive. After hours of driving, they're very comfortable and never stifling.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Two-seat roadsters aren't known for being comfortable, but the 2016 Miata bucks that trend with a compliant suspension and innovative seat construction. While the new Miata is quieter than before, there still is a noticeable amount of noise, but for some, that's part of the allure.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Despite its small dimensions and sporty intentions, the Miata isn't punishing. There's plenty of compliance to smooth over bumps but bigger potholes will send a good thud through the chassis. Long road trips wouldn't be a problem.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Two-seat roadsters aren't known for being comfortable, but the 2016 Miata bucks that trend with a compliant suspension and innovative seat construction. While the new Miata is quieter than before, there still is a noticeable amount of noise, but for some, that's part of the allure.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Road and wind noise are prevalent at highway speeds with the top up, but not to the point that they're intrusive. The pleasant exhaust tenor is loud enough to make it sound special, but not so loud that it's obnoxious.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Two-seat roadsters aren't known for being comfortable, but the 2016 Miata bucks that trend with a compliant suspension and innovative seat construction. While the new Miata is quieter than before, there still is a noticeable amount of noise, but for some, that's part of the allure.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Primary controls are well-placed around the driver. The infotainment screen can be read with a quick glance, and is redundantly controlled by touch or with a knob controller. One of the best, even if the knob's placement isn't ideal.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata's interior is well-crafted with good materials and pleasing design. Mazda's infotainment system is excellent, as is overall visibility. The big drawbacks are typical for roadsters and come down to space and cargo, which are in short supply.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The average-sized adult will have no problem slipping in and out. Taller drivers will have to curl themselves through the opening if the top is up. Short doors aid access in tight parking spots.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata's interior is well-crafted with good materials and pleasing design. Mazda's infotainment system is excellent, as is overall visibility. The big drawbacks are typical for roadsters and come down to space and cargo, which are in short supply.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Six-foot-tall drivers would reach the size limitations of head- and legroom. Even for the typical adult, the cockpit is snug enough to feel as though you're wearing the car. It doesn't feel claustrophobic, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata's interior is well-crafted with good materials and pleasing design. Mazda's infotainment system is excellent, as is overall visibility. The big drawbacks are typical for roadsters and come down to space and cargo, which are in short supply.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Forward visibility is as good as it gets nowadays, thanks to favorable windshield positioning and narrow roof pillars. As small as the car is, there's very little guesswork with rear visibility, too.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata's interior is well-crafted with good materials and pleasing design. Mazda's infotainment system is excellent, as is overall visibility. The big drawbacks are typical for roadsters and come down to space and cargo, which are in short supply.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: A significant drawback. The Miata's 4.6-cu-ft trunk is comically small and there's no glovebox. There are small bins behind the seats and other pockets are tiny. The removable cupholders can obstruct shifting.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata's interior is well-crafted with good materials and pleasing design. Mazda's infotainment system is excellent, as is overall visibility. The big drawbacks are typical for roadsters and come down to space and cargo, which are in short supply.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The manual cloth top drops quickly and easily without leaving your seat, but requires a final push to latch in place. Deploying it is easier than previous Miatas thanks to some assistance from lifting springs. Buffeting is not excessive.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2016 Miata's interior is well-crafted with good materials and pleasing design. Mazda's infotainment system is excellent, as is overall visibility. The big drawbacks are typical for roadsters and come down to space and cargo, which are in short supply.
title: Convertible Top

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Interior materials have improved significantly from the last Miata and now meet the standards for this price point, while being much nicer than the similarly priced Scion FR-S/Subaru BRZ. Infotainment system is near luxury standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a starting price of just under $26,000, the Miata in base Sport trim delivers a lot of bang for the buck. You get a well-built and very entertaining roadster for the price and to sweeten the deal, it also gets commendable gas mileage. This little car defines fun on a budget.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Club trim is acceptably equipped given price around $30,000. Includes LED headlights, sport suspension, limited-slip diff, excellent tech interface, satellite radio and Bose sound. Brembo brakes/BBS wheels package adds $3,400.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a starting price of just under $26,000, the Miata in base Sport trim delivers a lot of bang for the buck. You get a well-built and very entertaining roadster for the price and to sweeten the deal, it also gets commendable gas mileage. This little car defines fun on a budget.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: A similarly equipped Mini convertible is priced on-par with our Miata Club tester, but can't match its rear-wheel-drive fun or driver engagement. The FR-S/BRZ come close and are cheaper, but aren't convertibles and lack refinement.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a starting price of just under $26,000, the Miata in base Sport trim delivers a lot of bang for the buck. You get a well-built and very entertaining roadster for the price and to sweeten the deal, it also gets commendable gas mileage. This little car defines fun on a budget.
title: Cost

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The EPA estimates fuel economy at 30 mpg combined (27 city/34 hwy). We easily exceeded these favorable figures with a 28.5-mpg overall average and 35.1 mpg on our highway-heavy evaluation route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a starting price of just under $26,000, the Miata in base Sport trim delivers a lot of bang for the buck. You get a well-built and very entertaining roadster for the price and to sweeten the deal, it also gets commendable gas mileage. This little car defines fun on a budget.
title: MPG

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Mazda's basic 3-year/36,000-mile warranty and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage is typical for cars in this price range.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a starting price of just under $26,000, the Miata in base Sport trim delivers a lot of bang for the buck. You get a well-built and very entertaining roadster for the price and to sweeten the deal, it also gets commendable gas mileage. This little car defines fun on a budget.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: Roadside assistance coverage for 3 years/36,000 miles is average for small sporty cars. No maintenance is included. Mini breaks the mold by providing free maintenance for 3 years.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a starting price of just under $26,000, the Miata in base Sport trim delivers a lot of bang for the buck. You get a well-built and very entertaining roadster for the price and to sweeten the deal, it also gets commendable gas mileage. This little car defines fun on a budget.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The Miata is a holdout from roadsters past, with a certain purity that is missing from more technically advanced cars. Drivers feel fully in control of the car as their intentions are executed with immediacy and accuracy.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Few cars are as fun and engaging as a Miata and this latest redesign sustains the bloodline. There's nothing like bounding from corner to corner with the top down in a little roadster. It's not as fast as other sports cars, but it also doesn't instill abject fear like they do, either.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mazda
model.name: MX-5 Miata
style.name: Club 2dr Convertible (2.0L 4cyl 6M)
summary: The new MX-5's less-cute styling broadens its appeal, while being just as playful and accessible as before. It's easy to drive and never intimidating like bigger, more powerful cars, encouraging drivers of any skill level.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Few cars are as fun and engaging as a Miata and this latest redesign sustains the bloodline. There's nothing like bounding from corner to corner with the top down in a little roadster. It's not as fast as other sports cars, but it also doesn't instill abject fear like they do, either.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Acceleration from 0 to 60 mph took 3.8 seconds en route to a quarter-mile pass 12.2 sec @ 115 mph. Race Start launch control was 0.15 sec slower than Sport Plus and our reflexes.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Impressive across all categories. It boasts 0-to-60-mph acceleration in 3.8 seconds and slows from 60-to-0 mph in 101 feet. The C63 generated 0.96g of lateral grip during testing. This car is the complete package.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: The C63 AMG Coupe reaches a stop from 60 mph in just 101 feet. Firm pedal, zero ABS commotion and nearly no nosedive. Absolutely impressive braking abilities.
ratings.title: Performance

model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Steering is quick and weighted properly to manage this well-balanced coupe. And the suede steering wheel wrap is great for grip once the palms get moist.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Impressive across all categories. It boasts 0-to-60-mph acceleration in 3.8 seconds and slows from 60-to-0 mph in 101 feet. The C63 generated 0.96g of lateral grip during testing. This car is the complete package.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Excellent grip. We recorded 0.96g around the skid pad. Sport Handling ESC mode was hardly intrusive at all, allowing very aggressive turn-in.
ratings.title: Performance
