make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Everyday driving is possible, but not the easiest to do in this car. The lower front lip not only rides low but sticks out, making driveway entries a mandatory artform.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Impressive across all categories. It boasts 0-to-60-mph acceleration in 3.8 seconds and slows from 60-to-0 mph in 101 feet. The C63 generated 0.96g of lateral grip during testing. This car is the complete package.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Seats conform tightly to the body laterally and offer support from that perspective. But they are clearly race-inspired, and as such, transmit plenty of road feel to the rump.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C63 AMG Coupe is not known for comfort. The stiff, sporting suspension is not calibrated for leisure. Noise isolation similarly ranks low on the priority list. This car is made to be loud, and its voice enjoyed.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: For a car built to run on the track, the C63 AMG Coupe is somewhat comfortable. Ordinary street driving can be tooth jarring. Avoid potholes at all costs.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C63 AMG Coupe is not known for comfort. The stiff, sporting suspension is not calibrated for leisure. Noise isolation similarly ranks low on the priority list. This car is made to be loud, and its voice enjoyed.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Not a chance. Even parked with the engine off, the AMG is louder than most cars. Noise is part of its appeal. Yet with the windows up, phone conversations are loud and clear.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C63 AMG Coupe is not known for comfort. The stiff, sporting suspension is not calibrated for leisure. Noise isolation similarly ranks low on the priority list. This car is made to be loud, and its voice enjoyed.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: All primary and secondary controls are within easy reach of the driver. The cabin layout is simple and functional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This feels like a compact coupe. That's good when it comes to the controls, as everything is within reach. But as it pertains to interior access and space, the C63 is about average in the class. Rear seatbacks fold down.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: The C63 rides low, like a sports car, so climbing in and out of the vehicle can be difficult for some. Tall, stiff bolsters for the front seats increase the degree of difficulty.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This feels like a compact coupe. That's good when it comes to the controls, as everything is within reach. But as it pertains to interior access and space, the C63 is about average in the class. Rear seatbacks fold down.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Front occupants will find the seats snug, offering limited space and room for moving around. Its compact dimensions see to it that the rest of the cabin is also tight.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This feels like a compact coupe. That's good when it comes to the controls, as everything is within reach. But as it pertains to interior access and space, the C63 is about average in the class. Rear seatbacks fold down.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Forward visibility is good. Rearward visibility is hampered by a tall trunk line, solid C-pillars and a large mounted wing. The back-up camera helps greatly.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This feels like a compact coupe. That's good when it comes to the controls, as everything is within reach. But as it pertains to interior access and space, the C63 is about average in the class. Rear seatbacks fold down.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Surprisingly, the coupe offers a fair amount of storage space. Bins up front swallow the little things while folding rear seatbacks amplify rear cargo room.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This feels like a compact coupe. That's good when it comes to the controls, as everything is within reach. But as it pertains to interior access and space, the C63 is about average in the class. Rear seatbacks fold down.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: The C63 Coupe holds to the high build quality standards we've come to expect from Mercedes-Benz products.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Some might argue that no amount of features are worth the money. Others will say that any amount of money is worth this engine and suspension. We'll call it a draw.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: The base price for a C63 AMG Coupe is $61,430. A series of Black Series packages and the carbon-fiber treatment launch the MSRP to $129,725. You don't buy this car for frugality.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: You also don't buy this car for fuel economy. The EPA wagers 13 city and 19 highway mpg. Our best tank was 14 mpg, and our worst was 6 mpg. Gas-guzzler tax is $1,700.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: A 4-year/50,000-mile new vehicle limited warranty and 24-hour roadside assistance are yours with the cost of admission.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Pre-paid maintenance plan is available. And it is pre-paid by you.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: This car is built for places where it pays to be fast and laps are timed. The only way to truly appreciate the driving experience is to put the C63 thorugh its paces on the track.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Intoxicating throttle blips on rev-matched downshifts send you rifling through the gears with little reason other than audible satisfaction. The V8 sounds awesome. Oh yeah, and the Black Series chassis knows what to do with corners, too.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Aesthetic and audible character are what the C63 AMG Black Series bring to the table. We found it hard not to drive with a smile on our face.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Intoxicating throttle blips on rev-matched downshifts send you rifling through the gears with little reason other than audible satisfaction. The V8 sounds awesome. Oh yeah, and the Black Series chassis knows what to do with corners, too.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: This is a willing and smooth V6. Gets a bit loud at high revs. Automatic has subtle shifts, but slow to react in Normal mode. Sport clears that up, but brings stiffer suspension.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Panic brake numbers were aided by summer tires, but a good performance regardless. Brakes were linear around town, not touchy in the least, but plenty of power.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Braking

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Very light in parking lots and around town. Builds effort nicely as speed increases. Wish Sport mode could be adjusted individually to have firmer steering with softer suspension.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Steering

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The optional adjustable suspension sharpens the C350's manners. Even the Normal mode is stiff enough for back roads at a moderate clip. But it's still no BMW 3 Series or Audi A4.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Handling

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The steering is light in normal driving, then builds effort nicely. Supple throttle calibration, smooth-shifting 7-speed automatic transmission. Start/Stop feature reacts quickly.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Front seats are firm but comfortable and have bolsters for cornering. The door-side armrests are too low and far way, center armrest is unpadded. Rear seatbacks are overly hard.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C-Class is firm in a typical Germanic way, from the ride to the seats. Hey, it was designed with the Autobahn in mind. The rear seats in particular are surprisingly hard. But the car does a good job of keeping noises on the outside.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: It's far from plush, but the ride in normal suspension mode is supple enough to cancel out all but the harshest bumps. Sport mode can get jiggly on any kind of rough surface.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C-Class is firm in a typical Germanic way, from the ride to the seats. Hey, it was designed with the Autobahn in mind. The rear seats in particular are surprisingly hard. But the car does a good job of keeping noises on the outside.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: This is a very quiet car, other than road noise from the optional summer tires. Near zero wind noise. The engine is very silent, except at full throttle when it gets a bit honky.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C-Class is firm in a typical Germanic way, from the ride to the seats. Hey, it was designed with the Autobahn in mind. The rear seats in particular are surprisingly hard. But the car does a good job of keeping noises on the outside.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Controls work superbly well. Huge Comand knob for changing radio stations. But three stalks on left side of steering wheel is too much. Can configure IP to show digital speedo.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Easy in/out up front, don't have to duck to avoid roof. Rear doors don't open very wide, but are long, easing entry. Foot can get caught between front seat and door sill on exit.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Door-side elbow room is tight up front, but headroom is good and driver's right knee has room to move. Rear elbow room is decent, but poor foot and knee room, minimal headroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Nice natural driving position, plenty of window surface and smallish pillars all around. The windshield is more upright than most. The optional rearview camera is a bit on the small side.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Front door pockets are small but useful, but no cupholder slots. No front bin, smallish armrest bin. Rear door pockets are useless. Trunk has a wide opening, rear seats fold.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: This is a well-made car, with that carved-from-billet Mercedes solidity. Mostly soft-touch materials, some Alcantara, quality controls. Doors close with a solid thunk.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: At its $41,400 base price, the C350 sedan comes with a power sunroof, dual-zone climate control, Bluetooth, the large and easy-to-use Comand central controller and heated seats.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: German cars have become famous for killing you with options. This C350 cost $49,245 as-tested due to adjustable suspension, navigation, back-up camera and blind-spot assist.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The EPA rates the C350 at 20 city/29 highway/23 combined mpg with the standard Start/Stop techhnology. We averaged 21.8 mpg overall, including 27.1 mpg on our 116-mile test route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Both the basic warranty and drivetrain are covered for 4 years/50,000 miles. This is average, and below the 6 years/70,000 miles the Lexus IS carries for its drivetrain.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Roadside assistance is standard but the C-Class does not come with free maintenance. BMW offers it for 4 years/50,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Even though the C-Class is the base Mercedes in the U.S., it's an aspirational car. It's a comfortable, luxurious and extremely well-made machine.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Mercedes' adjustable suspension, which is part of the $3,050 Dynamic Sport Package, really livens up the C-Class. The strong, burly-sounding V6 and paddle shifters make nearly any drive fun.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: There's not as much personality in the C350 as, say, a BMW 3 Series. But this V6 is strong, it really scoots. And with this suspension package, it handles corners with ease.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Mercedes' adjustable suspension, which is part of the $3,050 Dynamic Sport Package, really livens up the C-Class. The strong, burly-sounding V6 and paddle shifters make nearly any drive fun.

summary: Acceleration from 0 to 60 mph took 3.8 seconds en route to a quarter-mile pass 12.2 sec @ 115 mph. Race Start launch control was 0.15 sec slower than Sport Plus and our reflexes.

ratings.summary: Impressive across all categories. It boasts 0-to-60-mph acceleration in 3.8 seconds and slows from 60-to-0 mph in 101 feet. The C63 generated 0.96g of lateral grip during testing. This car is the complete package.

style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: The C63 AMG Coupe reaches a stop from 60 mph in just 101 feet. Firm pedal, zero ABS commotion and nearly no nosedive. Absolutely impressive braking abilities.

summary: Steering is quick and weighted properly to manage this well-balanced coupe. And the suede steering wheel wrap is great for grip once the palms get moist.

summary: Excellent grip. We recorded 0.96g around the skid pad. Sport Handling ESC mode was hardly intrusive at all, allowing very aggressive turn-in.

summary: Everyday driving is possible, but not the easiest to do in this car. The lower front lip not only rides low but sticks out, making driveway entries a mandatory artform.

style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Seats conform tightly to the body laterally and offer support from that perspective. But they are clearly race-inspired, and as such, transmit plenty of road feel to the rump.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C63 AMG Coupe is not known for comfort. The stiff, sporting suspension is not calibrated for leisure. Noise isolation similarly ranks low on the priority list. This car is made to be loud, and its voice enjoyed.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: For a car built to run on the track, the C63 AMG Coupe is somewhat comfortable. Ordinary street driving can be tooth jarring. Avoid potholes at all costs.
ratings.title: Comfort

model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Not a chance. Even parked with the engine off, the AMG is louder than most cars. Noise is part of its appeal. Yet with the windows up, phone conversations are loud and clear.

summary: All primary and secondary controls are within easy reach of the driver. The cabin layout is simple and functional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: This feels like a compact coupe. That's good when it comes to the controls, as everything is within reach. But as it pertains to interior access and space, the C63 is about average in the class. Rear seatbacks fold down.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: The C63 rides low, like a sports car, so climbing in and out of the vehicle can be difficult for some. Tall, stiff bolsters for the front seats increase the degree of difficulty.

summary: Front occupants will find the seats snug, offering limited space and room for moving around. Its compact dimensions see to it that the rest of the cabin is also tight.

summary: Forward visibility is good. Rearward visibility is hampered by a tall trunk line, solid C-pillars and a large mounted wing. The back-up camera helps greatly.

summary: The C63 Coupe holds to the high build quality standards we've come to expect from Mercedes-Benz products.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Build quality is excellent. Overall value is arguable due to its high sticker price, but as a low-volume collector-car it is quite appealing. The cost to own is generally high, however.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Some might argue that no amount of features are worth the money. Others will say that any amount of money is worth this engine and suspension. We'll call it a draw.

summary: The base price for a C63 AMG Coupe is $61,430. A series of Black Series packages and the carbon-fiber treatment launch the MSRP to $129,725. You donâ€™t buy this car for frugality.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: This car is built for places where it pays to be fast and laps are timed. The only way to truly appreciate the driving experience is to put the C63 thorugh its paces on the track.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Intoxicating throttle blips on rev-matched downshifts send you rifling through the gears with little reason other than audible satisfaction. The V8 sounds awesome. Oh yeah, and the Black Series chassis knows what to do with corners, too.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C63 AMG 2dr Coupe (6.2L 8cyl 7A)
summary: Aesthetic and audible character are what the C63 AMG Black Series bring to the table. We found it hard not to drive with a smile on our face.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Intoxicating throttle blips on rev-matched downshifts send you rifling through the gears with little reason other than audible satisfaction. The V8 sounds awesome. Oh yeah, and the Black Series chassis knows what to do with corners, too.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: This is a willing and smooth V6. Gets a bit loud at high revs. Automatic has subtle shifts, but slow to react in Normal mode. Sport clears that up, but brings stiffer suspension.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Panic brake numbers were aided by summer tires, but a good performance regardless. Brakes were linear around town, not touchy in the least, but plenty of power.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Braking

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Very light in parking lots and around town. Builds effort nicely as speed increases. Wish Sport mode could be adjusted individually to have firmer steering with softer suspension.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Steering

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The optional adjustable suspension sharpens the C350's manners. Even the Normal mode is stiff enough for back roads at a moderate clip. But it's still no BMW 3 Series or Audi A4.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Handling

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The steering is light in normal driving, then builds effort nicely. Supple throttle calibration, smooth-shifting 7-speed automatic transmission. Start/Stop feature reacts quickly.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 3.5-liter V6 has power everywhere on the tach, hustles the car to 60 mph in just 5.6 seconds. The brakes proved fade-free at the track, linear around town. The handling is sporty, but below that of the class-leading BMW 3 Series.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Front seats are firm but comfortable and have bolsters for cornering. The door-side armrests are too low and far way, center armrest is unpadded. Rear seatbacks are overly hard.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C-Class is firm in a typical Germanic way, from the ride to the seats. Hey, it was designed with the Autobahn in mind. The rear seats in particular are surprisingly hard. But the car does a good job of keeping noises on the outside.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: It's far from plush, but the ride in normal suspension mode is supple enough to cancel out all but the harshest bumps. Sport mode can get jiggly on any kind of rough surface.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C-Class is firm in a typical Germanic way, from the ride to the seats. Hey, it was designed with the Autobahn in mind. The rear seats in particular are surprisingly hard. But the car does a good job of keeping noises on the outside.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: This is a very quiet car, other than road noise from the optional summer tires. Near zero wind noise. The engine is very silent, except at full throttle when it gets a bit honky.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The C-Class is firm in a typical Germanic way, from the ride to the seats. Hey, it was designed with the Autobahn in mind. The rear seats in particular are surprisingly hard. But the car does a good job of keeping noises on the outside.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Controls work superbly well. Huge Comand knob for changing radio stations. But three stalks on left side of steering wheel is too much. Can configure IP to show digital speedo.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Easy in/out up front, don't have to duck to avoid roof. Rear doors don't open very wide, but are long, easing entry. Foot can get caught between front seat and door sill on exit.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Door-side elbow room is tight up front, but headroom is good and driver's right knee has room to move. Rear elbow room is decent, but poor foot and knee room, minimal headroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Nice natural driving position, plenty of window surface and smallish pillars all around. The windshield is more upright than most. The optional rearview camera is a bit on the small side.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Front door pockets are small but useful, but no cupholder slots. No front bin, smallish armrest bin. Rear door pockets are useless. Trunk has a wide opening, rear seats fold.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The C-Class has tighter quarters inside than some competitors. But the interior controls are intelligently laid out and mostly easy to use, other than the congested three steering wheel stalks. Interior storage is lacking, though.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: This is a well-made car, with that carved-from-billet Mercedes solidity. Mostly soft-touch materials, some Alcantara, quality controls. Doors close with a solid thunk.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: At its $41,400 base price, the C350 sedan comes with a power sunroof, dual-zone climate control, Bluetooth, the large and easy-to-use Comand central controller and heated seats.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: German cars have become famous for killing you with options. This C350 cost $49,245 as-tested due to adjustable suspension, navigation, back-up camera and blind-spot assist.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The EPA rates the C350 at 20 city/29 highway/23 combined mpg with the standard Start/Stop techhnology. We averaged 21.8 mpg overall, including 27.1 mpg on our 116-mile test route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Both the basic warranty and drivetrain are covered for 4 years/50,000 miles. This is average, and below the 6 years/70,000 miles the Lexus IS carries for its drivetrain.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Roadside assistance is standard but the C-Class does not come with free maintenance. BMW offers it for 4 years/50,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With its rather high base price, the C-Class may not seem like a great value. But when you factor in its superb build quality, stately interior, decent standard features and an overall feeling of luxury, you're getting what you pay for.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Even though the C-Class is the base Mercedes in the U.S., it's an aspirational car. It's a comfortable, luxurious and extremely well-made machine.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Mercedes' adjustable suspension, which is part of the $3,050 Dynamic Sport Package, really livens up the C-Class. The strong, burly-sounding V6 and paddle shifters make nearly any drive fun.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C350 Sport 4dr Sedan (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: There's not as much personality in the C350 as, say, a BMW 3 Series. But this V6 is strong, it really scoots. And with this suspension package, it handles corners with ease.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Mercedes' adjustable suspension, which is part of the $3,050 Dynamic Sport Package, really livens up the C-Class. The strong, burly-sounding V6 and paddle shifters make nearly any drive fun.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: With acceleration to 60 mph in 6.5 seconds, the C300 is average among four-cylinder-powered luxury sedans. It lacks the smoothness and pleasing note of six-cylinder cars in the class, but it's good for a four, and the 7-speed trans works well.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Among four-cylinder luxury sedans, the C300 is one of the most athletic. It's quick to respond to steering inputs, offers decent straight-line speed and stops with the best in the class.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Our C300 test car stopped from 60 in only 114 feet -- an excellent performance for the class. It was fitted with the optional Sport Package which provided sticky summer tires and improved its performance. Pedal feel is excellent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Among four-cylinder luxury sedans, the C300 is one of the most athletic. It's quick to respond to steering inputs, offers decent straight-line speed and stops with the best in the class.
title: Braking

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Electric-assist steering in the C300 provides adequate feedback to guide the car prudently when driving hard. Response to inputs is rapid thanks to low-profile tires and relatively stiff suspension when equipped with the Sport Package.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Among four-cylinder luxury sedans, the C300 is one of the most athletic. It's quick to respond to steering inputs, offers decent straight-line speed and stops with the best in the class.
title: Steering

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: The new C Class demonstrates more athleticisim than previous models, especially when equipped with the Sport Package. Cornering is relatively flat. All-wheel drive stability is obvious and bolsters confidence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Among four-cylinder luxury sedans, the C300 is one of the most athletic. It's quick to respond to steering inputs, offers decent straight-line speed and stops with the best in the class.
title: Handling

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Other than a less-than-pleasing engine note, the C 300 is genuinely pleasant from behind the wheel. It's as easy to navigate around town and in tight quarters as it is on the open road. We witnessed no drivability gaffs.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Among four-cylinder luxury sedans, the C300 is one of the most athletic. It's quick to respond to steering inputs, offers decent straight-line speed and stops with the best in the class.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Big bolsters on the C300's seats give them an aggressive appearance but comfort is good. Grippier material in the seatbottom and seatback would make them more suited to aggressive driving. Heating and ventilation are optional.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As of this writing we've only tested a Sport Package-equipped C-Class, which makes compromises in comfort in an effort to boost performance. Buyers less concerned with performance could avoid the Sport suspension. Enthusiasts likely won't notice.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: With the sport tuned suspension, the ride is stiffer than most in the segment but is rarely if ever offensive. For those who want more comfort, there are two optional suspensions that should smooth things out.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As of this writing we've only tested a Sport Package-equipped C-Class, which makes compromises in comfort in an effort to boost performance. Buyers less concerned with performance could avoid the Sport suspension. Enthusiasts likely won't notice.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: The C300's engine noise is present during full-throttle acceleration and its sound isn't a good one. However, engine noise during cruise and idle are unobtrusive. Wind and tire noise are minimal.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As of this writing we've only tested a Sport Package-equipped C-Class, which makes compromises in comfort in an effort to boost performance. Buyers less concerned with performance could avoid the Sport suspension. Enthusiasts likely won't notice.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Controls are well labeled and well placed. HVAC controls are easily accessed as are navigation, radio and media functions. Some Comand functions are awkward.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With a combination of S-Class opulence and unique C-Class touches, the C300's interior is among the nicest in the class. Controls are well placed, materials are high end and the whole package is assembled with stunning quality.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: An optional flat-bottom steering wheel, which is typically associated with performance, makes entering the C300 easier when positioned correctly. Door apertures are large and door opening angles are adequate.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With a combination of S-Class opulence and unique C-Class touches, the C300's interior is among the nicest in the class. Controls are well placed, materials are high end and the whole package is assembled with stunning quality.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: More rear seat room is available this year, putting the C on par with the former best in class. Its interior, which wraps around occupants, reduces the sense of space. Large rear seat occupants prefered the C over an Audi A4 in testing.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With a combination of S-Class opulence and unique C-Class touches, the C300's interior is among the nicest in the class. Controls are well placed, materials are high end and the whole package is assembled with stunning quality.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: A high waistline and sculpted interior create a small visibility compromise relative to the best cars in the segment. Even so, it's nothing that would keep us from buying the C300. Blind-spot assist and a rear-view camera are optional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With a combination of S-Class opulence and unique C-Class touches, the C300's interior is among the nicest in the class. Controls are well placed, materials are high end and the whole package is assembled with stunning quality.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: At 12.8 cubic feet, the C300's trunk is average for the segment. Its standard rear seats fold completely flat, too. Small item storage isn't abundant in the C300, but its door pockets do offer cupholders and additional storage.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With a combination of S-Class opulence and unique C-Class touches, the C300's interior is among the nicest in the class. Controls are well placed, materials are high end and the whole package is assembled with stunning quality.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Even our pre-production car demonstrates competence in assembly quality. Panels fit well, paint is immaculate and interior materials are the best in the class when optioned with the Interior Package.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though the C300 starts with a comptitive base price, it's very easy to option it to more than $50K. Many will find it worth the money, however, thanks to aggressive new styling inside and out. The C now offers more features and more personality than ever before.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Standard Collision Prevention Assist Plus (autonomous braking), Presafe (tightens belts, preloads brakes) and driver drowsiness monitor are rare, even among the best competitors. Keyless start and auto start/stop are standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though the C300 starts with a comptitive base price, it's very easy to option it to more than $50K. Many will find it worth the money, however, thanks to aggressive new styling inside and out. The C now offers more features and more personality than ever before.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: The C300 4Matic starts in the middle of the range of its competitors' prices. However, it quickly builds to more than $50K with options you'll want. Its $600 Garmin Map Pilot nav system is a good alternative to full-blown nav, however.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though the C300 starts with a comptitive base price, it's very easy to option it to more than $50K. Many will find it worth the money, however, thanks to aggressive new styling inside and out. The C now offers more features and more personality than ever before.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: At 27 mpg Combined, the C300 4Matic offers the best combined fuel economy among its primary competitors. Our testing produced 25.8 mpg in mixed driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though the C300 starts with a comptitive base price, it's very easy to option it to more than $50K. Many will find it worth the money, however, thanks to aggressive new styling inside and out. The C now offers more features and more personality than ever before.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: The C300's warranty is average. Basic: 4 yr./50,000 mile, Drivetrain: 4 yr./50,000 mile.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though the C300 starts with a comptitive base price, it's very easy to option it to more than $50K. Many will find it worth the money, however, thanks to aggressive new styling inside and out. The C now offers more features and more personality than ever before.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Service is not included with the C300. Roadside assistance comes with the 6-month M-Brace trial that's included standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though the C300 starts with a comptitive base price, it's very easy to option it to more than $50K. Many will find it worth the money, however, thanks to aggressive new styling inside and out. The C now offers more features and more personality than ever before.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Though the C300 isn't a true driver's car, it offers dynamics on par with the best cars in the class when it's fitted with the Sport Package.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Sport-trim C300s are stunning machines which shrug off the tight-collared reputation of most Mercedes and replace it with genuinely striking looks and dynamics to back them up.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: C-Class
style.name: C 300 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7A)
summary: Inside and out, the C300 is a stunning machine which provides the styling, features and performance most buyers are looking for in a luxury sedan this size.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Sport-trim C300s are stunning machines which shrug off the tight-collared reputation of most Mercedes and replace it with genuinely striking looks and dynamics to back them up.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Because of the auto-clutch manual transmission, the CLA45 leaves a little soft. Then it takes off, using all 355 turbocharged horses and AWD for a breathtaking 4.7-sec 0-60 time.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: There's no other compact sedan available that can come close to the performance of the CLA45 AMG. Benchmark acceleration, stellar brakes and inspired handling.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Powerful, steady and highly fade-resistant brakes in testing, however, touchy pedal and abrupt engagement require steep learning curve. Difficult to achieve perfect "limo stop."
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: There's no other compact sedan available that can come close to the performance of the CLA45 AMG. Benchmark acceleration, stellar brakes and inspired handling.
title: Braking

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Steering is direct and ultra-precise, yet doesn't offer what we'd categorize as "feel" but rather "resistance" as speed increases. Standard AMG-issue wheel is terrific in hand.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: There's no other compact sedan available that can come close to the performance of the CLA45 AMG. Benchmark acceleration, stellar brakes and inspired handling.
title: Steering

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: One of the most sure-footed sedans available, with loads of grip and true athleticism. Practically unflappable cornering behavior that can actually make use of its sorted AWD.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: There's no other compact sedan available that can come close to the performance of the CLA45 AMG. Benchmark acceleration, stellar brakes and inspired handling.
title: Handling

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Stiff suspension is always busy, and at speeds below 30 mph the confluence of high-performance transmission programming and touchy brakes make it a chore to drive and park.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: There's no other compact sedan available that can come close to the performance of the CLA45 AMG. Benchmark acceleration, stellar brakes and inspired handling.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Superb front sport seats (optional heating), but forward-canted and fixed head restraints might be a problem for some. Rear is cramped in both head- and legroom.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Your tolerance for its stiff-legged suspension will be tested daily. Your rear-seat passengers can be no taller than 5'8". Otherwise the CLA45 is comfortable and appealing.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: There's an obvious price for the CLA45's on-rails handling: poor ride comfort. It's extremely busy and we can't recommend the optional sport suspension that's even stiffer/firmer.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Your tolerance for its stiff-legged suspension will be tested daily. Your rear-seat passengers can be no taller than 5'8". Otherwise the CLA45 is comfortable and appealing.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: There's a distinctive sound to the exhaust that we like. It's especially evident in sport mode under hard acceleration, but otherwise it's as quiet as a Mercedes should be.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Your tolerance for its stiff-legged suspension will be tested daily. Your rear-seat passengers can be no taller than 5'8". Otherwise the CLA45 is comfortable and appealing.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: M-B's multi-controller and optional infotainment upgrade with hi-res screen are intuitive. Standard Bluetooth supplements are well-placed and buttons and gauges are clearly labeled.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Being a Mercedes-Benz, especially an AMG, carries some high expectations, but the CLA45 offers a merely acceptable combination of interior practicality and convenience for a compact sedan.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Despite deeply bolstered sport seats, access up front is easy. Rear ingress/egress, however, is tight due to smallish doors and a steeply sloped roof.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Being a Mercedes-Benz, especially an AMG, carries some high expectations, but the CLA45 offers a merely acceptable combination of interior practicality and convenience for a compact sedan.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: This is a compact sedan in both definition and practice, with the lion's share of space and room afforded to the front passengers. Adult passengers will feel confined in the back.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Being a Mercedes-Benz, especially an AMG, carries some high expectations, but the CLA45 offers a merely acceptable combination of interior practicality and convenience for a compact sedan.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Due to the CLA's thick A- and C-pillars, plus a sloping roofline, we recommend the optional parking aids, blind-spot monitor and rearview camera. Mirrors can help only so much.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Being a Mercedes-Benz, especially an AMG, carries some high expectations, but the CLA45 offers a merely acceptable combination of interior practicality and convenience for a compact sedan.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: At just 13.1 cu-ft, the trunk is decently proportioned, with a large opening and shrouded hinges. Standard split-fold rear seats will help when things get tight.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Being a Mercedes-Benz, especially an AMG, carries some high expectations, but the CLA45 offers a merely acceptable combination of interior practicality and convenience for a compact sedan.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The CLA walks that fine line Mercedes-Benz has been reluctant to approach in the past. Historically high expectations are met, but not exceeded, in this new entry-level Benz.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CLA45 represents an okay value with its AMG-fortified performance and exclusivity, surprisingly decent fuel consumption and competitive warranty.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The base $48,000 CLA45 includes a tremendous turbocharged engine and AWD, but not much else above the standard $30K CLA250. Not included: dual-zone climate control, heated seats, premium audio, etc.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CLA45 represents an okay value with its AMG-fortified performance and exclusivity, surprisingly decent fuel consumption and competitive warranty.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: In raw terms, you will find few cars with this much performance for this car's $55,265 as-tested price. Part of this car's cost is also owed to AMG exclusivity, which does have its value.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CLA45 represents an okay value with its AMG-fortified performance and exclusivity, surprisingly decent fuel consumption and competitive warranty.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: It's rated by the EPA at 26 mpg Combined (23 City/31 Highway). We found those values to be dead-on with our own 26.4 mpg on Edmunds' evaluation loop and precisely 23 mpg in the city.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CLA45 represents an okay value with its AMG-fortified performance and exclusivity, surprisingly decent fuel consumption and competitive warranty.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The 4-year/50,000-mile basic warranty that includes roadside assistance is competitive, especially considering the high-performance nature of the CLA45 itself.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CLA45 represents an okay value with its AMG-fortified performance and exclusivity, surprisingly decent fuel consumption and competitive warranty.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Prepaid Mercedes maintenance is offered at additional cost, but BMW offers it for free. 24-hr roadside assistance is included, as is six months of mbrace emergency telematics.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The CLA45 represents an okay value with its AMG-fortified performance and exclusivity, surprisingly decent fuel consumption and competitive warranty.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Because of its performance-tuned ride, transmission and brakes, you'll grit your teeth most of the time driving the CLA45. But drive it hard on the right road, and all is forgiven.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CLA45 is tremendously fun to drive about 10 percent of the time and tolerable for the remainder. Of course, those values reverse if you happen to live at the top of a smooth, serpentine mountain road.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA45 AMG 4dr Sedan AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Driving the CLA45 is sort of like keeping a juicy secret to yourself. You know what the car can do, but most other drivers/passengers will probably be shocked.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The CLA45 is tremendously fun to drive about 10 percent of the time and tolerable for the remainder. Of course, those values reverse if you happen to live at the top of a smooth, serpentine mountain road.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: With 208 horsepower from a turbocharged four-cylinder and a quick-shifting dual-clutch automatic, the CLA250 accelerates effortlessly, especially from 20 mph on. From a standstill, we got it to 60 mph in 6.4 seconds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CLA250 offers enough performance to impress owners of the larger C-Class, with its strong four-cylinder and lightning-fast upshifts from the 7-speed transmission. Unfortunately, that same transmission can be quirky in normal driving.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Even in heavy traffic the CLA's brakes were linear and easy to modulate, never grabby. We recorded a panic-stop distance of 121 feet from 60 mph.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CLA250 offers enough performance to impress owners of the larger C-Class, with its strong four-cylinder and lightning-fast upshifts from the 7-speed transmission. Unfortunately, that same transmission can be quirky in normal driving.
title: Braking

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The CLA250's steering is nicely weighted; not too heavy, not too light. Turn-in is sharp and there's enough articulation for easy parking. Actual feedback/feel is on the low side, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CLA250 offers enough performance to impress owners of the larger C-Class, with its strong four-cylinder and lightning-fast upshifts from the 7-speed transmission. Unfortunately, that same transmission can be quirky in normal driving.
title: Steering

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Though it won't be confused with a sports car, the CLA250 has enough poise and control to feel stable on a mountain road or a fast highway offramp curve.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CLA250 offers enough performance to impress owners of the larger C-Class, with its strong four-cylinder and lightning-fast upshifts from the 7-speed transmission. Unfortunately, that same transmission can be quirky in normal driving.
title: Handling

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The CLA's dual-clutch automatic can be slow to react to your commands, like when making a three-point turn. It also allows rollback, and at times its operation makes it feel like the engine is over-revving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The CLA250 offers enough performance to impress owners of the larger C-Class, with its strong four-cylinder and lightning-fast upshifts from the 7-speed transmission. Unfortunately, that same transmission can be quirky in normal driving.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The CLA's seats offer nice bolstering, but have a short cushion that lacks thigh support. Mercedes' MBTex faux leather feels exceptional and durable, but lacks ventilation. Prepare to feel sticky.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The CLA250 falls in between the expectations of a sport sedan and a luxury car. This may be the least expensive Mercedes, but it sure doesn't feel entry-level in terms of its suspension capabilities or the cabin's noise suppression.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: A mixed bag here. The CLA250 handles potholes and breaks in the pavement with zero drama, but gets jostled by seams in the highway and pulled around by grooved pavement.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The CLA250 falls in between the expectations of a sport sedan and a luxury car. This may be the least expensive Mercedes, but it sure doesn't feel entry-level in terms of its suspension capabilities or the cabin's noise suppression.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: In true Mercedes fashion, the CLA250 is quiet at all speeds and does an admirable job blocking out the ambient sounds you'll find on the road.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The CLA250 falls in between the expectations of a sport sedan and a luxury car. This may be the least expensive Mercedes, but it sure doesn't feel entry-level in terms of its suspension capabilities or the cabin's noise suppression.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The CLA's interior is deceptively simple and remarkably easy to use, with a large infotainment screen, clear gauges and an easy knob/button-based climate control. The gear-selector stalk is love-it or hate-it.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A traditional Mercedes-Benz interior design in that it isn't flashy, but it surprises with its ease of use. Limited rear seat access and space, and lackluster visibility, hurt the CLA's score in this category.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Front seat access is a non-issue with wide door openings and a reasonably high seat. Rear seat access is hugely problematic. Thanks to the sloping roof, there just isn't enough head clearance.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A traditional Mercedes-Benz interior design in that it isn't flashy, but it surprises with its ease of use. Limited rear seat access and space, and lackluster visibility, hurt the CLA's score in this category.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: While the CLA250 has a similar footprint to the C-Class, the interior feels tighter. Not unpleasant, but cozy. Rear seats have good legroom but, severely lack headroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A traditional Mercedes-Benz interior design in that it isn't flashy, but it surprises with its ease of use. Limited rear seat access and space, and lackluster visibility, hurt the CLA's score in this category.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Our test car was optioned with a rear-view camera, a near-necessity due to the CLA's poor rear visibility. You can thank that sloping roofline. Driving this car definitely requires proper mirror adjustment.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A traditional Mercedes-Benz interior design in that it isn't flashy, but it surprises with its ease of use. Limited rear seat access and space, and lackluster visibility, hurt the CLA's score in this category.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: At 13.1 cu-ft, the trunk is decently proportioned, with a large opening and shrouded hinges. Standard split-fold rear seats will help when things get tight.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A traditional Mercedes-Benz interior design in that it isn't flashy, but it surprises with its ease of use. Limited rear seat access and space, and lackluster visibility, hurt the CLA's score in this category.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Meticulous types will be able to find some bits on the CLA that wouldn't make it to the C-Class. But most everything you touch, from steering wheel to stalks, switches, the COMAND controller or the seats, feels like a Mercedes.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's hard to argue with a car that looks and feels exactly like a Mercedes-Benz (because it is), yet starts under $30,000.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Our test car included iPod interface, dual-zone climate control, 5.8-inch navigation screen, rear-view camera, auto-dimming mirrors and heated seats. These are all optional. Automatic lights and Bluetooth come standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's hard to argue with a car that looks and feels exactly like a Mercedes-Benz (because it is), yet starts under $30,000.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: CLA pricing can be a murky subject. Our test car stickered at a reasonable $35,495, far cheaper than a similarly equipped C-Class. But that price also represents a totally loaded Honda Accord V6.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's hard to argue with a car that looks and feels exactly like a Mercedes-Benz (because it is), yet starts under $30,000.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The EPA rates the CLA250 at 30 mpg Combined (26 City/ 38 Highway). On our 116-mile evaluation route we managed 36.7 mpg. Impressive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's hard to argue with a car that looks and feels exactly like a Mercedes-Benz (because it is), yet starts under $30,000.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The 2014 CLA250 carries a four-year/50,000-mile warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's hard to argue with a car that looks and feels exactly like a Mercedes-Benz (because it is), yet starts under $30,000.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: There is no free scheduled maintenance with the CLA250, but pre-paid maintance and an mbrace emergency notification suite is available for a fee.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's hard to argue with a car that looks and feels exactly like a Mercedes-Benz (because it is), yet starts under $30,000.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The CLA's overall driving experience is dependent upon your surroundings. It's a little funky at slow speeds and has a slightly firm suspension. But on smooth roads and freeways? The CLA250 is a gem.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite the transmission's inconsistencies at slow speeds, the CLA250 makes good power and has a sporty feel that makes you want to keep driving.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: CLA-Class
style.name: CLA250 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: How often do you get to tell your friends you just bought a brand new Mercedes-Benz?
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite the transmission's inconsistencies at slow speeds, the CLA250 makes good power and has a sporty feel that makes you want to keep driving.
title: Personality

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: 0-60 mph in 6.0 seconds is a few tenths slower than some rivals but still plenty fast for most drivers. Gear shifts are incredibly smooth and passing slower traffic is effortless.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350's 302-hp 3.5-liter V6 is comparable to other mid-range luxury sedans, but overall the E-Class lacks some performance versus a few rivals. The sport-tuned suspension did not quite live up to our expectations in terms of athleticism.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Panic stops from 60 mph needed only 110 feet, which is expected for sedans like these with summer tires. The pedal remained moderately firm with little nosedive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350's 302-hp 3.5-liter V6 is comparable to other mid-range luxury sedans, but overall the E-Class lacks some performance versus a few rivals. The sport-tuned suspension did not quite live up to our expectations in terms of athleticism.
title: Braking

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Steering effort is far too light and lacks feedback. The wheel is slow to center, and we occasionally outran the power assist during slalom testing, resulting in a weird squishy resistance.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350's 302-hp 3.5-liter V6 is comparable to other mid-range luxury sedans, but overall the E-Class lacks some performance versus a few rivals. The sport-tuned suspension did not quite live up to our expectations in terms of athleticism.
title: Steering

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Odd rebounds were evident during hard cornering, made worse by mid-corner bumps. The 4Matic all-wheel-drive kept it on the intended path, but handling lacked confidence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350's 302-hp 3.5-liter V6 is comparable to other mid-range luxury sedans, but overall the E-Class lacks some performance versus a few rivals. The sport-tuned suspension did not quite live up to our expectations in terms of athleticism.
title: Handling

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Engine auto start/stop is fairly smooth and quick to respond. The E350 is best suited to the daily commute and leisure touring. The light steering does make parking in tight spots effortless.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350's 302-hp 3.5-liter V6 is comparable to other mid-range luxury sedans, but overall the E-Class lacks some performance versus a few rivals. The sport-tuned suspension did not quite live up to our expectations in terms of athleticism.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Front seats are well shaped and padded, and were still comfy after many hours in the saddle. Taller drivers may find the seat cushion lacks thigh support. MB Tex faux leather is very convincing and breathes well.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The E350's cabin puts an emphasis on comfort and luxury. Average-sized adults will find all seats acceptable for long periods, but taller folk may lack thigh support. The optional Sport package compromised ride quality slightly.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The optional Sport suspension smoothes out smaller road imperfections, but moderate bumps on the highway cause an unsettling lurch followed by a few odd rebounds.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The E350's cabin puts an emphasis on comfort and luxury. Average-sized adults will find all seats acceptable for long periods, but taller folk may lack thigh support. The optional Sport package compromised ride quality slightly.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Road and wind noise are barely detectable at highway speeds and over a variety of surfaces. Creaks and squeaks from the interior were non-existent.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The E350's cabin puts an emphasis on comfort and luxury. Average-sized adults will find all seats acceptable for long periods, but taller folk may lack thigh support. The optional Sport package compromised ride quality slightly.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: All buttons and knobs are thoughtfully placed, particularly the single COMAND dial that rests perfectly under your right hand. The display is sharp and easy to navigate.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The E350 is stately with old-school luxury and new-tech capabilities. Materials are top-notch and all controls are right where they should be. After a very short period, the quick-reacting COMAND interface becomes second nature.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Appropriately sized doors make access easy in tight parking spaces and the door frames don't obstruct, either.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The E350 is stately with old-school luxury and new-tech capabilities. Materials are top-notch and all controls are right where they should be. After a very short period, the quick-reacting COMAND interface becomes second nature.

model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: All seats have enough head- and legroom for the average adult, though seat cushions are low and slightly reclined.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The E350 is stately with old-school luxury and new-tech capabilities. Materials are top-notch and all controls are right where they should be. After a very short period, the quick-reacting COMAND interface becomes second nature.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Excellent forward visibility. Angled A-pillars to make them seem thinner. Rear visibility is good, but backing into small spots requires reliance on the optional rearview camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The E350 is stately with old-school luxury and new-tech capabilities. Materials are top-notch and all controls are right where they should be. After a very short period, the quick-reacting COMAND interface becomes second nature.

model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Good-sized pockets, bins and removable cupholders. Generous 15.9 cu-ft trunk is larger than most and features a low liftover, remote rear seat releases and no obstructions.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The E350 is stately with old-school luxury and new-tech capabilities. Materials are top-notch and all controls are right where they should be. After a very short period, the quick-reacting COMAND interface becomes second nature.
