make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: There is no doubt the E350 is well built. All interior elements are well constructed and free of squeaks and creaks. Previous E-Class generations did feel a bit more solid, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $65,300, our generously optioned E350 4Matic is priced right with similarly equipped AWD luxury sedans in its class. The Sport package (sport suspension and styling) is a no-cost option that we would skip.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Standard features and option pricing are comparable for the class, but navigation and a rearview camera are only offered with the $3,870 Premium 1 package, not as standalone options.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $65,300, our generously optioned E350 4Matic is priced right with similarly equipped AWD luxury sedans in its class. The Sport package (sport suspension and styling) is a no-cost option that we would skip.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The base E350 $51,900 sticker is a few thousand less than the Audi A6 and BMW 5 Series, but about $5,000 more than a Jaguar XF. Adding options eventually evens the playing field.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $65,300, our generously optioned E350 4Matic is priced right with similarly equipped AWD luxury sedans in its class. The Sport package (sport suspension and styling) is a no-cost option that we would skip.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: With an EPA-estimated 24 mpg Combined (20 City/29 Hwy), the E350 4Matic is typical for the class. We averaged 25.8 mpg on our evaluation loop, but only 18.7 over our two weeks with the car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $65,300, our generously optioned E350 4Matic is priced right with similarly equipped AWD luxury sedans in its class. The Sport package (sport suspension and styling) is a no-cost option that we would skip.
title: MPG

model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The E-Class' 4-year/50,000-mile basic and powertrain warranty is the same as other mid-sized luxury sedans in this class. Factory extended warranties are available at added cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $65,300, our generously optioned E350 4Matic is priced right with similarly equipped AWD luxury sedans in its class. The Sport package (sport suspension and styling) is a no-cost option that we would skip.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Prepaid Mercedes maintenance is offered at additional cost but BMW offers it for free. 24-hr roadside assistance is included, as is six months of mbrace emergency telematics.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $65,300, our generously optioned E350 4Matic is priced right with similarly equipped AWD luxury sedans in its class. The Sport package (sport suspension and styling) is a no-cost option that we would skip.

style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Think of the E350 only as a luxury sedan and it will certainly satisfy, though we would again caution against the Sport package's stiffer suspension that degrades the ride.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Even with the Sport package and its sport-tuned suspension, the Benz isn't quite at the performance standards of Audi and BMW. All-wheel-drive keeps it solidly on the road, but this car should be thought of as a luxury sedan, not a sport sedan.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Sport 4MATIC 4dr Sedan AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: The E350 is as luxury sedans should be: stately, warm and sophisticated. The Sport package adds a slightly disingenuous visual athleticism that isn't backed up on the road.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Even with the Sport package and its sport-tuned suspension, the Benz isn't quite at the performance standards of Audi and BMW. All-wheel-drive keeps it solidly on the road, but this car should be thought of as a luxury sedan, not a sport sedan.

style.name: E350 Luxury 4MATIC 4dr Wagon AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Maybe running to 60 mph in 6.5 seconds doesn't matter to you, but the E350 Wagon will do it with ease. It nearly reaches 100 mph in the quarter-mile.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350 Sport Wagon is one of the best-performing wagons available: Powerful 302-hp V6, standard all-wheel drive, strong brakes, capable suspension and excellent overall drivability.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: E-Class
style.name: E350 Luxury 4MATIC 4dr Wagon AWD (3.5L 6cyl 7A)
summary: Responsive, strong brakes stopped our test car in just 109 feet. Excellent fade resistance and pedal feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350 Sport Wagon is one of the best-performing wagons available: Powerful 302-hp V6, standard all-wheel drive, strong brakes, capable suspension and excellent overall drivability.

summary: Weak on-center feel from new electric-assist system, but still a sense of stability. Slightly isolated overall, but always precise when cornering.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The E350 Sport Wagon is one of the best-performing wagons available: Powerful 302-hp V6, standard all-wheel drive, strong brakes, capable suspension and excellent overall drivability.

ratings.summary: The E350 Wagon blends old world craftsmanship with new world tech in a way that few makers can. Plenty of room all around for a midsize wagon, plus unexpected rear-facing 3rd row seat.

summary: There's something satisfying about a vehicle that does exactly what it was designed to do, then goes further with surprising performance, features and options in a wagon.

ratings.summary: We weren't expecting to call the E350 Sport Wagon fun to drive. But we just did.

summary: A refined appearance that still expresses the Mercedes-Benz image, perfect for its very exclusive owner group. For a more outgoing appearance, choose the E63 AMG wagon.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Deceptively quick, undramatic acceleration. Very impressive 2.0-liter turbo 4-cyl engine doesn't feel turbocharged. 0-60 in 5.2 seconds. Gearing spacing is too tall. Sluggish responses from 7-speed automatic gearbox when launching from a stop.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Brilliant engine, loads of torque, yet is civilized. Very rapid. You would never know how powerful it is when just trundling around. Transmission a bit slow-witted when leaving a stoplight. Sharp steering and suspension tuning plus terrific brakes encourage fast driving.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Short, secure, ultra-consistent stops every time. Very little nosedive or side-to-side squirm. 60-0 in 104 feet, an excellent result. Nicely firm pedal that's easy to modulate in around-town or spirited driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Brilliant engine, loads of torque, yet is civilized. Very rapid. You would never know how powerful it is when just trundling around. Transmission a bit slow-witted when leaving a stoplight. Sharp steering and suspension tuning plus terrific brakes encourage fast driving.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Very nicely weighted and friction-free steering, appropriately quick and linear. Not a whole lot of feel - it's somewhat inert. This car's path accuracy is very good -- goes right where you point it.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Brilliant engine, loads of torque, yet is civilized. Very rapid. You would never know how powerful it is when just trundling around. Transmission a bit slow-witted when leaving a stoplight. Sharp steering and suspension tuning plus terrific brakes encourage fast driving.

summary: Sharp all the way to its limits, which are pretty high yet still accessible. Very little body roll. Can be upset by midcorner bumps. Handling balance can be adjusted with the throttle, which we like. ESC not intrusive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Brilliant engine, loads of torque, yet is civilized. Very rapid. You would never know how powerful it is when just trundling around. Transmission a bit slow-witted when leaving a stoplight. Sharp steering and suspension tuning plus terrific brakes encourage fast driving.

model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Stop/start works pretty smoothly but can be sluggish when leaving the line. Very good grade logic, holds gears even on modest inclines. Audible thump from rear of car when coming to a stop. Some engine vibration comes through the steering wheel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Brilliant engine, loads of torque, yet is civilized. Very rapid. You would never know how powerful it is when just trundling around. Transmission a bit slow-witted when leaving a stoplight. Sharp steering and suspension tuning plus terrific brakes encourage fast driving.

summary: Front seats are comfortable though seat bottom might be too narrow for some people. Road butt sets in after a couple of hours due to padding that's on the firm side. Backseat is rather upright.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Supportive front seats and an effective sporting ride quality. If your idea of comfort is control, you will like the GLA 45. It's not very quiet, though.

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Ride quality is firm, but it manages to pick up its feet over and absorb bumps. This is a sporty-riding car, but it's well-damped and not crashy. Dampers have one setting.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Supportive front seats and an effective sporting ride quality. If your idea of comfort is control, you will like the GLA 45. It's not very quiet, though.

model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Prominent wind noise from a-pillar and front window area even when not at high speed. Buzzy exhaust note when under any load, though is quiet at a cruise. Some road noise but not excessive. Structure-borne thrum as revs coast down.

summary: Multimedia screen in center stack showing its age, screen flow can be clumsy. Steering wheel feels good with alcantara inserts. Glossy carbon fiber trim reflects into face when sunny out. Knob-based climate controls a plus.

model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Easy ingress, egress. Doors open wide, roofline low, minor B-pillar intrusion at sill. Backseat is upright, has wheelwell intrusion, roofline drops down in rear. Backseat has vents, flip-down console with two cupholders and a passthru.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Space and visibility are the same as a compact hatchback, but you're paying a price that's closer to a luxury full-size SUV. The multimedia interface works well but is showing its age.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Decent headroom, aided by no sunroof (huzzah!). Good shoulder room. Good rear headroom; head is close to curving roof near door. Cutouts in front seatback back provide knee clearance, but there's not much legroom back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Space and visibility are the same as a compact hatchback, but you're paying a price that's closer to a luxury full-size SUV. The multimedia interface works well but is showing its age.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Greenhouse not especially large, as the cowl and beltline are modestly high. B-pillars are quite wide, C-pillars are monolithic, and the greenhouse tapers as it goes back.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Space and visibility are the same as a compact hatchback, but you're paying a price that's closer to a luxury full-size SUV. The multimedia interface works well but is showing its age.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Power liftgate, 60/40 split seat, reasonable liftover. Cargo area (17.2 cu-ft) would be average for a compact hatchback (which the GLA actually is), but is far less than what others offer. Small item cabin storage is excellent.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Space and visibility are the same as a compact hatchback, but you're paying a price that's closer to a luxury full-size SUV. The multimedia interface works well but is showing its age.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Interior material quality is a mixed bag, with leather and low-rent plastic surfaces. Optional steering wheel in our test car is strikingly nice with synthetic suede grips. Stitching and trim primps it up but can't overcome the humdrum vibe.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricey to start, plus many items are optional and often bundled into packages. The cabin shows its entry-level roots despite the gussying-up that's been done. Fuel economy is surprisingly good even with some hard driving thrown in.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Base price of $49,225 is lofty for the equipment it comes with, which is not much. Summer tires are standard, as are crash alerts, power seats with lumbar and rain-sensing wipers. You're paying for performance here.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricey to start, plus many items are optional and often bundled into packages. The cabin shows its entry-level roots despite the gussying-up that's been done. Fuel economy is surprisingly good even with some hard driving thrown in.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Options add up quickly. Our test car included $15,500 in options, many of which were bundled into packages, which might frustrate some buyers. Other options were simply needless fripperies. Overall, you gotta pay to play.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricey to start, plus many items are optional and often bundled into packages. The cabin shows its entry-level roots despite the gussying-up that's been done. Fuel economy is surprisingly good even with some hard driving thrown in.
title: Cost

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: 25 combined mpg (23 city/29 highway) is a good result considering the performance. We observed 27.7 mpg on our 115-mile evaluation loop and 20.1 mpg over nearly 900 miles of mixed driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricey to start, plus many items are optional and often bundled into packages. The cabin shows its entry-level roots despite the gussying-up that's been done. Fuel economy is surprisingly good even with some hard driving thrown in.
title: MPG

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Basic coverage is 4 years/50,000 miles, and the drivetrain warranty is likewise 4 years/50,000 miles
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricey to start, plus many items are optional and often bundled into packages. The cabin shows its entry-level roots despite the gussying-up that's been done. Fuel economy is surprisingly good even with some hard driving thrown in.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Free scheduled maintenance is not included, unlike the BMW X1, which includes it for 4 years/50,000 miles. The GLA has roadside assistance for 4 years/50,000 miles. A six-month trial of mbrace emergency telematics is standard.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricey to start, plus many items are optional and often bundled into packages. The cabin shows its entry-level roots despite the gussying-up that's been done. Fuel economy is surprisingly good even with some hard driving thrown in.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: This engine is a gem. All four-cylinders should be replaced with this one. The gearbox lacks the engine's brilliance. Otherwise, this is a sharp-driving little hatchback that begs to be thrown around.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's not a lot of competition for the GLA 45 in the USA, as high-performance premium compact SUVs are in their infancy. It does set a high-water performance mark that, admittedly, is bettered by the lighter CLA 45 sedan. It could stand to lose some weight. Shorter gearing would be nice, too.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mercedes-Benz
model.name: GLA-Class
style.name: GLA 45 AMG 4MATIC 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Such a rorty little hoot to drive. Not a good sounding engine. It's all exhaust note, and on overrun has the typical grating 4cyl not-goodness. Volkswagen makes I-4 turbos sound good, so it's possible. Garish, adolescent styling.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's not a lot of competition for the GLA 45 in the USA, as high-performance premium compact SUVs are in their infancy. It does set a high-water performance mark that, admittedly, is bettered by the lighter CLA 45 sedan. It could stand to lose some weight. Shorter gearing would be nice, too.
title: Personality

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: It's impressive that the Mini hits 60 mph in 7.4 sec. with a turbo 3-cylinder engine producing 134 hp. One of the quickest cars in its class/price range. Our test vehicle was prone to uneven acceleration and unexpected surges, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mini's reputation for playful driving dynamics is confirmed, even with this base model. The high level of confidence encourages spirited driving, but it stumbles during traffic-filled commuting, with some inelegant lurches at low speeds from the optional 6-sp automatic transmission.
title: Acceleration

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Stopping from 60 mph required only 114 feet, which is expected from a car like this with summer tires. In everyday driving, the automatic transmission causes clumsy lurches as you roll to a stop.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mini's reputation for playful driving dynamics is confirmed, even with this base model. The high level of confidence encourages spirited driving, but it stumbles during traffic-filled commuting, with some inelegant lurches at low speeds from the optional 6-sp automatic transmission.
title: Braking

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Steering feel is sharp and direct, which is great for drivers with a penchant for curvy roads. For the typical commuter, it could feel a bit too busy or quick, particularly on the highway, as it reacts to small or unintentional inputs.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mini's reputation for playful driving dynamics is confirmed, even with this base model. The high level of confidence encourages spirited driving, but it stumbles during traffic-filled commuting, with some inelegant lurches at low speeds from the optional 6-sp automatic transmission.
title: Steering

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Despite being the base model Cooper, it's surprisingly capable when cornering hard. The front tires lose grip first, but it's predictable and controllable. The Cooper feels playful and nimble thanks to its small footprint.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mini's reputation for playful driving dynamics is confirmed, even with this base model. The high level of confidence encourages spirited driving, but it stumbles during traffic-filled commuting, with some inelegant lurches at low speeds from the optional 6-sp automatic transmission.
title: Handling

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mini Cooper is a fun little car to blast through the canyons, but it suffers during more mundane driving. The lurches under slow acceleration and braking are the main culprits, along with noticable shudder from the automatic start/stop.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Mini's reputation for playful driving dynamics is confirmed, even with this base model. The high level of confidence encourages spirited driving, but it stumbles during traffic-filled commuting, with some inelegant lurches at low speeds from the optional 6-sp automatic transmission.
title: Driveability

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The optional sport seats provide excellent all-around support for drivers with average builds. Wider body types will likely find the narrow, aggressive bolsters constricting or intrusive. Cushioning is adequate for longer drives.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Mini doesn't rate high in comfort thanks to its emphasis on athleticism. The stiff ride quality can be jarring, partially a result of our test car's optional 17-in. wheels and standard run-flat tires. Less spirited drivers should stick with the smaller standard wheels.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mini has a stiff ride quality with initial impact harshness that may be attributed to the larger optional wheels and run-flat tires. Enthusiasts will probably be okay with it, but we think most drivers will find it tiresome.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Mini doesn't rate high in comfort thanks to its emphasis on athleticism. The stiff ride quality can be jarring, partially a result of our test car's optional 17-in. wheels and standard run-flat tires. Less spirited drivers should stick with the smaller standard wheels.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: At idle the direct-injected 3-cylinder engine has an unrefined diesel-like clatter. Once underway it sounds much better, with a pleasant burble. There's a noticeable amount of road noise, and at highway speeds there's some wind noise, too.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Mini doesn't rate high in comfort thanks to its emphasis on athleticism. The stiff ride quality can be jarring, partially a result of our test car's optional 17-in. wheels and standard run-flat tires. Less spirited drivers should stick with the smaller standard wheels.
title: Quietness

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The low-mounted infotainment dial makes operation challenging and is obstructed by the center armrest and parking brake. The system itself is well executed, as are the many logically-placed switches and buttons.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although this latest generation Mini Cooper is larger than before, it's still challenged when it comes to interior space and cargo capacity, both of which are smaller than some rivals. The placement of the infotainment controller is far from ideal. You do get a lot of personality, though.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The short (lengthwise) doors and tall opening make getting in and out of the front seats easy, even in tight spots. They do, however, complicate access to the rear seats, forcing an inelegant stoop and crawl.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although this latest generation Mini Cooper is larger than before, it's still challenged when it comes to interior space and cargo capacity, both of which are smaller than some rivals. The placement of the infotainment controller is far from ideal. You do get a lot of personality, though.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: There's plenty of headroom in the front seats for taller drivers, but the Mini still feels quite compact because of its narrow width. Rear seats are very small, even for children, with a lack of legroom plus low-mounted seat cushions.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although this latest generation Mini Cooper is larger than before, it's still challenged when it comes to interior space and cargo capacity, both of which are smaller than some rivals. The placement of the infotainment controller is far from ideal. You do get a lot of personality, though.
title: Space/Room

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Overall visibility is excellent. The tall side windows and upright windshield afford a nearly unobstructed view, and the mirrors are thoughtfully placed and sized. No need for a rearview camera when backing into a tight parking spot.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although this latest generation Mini Cooper is larger than before, it's still challenged when it comes to interior space and cargo capacity, both of which are smaller than some rivals. The placement of the infotainment controller is far from ideal. You do get a lot of personality, though.
title: Visibility

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Cargo space is tight, at a tiny 8.7 cubic-feet, as is interior storage with small but numerous bins. Maximum cargo is slightly above-average at 38 cu-ft. A clever trunk floor panel evens out the load surface and hides a bin underneath.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Although this latest generation Mini Cooper is larger than before, it's still challenged when it comes to interior space and cargo capacity, both of which are smaller than some rivals. The placement of the infotainment controller is far from ideal. You do get a lot of personality, though.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: For the most part, the Mini has excellent interior materials with less hard plastic than competitors. We did detect some creaks from time to time, and that tends to slightly diminish the overall impression of quality.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price starting just under $21,000, the base Mini Cooper is $2,000-$3,000 more than other hatchbacks. In terms of standard feature content, you're not getting much extra, but the Mini does boast stronger performance, free maintenance and far more personality.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Many of the Mini's unique features are cosmetic and add some personality. Otherwise, standard features (automatic climate control, audio input and Bluetooth) are comparable to other hatchbacks, but it still remains more expensive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price starting just under $21,000, the base Mini Cooper is $2,000-$3,000 more than other hatchbacks. In terms of standard feature content, you're not getting much extra, but the Mini does boast stronger performance, free maintenance and far more personality.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Our test vehicle was appointed with almost every option package plus the automatic transmission, bringing the as-tested price all the way to $33,095. While some Mini features are unique, it's still significantly more expensive than rivals.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price starting just under $21,000, the base Mini Cooper is $2,000-$3,000 more than other hatchbacks. In terms of standard feature content, you're not getting much extra, but the Mini does boast stronger performance, free maintenance and far more personality.
title: Cost

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: EPA estimates of 31 mpg Combined (28 City/37 Highway) are above average for the class. These figures were confirmed by our 32.4-mpg average during a mixed driving loop and a 26.4-mpg overall average with some aggressive driving.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price starting just under $21,000, the base Mini Cooper is $2,000-$3,000 more than other hatchbacks. In terms of standard feature content, you're not getting much extra, but the Mini does boast stronger performance, free maintenance and far more personality.
title: MPG

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Mini's 4-year/50,000-mile coverage for both the basic warranty and the drivetrain is typical for cars in this class. Extended factory coverage up to 7 years/100,000 miles is available at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price starting just under $21,000, the base Mini Cooper is $2,000-$3,000 more than other hatchbacks. In terms of standard feature content, you're not getting much extra, but the Mini does boast stronger performance, free maintenance and far more personality.
title: Warranty

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Free maintenance for 3 years/36,000 miles comes standard, an unusual bonus for cars in this class. Four years of included roadside assistance with unlimited mileage put the Mini slightly above average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: With a base price starting just under $21,000, the base Mini Cooper is $2,000-$3,000 more than other hatchbacks. In terms of standard feature content, you're not getting much extra, but the Mini does boast stronger performance, free maintenance and far more personality.
title: Ownership

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mini Cooper is as fun a car as you'll find at this price, but shoppers should pay attention to how it behaves in normal driving conditions. If heavy traffic is typical in your commute, there are better choices out there.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun has always been Mini's strong suit, and this latest Cooper is no exception. Sure, ride quality and overall refinement suffer as a result, but those qualities are usually secondary to entertainment and personality when it comes to potential owners.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: 2dr Hatchback (1.5L 3cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: If there's one thing the Mini Cooper has in spades, it's personality. In both appearance and driving, its playful nature is unique. Some elements of the interior are gimmicky, but the strong execution keeps it from feeling cheap.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun has always been Mini's strong suit, and this latest Cooper is no exception. Sure, ride quality and overall refinement suffer as a result, but those qualities are usually secondary to entertainment and personality when it comes to potential owners.
title: Personality

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cooper S reached 60 mph in 6.3 seconds, which is about equal to the VW GTI and slightly quicker than the Ford Focus ST. The optional 6-sp automatic gives quick and smooth shifts and there's no sign of turbo lag or torque steer.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We simply can't find a downside to having two more doors on a Mini Cooper. If anything, the longer wheelbase makes the steering less nervous while improving the ride quality. The Cooper S engine not only makes more power than the base 3-cylinder, but it's smoother and more refined.
title: Acceleration

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Took 116 feet to stop from 60 mph during our panic-brake test, about average for the class. It remained composed and controllable, though the pedal got soft after heavy use. Less lurchiness coming to a stop than with base car, too.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We simply can't find a downside to having two more doors on a Mini Cooper. If anything, the longer wheelbase makes the steering less nervous while improving the ride quality. The Cooper S engine not only makes more power than the base 3-cylinder, but it's smoother and more refined.
title: Braking

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Steering feel and effort are excellent, with good precision and responsiveness. The larger four-door footprint keeps it from being as busy or nervous as the two-door Cooper. It's a win-win!
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We simply can't find a downside to having two more doors on a Mini Cooper. If anything, the longer wheelbase makes the steering less nervous while improving the ride quality. The Cooper S engine not only makes more power than the base 3-cylinder, but it's smoother and more refined.
title: Steering

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Right out of the gate, the Cooper S gains your trust with its tenacious grip. This encourages spirited driving, making it fun to explore the car's potential. Mid-corner bumps are barely felt, the car just keeps delivering thrills.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We simply can't find a downside to having two more doors on a Mini Cooper. If anything, the longer wheelbase makes the steering less nervous while improving the ride quality. The Cooper S engine not only makes more power than the base 3-cylinder, but it's smoother and more refined.
title: Handling

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cooper S has smooth power delivery, without the inelegant lurches we noticed in the base car. It's as adept at the daily commute as it is on a twisty road. The automatic start/stop system is unrefined, but it can be easily turned off.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We simply can't find a downside to having two more doors on a Mini Cooper. If anything, the longer wheelbase makes the steering less nervous while improving the ride quality. The Cooper S engine not only makes more power than the base 3-cylinder, but it's smoother and more refined.
title: Driveability

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Average-sized drivers should find the optional sport seats comfortable and supportive, but wider passengers will probably feel a bit confined. Cushioning is just generous enough, seats are contoured well for long road trips.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The four-door's longer wheelbase greatly benefits ride comfort, feeling much more settled than the base-level two-door version. Avoiding the larger, optional wheels and run-flat tires will further improve the ride quality.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Cooper S has a slightly stiffer ride than the base model, but this is expected due to its sporty intentions. The ride still avoids being overly harsh, and drivers seeking a softer ride should avoid the larger wheels and run-flat tires.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The four-door's longer wheelbase greatly benefits ride comfort, feeling much more settled than the base-level two-door version. Avoiding the larger, optional wheels and run-flat tires will further improve the ride quality.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The turbo 4-cylinder sounds good from idle to redline without being obnoxious or annoying. This is in contrast to the rather rattly base engine. Road noise is present but not intrusive on the highway and the same holds true for wind noise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The four-door's longer wheelbase greatly benefits ride comfort, feeling much more settled than the base-level two-door version. Avoiding the larger, optional wheels and run-flat tires will further improve the ride quality.
title: Quietness

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Primary controls, gauges and screens are well placed and easy to read. The low-mounted infotainment controller is difficult to reach, especially with the center armrest obstructing access. Too bad, because the system itself works well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For those who may have considered a Mini Cooper in the past but needed more space, this new four-door addresses those issues without any meaningful drawbacks. Unfortunately, these improvements still aren't enough to overcome its interior deficiencies versus most rivals.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The added rear doors pay dividends, as those extra passengers no longer have to crawl past a narrow opening to their seats. The front and rear doors are short in length and tall in height, making access in tight spots that much easier.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For those who may have considered a Mini Cooper in the past but needed more space, this new four-door addresses those issues without any meaningful drawbacks. Unfortunately, these improvements still aren't enough to overcome its interior deficiencies versus most rivals.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: There's good headroom up front, even for taller occupants, though the seats are on the narrow side. Rear seats are much roomier than in the two-door, with plenty of headroom and adequate legroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For those who may have considered a Mini Cooper in the past but needed more space, this new four-door addresses those issues without any meaningful drawbacks. Unfortunately, these improvements still aren't enough to overcome its interior deficiencies versus most rivals.
title: Space/Room

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: An upright windshield, tall windows and narrow pillars afford a nearly unobstructed outward view. It's so good that you'll rarely wish you had sprung for the optional rearview camera or parking sensors when backing into a tight spot.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For those who may have considered a Mini Cooper in the past but needed more space, this new four-door addresses those issues without any meaningful drawbacks. Unfortunately, these improvements still aren't enough to overcome its interior deficiencies versus most rivals.
title: Visibility

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Cargo capacity still trails rivals but the four door's advantage over the two-door is significant. The trunk holds 13.1 cu-ft (vs. 8.7) and a handy load floor doubles as a covered bin. Plenty of interior bins, but they're all rather small.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For those who may have considered a Mini Cooper in the past but needed more space, this new four-door addresses those issues without any meaningful drawbacks. Unfortunately, these improvements still aren't enough to overcome its interior deficiencies versus most rivals.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Compared to most competitors, the Mini Cooper uses better interior materials and has a more substantial look and feel. Overall, the cabin gives a favorable impression. Even the cool toggle switches have a satisfying heft.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The four-door Cooper S starts at around the $25,000 mark, which is right in there with the Ford Focus ST and VW GTI. The Mini has more personality than those rivals, and for some shoppers the costly options may be worth the extra price. High praise for the free scheduled maintenance plan.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Mini's infotainment system is identical to BMW's iDrive and is the best in this class. Unfortunately this, and all options, come at a cost which makes it considerably more expensive as more features are added.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The four-door Cooper S starts at around the $25,000 mark, which is right in there with the Ford Focus ST and VW GTI. The Mini has more personality than those rivals, and for some shoppers the costly options may be worth the extra price. High praise for the free scheduled maintenance plan.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: With almost every option added to our test vehicle, the price shot past the $35,000 mark. You read that correctly. That's several thousand dollars more than fully-loaded rivals. Keep a close eye on the bottom line and prioritize extras.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The four-door Cooper S starts at around the $25,000 mark, which is right in there with the Ford Focus ST and VW GTI. The Mini has more personality than those rivals, and for some shoppers the costly options may be worth the extra price. High praise for the free scheduled maintenance plan.
title: Cost

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: EPA estimates of 29 mpg Combined (26 City/33 Highway) are slightly better than competitors. The Mini 4-door averaged 28.2 mpg during its time with us, including some very spirited driving. Most drivers should be able to get better results.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The four-door Cooper S starts at around the $25,000 mark, which is right in there with the Ford Focus ST and VW GTI. The Mini has more personality than those rivals, and for some shoppers the costly options may be worth the extra price. High praise for the free scheduled maintenance plan.
title: MPG

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Mini's 4-year/50,000-mile coverage for both the basic warranty and the drivetrain is typical for cars in this class. Extended factory coverage up to 7 years/100,000 miles is available at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The four-door Cooper S starts at around the $25,000 mark, which is right in there with the Ford Focus ST and VW GTI. The Mini has more personality than those rivals, and for some shoppers the costly options may be worth the extra price. High praise for the free scheduled maintenance plan.
title: Warranty

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Free maintenance for 3 years/36,000 miles comes standard, an unusual bonus for cars in this class. Four years of included roadside assistance with unlimited mileage put the Mini slightly above average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The four-door Cooper S starts at around the $25,000 mark, which is right in there with the Ford Focus ST and VW GTI. The Mini has more personality than those rivals, and for some shoppers the costly options may be worth the extra price. High praise for the free scheduled maintenance plan.
title: Ownership

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We know the S version of the Mini performs better dynamically than the base car. But it also behaves better in normal commuting conditions and there's no sacrifice for the four-door's larger footprint. We consider this the Mini of choice.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Not only does the Cooper S post stronger performance figures than the base Mini and most competing sporty hatchbacks, but it reacts to inputs in a way that encourages exuberant driving. It's entertaining and trustworthy when driven hard.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: MINI
model.name: Cooper
style.name: S 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Even with the additional rear doors, this Mini Cooper S retains all of the charm of the standard two-door model. Much more than the forthcoming Clubman, we think. Yes, some features are gimmicky, but at least they avoid looking cheap.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Not only does the Cooper S post stronger performance figures than the base Mini and most competing sporty hatchbacks, but it reacts to inputs in a way that encourages exuberant driving. It's entertaining and trustworthy when driven hard.
title: Personality

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The Mirage only weighs 2,067 pounds, but its engine is just a 1.2-liter 3-cylinder making 74 horsepower mated to a CVT. Zero to 60 mph dragged by in 11.7 seconds. Merging requires extra caution and two-lane passes are difficult.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Combining a tiny 3-cylinder engine with a Continuously Variable Transmission is a recipe for slow-moving transport. The underdamped suspension causes the car to skitter across mid-corner bumps. The brakes at least work well.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Around town the brakes have an intuitive jump-in and don't feel spongy. Our panic-stop test was aided by the Mirage's feather curb weight, but 121 feet from 60 mph is respectable, although stability was lacking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Combining a tiny 3-cylinder engine with a Continuously Variable Transmission is a recipe for slow-moving transport. The underdamped suspension causes the car to skitter across mid-corner bumps. The brakes at least work well.
title: Braking

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The steering is slow and lacks feel, and we can't remember the last time we felt so many kickbacks through the steering wheel. The skinny, 165-width tires endow the Mirage with more than a little understeer.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Combining a tiny 3-cylinder engine with a Continuously Variable Transmission is a recipe for slow-moving transport. The underdamped suspension causes the car to skitter across mid-corner bumps. The brakes at least work well.
title: Steering

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The Mirage feels massively underdamped despite weighing so little, and the chassis is easily upset by any kind of mid-corner road imperfections, throwing it off-line. Also incredibly susceptible to crosswinds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Combining a tiny 3-cylinder engine with a Continuously Variable Transmission is a recipe for slow-moving transport. The underdamped suspension causes the car to skitter across mid-corner bumps. The brakes at least work well.
title: Handling

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Even the slightest change in throttle causes the CVT to drastically increase rpm level. Uphills are especially tough. There's low-speed lurchiness, too, and the engine is loud during acceleration. Unpleasant.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Combining a tiny 3-cylinder engine with a Continuously Variable Transmission is a recipe for slow-moving transport. The underdamped suspension causes the car to skitter across mid-corner bumps. The brakes at least work well.
title: Driveability

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The seats are cushioned enough for long stints, though they look flimsy and the cloth material feels cheap. The side bolsters basically give way during cornering. No center armrest, and door armrests are plastic.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Mirage's front seats proved surprisingly comfortable, although the door armrests are made of rock-hard plastic. But the ride was unduly harsh and the 3-cylinder/CVT setup makes for lots of high-rev driving.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Of course on smooth roads the Mirage's suspension feels adequate, but even the smallest bumps can be felt and heard. Serious vibration comes into the cabin. The shocks are underdamped, though the comfy seats help.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Mirage's front seats proved surprisingly comfortable, although the door armrests are made of rock-hard plastic. But the ride was unduly harsh and the 3-cylinder/CVT setup makes for lots of high-rev driving.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The 3-cylinder sounds rough even at idle, but to be fair the Chevy Spark is louder at full throttle. Wind noise is fairly well controlled, but this thing is boomy and seems to have a complete lack of sound deadening.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Mirage's front seats proved surprisingly comfortable, although the door armrests are made of rock-hard plastic. But the ride was unduly harsh and the 3-cylinder/CVT setup makes for lots of high-rev driving.
title: Quietness

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: About the most basic interior you'll see these days. ES model comes with Bluetooth, but phone pairing was lengthy. Too high driving position. Large buttons on center stack. Push-button starter on left side of dash.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior controls work well for the most part, and if you're familiar with Mitsubishi products you'll recognize some of the shared parts. There's more space inside than you'd think, and it's easy to get in/out, up front anyway.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Pretty much perfect step-in height up front plus large doors make things easy. Rear doors, though, are small. The rear seatback is quite upright, and you need to duck your head to avoid the roof.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior controls work well for the most part, and if you're familiar with Mitsubishi products you'll recognize some of the shared parts. There's more space inside than you'd think, and it's easy to get in/out, up front anyway.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Excellent headroom up front, surprisingly good door-side elbow room. Classified as a 5-seater, but extremely tight elbow and shoulder room in back. Knee and footroom are pretty good considering size of car.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior controls work well for the most part, and if you're familiar with Mitsubishi products you'll recognize some of the shared parts. There's more space inside than you'd think, and it's easy to get in/out, up front anyway.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Narrow pillars, other than the thick rearmost ones. Pretty easy lane-change sightings, though rear side windows do slope dramatically. Small but not horrible rear window. No rearview camera or parking sensors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior controls work well for the most part, and if you're familiar with Mitsubishi products you'll recognize some of the shared parts. There's more space inside than you'd think, and it's easy to get in/out, up front anyway.
title: Visibility

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Center console cupholders don't hold bottles in place. Handy key fob slot. Minimal bins but good-sized door pockets. 17.2 cu-ft trunk is large for class, but has small opening and painfully deep well. Folding rear seats.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior controls work well for the most part, and if you're familiar with Mitsubishi products you'll recognize some of the shared parts. There's more space inside than you'd think, and it's easy to get in/out, up front anyway.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Other than the interior controls, the whole car feels cheap, like it's made out of tin. If you tap the roof liner, you hear metal. There's no soft-touch anywhere, and there were some interior rattles over harsh pavement.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Mirage offers pretty good value due to its low price, large amount of standard features and impressive warranty. But the car's build quality leaves much to be desired, and we were expecting better fuel mileage.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The Mirage ES comes standard with Bluetooth, CD player, aux-in jack, power mirrors, cruise control, steering wheel audio controls, fog lights, a rear wiper, alloy wheels and push-button start.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Mirage offers pretty good value due to its low price, large amount of standard features and impressive warranty. But the car's build quality leaves much to be desired, and we were expecting better fuel mileage.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The Mirage ES comes with some features other competitors don't at its $15,990 as-tested price. The problem is its rivals are simply better cars to drive and live with, so its value diminishes in comparison.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Mirage offers pretty good value due to its low price, large amount of standard features and impressive warranty. But the car's build quality leaves much to be desired, and we were expecting better fuel mileage.
title: Cost

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: Mitsubishi says the Mirage is the most fuel efficient gasoline-powered non-hybrid in the U.S., with an EPA rating of 40 Combined mpg (37 City/44 Highway) with the CVT. But we only averaged 35.9 mpg during our evaluation.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Mirage offers pretty good value due to its low price, large amount of standard features and impressive warranty. But the car's build quality leaves much to be desired, and we were expecting better fuel mileage.
title: MPG

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: With a 5-year/60,000-mile basic warranty and 10 years/100,000 miles for the drivetrain, only the Kia Rio and Hyundai Accent can match the Mirage's coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Mirage offers pretty good value due to its low price, large amount of standard features and impressive warranty. But the car's build quality leaves much to be desired, and we were expecting better fuel mileage.
title: Warranty

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: The Mirage comes with roadside assistance for 5 years, which is similar to many of its rivals. It does not have a free maintenance program. We do have some qualms about the car's longevity.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Mirage offers pretty good value due to its low price, large amount of standard features and impressive warranty. But the car's build quality leaves much to be desired, and we were expecting better fuel mileage.
title: Ownership

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: There's not much life to this car. The weak 3-cylinder engine is loud and never sounds good, the suspension is poorly-developed while the CVT sucks what's left out of the Mirage.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The only way you could think of the Mirage as being fun to drive is because it's so small and light. And with such skinny tires, almost as soon as you bend it into a turn the tires squeal. But mostly, it's just not a nice car to drive.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Mitsubishi
model.name: Mirage
style.name: ES 4dr Hatchback (1.2L 3cyl CVT)
summary: It's got the light and small thing going for it, and it gets decent (though not awesome) fuel mileage. Our test car's bright green color only served to draw more unwanted attention to this slightly odd-looking little car.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The only way you could think of the Mirage as being fun to drive is because it's so small and light. And with such skinny tires, almost as soon as you bend it into a turn the tires squeal. But mostly, it's just not a nice car to drive.
title: Personality

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 4-cylinder engine is surprisingly peppy. Moves briskly from a full stop. Under full acceleration the CVT brings revs quickly to 6,100 rpm and holds them there.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: One of the sportier sedans within the segment. We were impressed with the responsiveness of the continuously variable transmission. The 2.5 SV doesn't handle as well as the 3.5 SL, but it's still near the top of the 4-cylinder class.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The brake pedal is linear around town, very firm under panic stop conditions. Low-grip all-season tires made for average distances, and those distances did increase during testing.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: One of the sportier sedans within the segment. We were impressed with the responsiveness of the continuously variable transmission. The 2.5 SV doesn't handle as well as the 3.5 SL, but it's still near the top of the 4-cylinder class.
title: Braking

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The effort/amount of assist will be a tad light for enthusiastic drivers but there's very good feedback through the wheel. Responsive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: One of the sportier sedans within the segment. We were impressed with the responsiveness of the continuously variable transmission. The 2.5 SV doesn't handle as well as the 3.5 SL, but it's still near the top of the 4-cylinder class.
title: Steering

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Not as flickable or composed as the 3.5 SL model we tested previously, due to less tire and softer suspension. Still, it handles with the best of the four-cylinder class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: One of the sportier sedans within the segment. We were impressed with the responsiveness of the continuously variable transmission. The 2.5 SV doesn't handle as well as the 3.5 SL, but it's still near the top of the 4-cylinder class.
title: Handling

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CVT can at times be almost too responsive, suddenly pegging the revs when you only asked for a bit more power, not 5,000-rpm-worth. But overall, this is an easy car to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: One of the sportier sedans within the segment. We were impressed with the responsiveness of the continuously variable transmission. The 2.5 SV doesn't handle as well as the 3.5 SL, but it's still near the top of the 4-cylinder class.
title: Driveability

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The seat cushions are exceptionally comfortable and the cloth is very soft. Best-in-class front seats. Rear seats are comfy with a plush center armrest.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The new Altima is a step up from the model it replaces in every way, especially in terms of noise (or lack thereof) and ride refinement.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Smooth ride, soaks up bumps very well with no jiggliness whatsoever. The soft seats help with the ride as well.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The new Altima is a step up from the model it replaces in every way, especially in terms of noise (or lack thereof) and ride refinement.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Very hushed, just a whisper of wind rustling around the mirrors, only minor amount of tire flap over concrete gaps. Engine is quiet for a 4-cylinder, especially at highway speeds.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The new Altima is a step up from the model it replaces in every way, especially in terms of noise (or lack thereof) and ride refinement.
title: Quietness

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: For the most part the ergos are very good, the climate control is easy to use, cruise control makes sense. Only real sore point is the stereo's tuning knob, which has weak detents.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior doesn't offer the most stylish presentation, but the fit and finish are excellent. The quality of the materials puts the Altima right near the top of the class.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The front doors open nice and wide, making it very easy to get in and out. The rear doors could open wider, and you need to duck your head slightly to miss the ceiling.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior doesn't offer the most stylish presentation, but the fit and finish are excellent. The quality of the materials puts the Altima right near the top of the class.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Plenty of front headroom with decent elbow room. There's a goodly amount of knee and foot room in the rear. Headroom will only be tight for those particularly long of torso.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior doesn't offer the most stylish presentation, but the fit and finish are excellent. The quality of the materials puts the Altima right near the top of the class.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Smallish A-/B-pillars, large rear side windows plus helpful triangle windows and good-size rear window greatly aid visibility. Backup camera is standard.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior doesn't offer the most stylish presentation, but the fit and finish are excellent. The quality of the materials puts the Altima right near the top of the class.
title: Visibility

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Multilevel center armrest with large lower bin. Also has handy front bin and another bin behind the cupholders. Door pockets are easily accessible. Split-folding rear seats.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior doesn't offer the most stylish presentation, but the fit and finish are excellent. The quality of the materials puts the Altima right near the top of the class.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Build quality is good for the $25,065 out-the-door price. Door armrests feel a little cheap and unpadded, but the seats are made of a super-cushy cloth material. Soft-touch dash.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A lot of value here. The interior of this 2.5 SV isn't quite as luxurious as the uplevel V6 models, but it's still near the top of the class. And it comes with just about every tech and luxury feature you could expect at this price.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Nice amount of features for the price, like standard Bluetooth, USB port, rearview camera, dual-zone A/C, rear vents, cruise control and a leather-wrapped steering wheel.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A lot of value here. The interior of this 2.5 SV isn't quite as luxurious as the uplevel V6 models, but it's still near the top of the class. And it comes with just about every tech and luxury feature you could expect at this price.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: You get quite a lot for the Altima 2.5 SV's $24,100 base price. The only options on our test car were floor and trunk mats for $185.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A lot of value here. The interior of this 2.5 SV isn't quite as luxurious as the uplevel V6 models, but it's still near the top of the class. And it comes with just about every tech and luxury feature you could expect at this price.
title: Cost

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The EPA rates the four-cylinder Altima at 27 city/38 highway/31 mpg combined. We averaged 31.7 mpg overall, along with an astounding 39.7 mpg on our 116-mile Edmunds evaluation route.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A lot of value here. The interior of this 2.5 SV isn't quite as luxurious as the uplevel V6 models, but it's still near the top of the class. And it comes with just about every tech and luxury feature you could expect at this price.
title: MPG

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Altima's basic warranty is 3 years/36,000 miles with 5 years/60,000 miles for powertrain, both of which are merely average.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A lot of value here. The interior of this 2.5 SV isn't quite as luxurious as the uplevel V6 models, but it's still near the top of the class. And it comes with just about every tech and luxury feature you could expect at this price.
title: Warranty

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Altima comes with 3 years/36,000 miles worth of roadside assistance, but it doesn't have any kind of free scheduled maintenance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A lot of value here. The interior of this 2.5 SV isn't quite as luxurious as the uplevel V6 models, but it's still near the top of the class. And it comes with just about every tech and luxury feature you could expect at this price.
title: Ownership

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The driving experience is fine as-is, but would be improved if Nissan offered the car with a way to shift the CVT manually, whether with the console lever or paddles.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: We'll be honest -- the four-cylinder Altima isn't as fun to drive as the V6. This car has less power and doesn't handle quite as well. But the 2.5 SV's steering is precise, and the car offers a surprising amount of driver feedback.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SV 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There isn't a ton of personality here, what with a four-cylinder mated to a CVT. But this combo is surprisingly peppy and responsive, and the steering is sharp.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: We'll be honest -- the four-cylinder Altima isn't as fun to drive as the V6. This car has less power and doesn't handle quite as well. But the 2.5 SV's steering is precise, and the car offers a surprising amount of driver feedback.
title: Personality

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There's not much power or responsiveness from the 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine. It takes a long 8.2 seconds to reach 60 mph and is accompanied by a loud groan from under the hood. Simulated gear changes from the CVT do keep the drone from being overly intrusive, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the SR is supposed to be the sporty Altima model, it lacks the performance of even its non-sporty in-class competition. The Altima SR receives a decent score for handling but in almost every other measure, it falls well short of the mark set by competitors.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The brake pedal feels unsettlingly spongy and you can actually press it all the way to the floor. That said, the brakes are still effective on paper, stopping the car from 60 mph in a class-average 120 feet.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the SR is supposed to be the sporty Altima model, it lacks the performance of even its non-sporty in-class competition. The Altima SR receives a decent score for handling but in almost every other measure, it falls well short of the mark set by competitors.
title: Braking

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: At parking lot speeds, there's far too much effort needed and further compounding this issue is the slippery leather wheel covering. Even worse, the wheel does not return to center on its own, forcing to driver to manually unwind it. This is about as bad as modern steering systems get.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the SR is supposed to be the sporty Altima model, it lacks the performance of even its non-sporty in-class competition. The Altima SR receives a decent score for handling but in almost every other measure, it falls well short of the mark set by competitors.
title: Steering

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Altima SR trim benefits from sportier suspension tuning, allowing it to corner without much body roll relative to other sedans. In aggressive maneuvers, the stability control subtly intervenes to keep the car on the intended path.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the SR is supposed to be the sporty Altima model, it lacks the performance of even its non-sporty in-class competition. The Altima SR receives a decent score for handling but in almost every other measure, it falls well short of the mark set by competitors.
title: Handling

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: In addition to the aforementioned shortcomings, the Altima also suffers from some subtle lurches at low speeds, which are likely the result of the CVT's lack of response. We also experienced inconsistent acceleration from a stop.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the SR is supposed to be the sporty Altima model, it lacks the performance of even its non-sporty in-class competition. The Altima SR receives a decent score for handling but in almost every other measure, it falls well short of the mark set by competitors.
title: Driveability

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The standard cloth front seats are well shaped and make drivers feel like they're suspended in an elastic hammock. Despite the lack of adjustments, tall and short passengers should be able to find a comfortable position.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: While other midsize sedans are creeping ever closer to entry-level luxury standards, the Altima seems stuck in the economy car class. One of the few bright spots in regards to comfort are the supportive front seats, but it does little to make up for the stiff ride and loud cabin.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A byproduct of the Altima SR's sporty suspension is a stiffer ride. Even though impact harshness is filtered out, you feel every bump in the road, and passengers will experience a lot of jostling, even over moderate undulations.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: While other midsize sedans are creeping ever closer to entry-level luxury standards, the Altima seems stuck in the economy car class. One of the few bright spots in regards to comfort are the supportive front seats, but it does little to make up for the stiff ride and loud cabin.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: When accelerating with purpose, the engine emits an unpleasant sound like someone groaning into an empty glass jar. Road and wind noise is ever-present but not intrusive, which makes the numerous interior creaks and rattles more noticeable.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: While other midsize sedans are creeping ever closer to entry-level luxury standards, the Altima seems stuck in the economy car class. One of the few bright spots in regards to comfort are the supportive front seats, but it does little to make up for the stiff ride and loud cabin.
title: Quietness

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Primary controls are placed where you'd expect, but many secondary knobs and buttons are awkward. The infotainment system is well behind the times, and the low-mounted screen is far outside of the driver's sightlines. The controller knob is also small and has weak detents.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior also trails newer sedans when it comes to overall design. The infotainment system is outdated, and its low placement can be a distraction for the driver. Interior materials look comparable to some competitors, but many of the surfaces are made of hard plastic.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: It's as easy to get in and out of the Altima as most other cars in the class. Front passenger access is unobstructed, while rear passengers have to dip their heads to clear the sloping roofline.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior also trails newer sedans when it comes to overall design. The infotainment system is outdated, and its low placement can be a distraction for the driver. Interior materials look comparable to some competitors, but many of the surfaces are made of hard plastic.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There is enough space for taller passengers up front and just enough room in back for the average-sized adult, and the elevated seat gives a good forward view. Newer midsize sedans feel more spacious and airy, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior also trails newer sedans when it comes to overall design. The infotainment system is outdated, and its low placement can be a distraction for the driver. Interior materials look comparable to some competitors, but many of the surfaces are made of hard plastic.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Comparably narrow roof pillars and a lower rear decklid give the Altima better all around outward visibility than rivals. The standard rearview camera display is small and does not give as clear an indication of how much space is available as do competitors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior also trails newer sedans when it comes to overall design. The infotainment system is outdated, and its low placement can be a distraction for the driver. Interior materials look comparable to some competitors, but many of the surfaces are made of hard plastic.
title: Visibility

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The wide and low trunk space makes the class-average 15.4-cu-ft capacity seem bigger than it is. Bulky luggage and golf bags are easily swallowed up and remote seatback releases further simplify loading larger items.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Altima's interior also trails newer sedans when it comes to overall design. The infotainment system is outdated, and its low placement can be a distraction for the driver. Interior materials look comparable to some competitors, but many of the surfaces are made of hard plastic.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Altima misses the mark set by competitors by a wide margin due to its abundance of hard plastics and frequent creaks inside. The last-generation infotainment system further drives this point home.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Altima prices start around $23,000 for the base 2.5 model and max out at almost $36,000 for a fully loaded 3.5 SL trim. This price range is comparable to other midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Hyundai Sonata and Ford Fusion. These A-rated alternatives will likely exceed your expectations, while the Altima struggles to meet them.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Some features that are either standard or available as options on rivals are restricted to higher-trimmed Altima models. For example, if you want navigation, you have to step up to the $26,000 midlevel SV trim.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Altima prices start around $23,000 for the base 2.5 model and max out at almost $36,000 for a fully loaded 3.5 SL trim. This price range is comparable to other midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Hyundai Sonata and Ford Fusion. These A-rated alternatives will likely exceed your expectations, while the Altima struggles to meet them.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Our 2.5 SR Altima test vehicle costs just over $25,000 and options are limited to minor or cosmetic features. Even if you disregard the numerous drawbacks pointed out above, you'll get more for your money with most any other sedan in the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Altima prices start around $23,000 for the base 2.5 model and max out at almost $36,000 for a fully loaded 3.5 SL trim. This price range is comparable to other midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Hyundai Sonata and Ford Fusion. These A-rated alternatives will likely exceed your expectations, while the Altima struggles to meet them.
title: Cost

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
