summary: The EPA estimates fuel economy at 30 mpg (26 city/37 hwy), which is similar to other cars in this class with the base engine. On our highway-heavy evaluation loop we only managed 32.1 mpg and our overall average resulted in 22.5 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Altima prices start around $23,000 for the base 2.5 model and max out at almost $36,000 for a fully loaded 3.5 SL trim. This price range is comparable to other midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Hyundai Sonata and Ford Fusion. These A-rated alternatives will likely exceed your expectations, while the Altima struggles to meet them.
title: MPG

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Nissan's 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty is typical for the class but the 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage is longer than average. Factory-backed extended warranties are available at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Altima prices start around $23,000 for the base 2.5 model and max out at almost $36,000 for a fully loaded 3.5 SL trim. This price range is comparable to other midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Hyundai Sonata and Ford Fusion. These A-rated alternatives will likely exceed your expectations, while the Altima struggles to meet them.
title: Warranty

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Roadside assistance is provided for 3 years/36,000 miles and is also typical for the class. Some competitors also include some free scheduled maintenance as added incentive, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Altima prices start around $23,000 for the base 2.5 model and max out at almost $36,000 for a fully loaded 3.5 SL trim. This price range is comparable to other midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Hyundai Sonata and Ford Fusion. These A-rated alternatives will likely exceed your expectations, while the Altima struggles to meet them.
title: Ownership

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: After some time, drivers may become accustomed to the Altima's many quirks and drawbacks and find a way to work around them. It seems unlikely, however, that they'd find it as enjoyable to drive as alternatives.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Even though the SR's handling is more capable than the average sedan, the lack of power, odd spongy brakes and lazy steering take most of the fun out of the Altima.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Altima
style.name: 2.5 SR 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A handful of exterior updates in the most recent mid-cycle refresh may give the Altima a little more curb appeal, but the dull interior and driving dynamics quickly tarnish that shine. At a time when many cars exceed expectations, the Altima is merely adequate.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Even though the SR's handling is more capable than the average sedan, the lack of power, odd spongy brakes and lazy steering take most of the fun out of the Altima.
title: Personality

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: With 0-60 mph in 6.9 seconds, it's quick for the class, only slightly slower than a Ford Focus ST. A bit of lag from the 197-hp turbo 4-cylinder. Six-speed manual shifts easily.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Juke Nismo never feels overly quick, yet its acceleration is more like a car than a small SUV. Handling is decent, but we were expecting better from this Nismo version. With an easy clutch and shifter, driveability is excellent.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Exhibited a wild amount of ABS commotion during panic stops. But the brakes felt normal and reasonably powerful around town. Pedal spacing allows for heel-and-toe downshifting.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Juke Nismo never feels overly quick, yet its acceleration is more like a car than a small SUV. Handling is decent, but we were expecting better from this Nismo version. With an easy clutch and shifter, driveability is excellent.
title: Braking

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We noticed some difference in assist level between the Normal and Sport modes, but not much. Overall the steering lacks feel and doesn't telegraph what the front tires are doing.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Juke Nismo never feels overly quick, yet its acceleration is more like a car than a small SUV. Handling is decent, but we were expecting better from this Nismo version. With an easy clutch and shifter, driveability is excellent.
title: Steering

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: With its short wheelbase, the Juke Nismo is a fun car to toss around. Plenty of suspension travel and ground clearance make it especially good on curvy, bumpy back roads.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Juke Nismo never feels overly quick, yet its acceleration is more like a car than a small SUV. Handling is decent, but we were expecting better from this Nismo version. With an easy clutch and shifter, driveability is excellent.
title: Handling

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: With a light clutch, intuitive throttle delivery and and an easy six-speed shifter, the Juke Nismo is simple to drive. It would be a good stick-shift-learning vehicle.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Juke Nismo never feels overly quick, yet its acceleration is more like a car than a small SUV. Handling is decent, but we were expecting better from this Nismo version. With an easy clutch and shifter, driveability is excellent.
title: Driveability

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Juke is actually a decent off-roader, with better-than-average front and rear clearance. The Juke Nismo, with its lower front airdam, side skirts and summer tires, is less so.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Juke Nismo never feels overly quick, yet its acceleration is more like a car than a small SUV. Handling is decent, but we were expecting better from this Nismo version. With an easy clutch and shifter, driveability is excellent.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We've come across few seats better than these Nismo sport buckets. Not just laterally supportive, they're also cushy with a soft, grippy covering. Door armrests need more padding.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Slightly stiffer suspension and summer tires endow the Juke Nismo with a harsher ride than the regular model. The fantastically-comfortable and supportive sport seats partially make up for this. The lack of wind noise was impressive.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The regular Juke can be a bit harsh. With 10 percent stiffer springs and dampers, the Juke Nismo is even more jiggly and things can get a bit rough and bouncy on torn-up surfaces.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Slightly stiffer suspension and summer tires endow the Juke Nismo with a harsher ride than the regular model. The fantastically-comfortable and supportive sport seats partially make up for this. The lack of wind noise was impressive.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Some wind noise around the side mirrors. Minimal road noise, despite summer tires. Short gearing means engine revs high. Seat squeaks against center console when pushed forward.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Slightly stiffer suspension and summer tires endow the Juke Nismo with a harsher ride than the regular model. The fantastically-comfortable and supportive sport seats partially make up for this. The lack of wind noise was impressive.
title: Quietness

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The integrated climate/drive-mode selector adds steps. Wider Nismo seats make it harder to grab seatbelt. Knobs need more obvious detents. Alcantara steering wheel feels great.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like its exterior, the Juke's cabin is a bit overstyled. Combining the a/c controls with the drive-mode selector is just weird. There's plenty of headroom up front, less in the rear, and the sloping roof means cargo space is limited.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Long front doors and plenty of headroom make for easy ingress, though foot sometimes hits Nismo rocker panels. Small rear doors give tight entry/exit space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like its exterior, the Juke's cabin is a bit overstyled. Combining the a/c controls with the drive-mode selector is just weird. There's plenty of headroom up front, less in the rear, and the sloping roof means cargo space is limited.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Plenty of front headroom, but restricted door elbow room. Good amount of space for driver's right knee. Tight rear seat, with cramped knee and headroom. No rear center armrest.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like its exterior, the Juke's cabin is a bit overstyled. Combining the a/c controls with the drive-mode selector is just weird. There's plenty of headroom up front, less in the rear, and the sloping roof means cargo space is limited.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Narrow A- and B-pillars make for decent front/side vision. But sloping roof, short rear side windows, thick C-pillars and small rear window make rearward visibility a chore.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like its exterior, the Juke's cabin is a bit overstyled. Combining the a/c controls with the drive-mode selector is just weird. There's plenty of headroom up front, less in the rear, and the sloping roof means cargo space is limited.
title: Visibility

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Good-sized optional armrest bin and door pockets. Small front bin. Cupholders do okay job without anti-tip. Tiny trunk, but rear seats fold down. Usable underfloor storage.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Like its exterior, the Juke's cabin is a bit overstyled. Combining the a/c controls with the drive-mode selector is just weird. There's plenty of headroom up front, less in the rear, and the sloping roof means cargo space is limited.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Some low-buck plastics around the cabin, and the optional center armrest feels chintzy. Front seats look and feel superb, as does the steering wheel. Noticed small rattle in dash.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Surprisingly, Nissan is bringing the $23,780 Juke Nismo in below the top model, the SL. This, despite the Nismo version carrying an extra 9 horsepower, stiffer suspension, an aero body kit, new seats and a sportier interior.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: There's a lot of car here at the Juke Nismo's $23,780 base. Push-button start, Bluetooth, satellite radio, along with an extra 9 hp, firmer suspension and a sportier interior.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Surprisingly, Nissan is bringing the $23,780 Juke Nismo in below the top model, the SL. This, despite the Nismo version carrying an extra 9 horsepower, stiffer suspension, an aero body kit, new seats and a sportier interior.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Nissan makes you pay $245 for a center armrest. The navigation package, which includes premium audio, USB port and rearview camera, tacks on another $1,170 for a total of $25,195.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Surprisingly, Nissan is bringing the $23,780 Juke Nismo in below the top model, the SL. This, despite the Nismo version carrying an extra 9 horsepower, stiffer suspension, an aero body kit, new seats and a sportier interior.
title: Cost

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The EPA rates the Juke Nismo at 25 city/31 highway/27 mpg combined. We averaged 26.1 mpg over 1,020 miles of varied driving, including 32.4 mpg on the 116-mile Edmunds test loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Surprisingly, Nissan is bringing the $23,780 Juke Nismo in below the top model, the SL. This, despite the Nismo version carrying an extra 9 horsepower, stiffer suspension, an aero body kit, new seats and a sportier interior.
title: MPG

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Basic warranty is 3 years/36,000 miles, with 5 years/60,000 miles for the drivetrain. These are both about average, but well below what the Kia Soul offers.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Surprisingly, Nissan is bringing the $23,780 Juke Nismo in below the top model, the SL. This, despite the Nismo version carrying an extra 9 horsepower, stiffer suspension, an aero body kit, new seats and a sportier interior.
title: Warranty

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: Roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles. Mini offers free maintenance for 3 years/36,000 miles. Nissan offers none.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Surprisingly, Nissan is bringing the $23,780 Juke Nismo in below the top model, the SL. This, despite the Nismo version carrying an extra 9 horsepower, stiffer suspension, an aero body kit, new seats and a sportier interior.
title: Ownership

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: We have no problem with the Juke's driving experience. It's sporty, fun, even engaging. But you always worry someone is pointing and laughing at you. Because it looks goofy.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Juke, especially the Nismo version with the six-speed manual transmission, is surprisingly fun to drive. It gobbles up bumpy backroads like a rally car, and the grippy steering wheel and supportive seats are purely functional.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Juke
style.name: NISMO 4dr Hatchback (1.6L 4cyl Turbo 6M)
summary: The Juke's frog-like love-it or loathe-it styling gives it personality. The zippy turbo power and willing handling lend credence to the saying, "it's what's inside that counts."
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Juke, especially the Nismo version with the six-speed manual transmission, is surprisingly fun to drive. It gobbles up bumpy backroads like a rally car, and the grippy steering wheel and supportive seats are purely functional.
title: Personality

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The engine has adequate low-end torque, but can only do so much to control the high-rpm drone and engine noise caused by the CVT's operation. Acceleration is reasonable but uninspiring, with 0-60 mph in 9.3 sec.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Pedal feel is soft with a long travel, but it doesn't inhibit daily use. The Rogue's panic-stop distance of 124 feet from 60 mph is about average for the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Braking

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Steering effort is fairly high on the Rogue, but not enough to bother anyone. There's feedback to guide it with confidence at moderate speeds, but don't expect to attack any backroads.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Steering

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Rogue isn't the sportiest choice in the compact SUV segment. It exhibits ample body roll when taking corners with verve. But there's good control and it gives the driver confidence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Handling

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There's a "rubber-band" sensation typical of CVTs, meaning a noticeable delay between applying the gas pedal and the delivery of actual acceleration. In most other ways the Rogue is an easy-driving vehicle.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Driveability

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Though the Rogue has the ability to tow a trailer, its 1,000-pound capacity is low even for this segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Towing

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Rogue offers more hardware for light off-roading than most of its counterparts. The all-wheel-drive model includes a locking center differential, hill descent control and brake-lock differentials front and rear.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Front seat comfort is excellent, with six-way power adjustment plus lumbar. Nissan's attention to detail here is noticable. Heated front seats are standard on SL models. The backseat area has air vents for passengers.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Most buyers will be satisfied with the Rogue's ride comfort. It's not the softest in the class, but it's also not the stiffest. The front seats are particularly comfortable.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Decently smooth ride in spite of the large, 18-inch wheels on our top-level SL test model. An easy-going SUV that makes long days seem shorter.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Most buyers will be satisfied with the Rogue's ride comfort. It's not the softest in the class, but it's also not the stiffest. The front seats are particularly comfortable.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Some mild engine thrumming is apparent at the very low speed the engine is often turning because of the CVT. Otherwise, the Rogue's wind and road noise levels are acceptable.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Most buyers will be satisfied with the Rogue's ride comfort. It's not the softest in the class, but it's also not the stiffest. The front seats are particularly comfortable.
title: Quietness

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The turn signal stalk is too far from the steering wheel, and the infotainment screen is a bit of a reach. We've also had some iPhone pairing issues. Other controls are within easy reach and intuitive to use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Rogue's interior utilizes quality materials which are assembled well. Plastics are soft touch and leather surfaces feel genuine. Third-row seating is available on S and SV models. We do have a few ergonomic gripes, though, and outward visibility is pretty poor.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Though its seat height is taller than some, getting in and out of the Rogue is still relatively easy. The doors open nice and wide, revealing large entryways.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Rogue's interior utilizes quality materials which are assembled well. Plastics are soft touch and leather surfaces feel genuine. Third-row seating is available on S and SV models. We do have a few ergonomic gripes, though, and outward visibility is pretty poor.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: You'll won't feel confined in the Rogue whether in the front or back. The rear seats offer 9 inches of fore/aft adjustment and there's a good sense of space in both rows.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Rogue's interior utilizes quality materials which are assembled well. Plastics are soft touch and leather surfaces feel genuine. Third-row seating is available on S and SV models. We do have a few ergonomic gripes, though, and outward visibility is pretty poor.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Although the windshield pillars are slim enough, the remaining pillars are on the thick side which greatly inhibits rear-quarter visibility in some situations. A rear-view camera is standard on all trim levels. It needs it.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Rogue's interior utilizes quality materials which are assembled well. Plastics are soft touch and leather surfaces feel genuine. Third-row seating is available on S and SV models. We do have a few ergonomic gripes, though, and outward visibility is pretty poor.
title: Visibility

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: At 39.3 cu-ft with the second row up and 70 cu-ft with seats folded, the Rogue's cargo area is better than most rivals. Unique configurable cargo area. The power liftgate's convenience is hampered by slow operation.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Rogue's interior utilizes quality materials which are assembled well. Plastics are soft touch and leather surfaces feel genuine. Third-row seating is available on S and SV models. We do have a few ergonomic gripes, though, and outward visibility is pretty poor.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Interior materials and assembly quality are good. Buttons and knobs are above average in feel. But we've have had some infotainment system "crashing" issues and have noticed a few creaks from the cargo area.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Rogue provides the features we'd expect at this price, such as Bluetooth, navigation, uplevel interior trim and a variety of safety features. Its value is hurt by some infotainment glitches, disappointing fuel economy and the lack of standard roadside assistance.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Rogue separates itself with powertrain features like a locking center differential and hill descent control as well as a configurable cargo area. Infotainment system is among the easiest to use, if a bit of a reach.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Rogue provides the features we'd expect at this price, such as Bluetooth, navigation, uplevel interior trim and a variety of safety features. Its value is hurt by some infotainment glitches, disappointing fuel economy and the lack of standard roadside assistance.

summary: The Rogue AWD has a class-leading EPA rating of 28 mpg Combined (25 City/32 Highway). Real-world mpg isn't as good with just 26.4 mpg on our evlauation loop and 24.5 mpg over 20,000 miles.

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Without free maintenance or roadside assistance, the Rogue lacks benefits offered by several of its key competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Rogue provides the features we'd expect at this price, such as Bluetooth, navigation, uplevel interior trim and a variety of safety features. Its value is hurt by some infotainment glitches, disappointing fuel economy and the lack of standard roadside assistance.
title: Ownership

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Car-savvy consumers might be annoyed by the antics of the CVT, and we wish the Rogue offered more driver engagement. Plentiful features give it capability and usefulness, and its ride is comfortable for long trips.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Rogue isn't a vehicle you'll want to drive like a sports car, but its combination of all-weather/dirt-road utility and a reasonably high-quality, multi-configurable and super-comfortable interior make it a desirable family vehicle.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Nissan has hit a sweet spot with the Rogue when it comes to its useable interior along with good capabilities from behind the wheel. It's not the best handling compact SUV, rather it's a jack-of-all trades.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Rogue isn't a vehicle you'll want to drive like a sports car, but its combination of all-weather/dirt-road utility and a reasonably high-quality, multi-configurable and super-comfortable interior make it a desirable family vehicle.
title: Personality

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The engine has adequate low-end torque, but can only do so much to control the high-rpm drone and engine noise caused by the CVT's operation. Acceleration is reasonable but uninspiring, with 0-60 mph in 9.3 sec.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Pedal feel is soft with a long travel, but it doesn't inhibit daily use. The Rogue's panic-stop distance of 124 feet from 60 mph is about average for the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Braking

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Steering effort is fairly high on the Rogue, but not enough to bother anyone. There's feedback to guide it with confidence at moderate speeds, but don't expect to attack any backroads.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Steering

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Rogue isn't the sportiest choice in the compact SUV segment. It exhibits ample body roll when taking corners with verve. But there's good control and it gives the driver confidence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Handling

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There's a "rubber-band" sensation typical of CVTs, meaning a noticeable delay between applying the gas pedal and the delivery of actual acceleration. In most other ways the Rogue is an easy-driving vehicle.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Driveability

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Though the Rogue has the ability to tow a trailer, its 1,000-pound capacity is low even for this segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Because this is a CVT paired with a 170-horsepower 2.5-liter 4-cylinder, the Rogue accelerates tepidly off the line, more so than many rivals. Its handling, though well mannered, is characterized by soft response to inputs.
title: Towing

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Rogue
style.name: SL 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Rogue offers more hardware for light off-roading than most of its counterparts. The all-wheel-drive model includes a locking center differential, hill descent control and brake-lock differentials front and rear.

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 130-horsepower four-cylinder and CVT take the Sentra from 0-60 mph in 10.1 seconds, making it the slowest compact car in the segment. It feels it, but the CVT is at least responsive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Nissan Sentra doesn't have much power and it shows. Its acceleration is the slowest in its segment. Still, the brakes are well above average, and the handling is reassuring even if not very engaging.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Sentra stopped from 60 mph in 118 feet, which is one of the best results in the segment despite its rear drum brakes. Fade after multiple panic stops was negligible.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Nissan Sentra doesn't have much power and it shows. Its acceleration is the slowest in its segment. Still, the brakes are well above average, and the handling is reassuring even if not very engaging.
title: Braking

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Steering offers a reassuring amount of weight for a compact car, with good precision and intuitive response. Not sporty like a Mazda 3 or Ford Focus, but more responsive than a Corolla.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Nissan Sentra doesn't have much power and it shows. Its acceleration is the slowest in its segment. Still, the brakes are well above average, and the handling is reassuring even if not very engaging.
title: Steering

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Its precise steering, surprising grip (0.84g on skidpad) and controlled body motions result in commendable, reassuring handling. Not the sportiest in the segment, but it won't disappoint.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Nissan Sentra doesn't have much power and it shows. Its acceleration is the slowest in its segment. Still, the brakes are well above average, and the handling is reassuring even if not very engaging.
title: Handling

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Sentra is an easy car to drive. Its CVT doesn't suffer from as much of the elastic band power delivery and droning noises of other such transmissions, but the sluggish engine is an issue.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Nissan Sentra doesn't have much power and it shows. Its acceleration is the slowest in its segment. Still, the brakes are well above average, and the handling is reassuring even if not very engaging.
title: Driveability

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Six-way manual driver seat offered an acceptable amount of adjustment for even a tall driver, while seat itself proved supportive during our evaluation drives.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Sentra isn't as comfortable as its junior luxury car looks would indicate, falling short of the Honda Civic's supple ride and Mazda 3's supportive seats. It's very quiet, however. Like the rest of the car, its comfort is acceptable.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Harsh impacts are reasonably isolated from the cabin. In general, a middle ground between firmer, sportier competitors and those that wallow about.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Sentra isn't as comfortable as its junior luxury car looks would indicate, falling short of the Honda Civic's supple ride and Mazda 3's supportive seats. It's very quiet, however. Like the rest of the car, its comfort is acceptable.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: According to our ears and our decibel reader, the Sentra is one of the quieter compact cars -- even with a CVT, which tend to be rather noisy.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Sentra isn't as comfortable as its junior luxury car looks would indicate, falling short of the Honda Civic's supple ride and Mazda 3's supportive seats. It's very quiet, however. Like the rest of the car, its comfort is acceptable.
title: Quietness

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Although the available touchscreen is small, its controls are easier to use than other such interfaces. The standard stereo head unit is simpler still. A refreshingly easy to use cabin.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With its faux wood trim, two-tone tan color scheme and conservative design, the Sentra feels like a car intended for more mature buyers (differently equipped Sentras feel less upscale). Its spacious cabin and simple controls add to this perception.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: High-mounted seats, sizeable door openings and generous backseat space make this a friendly car to get in and out of.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With its faux wood trim, two-tone tan color scheme and conservative design, the Sentra feels like a car intended for more mature buyers (differently equipped Sentras feel less upscale). Its spacious cabin and simple controls add to this perception.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Taller drivers will welcome the unexpectedly spacious front seats. The back seat is so spacious that the Sentra practically feels like a midsize sedan. Very good for the segment.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With its faux wood trim, two-tone tan color scheme and conservative design, the Sentra feels like a car intended for more mature buyers (differently equipped Sentras feel less upscale). Its spacious cabin and simple controls add to this perception.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Bubble-ish roof shape and high-mounted seats yield good forward and side visibility. View out back is typical for the segment. Rearview camera is part of a $650 navigation package; display is small.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With its faux wood trim, two-tone tan color scheme and conservative design, the Sentra feels like a car intended for more mature buyers (differently equipped Sentras feel less upscale). Its spacious cabin and simple controls add to this perception.
title: Visibility

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: At 15.1 cubic feet, the Sentra's trunk volume is comparable to that of many midsize sedans. One of the biggest in the segment. Interior storage is lacking, especially in center console.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: With its faux wood trim, two-tone tan color scheme and conservative design, the Sentra feels like a car intended for more mature buyers (differently equipped Sentras feel less upscale). Its spacious cabin and simple controls add to this perception.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Materials are simply average for the increasingly improving compact segment, but everything seems nicely screwed together. Certain trim/color choices will make it seem nicer than it is.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot of features for your money in the Nissan Sentra, especially in the upper SL trim we sampled. However, it's not any more than the segment leaders that have higher quality cabins and better observed fuel economy.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: SL trim very well equipped for $19,590; dual-zone climate control and keyless ignition are unexpected inclusions. Similar value to the surprisingly generous Honda Civic, but less than a Hyundai Elantra.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot of features for your money in the Nissan Sentra, especially in the upper SL trim we sampled. However, it's not any more than the segment leaders that have higher quality cabins and better observed fuel economy.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: As-tested price of $22,420. Navigation package with real-time traffic, touchscreen, smartphone apps, rearview camera and Bluetooth audio a very reasonable $650.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot of features for your money in the Nissan Sentra, especially in the upper SL trim we sampled. However, it's not any more than the segment leaders that have higher quality cabins and better observed fuel economy.
title: Cost

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The EPA estimates 34 mpg Combined (30 City/39 Highway), which is excellent but the norm for the segment. We struggled to get these numbers, with our best tank of 34.6 mpg accomplished on the highway.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot of features for your money in the Nissan Sentra, especially in the upper SL trim we sampled. However, it's not any more than the segment leaders that have higher quality cabins and better observed fuel economy.
title: MPG

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Sentra is covered by a 36-month/36,000-mile basic warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mi. powertrain warranty. This is typical coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot of features for your money in the Nissan Sentra, especially in the upper SL trim we sampled. However, it's not any more than the segment leaders that have higher quality cabins and better observed fuel economy.
title: Warranty

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Roadside assistance is available for 3 years/36,000 miles. This, too, is typical.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: You get a lot of features for your money in the Nissan Sentra, especially in the upper SL trim we sampled. However, it's not any more than the segment leaders that have higher quality cabins and better observed fuel economy.
title: Ownership

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Sentra provides a safe, reassuring driving experience that doesn't necessarily excite, but feels solid and confident.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There really isn't anything exactly "fun" about the Nissan Sentra. It's sensible, spacious and easy to use, with a conservative, junior luxury car look that should appeal to many.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Nissan
model.name: Sentra
style.name: SL 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Nissan Sentra, especially in our as-tested SL trim, should appeal to those downsizing from a bigger, more luxurious car. It has a premium look other compacts lack.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There really isn't anything exactly "fun" about the Nissan Sentra. It's sensible, spacious and easy to use, with a conservative, junior luxury car look that should appeal to many.
title: Personality

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: With 0-60 mph in 5.1 sec., it's not quite as quick as its big brother, the 911. Easy-to-use 6-speed manual shifter with intuitive clutch takeup. Acceleration is hampered somewhat by a tall first gear.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This is where the Boxster truly shines. Not only is it quick in a straight line thanks to a quick-revving 315-hp flat-6 engine, but its handling abilities are downright amazing, including 1.0g of lateral acceleration.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Solid pedal feel and ultra-consistent stops. Distances were short, too, needing just 103 feet from 60 mph.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This is where the Boxster truly shines. Not only is it quick in a straight line thanks to a quick-revving 315-hp flat-6 engine, but its handling abilities are downright amazing, including 1.0g of lateral acceleration.
title: Braking

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: This electric-assist system lacks some feel compared to the previous Boxster's hydraulically assisted steering. But we still found it to be very precise at speed.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This is where the Boxster truly shines. Not only is it quick in a straight line thanks to a quick-revving 315-hp flat-6 engine, but its handling abilities are downright amazing, including 1.0g of lateral acceleration.
title: Steering

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Stunning dynamic abilities thanks to the Boxster's optimized packaging which consists of a low, center-mounted engine. It provides more confidence than the 911.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This is where the Boxster truly shines. Not only is it quick in a straight line thanks to a quick-revving 315-hp flat-6 engine, but its handling abilities are downright amazing, including 1.0g of lateral acceleration.
title: Handling

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: With the exception of the tall first gear, driveability is very good. This is an easy car to drive, whether puttering around town or pushing the limits down a canyon road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This is where the Boxster truly shines. Not only is it quick in a straight line thanks to a quick-revving 315-hp flat-6 engine, but its handling abilities are downright amazing, including 1.0g of lateral acceleration.
title: Driveability

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: The firm and well-bolstered sport seats hold you in place during cornering. But we found ourselves squirming after just an hour's drive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Overall the Boxster S strikes a remarkable balance between handling and ride comfort, thanks in large part to its adjustable dampers. You won't ever forget it's a sports car, but it's certainly one you could drive every day.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: As you expect of a sports car, the ride is firm and controlled. But it's also one that's easily tolerated for driving to and from work, not just back roads on the weekends.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Overall the Boxster S strikes a remarkable balance between handling and ride comfort, thanks in large part to its adjustable dampers. You won't ever forget it's a sports car, but it's certainly one you could drive every day.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Average noise performance. The Boxster is adequately quiet and the noises you do hear are almost all good ones, like a howling intake and glorious exhaust note.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Overall the Boxster S strikes a remarkable balance between handling and ride comfort, thanks in large part to its adjustable dampers. You won't ever forget it's a sports car, but it's certainly one you could drive every day.
title: Quietness

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: The button-cluttered center console can overwhelm (even once you've acclimated), but pressing a button is faster than working through menus. Touchscreen isn't the most user friendly.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Porsche does interiors right. A lot of functionality leads to a lot of controls, but at least they're well organized. The smallish buttons and switchgear are immensely precise and everything inside the Boxster utilizes high-end materials.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Like most roadsters, the Boxster is low, which means getting in and out requires far more work than an SUV. It's worth it. Plus, the sills are relatively narrow for a sports car.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Porsche does interiors right. A lot of functionality leads to a lot of controls, but at least they're well organized. The smallish buttons and switchgear are immensely precise and everything inside the Boxster utilizes high-end materials.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Even with the top down, you feel surrounded in the Boxster and it feels less convertible-like. Legroom is typical for a roadster (tall folks may be squished), a BMW Z4 has more.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Porsche does interiors right. A lot of functionality leads to a lot of controls, but at least they're well organized. The smallish buttons and switchgear are immensely precise and everything inside the Boxster utilizes high-end materials.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Visibility isn't very good top up or down, but it's definitely worse with the top up.  Especially the rear three-quarter view for changing lanes, which can be problematic.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Porsche does interiors right. A lot of functionality leads to a lot of controls, but at least they're well organized. The smallish buttons and switchgear are immensely precise and everything inside the Boxster utilizes high-end materials.
title: Visibility

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Front and rear trunks are modest, but together there's more than enough for weekend trips. It's impressive for a mid-engine car. The fold-out cupholders are beyond pathetic.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Porsche does interiors right. A lot of functionality leads to a lot of controls, but at least they're well organized. The smallish buttons and switchgear are immensely precise and everything inside the Boxster utilizes high-end materials.

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: It takes less than 10 seconds to raise or lower the top. And it can be done at speeds up to 31 mph. When lowered, doesn't impinge upon trunk space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Porsche does interiors right. A lot of functionality leads to a lot of controls, but at least they're well organized. The smallish buttons and switchgear are immensely precise and everything inside the Boxster utilizes high-end materials.
title: Convertible Top

model.name: Boxster
style.name: S 2dr Convertible (3.4L 6cyl 6M)
summary: Build quality is right up there with high-end luxury cars. Assembly is top-notch, although some materials could be better.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Unless you have a lot of extra means, it's hard to make a solid value statement for any Porsche. They're expensive. Period. But they're usually really good, too. The Boxster is no exception.

summary: With the ability to surprise just about any car on a back road, the Boxster S is a bit of a sleeper. It exudes world-class sports car in every sense.
