title: Personality

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The Macan S has a 3.0-liter twin-turbo V6 engine hooked up to a super-fast-shifting 7-speed automatic transmission. It hits 60 mph in 5.6 sec., making cool noises along the way. The SQ5 takes 5.0 sec., the Macan Turbo just 4.4.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Perhaps a concession to its off-road/towing prowess, the Macan has a light, long brake-pedal action. When you need them, this thing's got brakes, but they're not as immediate as Porsche owners may be used to. 60-0 takes 121 feet.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Braking

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The steering is weighted on the heavy side, but not overly so. It's as easy to point the Macan to the apex of a corner as it is to drive in a straight line for 500 miles. Although we'd like a bit more feedback, it's better than rivals.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Steering

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: With handling like this, who needs a sport sedan? Even without the Macan Turbo's adjustable suspension, the S is poised and confident no matter how you drive it. Oddly, we achieved slightly better track numbers with the S over the Turbo.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Handling

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The Macan is whatever you want it to be. Leave it in drive and it's a comfy, easy crossover. Put the 7-speed automatic into Manual mode, hit the Sport button and the Macan S will dust dedicated sports cars from only a few years ago.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Driveability

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Properly equipped, the Macan S can tow 4,400 pounds. That's significant, and rare, for a compact SUV.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Towing

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The off-road mode adjusts the transmission, AWD torque split, throttle and brakes for low-grip situations, while the downhill assistant manages speed on descents. It has an ample 7.5 in. of ground clearance without the opt. air suspension.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The only real competitors to the Porsche Macan S in terms of performance are the higher-spec Macan Turbo and the Audi SQ5. But with 340 hp and all-wheel drive, we're not sure we need any more power than this S. It's a truly special vehicle. Oh, and it'll tow and go off-road, too.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: This Macan S had the base 8-way power seats. Comfortable and extremely well-bolstered, they lack the finite adjustment (thigh support for example) of the optional seats. Rear seats split 40/20/40 and are nearly as bolstered as the fronts.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Even without many of the available options, this Macan S is a comfortable place to spend time. Great seats, a firm-but-not-unpleasant ride and little in the way of wind or tire noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Even when equipped with 20-inch wheels, the Macan S's ride is completely livable. We'd describe it as firm, but never harsh. Compliant but not squishy. It's not a Lexus. And it's not supposed to be.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Even without many of the available options, this Macan S is a comfortable place to spend time. Great seats, a firm-but-not-unpleasant ride and little in the way of wind or tire noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The Macan S is whisper quiet. Some exhaust note creeps into the cabin during hard acceleration, but it's a welcome and thrilling sound. It's almost too quiet when cruising on the highway, at least for something that goes so fast so easily.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Even without many of the available options, this Macan S is a comfortable place to spend time. Great seats, a firm-but-not-unpleasant ride and little in the way of wind or tire noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: As other carmakers dump features into submenus on a touchscreen, Porsche dumps them all onto real buttons on the center console. It's the right decision as everything is easy to operate with only cursory glances away from the road.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Macan S is better than you'd expect from a $50,000 SUV. Everything is in the right place, made of the right materials and is satisfying to operate. Downsides include tight cargo capacity and typical-for-small-SUV blindspots.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The Macan S is lower to the ground than other compact SUVs and the base seats don't have a ton of bolstering to climb over. No need to step up too high or squat down to get in. It's easy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Macan S is better than you'd expect from a $50,000 SUV. Everything is in the right place, made of the right materials and is satisfying to operate. Downsides include tight cargo capacity and typical-for-small-SUV blindspots.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: For a small SUV the Macan feels pretty large inside, thanks to a low dashboard, ample-sized windows and plenty of passenger room. It seems Porsche focused more on people space than luggage room.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Macan S is better than you'd expect from a $50,000 SUV. Everything is in the right place, made of the right materials and is satisfying to operate. Downsides include tight cargo capacity and typical-for-small-SUV blindspots.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Front visibility is excellent, but the rear view is hampered by thick pillars. Optional blind spot monitoring, a backup camera and front/rear parking sensors make up for the shape-related deficiencies.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Macan S is better than you'd expect from a $50,000 SUV. Everything is in the right place, made of the right materials and is satisfying to operate. Downsides include tight cargo capacity and typical-for-small-SUV blindspots.
title: Visibility

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Cupholders are snugged together so that two cups end up tilting each other. Minimal room in small center console storage. Luggage space is 18 cu-ft, max of 53 cu-ft with seats folded. That's limited cargo room, even for a compact SUV.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Macan S is better than you'd expect from a $50,000 SUV. Everything is in the right place, made of the right materials and is satisfying to operate. Downsides include tight cargo capacity and typical-for-small-SUV blindspots.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Although it's undeniably expensive for a compact SUV, you're getting a Porsche. Everything in the Macan feels like it was made with quality materials and assembled with impeccable care. Because it was.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Macan S has a starting price of around $50,000. Our test car rang up at just over $60,000, yet this SUV still feels every bit a Porsche. Even a bit of a bargain, especially compared to the $70,000-plus Macan Turbo.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Some options, like the $2,590 Premium pkg (heated front seats, park-assist radar, adaptive headlights) feel like mandatory additions. We'd skip the $1,490 carbon-fiber trim. Bluetooth, Homelink, pwr tailgate and dual-zone climate are std.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Macan S has a starting price of around $50,000. Our test car rang up at just over $60,000, yet this SUV still feels every bit a Porsche. Even a bit of a bargain, especially compared to the $70,000-plus Macan Turbo.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: The Macan S is nearly as fast and nearly as competent as the Macan Turbo model, but costs thousands less. It's not a bargain-basement crossover, yet it feels like it's well worth the cost. Did we mention the performance is amazing?
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Macan S has a starting price of around $50,000. Our test car rang up at just over $60,000, yet this SUV still feels every bit a Porsche. Even a bit of a bargain, especially compared to the $70,000-plus Macan Turbo.
title: Cost

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: According to the EPA, the Macan S returns 19 mpg Combined (17 City/23 Highway). We averaged closer to 17 mpg with a best tank of 20 mpg on our evaluation loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Macan S has a starting price of around $50,000. Our test car rang up at just over $60,000, yet this SUV still feels every bit a Porsche. Even a bit of a bargain, especially compared to the $70,000-plus Macan Turbo.
title: MPG

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Porsche's basic warranty and drivetrain coverage last for 4 years/50,000 miles, along with a 12-year corrosion plan.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Macan S has a starting price of around $50,000. Our test car rang up at just over $60,000, yet this SUV still feels every bit a Porsche. Even a bit of a bargain, especially compared to the $70,000-plus Macan Turbo.
title: Warranty

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: Scheduled maintenance is not included, but there's free roadside assistance for 4 years/50,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Macan S has a starting price of around $50,000. Our test car rang up at just over $60,000, yet this SUV still feels every bit a Porsche. Even a bit of a bargain, especially compared to the $70,000-plus Macan Turbo.
title: Ownership

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: From the second you twist the key on the left side of the steering wheel, the Porsche Macan S is an experience. And every bit a proper Porsche. Great noises, a sporty ride and way more speed than you'd expect.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: A small crossover shouldn't be this fun. With Sport Mode engaged, the Macan's transmission upshifts and downshifts with authortiy and the exhaust makes a heckuva good noise. It corners faster than you'd imagine, especially given the all-season tires and its SUV bodystyle.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Macan
style.name: S 4dr SUV AWD (3.0L 6cyl Turbo 7AM)
summary: It would be easy to deride the Macan and call it cute. It's small, yes, but with an expressive, aggressive grille and some grunt to back that up, the Macan S is more than a pretty face.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: A small crossover shouldn't be this fun. With Sport Mode engaged, the Macan's transmission upshifts and downshifts with authortiy and the exhaust makes a heckuva good noise. It corners faster than you'd imagine, especially given the all-season tires and its SUV bodystyle.
title: Personality

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: EV mode is extremely smooth, and the gasoline engine automatically kicks in when you floor it for a total of 416 horsepower. The result is 0 to 60 mph in 4.7 seconds. Part-throttle acceleration is generally most immediate in hybrid mode.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Together the 3.0-liter supercharged V6 and electric motors conspire to produce a full 416 hoursepower. The Panamera's chassis is equally capable, with direct steering, flat cornering and impressive grip. Brakes are massively strong, but can be a little non-linear at low speed.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Powerful brakes (with distinctive green calipers) hauled our E-hybrid to rest from 60 mph in just 102 feet. Feel and modulation are impressively intuitive, except at mundane city speeds where the regenerative system can feel inconsistent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Together the 3.0-liter supercharged V6 and electric motors conspire to produce a full 416 hoursepower. The Panamera's chassis is equally capable, with direct steering, flat cornering and impressive grip. Brakes are massively strong, but can be a little non-linear at low speed.
title: Braking

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Immediate and direct response when the wheel is turned, but it's not nervous when cruising straight. Reasonable effort buildup in normal mode can be ratcheted up in Sport and Sport Plus. Steering wheel rim itself feels a bit dainty, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Together the 3.0-liter supercharged V6 and electric motors conspire to produce a full 416 hoursepower. The Panamera's chassis is equally capable, with direct steering, flat cornering and impressive grip. Brakes are massively strong, but can be a little non-linear at low speed.
title: Steering

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Panameras exhibit impeccable poise on the tightest winding roads, flat cornering and the grip is tremendous. Our E-hybrid weighs 374 pounds more than a pure gasoline Panamera S, but it still impressed us with a nimble 70.1 mph slalom run.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Together the 3.0-liter supercharged V6 and electric motors conspire to produce a full 416 hoursepower. The Panamera's chassis is equally capable, with direct steering, flat cornering and impressive grip. Brakes are massively strong, but can be a little non-linear at low speed.
title: Handling

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Hybrid mode expertly blends gasoline engine and electric motors through the 8-speed automatic gearbox. EV mode is quite smooth, but it's not as seamless as pure electrics because 5 of the gears are used. EVS are usually direct drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Together the 3.0-liter supercharged V6 and electric motors conspire to produce a full 416 hoursepower. The Panamera's chassis is equally capable, with direct steering, flat cornering and impressive grip. Brakes are massively strong, but can be a little non-linear at low speed.
title: Driveability

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Numerous adjustments only serve to improve on the basic goodness of the front seats' default shape. Not exactly soft, the feel comes across as supportive rather than hard. Rear bucket seats equally good, with similar adjustability.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Equipped with standard air suspension, the Panamera S E-hybrid is immensely good at covering miles without causing bother to its occupants. It's a very pleasant place to spend time. As a bonus, each day's dozen or so inital miles of electric driving are especially silent.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: The Panamera E-hybrid comes standard with air suspension, and that's how this Panamera manages to filter out smaller pavement flaws and larger bumps alike while still imparting a sporty feel with good damping and minimal stray body motion.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Equipped with standard air suspension, the Panamera S E-hybrid is immensely good at covering miles without causing bother to its occupants. It's a very pleasant place to spend time. As a bonus, each day's dozen or so inital miles of electric driving are especially silent.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Sleek shape does a fine job of quelling wind noise and the tight fitting doors with redundant seals keeps out road noise from below. Engine sound is intermittent as the battery status changes and the hybrid system toggles between modes.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Equipped with standard air suspension, the Panamera S E-hybrid is immensely good at covering miles without causing bother to its occupants. It's a very pleasant place to spend time. As a bonus, each day's dozen or so inital miles of electric driving are especially silent.
title: Quietness

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Driving position is outstanding, and the intuitive instrument panel includes a customizable gauge that can even display the navi route. But other controls surround the shifter in a mass of look-alike buttons, like an accordian.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Even outside you can tell that the styling limits access and visibility. Driving position is excellent and there's plenty of room inside, but only for four. Porsche's resident accordian player must've conceived the button-rich layout. Good cargo capacity, but a Tesla does eat it for lunch.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Broad doors open wide, but the Panamera sits lower than some of the Grand Touring sedans it competes with. The roofline is especially low in back, where tall and not-so-tall folks need to duck more than usual.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Even outside you can tell that the styling limits access and visibility. Driving position is excellent and there's plenty of room inside, but only for four. Porsche's resident accordian player must've conceived the button-rich layout. Good cargo capacity, but a Tesla does eat it for lunch.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Plenty of room, but the Panamera's broad tunnel makes it feel tighter than it is. This is especially true in the backseat, where an extension of the console bisects it into buckets. Styling makes rear doorside shoulder clearance cozy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Even outside you can tell that the styling limits access and visibility. Driving position is excellent and there's plenty of room inside, but only for four. Porsche's resident accordian player must've conceived the button-rich layout. Good cargo capacity, but a Tesla does eat it for lunch.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Easy to see out the front, but the hood slopes away and the Panamera is wider than you'd expect. Rear three-quarter view is compromised by the styling. Strongly suggest buying the front and rear parking sensors and reverse camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Even outside you can tell that the styling limits access and visibility. Driving position is excellent and there's plenty of room inside, but only for four. Porsche's resident accordian player must've conceived the button-rich layout. Good cargo capacity, but a Tesla does eat it for lunch.
title: Visibility

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: The Panamera E-hybrid loses a little trunk space because of batteries below but remains competitve with 11.8 cubic feet. Rear seats fold down in two parts to open as much as 40.7 cu. ft., and the hatchback design enables easy loading.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Even outside you can tell that the styling limits access and visibility. Driving position is excellent and there's plenty of room inside, but only for four. Porsche's resident accordian player must've conceived the button-rich layout. Good cargo capacity, but a Tesla does eat it for lunch.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: The interior is exquisitely built from premium materials that ooze quality and are assembled with precision. Leaves the similarly-priced Tesla Model S at the starting gate, frankly. Exterior benefits from uniform small gaps and rich paint.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera E-hybrid is very well built and admirably frugal in gasoline hybrid mode. New plug-in capability gives it 16 miles of electric vehicle range per charge, which makes HOV lane access possible. But it is expensive, and the base car needs optioning up in true Porsche fashion.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Porsche pricing strategy is built around a long list of optional items you'll want, leading you to check box after box and bulking up the cost. It's sort of like hotel internet access: free at Days Inn but $20 per night at The Ritz.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera E-hybrid is very well built and admirably frugal in gasoline hybrid mode. New plug-in capability gives it 16 miles of electric vehicle range per charge, which makes HOV lane access possible. But it is expensive, and the base car needs optioning up in true Porsche fashion.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Surprisingly, its base price of $99,975 lands the Panamera S E-Hybrid plug-in hybrid below the midpoint of the Panamera range. Expect this to rise substantially, however, as the inevitable options are added on. Ours came in at $132,355.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera E-hybrid is very well built and admirably frugal in gasoline hybrid mode. New plug-in capability gives it 16 miles of electric vehicle range per charge, which makes HOV lane access possible. But it is expensive, and the base car needs optioning up in true Porsche fashion.
title: Cost

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Same 25 mpg Combined gasoline rating as last year, but the new 2014 plug-in E-hybrid now offers 16 miles of pure electric driving. We matched the EV range on our test loop and after that consumed gas at 26.6 mpg in the default hybrid mode.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera E-hybrid is very well built and admirably frugal in gasoline hybrid mode. New plug-in capability gives it 16 miles of electric vehicle range per charge, which makes HOV lane access possible. But it is expensive, and the base car needs optioning up in true Porsche fashion.
title: MPG

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Porsche's 4-year/50,000-mile basic warranty is reasonable, but that level of powertrain coverage seems so-so. At least the hybrid components are covered for 8 years/100,000 miles (15 years/150,000 miles in California-emissions states).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera E-hybrid is very well built and admirably frugal in gasoline hybrid mode. New plug-in capability gives it 16 miles of electric vehicle range per charge, which makes HOV lane access possible. But it is expensive, and the base car needs optioning up in true Porsche fashion.
title: Warranty

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Now a plug-in hybrid, the 2014 may earn HOV lane access. Free roadside assistance lasts for 4 years/50,000 miles. Porsche doesn't provide free scheduled maintenance, but they'll happily let you pre-pay and bake it into the financing.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera E-hybrid is very well built and admirably frugal in gasoline hybrid mode. New plug-in capability gives it 16 miles of electric vehicle range per charge, which makes HOV lane access possible. But it is expensive, and the base car needs optioning up in true Porsche fashion.
title: Ownership

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: Excellent handling, the 3.0-liter supercharged V6 is stout, and yet it sips fuel. New EV mode offers 16 miles of electric car performance, and you can delay battery use if you want to impress a date. Low-speed brake feel is the only hiccup.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera S E-hybrid certainly has the performance and poise to be fun to drive. Its Porsche pedigree is more than just a badge. It's also very frugal, with a new plug-in E-hybrid mode that's sure to attract EV fans who can't quite commit to a fully electric car like the Tesla.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: S E-Hybrid 4dr Sedan (3.0L 6cyl S/C gas/electric hybrid 8A)
summary: There's no doubt the Panamera is a distinctive vehicle with a certain road presence. And it is certainly a technically interesting machine. But the attention it garners isn't always positive. Expect equal helpings of cheers and jeers.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The 2014 Panamera S E-hybrid certainly has the performance and poise to be fun to drive. Its Porsche pedigree is more than just a badge. It's also very frugal, with a new plug-in E-hybrid mode that's sure to attract EV fans who can't quite commit to a fully electric car like the Tesla.
title: Personality

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: It feels like there's more than 430 horsepower propelling this hefty sedan to 60 mph in just 4 seconds. Want to go quicker? Check out the 500-hp Panamera Turbo.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Few sports cars offer the dynamic capabilities engineered into the all-wheel-drive Panamera GTS. That it's a sedan, can seat four comfortably and also rides like a luxury sedan is miraculous.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Monstrously sized (15.4-in front, 13.8-in rear) standard vented, drilled brakes come from the Panamera Turbo. Carbon-ceramic discs are available with 20-inch wheels.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Few sports cars offer the dynamic capabilities engineered into the all-wheel-drive Panamera GTS. That it's a sedan, can seat four comfortably and also rides like a luxury sedan is miraculous.
title: Braking

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: The Panamera's speed- and position-sensitive electric-assist steering might not have great feel, but it's still very precise and intuitive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Few sports cars offer the dynamic capabilities engineered into the all-wheel-drive Panamera GTS. That it's a sedan, can seat four comfortably and also rides like a luxury sedan is miraculous.
title: Steering

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: One of the best-handling large sedans in existence: Sophisticated all-wheel drive and a dynamic stability control system are standard.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Few sports cars offer the dynamic capabilities engineered into the all-wheel-drive Panamera GTS. That it's a sedan, can seat four comfortably and also rides like a luxury sedan is miraculous.
title: Handling

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: With all of the potential performance a toe-tap away, one might be concerned that the Panamera's drivability would be sacrificed. One would be very wrong. It's a pussy cat.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Few sports cars offer the dynamic capabilities engineered into the all-wheel-drive Panamera GTS. That it's a sedan, can seat four comfortably and also rides like a luxury sedan is miraculous.
title: Driveability

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: It only seats four, but the heated 18-way power front seats (optional ventilation and active bolstering) plus optional heated 8-way power rear seats all offer exceptional comfort.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: With equal parts luxury, performance, and technology, the Panamera GTS is a very comfortable sedan despite its seemingly mixed-purpose mission. Excellent seats, ride and quietness.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Standard multi-mode adaptive air suspension smothers inputs from all but the largest road imperfections.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: With equal parts luxury, performance, and technology, the Panamera GTS is a very comfortable sedan despite its seemingly mixed-purpose mission. Excellent seats, ride and quietness.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Excellent aerodynamics and very good seals keep wind noise to a minimum while road isolation is suppressed. Hard to find a more hushed cabin, though engine noise is evident.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: With equal parts luxury, performance, and technology, the Panamera GTS is a very comfortable sedan despite its seemingly mixed-purpose mission. Excellent seats, ride and quietness.
title: Quietness

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: What initially looks like an intimidating waterfall of buttons and rockers is truly an ergonomic triumph. Even the touchscreen navigation and audio systems are intuitive once used.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever ergonomics, large-sedan room and flexible cargo capacity provide the Panamera GTS with a welcoming and useful interior.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Typical sedan entry/exit up front with only a slightly lower door opening for the rear passengers.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever ergonomics, large-sedan room and flexible cargo capacity provide the Panamera GTS with a welcoming and useful interior.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: The Panamera looks confining from the outside, but it's truly spacious inside with adult-size seats (for only four passengers, however) and plenty of headroom all around.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever ergonomics, large-sedan room and flexible cargo capacity provide the Panamera GTS with a welcoming and useful interior.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Standard rear parking sensors (the fronts are optional) plus available reverse camera and a blind-spot monitor help cope with the Panamera's poor rear visibility.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever ergonomics, large-sedan room and flexible cargo capacity provide the Panamera GTS with a welcoming and useful interior.
title: Visibility

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: The trunk holds 16 cu-ft when all the seats are occupied, and 44 cu-ft with the rear seats folded. The power-actuated hatchback design makes loading easy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Clever ergonomics, large-sedan room and flexible cargo capacity provide the Panamera GTS with a welcoming and useful interior.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Porsche is renowned for its uncompromising engineering, construction and quality of materials. The Panamera is no exception, with perfect build quality inside and out.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's true there are more cost-effective and fuel-efficient performance sedans. But none perform or drive as well as this Panamera GTS. Except the Panamera Turbo.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: The list of options is long, but so is the list of standard features. Some Panamera Turbo features and many options on the Panamera 4S (on which the GTS is based) are standard here.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's true there are more cost-effective and fuel-efficient performance sedans. But none perform or drive as well as this Panamera GTS. Except the Panamera Turbo.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: At about $110,000 to start, the Panamera GTS is no bargain, but it is still a competitive price within its super-sedan peer group.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's true there are more cost-effective and fuel-efficient performance sedans. But none perform or drive as well as this Panamera GTS. Except the Panamera Turbo.
title: Cost

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: With an EPA-rated 16 city/23 highway/19 mpg combined, the Panamera GTS is respectably fuel-efficient. Especially when you consider it can run to 60 mph in 4 seconds.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's true there are more cost-effective and fuel-efficient performance sedans. But none perform or drive as well as this Panamera GTS. Except the Panamera Turbo.
title: MPG

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: With so many manufacturers offering up to 100,000-mile warranties, Porsche's 4-year, 50,000-mile basic and drivetrain warranties seem rather weak.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's true there are more cost-effective and fuel-efficient performance sedans. But none perform or drive as well as this Panamera GTS. Except the Panamera Turbo.
title: Warranty

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: Porsche doesn't offer free scheduled maintenance, but the Panamera does come with roadside assistance for 4 years/50,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: It's true there are more cost-effective and fuel-efficient performance sedans. But none perform or drive as well as this Panamera GTS. Except the Panamera Turbo.
title: Ownership

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: The Panamera GTS drives like a polished luxury sedan, but when you lean on it, you find a sports car within.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Panamera GTS's performance capabilities seem to defy some laws of physics. This 4,300-lb 4-door sedan goes, stops and corners like a car half its size.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Porsche
model.name: Panamera
style.name: GTS 4dr Sedan AWD (4.8L 8cyl 7AM)
summary: There's no mistaking the Panamera for anything else on the road. Sure, it's not a beauty, but nothing else drives like this car. It's loaded with personality inside and out.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Panamera GTS's performance capabilities seem to defy some laws of physics. This 4,300-lb 4-door sedan goes, stops and corners like a car half its size.
title: Personality

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Keep your expectations realistic and the iA is manageable. Plan ahead, though, because there's never a lot of thrust available. Sport mode livens up responses. 60 mph arrives in 9.1 seconds in 6MT iA -- the AT version is slower still.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like most subcompacts, there's little emphasis on performance in the iA. Its Mazda roots offer decent performance but it lacks good control feel. Acceleration is a touch slower than the best in the segment. Handling is on-par with competitors but still not excellent.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Brakes are predictable and easily modulated and rear drums didnâ€™t hurt performance in our emergency stops. At 125 feet, the iA stops from 60 in about the same distance as its competitors.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like most subcompacts, there's little emphasis on performance in the iA. Its Mazda roots offer decent performance but it lacks good control feel. Acceleration is a touch slower than the best in the segment. Handling is on-par with competitors but still not excellent.
title: Braking

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Though its steering feel is rather lifeless, response is adequate and predictable. Body roll is manageable but hard tires keep limits low.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like most subcompacts, there's little emphasis on performance in the iA. Its Mazda roots offer decent performance but it lacks good control feel. Acceleration is a touch slower than the best in the segment. Handling is on-par with competitors but still not excellent.
title: Steering

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Reasonably lenient ESC allows some fun behind the wheel despite relatively low limits. Though it's not as capable as other Mazdas (the iA is based on the 2) it's still a respectable handler with relatively low limits.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like most subcompacts, there's little emphasis on performance in the iA. Its Mazda roots offer decent performance but it lacks good control feel. Acceleration is a touch slower than the best in the segment. Handling is on-par with competitors but still not excellent.
title: Handling

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Other than being fairly slow (which requires planning), the iA exhibits few drivability issues. It follows rain grooves (sometimes aggressively) on the freeway and isn't as stable as some competitors thanks to its tall, skinny stature.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Like most subcompacts, there's little emphasis on performance in the iA. Its Mazda roots offer decent performance but it lacks good control feel. Acceleration is a touch slower than the best in the segment. Handling is on-par with competitors but still not excellent.
title: Driveability

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Firm but supportive seats with good adjustability provide all we need on multi-hour trips. Very good lateral support thanks to both good bolstering and material.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Middling suspension compliance coupled to good body control makes the iA only average in ride comfort. Very supportive and comfortable front seats enable long-distance drives. Among subcompacts, this is level of ride comfort is normal.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The iA's ride is taut -- not stiff but certainly not soft, either. High frequency road irregularities are obvious in the cabin. Body control on large road swells is good. Overall comfort is average.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Middling suspension compliance coupled to good body control makes the iA only average in ride comfort. Very supportive and comfortable front seats enable long-distance drives. Among subcompacts, this is level of ride comfort is normal.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: One of our two test cars exhibited a wind whistle in the driver's window area -- even at low speed. Road and tire noise are no worse than most subcompacts, however.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Middling suspension compliance coupled to good body control makes the iA only average in ride comfort. Very supportive and comfortable front seats enable long-distance drives. Among subcompacts, this is level of ride comfort is normal.
title: Quietness

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Though its main controller and volume knob aren't as well placed as they could be, the audio/infotainment system is easy to use. Plus, steering wheel controls allow easy access to high-priority switches.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the iA's interior is a win. Stitched leather on the dash and doors is a clear step up from the segment standard. Basic but effective HVAC controls are easy to reach. Seat material is excellent. Some trims pieces still look and feel cheap, however.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Center pillar protrudes into entry area for tall drivers who need the seat far back. Front doors are large and open quite wide. Rear door aperture is small and doors donâ€™t open wide enough for large passengers.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the iA's interior is a win. Stitched leather on the dash and doors is a clear step up from the segment standard. Basic but effective HVAC controls are easy to reach. Seat material is excellent. Some trims pieces still look and feel cheap, however.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Front seat space is ample. There's good headroom and elbow room though there's no center armrest. Rear seats lack legroom and feel confining for tall occupants. The low roofline impedes headroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the iA's interior is a win. Stitched leather on the dash and doors is a clear step up from the segment standard. Basic but effective HVAC controls are easy to reach. Seat material is excellent. Some trims pieces still look and feel cheap, however.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Front quarter view is OK despite heavily sloped front pillars. Rear pillars are large and inhibit rear-quarter view. Tall rear decklid limits rear visibility but a rearview camera eliminates guesswork. Overall, visibility is average.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the iA's interior is a win. Stitched leather on the dash and doors is a clear step up from the segment standard. Basic but effective HVAC controls are easy to reach. Seat material is excellent. Some trims pieces still look and feel cheap, however.
title: Visibility

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The 13.5 cubic feet of trunk space is average for the segment. Split folding rear seats improve cargo space but don't fold flat, which hurts utility. No center console. Marginal small-item storage.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the iA's interior is a win. Stitched leather on the dash and doors is a clear step up from the segment standard. Basic but effective HVAC controls are easy to reach. Seat material is excellent. Some trims pieces still look and feel cheap, however.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: A mix of better-than-segment standard materials and hard, cheap plastics make up the iA's interior. Very good seat material and solid secondary controls give the iA a quality feel.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though most of the top subcompacts offer more power, the iA counters with excellent real-world fuel economy, an abundance of features and a higher-quality interior. Pricing is competitive -- neither the least or most costly in the segment.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Standard pre-collision warning, push-button start, rearview camera, A/C, bluetooth and a 7.0-inch infotainment screen. Two USB ports and an auxiliary port enable device charging and iPod integration. Navigation is optional.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though most of the top subcompacts offer more power, the iA counters with excellent real-world fuel economy, an abundance of features and a higher-quality interior. Pricing is competitive -- neither the least or most costly in the segment.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The iA ranges from the mid 16s to the mid 17s depending on which transmission you choose. Others in the segment have a larger range and some top out in the low 20s. For the money, it's a good offering. Our tester cost $17,750.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though most of the top subcompacts offer more power, the iA counters with excellent real-world fuel economy, an abundance of features and a higher-quality interior. Pricing is competitive -- neither the least or most costly in the segment.
title: Cost

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The iA showed its merit here by producing an outstanding 44.8 mpg on our standard test loop. Other competitors (Fit and Fiesta) only managed in the mid 30s. The EPA rates the AT-equipped iA at 37 mpg combined (33 city/42 highway)
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though most of the top subcompacts offer more power, the iA counters with excellent real-world fuel economy, an abundance of features and a higher-quality interior. Pricing is competitive -- neither the least or most costly in the segment.
title: MPG

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Basic: 3 years/36,000 miles, Powertrain: 5 years/60,000 miles -- average warranty numbers.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though most of the top subcompacts offer more power, the iA counters with excellent real-world fuel economy, an abundance of features and a higher-quality interior. Pricing is competitive -- neither the least or most costly in the segment.
title: Warranty

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Free maintenance and roadside assistance for 2 years or 25,000 miles is a genuinely valuable offer -- especially among subcompacts.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Though most of the top subcompacts offer more power, the iA counters with excellent real-world fuel economy, an abundance of features and a higher-quality interior. Pricing is competitive -- neither the least or most costly in the segment.
title: Ownership

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Plan ahead to make the most of the iA's diminutive size. It's not fast, but driving it with purpose is effective in the city. Response to steering inputs is rapid but cornering speed is limited by hard tires. Control feel is bunk.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's no avoiding that the iA is slow. But it moves adequately through city traffic and its size makes it easy to toss around. Not fun, exactly, but city-car athletic.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Scion
model.name: iA
style.name: 4dr Sedan (1.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: An abundance of tech features keep the iA at the cutting edge of the segment in that regard as does its somewhat flashy (and undeniably Mazda derived) styling. Fun, but not as functional as a Fit when it comes to passengers and cargo.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: There's no avoiding that the iA is slow. But it moves adequately through city traffic and its size makes it easy to toss around. Not fun, exactly, but city-car athletic.
title: Personality

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Ultra-smooth, quietly delivered power under lazy acceleration, but with any gusto, 1.8-liter four-cylinder is thrashy and totally gutless. 0-60 in 10 seconds is 1.5 seconds slower than class average and basically tied for class-worst.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Scion iM is sharper to drive than the Toyota Corolla upon which it's mechanically based, and although pleasant to drive, it's not as engaging as top competitors. With 137-hp the iM is underpowered and it perpetually shows, letting down the entire car. CVT automatic is surprisingly adept.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Stopped from 60 mph in class-average 122 feet. Distances did not change after multiple stops, demonstrating good fade resistance. The iM maintained control during emergency braking and its medium-firm pedal stayed consistent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Scion iM is sharper to drive than the Toyota Corolla upon which it's mechanically based, and although pleasant to drive, it's not as engaging as top competitors. With 137-hp the iM is underpowered and it perpetually shows, letting down the entire car. CVT automatic is surprisingly adept.
title: Braking

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There is some road feel transmitted when pushing hard through a corner, but otherwise, the steering is pretty numb and lifeless compared to the segment best. It does not provide extra confidence or encourage you to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Scion iM is sharper to drive than the Toyota Corolla upon which it's mechanically based, and although pleasant to drive, it's not as engaging as top competitors. With 137-hp the iM is underpowered and it perpetually shows, letting down the entire car. CVT automatic is surprisingly adept.
title: Steering

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: This lightweight car with small dimensions is reasonably responsive and nimble. It's OK being tossed about and changes directions well. While it doesn't encourage one to drive enthusiastically, it doesn't dissuade like its Corolla sibling does.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Scion iM is sharper to drive than the Toyota Corolla upon which it's mechanically based, and although pleasant to drive, it's not as engaging as top competitors. With 137-hp the iM is underpowered and it perpetually shows, letting down the entire car. CVT automatic is surprisingly adept.
title: Handling

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: CVT is better than most, providing smooth acceleration and simulating shifts under hard acceleration. Sport mode holds revs, especially when going up or down hill. Cruise control holds speed downhill. A very easy car to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Scion iM is sharper to drive than the Toyota Corolla upon which it's mechanically based, and although pleasant to drive, it's not as engaging as top competitors. With 137-hp the iM is underpowered and it perpetually shows, letting down the entire car. CVT automatic is surprisingly adept.
title: Driveability

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Some of the most comfortable and supportive front seats in the segment, with ample adjustment even for taller drivers. Remained so after many hours behind the wheel. Back seat is flat, but it has a long cushion of a suitable height.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Scion is not necessarily a brand you associate with comfort, tranquility and/or general refinement. However, the iM bucks that trend, offering a genuinely comfortable and controlled ride, and seats that are impressively supportive (both through corners and for distance).
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Big undulations cause some nautical suspension rebounding, but otherwise an impressively controlled suspension that soaks up bumps very well. Feels more grown up and sophisticated than tinny, unsubstantial past Scions. A stand-out attribute.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Scion is not necessarily a brand you associate with comfort, tranquility and/or general refinement. However, the iM bucks that trend, offering a genuinely comfortable and controlled ride, and seats that are impressively supportive (both through corners and for distance).
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Some noticeable wind noise on each side of the car aft of the rear doors. Beyond that, both wind and road noise are kept very nicely quelled. The underpowered engine is thrashy and not a pleasure to hear -- which you do a lot.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Scion is not necessarily a brand you associate with comfort, tranquility and/or general refinement. However, the iM bucks that trend, offering a genuinely comfortable and controlled ride, and seats that are impressively supportive (both through corners and for distance).
title: Quietness

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Controls are well-placed and simple, including those for the standard touchscreen interface. Its menus make sense, its buttons are of a reasonable size and reactions are very quick. Auto climate controls are a nice touch in this segment.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a some, the Scion iM will be a very aggreeable daily driver. Its user-friendly controls, abundant features and useful small-item storage will certainly be appreciated, while its so-so cargo-carrying ability and back seat room could be cause for concern.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Large, light doors. Even with smallish back seat, getting in back wasn't difficult. Rear roofline isn't aggressively raked, reducing the chances of clonking your head.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a some, the Scion iM will be a very aggreeable daily driver. Its user-friendly controls, abundant features and useful small-item storage will certainly be appreciated, while its so-so cargo-carrying ability and back seat room could be cause for concern.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There is less back seat legroom to be found than in a Kia Forte 5, Mazda 3 or Volkswagen Golf, but we wouldn't call it cramped per se. Good rear foot space and sufficient rear headroom. Good space all around up front, including for tall folks.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a some, the Scion iM will be a very aggreeable daily driver. Its user-friendly controls, abundant features and useful small-item storage will certainly be appreciated, while its so-so cargo-carrying ability and back seat room could be cause for concern.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Smallish rear window and big rear pillars equate to diminished visibility. Sharply angled windshield and high dash, but pillars are thin. A rearview camera is standard, but no other driver aides are even optional.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a some, the Scion iM will be a very aggreeable daily driver. Its user-friendly controls, abundant features and useful small-item storage will certainly be appreciated, while its so-so cargo-carrying ability and back seat room could be cause for concern.
title: Visibility

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Eight cupholders, deep armrest bin, smartphone bin with plugs (though not enough room for wire). Wide cargo area, but so-so depth and not much space above the cargo cover. More versatile than a sedan; less so than other hatchbacks.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: For a some, the Scion iM will be a very aggreeable daily driver. Its user-friendly controls, abundant features and useful small-item storage will certainly be appreciated, while its so-so cargo-carrying ability and back seat room could be cause for concern.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Scion cabins are known for hard, black plastic. The iM's are still black, but the surfaces you see and touch most often are soft. There's even a padded driver leg rest. Switchgear, especially climate controls, look and feel very nice.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Scion has found the sweet spot for how much shoppers in the compact segment want to spend and how much equipment they want. If you want higher-end equipment you're out of luck, though, as there are no options. Toyota reputation for superior reliability is also part of the package.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Abundant standard equipment at price that undercuts like-equipped rivals: auto headlights, power-folding mirrors, keyless start, dual-zone auto climate, rearview camera, leather wheel, rearview camera, touchscreen, good sound system.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Scion has found the sweet spot for how much shoppers in the compact segment want to spend and how much equipment they want. If you want higher-end equipment you're out of luck, though, as there are no options. Toyota reputation for superior reliability is also part of the package.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The only options are color, transmission and navigation, so what you see is what you get for $20,000-ish price tag. Similarly equipped rivals may cost more, but they also provide considerably more power and in most cases, driver engagement.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Scion has found the sweet spot for how much shoppers in the compact segment want to spend and how much equipment they want. If you want higher-end equipment you're out of luck, though, as there are no options. Toyota reputation for superior reliability is also part of the package.
title: Cost

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: We averaged 33.2 mpg on the Edmunds evaluation route. The EPA says you can expect 33 mpg combined (28 city/37 highway) with the CVT (1 mpg lower with manual). Quite thrifty, but others in the class are even moreso.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Scion has found the sweet spot for how much shoppers in the compact segment want to spend and how much equipment they want. If you want higher-end equipment you're out of luck, though, as there are no options. Toyota reputation for superior reliability is also part of the package.
title: MPG

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Basic 3 year/36,000-mile coverage and 5 year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage is average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Scion has found the sweet spot for how much shoppers in the compact segment want to spend and how much equipment they want. If you want higher-end equipment you're out of luck, though, as there are no options. Toyota reputation for superior reliability is also part of the package.
title: Warranty

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Free scheduled maintenance for 2 years/25,000 miles is matched only by the Toyota Corolla in this segment. A genuinely valuable extra. Roadside assistance is only for 2 years/unlimited miles, which is a year less than normal.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Scion has found the sweet spot for how much shoppers in the compact segment want to spend and how much equipment they want. If you want higher-end equipment you're out of luck, though, as there are no options. Toyota reputation for superior reliability is also part of the package.
title: Ownership

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: As an A-to-B transportation tool to bring you to work or venture out of town for the weekend, the iM is very appealing, as it provides plenty of comfort without being completely devoid of driver engagement.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you like the dependability, user-friendliness, comfort and value of a Toyota Corolla, but would like a modicum of driving engagement and visual interest, the Scion iM is your solution. Is it fun? No, the handling is benign and acceleration is sluggish, but it's not soul sucking either.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Scion
model.name: iM
style.name: 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Remove our test car's electric blue paint and the Scion iM would be just another compact hatchback. Not a lot of vivacious, youthful spirit to be found inside or out. It is instead capable, competent and surprisingly refined.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If you like the dependability, user-friendliness, comfort and value of a Toyota Corolla, but would like a modicum of driving engagement and visual interest, the Scion iM is your solution. Is it fun? No, the handling is benign and acceleration is sluggish, but it's not soul sucking either.
title: Personality

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The new 3-cylinder engine has decent mid-range power now that it's turbocharged, making it a more effective tool for threading traffic. It'll hit 60 mph in 10.1 seconds, which isn't fast, but is slightly quicker than the class average.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Being tiny and lightweight affords some intrinsic fun, including a higher perception of speed, and the tightest turning radius known to man at 22.8 feet! Despite the improvements made, the Fortwo ultimately misses its mark of being a great car for the city.
title: Acceleration

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Stopping distance tops subcompact performance at 110 feet, but the experience is unsettling. Under hard braking the front-end wiggles and rear tires may skid before things sort, out which is the last thing you want during panic stops.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Being tiny and lightweight affords some intrinsic fun, including a higher perception of speed, and the tightest turning radius known to man at 22.8 feet! Despite the improvements made, the Fortwo ultimately misses its mark of being a great car for the city.
title: Braking

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The Fortwo's steering is direct and responsive without being darty, and surprisingly stable at higher speeds. There isn't much road feedback, but this isn't a performance car, so the tuning and effort are good for its purposes.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Being tiny and lightweight affords some intrinsic fun, including a higher perception of speed, and the tightest turning radius known to man at 22.8 feet! Despite the improvements made, the Fortwo ultimately misses its mark of being a great car for the city.
title: Steering

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: A high center of gravity, relatively narrow track and skinny tires amount to low cornering limits. The Fortwo's stability control skews conservative for safety reasons, cutting power and applying brakes if it senses a whiff of danger.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Being tiny and lightweight affords some intrinsic fun, including a higher perception of speed, and the tightest turning radius known to man at 22.8 feet! Despite the improvements made, the Fortwo ultimately misses its mark of being a great car for the city.
title: Handling

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The new twin-clutch transmission dramatically improves driveability over the previous generation, but still delivers subpar smoothness within the 1 to 20 mph range. This is unacceptable for a city car.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Being tiny and lightweight affords some intrinsic fun, including a higher perception of speed, and the tightest turning radius known to man at 22.8 feet! Despite the improvements made, the Fortwo ultimately misses its mark of being a great car for the city.
title: Driveability

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The cushions offer decent padding but have minimal lateral support, and a seam on the bottom cushion is noticeable and distracting. There's zero padding on the door armrest and an inboard armrest, which is recommended, costs an extra $100.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: You might assume the Fortwo gets dinged on comfort due to its smallness, but it doesn't factor in here. Seat comfort is compromised for aesthetics and the suspension is much too stiff to provide any peace over rough city roads. These are issues that can and should be fixed.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: With an extra-short wheelbase, large road bumps are an adventure. Hit them with some speed, and you'd leave your seat if you weren't strapped to it. The ride is continuously busy thanks to a stiffer suspension. Not recommend for extended highway use.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: You might assume the Fortwo gets dinged on comfort due to its smallness, but it doesn't factor in here. Seat comfort is compromised for aesthetics and the suspension is much too stiff to provide any peace over rough city roads. These are issues that can and should be fixed.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Road and tire noise isn't very noticeable, but the Fortwo's flat front nose pushes air like a mini bulldozer, which makes it sound windy outside at all times. In the cabriolet, noise is even more noticeable. Hearing the engine work in back would be nice if it made nicer sounds.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: You might assume the Fortwo gets dinged on comfort due to its smallness, but it doesn't factor in here. Seat comfort is compromised for aesthetics and the suspension is much too stiff to provide any peace over rough city roads. These are issues that can and should be fixed.
title: Quietness

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The stereo is basic but easy to use, offering USB and AUX inputs to pipe your music through the cabin speakers. The climate controls are also straightforward, and are done up in a creative and stylish fashion. Simple does work.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Some cost-saving measures, like the non-adjustable cupholders molded into the hard plastic center console, are laughably obvious. But there are some redeeming qualities to the Fortwo's interior, like generous passenger room and a cabin design that feels modern and fun.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Wide door openings and a low step-in make this tiny car surprisingly easy to get into. However the doors are also extremely long, extending beyond the seat hip point, which doesn't bode well for opening them in tighter parking spaces.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Some cost-saving measures, like the non-adjustable cupholders molded into the hard plastic center console, are laughably obvious. But there are some redeeming qualities to the Fortwo's interior, like generous passenger room and a cabin design that feels modern and fun.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The smart is small but it creates a mirage of space inside. Despite not having an adjustable steering column, 6-foot drivers will fit relatively comfortably. That is, until another 6-footer climbs into the passenger seat and you realize how narrow it is.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Some cost-saving measures, like the non-adjustable cupholders molded into the hard plastic center console, are laughably obvious. But there are some redeeming qualities to the Fortwo's interior, like generous passenger room and a cabin design that feels modern and fun.
title: Space/Room

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Thin front roof pillars and big glass offer good forward visibility, but the rearview mirror is narrow and big rear roof pillars create big blind spots. The cabrio's tiny rear window makes it even harder to see out back, and no rearview camera is available. Optional park assist systems are recommended.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Some cost-saving measures, like the non-adjustable cupholders molded into the hard plastic center console, are laughably obvious. But there are some redeeming qualities to the Fortwo's interior, like generous passenger room and a cabin design that feels modern and fun.
title: Visibility

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Decent-sized bottle holders in the doors, and the small pull-out bin in front works well for wallets and phones. The passenger seat cleverly folds flat for longer cargo items, and 9.2 cu-ft of trunk space eclipses the Mini Cooper's 8.7 cu-ft.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Some cost-saving measures, like the non-adjustable cupholders molded into the hard plastic center console, are laughably obvious. But there are some redeeming qualities to the Fortwo's interior, like generous passenger room and a cabin design that feels modern and fun.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The convertible top opens or closes in about 12 seconds (with two pushes of a button). Two roof pillars then manually unlatch and stow away in the trunk. It's a bit of a process to get into full top-down mode, but few of the Smart's competitors can even pull off that trick.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Some cost-saving measures, like the non-adjustable cupholders molded into the hard plastic center console, are laughably obvious. But there are some redeeming qualities to the Fortwo's interior, like generous passenger room and a cabin design that feels modern and fun.
title: Convertible Top

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: With the exception of the seats and headliner, not one surface in the cabin is soft touch. A chic and trendy-looking interior design makes the hard plastic appear less cheap, but its hard to pick out anything of real quality in this cabin.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The list of reasons to buy a Fortwo coupe is short, and "value" is not on it. As a turbocharged rear-drive subcompact car, there isn't really anything else like it on the market, so there's some intangible value there. Otherwise, it's really just the basics.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: For roughly $20K, the only premium options included are heated seats, a JBL sound system, panoramic roof and auto headlights. Cars like the Kia Rio offer navigation, a rearview camera, keyless entry/ignition and more space for the same money.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The list of reasons to buy a Fortwo coupe is short, and "value" is not on it. As a turbocharged rear-drive subcompact car, there isn't really anything else like it on the market, so there's some intangible value there. Otherwise, it's really just the basics.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: The cost that goes into engineering a small rear-engine coupe leaves little wiggle room for bells and whistles. The spartan interior will resonate with some, but it'll be a purchase based on emotion, not value. What's more, the Fortwo requires expensive premium fuel.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The list of reasons to buy a Fortwo coupe is short, and "value" is not on it. As a turbocharged rear-drive subcompact car, there isn't really anything else like it on the market, so there's some intangible value there. Otherwise, it's really just the basics.
title: Cost

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: With an EPA rating of 36 combined for our twinamatic-equipped test car (34 city/39 highway), the Fortwo holds a city-mpg edge over most of its competition. We averaged 38.3 mpg in normal driving and an impressive 40.2 on our drive loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The list of reasons to buy a Fortwo coupe is short, and "value" is not on it. As a turbocharged rear-drive subcompact car, there isn't really anything else like it on the market, so there's some intangible value there. Otherwise, it's really just the basics.
title: MPG

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Smart offers 4-year/50,000-mile basic and powertrain warranties, which is better coverage than some but not as good as others. We consider this average for the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The list of reasons to buy a Fortwo coupe is short, and "value" is not on it. As a turbocharged rear-drive subcompact car, there isn't really anything else like it on the market, so there's some intangible value there. Otherwise, it's really just the basics.
title: Warranty

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: Being under the umbrella of Mercedes-Benz doesn't necessarily mean you receive all the benefits. Smart provides 2 years/24,000 miles of roadside assistance and no free scheduled maintenance, which is below competitor averages and well under MB's unlimited coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The list of reasons to buy a Fortwo coupe is short, and "value" is not on it. As a turbocharged rear-drive subcompact car, there isn't really anything else like it on the market, so there's some intangible value there. Otherwise, it's really just the basics.
title: Ownership

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: In congested cities the Fortwo should be the perfect vehicle, but suffers from low speed driveability issues. Outside of that setting, it feels like a compromise on every level, especially considering the other subcompacts that cost similar money.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Fortwo's smallness is entertaining, but once that novelty wears off, it'll stop being fun if it doesn't benefit you. This is not a car you'll take on road trips, or enjoy with a passenger on a twisty road -- its super power is squeezing into a parking spot the size of a broom closet.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: smart
model.name: fortwo
style.name: proxy 2dr Hatchback (.9L 3cyl Turbo 5M)
summary: If you're aren't buying this due to severe space constraints, you're buying it for the humor. It's 2016's interpretation of a clown car that will elicit smiles and laughs from passengers and passersby alike. Assume they're laughing with you.
