make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Hybrid boasts an extra 12 horsepower over the regular XV but weighs nearly 300 lb. more, so 0-60 mph remains about equal at 10.0 seconds. Slower than all competitors. The Continuously Variable Transmission (CVT) offers decent response.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Acceleration is about equal to the non-hybrid XV, but that means it remains slower than all of its competitors. The additional weight of the hybrid also makes it a less-capable handler, though it's still more carlike than most crossovers. Regenerative brakes are hard to predict.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Awkward, disconnected feeling from the brakes in low-speed situations. Fairly typical for hybrids but still annoying. The 60-0 panic stop was accomplished in 119 feet, which is pretty good.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Acceleration is about equal to the non-hybrid XV, but that means it remains slower than all of its competitors. The additional weight of the hybrid also makes it a less-capable handler, though it's still more carlike than most crossovers. Regenerative brakes are hard to predict.
title: Braking

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The electric-assisted steering is slightly quicker and thus offers better response than the non-hybrid XV. Nice and stable on the highway with a good ability to isolate steering kickbacks when driving over bumps.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Acceleration is about equal to the non-hybrid XV, but that means it remains slower than all of its competitors. The additional weight of the hybrid also makes it a less-capable handler, though it's still more carlike than most crossovers. Regenerative brakes are hard to predict.

summary: The XV gives more car-like responses than many compact SUVs, but with the extra suspension travel for off-road duty it's not what anyone would call a sporty handler. Worse handling numbers than the regular XV, mostly due to added weight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Acceleration is about equal to the non-hybrid XV, but that means it remains slower than all of its competitors. The additional weight of the hybrid also makes it a less-capable handler, though it's still more carlike than most crossovers. Regenerative brakes are hard to predict.
title: Handling

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The electric-motor assist actually improves driveability over the non-hybrid XV, thanks to a healthy dose of torque, which the gasoline engine lacks at low speeds. The regenerative brakes, however, are hard to predict at low speeds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Acceleration is about equal to the non-hybrid XV, but that means it remains slower than all of its competitors. The additional weight of the hybrid also makes it a less-capable handler, though it's still more carlike than most crossovers. Regenerative brakes are hard to predict.

summary: The Touring model's standard leather seats are excellent. They offer good support and a wide range of adjustability. If the driver's seat had adjustable lumbar support and the rear seats reclined, they would be even better.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is one of the XV Hybrid's biggest assets. The seats are comfortable and supportive, the ride quality is better than most compact SUVs and sound-deadening measures have improved quietness as well.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The off-road-capable suspension system helps on-road, too, with a comfortably-cushioned ride. The ride remains calm at higher speeds on freeways, and it even provides decent isolation when driving on unpaved surfaces.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is one of the XV Hybrid's biggest assets. The seats are comfortable and supportive, the ride quality is better than most compact SUVs and sound-deadening measures have improved quietness as well.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Leading the way for all subsequent XVs, the Hybrid employs new sound-deadening measures. They work quite well. Only a bit of wind noise from the side mirrors and roof rack intrude. Road and engine noise are minimal.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is one of the XV Hybrid's biggest assets. The seats are comfortable and supportive, the ride quality is better than most compact SUVs and sound-deadening measures have improved quietness as well.
title: Quietness

model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The touchscreen navigation and audio controls are far too small for quick and easy adjustments. The large three-knob climate controls, however, are excellent and intuitive. We also appreciate the unexpected convenience of shift paddles.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Only two items jump out as poorly executed: the interface for the standard navigation/audio system and the small display for the rearview camera. Otherwise, the XV Hybrid Touring offers plenty of room and easy access for people and things.

make.name: Subaru

summary: The XV's seats are situated in the sweet spot: higher than typical passenger cars but lower than most SUVs. Doors are reasonably sized for tight parking spots and have roof-mounted assist handles. Keyless entry/ignition is standard.

model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: There's a fair amount of glass area and relatively slender roof pillars for good outward visibility. The center rear headrest retracts and a rearview camera (albeit with a small 4.3-inch display) is standard on the XV Hybrid.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Only two items jump out as poorly executed: the interface for the standard navigation/audio system and the small display for the rearview camera. Otherwise, the XV Hybrid Touring offers plenty of room and easy access for people and things.
title: Visibility

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The XV inhabits the space between wagons and compact SUVs. It offers 21.5 cu-ft of luggage room, with 50.2 cu-ft max with seats folded. Adequate numbers, but not class-leading. The battery pack gives only a minor cargo penalty.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Only two items jump out as poorly executed: the interface for the standard navigation/audio system and the small display for the rearview camera. Otherwise, the XV Hybrid Touring offers plenty of room and easy access for people and things.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The XV doesn't feel fancy but it also doesn't feel cheap. Materials are pleasing and solid. Paint quality and plastic surfaces are good. The interior boominess we witnessed in last year's XV has been addressed.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The meager fuel-economy savings over a non-hybrid XV Crosstrek won't pay off at the pump for over 15 years. Starting at $26,820, our $30,120 Hybrid Touring's $3,000 premium cannot be justified. Luckily, the warranty terms and Subaru ownership experience remain intact nonetheless.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The $30,120 XV Hybrid Touring is essentially loaded. It comes with standard fog lights, roof rails, aluminum wheels, keyless entry/ignition, sunroof, leather seats, navigation, satellite radio and a rearview camera.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The meager fuel-economy savings over a non-hybrid XV Crosstrek won't pay off at the pump for over 15 years. Starting at $26,820, our $30,120 Hybrid Touring's $3,000 premium cannot be justified. Luckily, the warranty terms and Subaru ownership experience remain intact nonetheless.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The main problem with the XV Hybrid is that a comparably-equipped non-hybrid XV Limited costs $2,700 less. Without the usual substantially improved fuel economy of a hybrid in play, there's little value here.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The meager fuel-economy savings over a non-hybrid XV Crosstrek won't pay off at the pump for over 15 years. Starting at $26,820, our $30,120 Hybrid Touring's $3,000 premium cannot be justified. Luckily, the warranty terms and Subaru ownership experience remain intact nonetheless.
title: Cost

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The EPA rates the XV Crosstrek Hybrid at 31 mpg Combined (29 City/33 Highway). We managed 31 mpg on our standard evaluation loop, which is poor for a hybrid. Also, the fuel tank is smaller than a non-hybrid XV, reducing its ultimate range.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The meager fuel-economy savings over a non-hybrid XV Crosstrek won't pay off at the pump for over 15 years. Starting at $26,820, our $30,120 Hybrid Touring's $3,000 premium cannot be justified. Luckily, the warranty terms and Subaru ownership experience remain intact nonetheless.
title: MPG

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The basic warranty is good for 3 years/36,000 miles, with the drivetrain covered for 5 years/60,000 miles. These are very average warranty numbers for the segment. Extended service plans are available.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The meager fuel-economy savings over a non-hybrid XV Crosstrek won't pay off at the pump for over 15 years. Starting at $26,820, our $30,120 Hybrid Touring's $3,000 premium cannot be justified. Luckily, the warranty terms and Subaru ownership experience remain intact nonetheless.
title: Warranty

make.name: Subaru

summary: The XV comes with roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles but does not have a free maintenance program.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The meager fuel-economy savings over a non-hybrid XV Crosstrek won't pay off at the pump for over 15 years. Starting at $26,820, our $30,120 Hybrid Touring's $3,000 premium cannot be justified. Luckily, the warranty terms and Subaru ownership experience remain intact nonetheless.
title: Ownership

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: While the XV Crosstrek's hybrid-ness isn't readily apparent in the way the smooth and quiet drivetrain works, the awkward brakes are the give-away. Otherwise, it drives like a small wagon alternative to an SUV.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The perception that this hybrid version of the XV Crosstrek will save money in the long run is a myth. It won't. Still, this is a tough little wagon with that special Subaru off-road-readiness fully intact.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Hybrid Touring 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: If, for you, the most compelling reason to buy the hybrid version of the otherwise competent XV Crosstrek is for fuel, and thus money, savings, you're fooling yourself. This is basically a hybrid in name only.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The perception that this hybrid version of the XV Crosstrek will save money in the long run is a myth. It won't. Still, this is a tough little wagon with that special Subaru off-road-readiness fully intact.
title: Personality

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Slower than many competitors thanks to a smaller engine and CVT transmission.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The XV's overall performance is average for the segment. Its acceleration is slower than many competitors, but its handling is good and it offers light off-road abilities.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Average braking performance is neither impressive nor troubling.

summary: Seat comfort is good as is adjustability. Support is minimal, however.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is average in the XV. Its suspension is compliant and offers ample travel to soak up road irregularities. There's more body roll, pitch and dive than some competitors, however.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Ride comfort is good in the XV. There's an abundance of wheel travel to accommodate uneven terrain and damping is adequate but mild.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is average in the XV. Its suspension is compliant and offers ample travel to soak up road irregularities. There's more body roll, pitch and dive than some competitors, however.
title: Ride Comfort

model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: At cruise the XV isn't any louder than its competitors, but acceleration makes the engine drone because of continuously variable transmission.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is average in the XV. Its suspension is compliant and offers ample travel to soak up road irregularities. There's more body roll, pitch and dive than some competitors, however.
title: Quietness

model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Three-knob HVAC controls are easy to use, but navigation system interface is awkward and complex as is Bluetooth phone pairing.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the XV's interior is taken directly from the Impreza so don't expect upscale timmings. Still, this is a fairly functional and utilitarian setup that should serve most people well.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Taller seat height than standard Impreza makes entry and exit easier, but in this regard the XV is still more like a car than a small SUV.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the XV's interior is taken directly from the Impreza so don't expect upscale timmings. Still, this is a fairly functional and utilitarian setup that should serve most people well.

summary: There's less sense of space inside the XV than there is inside a Honda CR-V or Toyota RAV4, but it's certainly not confining.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the XV's interior is taken directly from the Impreza so don't expect upscale timmings. Still, this is a fairly functional and utilitarian setup that should serve most people well.

style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Nothing in the XV feels fancy, but it also doesn't feel cheap. The interior materials feel reasonably durable and like they'll stay together. We didn't witness any squeaks or rattles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's good value in the XV if you're looking for a carlike driving experience and all-weather/off-road functionality. Cost is well below most competitors, too.

summary: All Subarus offer a certain unique appeal that's not available in more mainstream offerings and the XV is no exception. The CVT will drive away some buyers, but many won't notice. Plus, there's a manual transmission available.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: There's good value in the XV if you're looking for a carlike driving experience and all-weather/off-road functionality. Cost is well below most competitors, too.

summary: Don't plan on setting any on-ramp records in the XV. It's tall and soft which pays off in the dirt, but it's not fast on the road.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If being different is your thing and you like a little Subaru frump, the XV might just be your car. It's not exactly fun, but it is highly utilitarian.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Subaru
model.name: XV Crosstrek
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.0L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There's some solid personality here. The CVT is probably the only downside, but many buyers will prefer it to a manual transmission. Otherwise, this is functional machine with decent looks.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If being different is your thing and you like a little Subaru frump, the XV might just be your car. It's not exactly fun, but it is highly utilitarian.

summary: Supportive and well shaped, but also thin in the name of light weight and space maximization. Comfortable, but those who crave deep cushy padding might not be satisfied.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Was hoping for a little more, but our test car was equipped with a performance-oriented sport suspension and low-profile performance tire package. We expect a bit more smoothness from cars with the standard air suspension setup.

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: The air suspension is generally smooth, but uneven pavement can be harsh. This is a likely outgrowth of the sport suspension and low-profile 21-inch tires fitted to our test car.

ratings.summary: A spacious, airy cabin with a high tech feel. The iPad-esque interface is groundbreaking in the sense that it controls nearly everything, though some controls (headlights, sunroof) are inconveniently buried in the menus.

summary: Generous door openings and no obstructions. No problem here.

model.name: Model S

summary: Plenty of front and rear leg-and headroom. Cabin feels airy and wide, too.

ratings.summary: A spacious, airy cabin with a high tech feel. The iPad-esque interface is groundbreaking in the sense that it controls nearly everything, though some controls (headlights, sunroof) are inconveniently buried in the menus.

model.name: Model S

summary: Generally good to the front, sides and rear quarter. Huge back-up camera can be left on while driving, too, so rear visibility isn't an issue.

ratings.summary: A spacious, airy cabin with a high tech feel. The iPad-esque interface is groundbreaking in the sense that it controls nearly everything, though some controls (headlights, sunroof) are inconveniently buried in the menus.

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Cargo storage behind the seats is excellent, and there's a front trunk (Frunk) too. But interior storage is weak, with no door pockets, no center console storage.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: A spacious, airy cabin with a high tech feel. The iPad-esque interface is groundbreaking in the sense that it controls nearly everything, though some controls (headlights, sunroof) are inconveniently buried in the menus.

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Wow! This thing is quick. Never mind that it's an EV. But the EV powertrain does make it seem even faster because of the seamlessness and the silence.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Model S stands up to conventional gas-powered Grand Touring machines in terms of acceleration and composure. Add in the smoothness of the EV power delivery (of which there is an abundance) and you've really got something.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Secure stops come about in short order, though the pedal height is too similar to the throttle. A robust regenerative braking system handles most routine slowing.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Model S stands up to conventional gas-powered Grand Touring machines in terms of acceleration and composure. Add in the smoothness of the EV power delivery (of which there is an abundance) and you've really got something.

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Response is quick and direct, and there are three EPS assist maps to choose from. We like the default just fine, as it balances effort and feedback just about right.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Model S stands up to conventional gas-powered Grand Touring machines in terms of acceleration and composure. Add in the smoothness of the EV power delivery (of which there is an abundance) and you've really got something.

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Returns good numbers at the track and feels planted and secure in the real world. The Model S also feels lighter than it is, because its massive battery pack is mounted quite low.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Model S stands up to conventional gas-powered Grand Touring machines in terms of acceleration and composure. Add in the smoothness of the EV power delivery (of which there is an abundance) and you've really got something.

summary: The AC induction motor and single-speed gearbox are smooth and utterly seamless. Say what you will about EVs, but their powertrains feel like a million bucks.
ratings.title: Performance

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Our Model S came up short in the body panel alignment department, but this was a very early build car. The materials used inside look good.

ratings.summary: This EV has enough, range, performance, style and high-end appeal to make the price seem reasonable, unlike the adapted EV econoboxes out there that seem shockingly expensive and of limited use.

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S

summary: 265 miles of range is one heck of an EV feature, but beyond that the Tesla Model S comes across as a high tech automobile with lots of unique content.

ratings.summary: This EV has enough, range, performance, style and high-end appeal to make the price seem reasonable, unlike the adapted EV econoboxes out there that seem shockingly expensive and of limited use.

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Considering its luxury position, outright performance, engineering and otherwrldly EV capabilities, the Model S's price does not seem out of line.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This EV has enough, range, performance, style and high-end appeal to make the price seem reasonable, unlike the adapted EV econoboxes out there that seem shockingly expensive and of limited use.

model.name: Model S

summary: MPG means little in the EV world; itâ€™s the plug-in range that matters. The Tesla Model S offers a game changing 265 miles, enough to make it much more than a mere commuter.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This EV has enough, range, performance, style and high-end appeal to make the price seem reasonable, unlike the adapted EV econoboxes out there that seem shockingly expensive and of limited use.

model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Tesla retroactively improved the warranty on the Model S. The battery and drive unit is covered with an 8-year, unlimited-mile warranty, while the basic lasts for 4 years/50,000 miles. Roadside assistance also lasts for 4 years/50,000 miles. There is no free maintenance, but a prepaid service plan is available.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This EV has enough, range, performance, style and high-end appeal to make the price seem reasonable, unlike the adapted EV econoboxes out there that seem shockingly expensive and of limited use.

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Little maintenance is required here. The trick is supporting the home charge port, which works best with a 100-amp circuit. Anything down to 40 amps will do, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: This EV has enough, range, performance, style and high-end appeal to make the price seem reasonable, unlike the adapted EV econoboxes out there that seem shockingly expensive and of limited use.
title: Ownership

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: Here's an EV you can take places. It has enough range to go somewhere for the fun of it. And it's fast, smooth, quiet, high-tech, luxurious.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: It's fast, it's high-tech, it's unique, it draws attention, it'll wow your friends. And then there's the EV part, the 265 miles of range and growing Supercharger network that'll allow cross country travel.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: Signature Performance 4dr Sedan (electric DD)
summary: This big luxury sedan is easy on the eyes and turns heads. And until someone else comes out with a long-range EV it'll be unique, the only one of its kind.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: It's fast, it's high-tech, it's unique, it draws attention, it'll wow your friends. And then there's the EV part, the 265 miles of range and growing Supercharger network that'll allow cross country travel.
title: Personality

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Tesla calls their most aggressive performance setting "Insane" mode, and it's not far from the truth. 0-60 mph takes just 3.5 sec. and is incredibly easy: Just floor the throttle. Even in normal situations, acceleration is impressive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: If the 691-horsepower Model S P85D simply accelerated with unbelievable speed yet did nothing else well, it would still get a top grade here. But that's not the case. All-wheel drive gives it a ton of grip and it changes direction like a much lighter machine. It's a total blast to drive.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Routine deceleration is aptly handled by the regenerative braking, while panic stops are smooth, short (just 102 feet from 60 mph) and stable with consistent distances. Gave a more predictable pedal feel than some other electric vehicles.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: If the 691-horsepower Model S P85D simply accelerated with unbelievable speed yet did nothing else well, it would still get a top grade here. But that's not the case. All-wheel drive gives it a ton of grip and it changes direction like a much lighter machine. It's a total blast to drive.
title: Braking

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Steering effort is variable between three different modes, but all are quite quick. The steering feels lighter than it does on non all-wheel-drive models, but it's not too light.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: If the 691-horsepower Model S P85D simply accelerated with unbelievable speed yet did nothing else well, it would still get a top grade here. But that's not the case. All-wheel drive gives it a ton of grip and it changes direction like a much lighter machine. It's a total blast to drive.
title: Steering

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Thanks to sharp steering and incredibly sticky summer performance tires, the grip available with this car is impressive. Corner-carving is also aided by immediate throttle response. Far more fun than such a heavy vehicle should be.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: If the 691-horsepower Model S P85D simply accelerated with unbelievable speed yet did nothing else well, it would still get a top grade here. But that's not the case. All-wheel drive gives it a ton of grip and it changes direction like a much lighter machine. It's a total blast to drive.
title: Handling

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Tesla's Autopilot system isn't live yet, but our car was equipped with an adaptive cruise control system that is nothing less than the best we've ever sampled. With the instantly available electric power, the Tesla is a cinch to drive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: If the 691-horsepower Model S P85D simply accelerated with unbelievable speed yet did nothing else well, it would still get a top grade here. But that's not the case. All-wheel drive gives it a ton of grip and it changes direction like a much lighter machine. It's a total blast to drive.
title: Driveability

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: The base seats are acceptable. The optional next-generation seats tested here are very good. They're well bolstered, grippy, adjustable and rival the seats from the class leaders. Still no cooling feature available.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: There are no obvious missteps for the Model S P85D. The new seats are very good, the ride is firm but not abusive and the road noise is reasonably quiet. The seats could offer more adjustablity as well as a cooling function.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: The P85D we tested had 21-inch wheels and air suspension but the ride still remains on the firm side. That's not a real complaint, as it's never coarse, but it's far from cushy.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: There are no obvious missteps for the Model S P85D. The new seats are very good, the ride is firm but not abusive and the road noise is reasonably quiet. The seats could offer more adjustablity as well as a cooling function.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: The Model S still suffers from an odd resonance at the back of the vehicle and our test car had quite a bit of electric whine from the front powertrain. Still, compared to most other cars on the road, it's quiet.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: There are no obvious missteps for the Model S P85D. The new seats are very good, the ride is firm but not abusive and the road noise is reasonably quiet. The seats could offer more adjustablity as well as a cooling function.
title: Quietness

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Giant 17-inch touchscreen is amazingly easy to use. Stalks and shifter are sourced from Mercedes-Benz. Everything works great except the power exterior door handles: They frequently fail to deploy right away. Annoying.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tesla's interior is a very special place to spend time, with a wide-open feel and lovely materials. Owing to the advanced features in this car, there is a bit of a learning curve. But Tesla focused on the user interface, and it shows.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Large door openings, good seat height and a medium-low step-in height makes this an easy car to get in and out of, in spite of its seemingly low-slung stance.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tesla's interior is a very special place to spend time, with a wide-open feel and lovely materials. Owing to the advanced features in this car, there is a bit of a learning curve. But Tesla focused on the user interface, and it shows.

model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: The cabin feels huge and there's a ton of leg and headroom for all occupants. The lack of a center storage bin opens things up further. Overall a very airy and wide feeling.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tesla's interior is a very special place to spend time, with a wide-open feel and lovely materials. Owing to the advanced features in this car, there is a bit of a learning curve. But Tesla focused on the user interface, and it shows.

model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: The P85D loses some front trunk storage compared to the regular Model S due to AWD hardware and second electric motor. It still has a massive rear trunk, and it still has the polarizing open-concept center console. No bins, just a tray.

ratings.summary: The Tesla's interior is a very special place to spend time, with a wide-open feel and lovely materials. Owing to the advanced features in this car, there is a bit of a learning curve. But Tesla focused on the user interface, and it shows.

model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: It's truly impressive that a company as young as Tesla has the build quality buttoned up this tightly. Panel gaps are tight, materials are excellent and everything feels expensive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: A long range, strong performance, high style, all-weather traction and advanced infotainment and driver-assistance systems. As such, the P85D isn't cheap, but it delivers on the promise of a six-figure car.

make.name: Tesla
model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: The base Model S starts at just over $70,000, comes with 12-way heated front seats, 17-in. touchscreen, Bluetooth, backup camera, dual-zone climate control and 208 miles of range from a  380-hp motor. Plenty of options are available.

style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Teslas are a regular sight out on the road these days, but they're still pretty special. Few cars drive this well, and fewer still drive this well while going this fast. And you can do it all with five people in the car.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: 691 horsepower. Instant torque. All-wheel drive. If Tesla had found a way to make this car anything less than awesome, that would be bigger news. They didn't.

model.name: Model S
style.name: P85D 4dr Sedan AWD (electric DD)
summary: Elon Musk. Stock prices. Supercharging. The Model S is a few years old now and yet still very much in the news. It's a great, big, electric sedan. But it's also so much more.

model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Acceleration is strong for a naturally aspirated 4-cylinder, yet almost one-half seconds slower to 60 mph than the last 4-cylinder Camry we tested.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There was no excessive body dive or pedal sponginess during our braking tests. On the streets, braking was linear and predictable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.

model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Steering is heavier than what you'll find in the LE and XLE, yet not so heavy as to be offensive. Communicates a sense of what the tires are doing which is rare for a Camry.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.

model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: As you might expect, the Camry is uninspiring when pushed and understeers at its limit. ESC is slighty crude, intervening heavy-handedly, but is effective.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The SE has firmer damping than the base Camry which doesn't hurt ride quality, but instead helps with stability especially at freeway speeds.

model.name: Camry

summary: Seat cushions are soft with suitable side bolstering.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort and isolation are the Camry's bread and butter. The front seats are wide and plush, the ride is soft and cabin noise levels are exceptional for this segment.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Camry soaks up road imperfections well. Even this sporty SE trim errs more on the side of comfort when cornering but remains controllable and not floaty.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort and isolation are the Camry's bread and butter. The front seats are wide and plush, the ride is soft and cabin noise levels are exceptional for this segment.

model.name: Camry

summary: Isolation is where the Camry excels. Tire and wind noise are minimal, even at speed. Exterior noises (passing cars, horns, etc.) are well neutralized and inoffensive.

summary: It drives like a Camry. Four cylinders that return good mpg and a suspension that is slightly firmer than other Camrys yet arguably just as comfortable.

ratings.summary: The SE is considered the sporty version of the Camry. We didn't find it to be particularly fun to drive, but relative to this segment and the normal Camry, this is a far better car to drive.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry

ratings.summary: The SE is considered the sporty version of the Camry. We didn't find it to be particularly fun to drive, but relative to this segment and the normal Camry, this is a far better car to drive.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Acceleration is strong for a naturally aspirated 4-cylinder, yet almost one-half seconds slower to 60 mph than the last 4-cylinder Camry we tested.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There was no excessive body dive or pedal sponginess during our braking tests. On the streets, braking was linear and predictable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Steering is heavier than what you'll find in the LE and XLE, yet not so heavy as to be offensive. Communicates a sense of what the tires are doing which is rare for a Camry.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: As you might expect, the Camry is uninspiring when pushed and understeers at its limit. ESC is slighty crude, intervening heavy-handedly, but is effective.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The SE has firmer damping than the base Camry which doesn't hurt ride quality, but instead helps with stability especially at freeway speeds.

ratings.summary: The 4-cylinder offers enough acceleration for freeway merging and passing, but we wouldn't call it spirited. This SE suspension enhances the ride and handling of the Camry.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Seat cushions are soft with suitable side bolstering.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort and isolation are the Camry's bread and butter. The front seats are wide and plush, the ride is soft and cabin noise levels are exceptional for this segment.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Camry soaks up road imperfections well. Even this sporty SE trim errs more on the side of comfort when cornering but remains controllable and not floaty.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort and isolation are the Camry's bread and butter. The front seats are wide and plush, the ride is soft and cabin noise levels are exceptional for this segment.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Isolation is where the Camry excels. Tire and wind noise are minimal, even at speed. Exterior noises (passing cars, horns, etc.) are well neutralized and inoffensive.
ratings.title: Comfort

summary: The primary and secondary controls are easily within reach. But some items on the dash are too far away for comfort and the Camry is missing a telescoping steering wheel.

ratings.summary: A combination of knobs, buttons and touchscreens keeps the layout clean yet functional. But the use of hard plastics is somewhat of a visual letdown. Plenty of space and storage.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The 2.5-liter 4-cylinder engine is refined around town, yet the 178 horsepower is plenty ample for safe freeway merging and passing. Our LE test car accelerated from 0-60 mph in 8.1 seconds, which is about mid-pack for the class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry LE is an effortless car to drive. Its brakes are predictable and responsive. The 4-cylinder engine is efficient but not underpowered. Its six-speed automatic transmission shifts smoothly. If there is a performance gripe, it's the heavy-feeling steering.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The brake pedal requires minimal pressure for the pads to engage, with linear progression after that. Super intuitive. In our panic brake testing, the Camry needed 116 feet to reach a stop from 60 mph, pretty decent vs. its rivals.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry LE is an effortless car to drive. Its brakes are predictable and responsive. The 4-cylinder engine is efficient but not underpowered. Its six-speed automatic transmission shifts smoothly. If there is a performance gripe, it's the heavy-feeling steering.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Steering feel is heavy to the point that it negatively impacts low-speed maneuvering. The heavier weight is more appropriate at highway speeds, where it enhances feel and stability.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry LE is an effortless car to drive. Its brakes are predictable and responsive. The 4-cylinder engine is efficient but not underpowered. Its six-speed automatic transmission shifts smoothly. If there is a performance gripe, it's the heavy-feeling steering.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Although steering feel is a bit distant, the Camry LE remains acceptably responsive and precise, even at its extreme limits on our test track or back roads. It has more athleticism than the average owner will ever ask of it.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry LE is an effortless car to drive. Its brakes are predictable and responsive. The 4-cylinder engine is efficient but not underpowered. Its six-speed automatic transmission shifts smoothly. If there is a performance gripe, it's the heavy-feeling steering.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Camry is the kind of car you can just get in and drive. Gas pedal and braking action are linear. The transmission shifts smoothly and is rarely left confused on mountain grades. Aside from the steering heft, it's easy to maneuver.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry LE is an effortless car to drive. Its brakes are predictable and responsive. The 4-cylinder engine is efficient but not underpowered. Its six-speed automatic transmission shifts smoothly. If there is a performance gripe, it's the heavy-feeling steering.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The driver seat is soft yet supportive, making it suited for long days. A tilt/telescoping steering wheel helps with the perfect fit. Two adults can sit comfortably in the rear seat for long distances, but three-wide might be pushing it.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Camry gets high marks here. Ride quality is smooth regardless of road surface. Seat comfort is better than most, for both front and rear passengers. Tire, wind and engine noise are kept impressively squelched.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Road imperfections are absorbed well by the Camry's suspension. This is how a mid-sized family sedan should ride. A good blend of road isolation with at least some semblance of body motion control.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Camry gets high marks here. Ride quality is smooth regardless of road surface. Seat comfort is better than most, for both front and rear passengers. Tire, wind and engine noise are kept impressively squelched.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Noise intrusion is minimal, be it from wind, road or engine. The 4-cylinder's note is barely perceptible at cruising speeds, and even at wide-open throttle the engine never becomes obtrusive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Camry gets high marks here. Ride quality is smooth regardless of road surface. Seat comfort is better than most, for both front and rear passengers. Tire, wind and engine noise are kept impressively squelched.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: A tilt/telescoping steering wheel helps various body types find the perfect fit. Secondary audio and climate system controls are a nice mixture of buttons and knobs, each logically placed and well labeled. Good touchscreen responsiveness.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: All four doors open wide to ease entry/exit, door opening is squared on top to minimize the need for ducking. Seats aren't too low, side bolsters are mild, further simplifying entry.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Lots of interior space here. Legroom is ample, including the back seats. Rear passenger foot room under front seats is decent, too. Headroom is good front and rear, though it's a bit less in the rear seat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Forward visibilty is aided by slim windshield pillars. The shape of the hood is such that it can be difficult to gauge where the front corners end, but the rear view is quite good. A rearview camera with a large screen comes standard.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Access to the 15.4 cubic-foot trunk is good thanks to a large opening. Rear seatbacks are split-folding to increase cargo space when needed. Door pockets are deep and wide enough to be quite useful. Enough cupholders for all.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Our test vehicle displayed zero squeaks and rattles. It's clear an effort was made to cover the most frequently used surfaces with soft-touch material. Switches have a more durable, less plasticky feel than the last generation car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The LE tested here is the entry-level Camry, with a starting price around $23,000. At that price it comes with a standard 6-inch touchscreen, heated mirrors, 8-way power driver seat, backup camera and remote keyless entry.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The only options on our test car were floormats for $225, bringing the as-tested price to around $24,000. By comparison, the top-level 2015 Camry XLE 4-cylinder has a starting MSRP of nearly $27,000.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Combined EPA fuel economy is 28 mpg Combined (26 City/35 Highway) for the Camry LE 4-cylinder, which is 2-3 mpg below several key rivals. We averaged 27.3 mpg over 700 miles of mixed driving. Our best single tank was 32.1 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties are standard. Neither is class-leading.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Toyota offers roadside assistance and free scheduled oil changes and tire rotations for 2 years/25,000 miles. Some competitors offer longer roadside assistance, but none match the Camry's free maintenance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There is a small degree of sport beneath the Camry's sleeker new skin. Admittedly most folks will never unlock the Camry's full dynamic potential, nor have any desire to. But it's nice to know it's there.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Camry is more of a function-to-drive car than it is fun-to-drive. It serves the purposes of moving people from here to there in comfort, with decent fuel economy and minimal hassle. But, with this redesign its fun factor has certainly improved thanks to better driving dynamics.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: This is not the sort of car chosen for its driving excitement. Comfort, convenience and efficiency are what the Camry is about. But if practicality gets you going, the Toyota's personality should suit you well.
