model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Lots of interior space here. Legroom is ample, including the back seats. Rear passenger foot room under front seats is decent, too. Headroom is good front and rear, though it's a bit less in the rear seat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Forward visibilty is aided by slim windshield pillars. The shape of the hood is such that it can be difficult to gauge where the front corners end, but the rear view is quite good. A rearview camera with a large screen comes standard.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Access to the 15.4 cubic-foot trunk is good thanks to a large opening. Rear seatbacks are split-folding to increase cargo space when needed. Door pockets are deep and wide enough to be quite useful. Enough cupholders for all.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Camry manages its space extremely well. Large door openings allow easy access for most body types with various degrees of flexibility. Interior head and legroom are commendable, narrow roof pillars make for an easy outward view. Lots of versatile storage space in the cabin.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Our test vehicle displayed zero squeaks and rattles. It's clear an effort was made to cover the most frequently used surfaces with soft-touch material. Switches have a more durable, less plasticky feel than the last generation car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The LE tested here is the entry-level Camry, with a starting price around $23,000. At that price it comes with a standard 6-inch touchscreen, heated mirrors, 8-way power driver seat, backup camera and remote keyless entry.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The only options on our test car were floormats for $225, bringing the as-tested price to around $24,000. By comparison, the top-level 2015 Camry XLE 4-cylinder has a starting MSRP of nearly $27,000.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Combined EPA fuel economy is 28 mpg Combined (26 City/35 Highway) for the Camry LE 4-cylinder, which is 2-3 mpg below several key rivals. We averaged 27.3 mpg over 700 miles of mixed driving. Our best single tank was 32.1 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties are standard. Neither is class-leading.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Toyota offers roadside assistance and free scheduled oil changes and tire rotations for 2 years/25,000 miles. Some competitors offer longer roadside assistance, but none match the Camry's free maintenance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: As a Toyota product, the Camry brings good build quality and competitive pricing. Its 28 mpg Combined fuel economy isn't bad, either. Free scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for the first two years of ownership are nice touches.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There is a small degree of sport beneath the Camry's sleeker new skin. Admittedly most folks will never unlock the Camry's full dynamic potential, nor have any desire to. But it's nice to know it's there.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Camry is more of a function-to-drive car than it is fun-to-drive. It serves the purposes of moving people from here to there in comfort, with decent fuel economy and minimal hassle. But, with this redesign its fun factor has certainly improved thanks to better driving dynamics.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry
style.name: LE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: This is not the sort of car chosen for its driving excitement. Comfort, convenience and efficiency are what the Camry is about. But if practicality gets you going, the Toyota's personality should suit you well.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Camry is more of a function-to-drive car than it is fun-to-drive. It serves the purposes of moving people from here to there in comfort, with decent fuel economy and minimal hassle. But, with this redesign its fun factor has certainly improved thanks to better driving dynamics.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Camry Hybrid's 200 horsepower gives 0-60 mph in 7.6 sec. Only the Honda Accord Hybrid can match that. Heavy throttle action causes the CVT to hold revs annoyingly high, other times it lugs the engine.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid's 156-horsepower four-cylinder plus electric motor combo give 200 horsepower in total. This results in class-leading accleration. Unfortunately, in just about every other performance parameter the Camry is merely mediocre.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The brakes are hard to modulate and have little feeling during slow driving. Some hybrids have improved here, but not Toyota. The Camry's panic-stop number was average at 122 feet from 60 mph.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid's 156-horsepower four-cylinder plus electric motor combo give 200 horsepower in total. This results in class-leading accleration. Unfortunately, in just about every other performance parameter the Camry is merely mediocre.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Camry Hybrid's heavily-weighted steering worked fine during instrumented testing. But in normal driving it exhibited an odd reluctance to return to center. Meaning, if you turn the wheel left, it stays pointed left.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid's 156-horsepower four-cylinder plus electric motor combo give 200 horsepower in total. This results in class-leading accleration. Unfortunately, in just about every other performance parameter the Camry is merely mediocre.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The car doesn't give the same kind of feedback to the driver as the Ford Fusion Hybrid, though it feels more connected to the road than the Hyundai Sonata. Uninspiring, like most hybrids.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid's 156-horsepower four-cylinder plus electric motor combo give 200 horsepower in total. This results in class-leading accleration. Unfortunately, in just about every other performance parameter the Camry is merely mediocre.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Camry doesn't feel as "normal" as some competitors, due to the operation of its CVT and some highway rpm surging. We do appreciate the good outward views, backup camera and supple throttle. Not the wonky brakes.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid's 156-horsepower four-cylinder plus electric motor combo give 200 horsepower in total. This results in class-leading accleration. Unfortunately, in just about every other performance parameter the Camry is merely mediocre.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Front seats are on the thin side padding-wise, but the optional Ultrasuede inserts are soft and grippy. Armrests could also use more cushioning. Rear seats are quite comfortable, with ample rake to seatback.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A combination of rough-riding tires and thinly-padded seats add up to a less-than-cushy ride. We do like the soft Ultrasuede seat material though. Wind and engine noise are pleasantly subdued at highway speeds.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The tires felt overly harsh across Botts' dots and other road imperfections. The suspension doesn't feel as cushy as you'd expect, transmitting freeway expansion joints into the cabin too frequently.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A combination of rough-riding tires and thinly-padded seats add up to a less-than-cushy ride. We do like the soft Ultrasuede seat material though. Wind and engine noise are pleasantly subdued at highway speeds.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: At highway speeds the engine and wind noise are barely noticeable, but tire hum is prevalent, especially on cement surfaces. The Camry is reasonably quiet at full throttle, though the CVT keeps revs high.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A combination of rough-riding tires and thinly-padded seats add up to a less-than-cushy ride. We do like the soft Ultrasuede seat material though. Wind and engine noise are pleasantly subdued at highway speeds.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Mostly simple ergos with easy-to-navigate 7-inch touchscreen. The steering wheel controls aren't labeled well. Large temp knobs, but the detents are mushy. Easy phone pairing. Driving position too high.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from below average headroom front and rear, the Camry Hybrid's interior offers a lot of positives. Easy entry/exit, excellent outward views, plenty of storage cubbies and a larger-than-average trunk.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Front doors don't open wide but are long, so there's still a large entryway. Easy to hit heel on the wide rocker panels. Fairly expansive opening to get in/out of the rear seats.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from below average headroom front and rear, the Camry Hybrid's interior offers a lot of positives. Easy entry/exit, excellent outward views, plenty of storage cubbies and a larger-than-average trunk.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: A surprising lack of front headroom for taller drivers, and it's even more problematic in the rear. Nice elbow cutouts front and rear and very good rear knee room, though tight foot space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from below average headroom front and rear, the Camry Hybrid's interior offers a lot of positives. Easy entry/exit, excellent outward views, plenty of storage cubbies and a larger-than-average trunk.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Narrow pillars all around the car, giving excellent outward views. Makes lane changes easy. Large rear window, plus a good-sized optional rearview camera for parking duty.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from below average headroom front and rear, the Camry Hybrid's interior offers a lot of positives. Easy entry/exit, excellent outward views, plenty of storage cubbies and a larger-than-average trunk.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Superb. Center console cupholders have excellent anti-tip, 10 total. Large center armrest bin, handy front bin with a privacy door. Coinholder. Trunk has large opening, big space for segment at 13.1 cu-ft.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from below average headroom front and rear, the Camry Hybrid's interior offers a lot of positives. Easy entry/exit, excellent outward views, plenty of storage cubbies and a larger-than-average trunk.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: We were a bit let down by the materials in this Camry Hybrid. The hard dash feels cheap, there are few pieces of soft-touch and controls aren't damped well. Should be better at the XLE's $28,465 starting price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid offers decent value, although we've come to expect "excellent" from Toyota. It's marred by some cheap-feeling interior materials, and several rival hybrids returned better fuel mileage in our real-world driving tests.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Camry Hybrid XLE comes with dual-zone climate control, a 6.1-inch touchscreen display, Bluetooth, USB and aux-in ports, an 8-way power driver's seat, cruise control, heated mirrors and 17-inch alloy wheels.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid offers decent value, although we've come to expect "excellent" from Toyota. It's marred by some cheap-feeling interior materials, and several rival hybrids returned better fuel mileage in our real-world driving tests.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Option packages brought our XLE to an as-tested $35,170. The added items include a blind-spot monitor, backup camera, Ultrasuede seat inserts, heated front seats, a 7-inch touchscreen and a power sunroof.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid offers decent value, although we've come to expect "excellent" from Toyota. It's marred by some cheap-feeling interior materials, and several rival hybrids returned better fuel mileage in our real-world driving tests.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The EPA rates the Camry Hybrid at 40 mpg Combined (40 City/38 Highway). We only averaged 37.4 mpg overall, although we did manage an impressive 46.4 mpg on our 100-mile fuel economy loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid offers decent value, although we've come to expect "excellent" from Toyota. It's marred by some cheap-feeling interior materials, and several rival hybrids returned better fuel mileage in our real-world driving tests.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Camry's 3-year/36,000-mile bumper-to-bumper and 5-year/60,000-mile drivetrain warranties are no better than average. Hybrid components are covered for 8 years/100,000 miles by law (10 years/150,000 miles in California).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid offers decent value, although we've come to expect "excellent" from Toyota. It's marred by some cheap-feeling interior materials, and several rival hybrids returned better fuel mileage in our real-world driving tests.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Roadside assistance for 2 years/25,000 miles and free maintenance also for 2 years/25,000 miles. The Ford Fusion Hybrid and VW Jetta Hybrid offer longer roadside assistance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Camry Hybrid offers decent value, although we've come to expect "excellent" from Toyota. It's marred by some cheap-feeling interior materials, and several rival hybrids returned better fuel mileage in our real-world driving tests.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: These days we like hybrids that drive more like normal cars, with less CVT rubberbanding or highway rpm surging. From this perspective, the Ford Fusion Hybrid provides a better driving experience.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With 200 blended horsepower (gasoline engine plus electric motor) the Camry Hybrid is one of the quickest in this segment. That makes it more interesting than some, but few people buying these hybrids get hung up on 0-60 times.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: XLE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota Camrys are known for getting the job done delivering you from A to B. With its odd steering, CVT transmission and only adequate comfort, the Camry Hybrid offers even less personality than usual.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With 200 blended horsepower (gasoline engine plus electric motor) the Camry Hybrid is one of the quickest in this segment. That makes it more interesting than some, but few people buying these hybrids get hung up on 0-60 times.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Considering how frugal this car can be, the Camry Hybrid SE accelerates smartly when asked. It can haul itself from zero to 60 mph in 7.7 seconds, but it also has good part-throttle response around town.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This car can sip fuel to the tune of 40 mpg, but it doesn't feel like it has suffered any great compromise to do so. It accelerates, steers and brakes like any normal family sedan, and the SE treatment is actually more than a badge. Glad to finally see SE and hybrid on the same Camry.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Brakes feel firmer and more responsive than the last Camry hybrid we drove, and it remains composed under hard braking. Sixty-to-zero panic stop distance of 126 feet is average, and it's not as smooth as it could be at parking speeds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This car can sip fuel to the tune of 40 mpg, but it doesn't feel like it has suffered any great compromise to do so. It accelerates, steers and brakes like any normal family sedan, and the SE treatment is actually more than a badge. Glad to finally see SE and hybrid on the same Camry.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Steering feels suitably accurate and responsive. There's a little more heft and effort than other Camry hybrid versions, but in a good way. It hasn't been taken too far and the feeling of control is generally enhanced.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This car can sip fuel to the tune of 40 mpg, but it doesn't feel like it has suffered any great compromise to do so. It accelerates, steers and brakes like any normal family sedan, and the SE treatment is actually more than a badge. Glad to finally see SE and hybrid on the same Camry.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Grip is modest but not deficient, and the SE hybrid exhibits good poise and balance for a family-oriented sedan. When pushed it even feels a wee bit perky. Tires tend to get moved around by some freeway rain grooves, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This car can sip fuel to the tune of 40 mpg, but it doesn't feel like it has suffered any great compromise to do so. It accelerates, steers and brakes like any normal family sedan, and the SE treatment is actually more than a badge. Glad to finally see SE and hybrid on the same Camry.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Smooth and seamless feel from the hybrid CVT transmission. There are never any distinct shift points, but the engine can rev higher than expected at times. Automatic engine stop/start generally unobtrusive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: This car can sip fuel to the tune of 40 mpg, but it doesn't feel like it has suffered any great compromise to do so. It accelerates, steers and brakes like any normal family sedan, and the SE treatment is actually more than a badge. Glad to finally see SE and hybrid on the same Camry.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Front seats offer a good mix of softness and support. Softex seat fabric that comes on the SE is very conforming (and it looks good, too.) Driver's side has 8-way power adjustment, but the passenger side is manually adjustable.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The new Camry SE hybrid benefits from a bit more ride control from its suspension, but it's no less comfortable than other models. Seats are comfortable and supportive, and nobody riding inside is likely to complain of any noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Doesn't bob or float as much as past Camry hybrids we've driven, perhaps because this is the new SE version. But it's not hard or harsh, either. Instead, the SE hybrid delivers a welcome blend of road isolation and body motion control.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The new Camry SE hybrid benefits from a bit more ride control from its suspension, but it's no less comfortable than other models. Seats are comfortable and supportive, and nobody riding inside is likely to complain of any noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally quiet, with little road or wind noise. This new Camry also seems to produce less of the quirky hybrid noises that are very self-evident in a Prius.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The new Camry SE hybrid benefits from a bit more ride control from its suspension, but it's no less comfortable than other models. Seats are comfortable and supportive, and nobody riding inside is likely to complain of any noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Clean and simple layout that's easy to decipher. Audio system flanked by large buttons that are clearly marked, climate controls are straighforward. Telescopic steering wheel and 8-way power driver seat make for a good driving position.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Recent Camry interiors have been logically arranged and easy to use, but the 2015 benefits from improved switchgear and upgraded materials. Cabin feels open and airy and it's easy to get in and out. Hybrid battery does make the trunk smaller, but there's still a useful amount of space.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Doors open wide and the seat height isn't overly low. Sportier SE seats don't have aggressive bolsters to get in the way, either. Rear door opening is cut pretty straight across the top, which makes it unnecessary to crouch much.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Recent Camry interiors have been logically arranged and easy to use, but the 2015 benefits from improved switchgear and upgraded materials. Cabin feels open and airy and it's easy to get in and out. Hybrid battery does make the trunk smaller, but there's still a useful amount of space.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The 2015 Camry offers plenty of leg and headroom in both rows of seats. Low dashboard and side glass enhances the feeling of space. Optional moonroof does take a small bite out of headroom, but it's minimal.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Recent Camry interiors have been logically arranged and easy to use, but the 2015 benefits from improved switchgear and upgraded materials. Cabin feels open and airy and it's easy to get in and out. Hybrid battery does make the trunk smaller, but there's still a useful amount of space.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Thin windshield pillars and low side glass add up to an airy feeling. Visibility is good out the back, too, and is aided by standard back-up camera. Front view is open, but the hood drops away such that the front corners are hard to see.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Recent Camry interiors have been logically arranged and easy to use, but the 2015 benefits from improved switchgear and upgraded materials. Cabin feels open and airy and it's easy to get in and out. Hybrid battery does make the trunk smaller, but there's still a useful amount of space.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Good-sized trunk despite battery intrusion, and the shape is quite useful. Trunk opening is good-sized and the liftover is low. The battery does make the trunk pass-through comically tiny, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Recent Camry interiors have been logically arranged and easy to use, but the 2015 benefits from improved switchgear and upgraded materials. Cabin feels open and airy and it's easy to get in and out. Hybrid battery does make the trunk smaller, but there's still a useful amount of space.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The new 2015 bodywork is well put together, with consistent small gaps all around. The improved interior has better switchgear and the multilayered design is made of interesting-looking materials that are soft at the touch points.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid is a more attractive choice than last year, and the new SE model gives hybrid buyers access to a popular and affordable trim package. Fuel economy is quite good, but it is true that falling gas prices make the hybrid payback period stretch out longer.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: For the first time the hybrid can be paired with the SE package, and our example felt well-equipped despite few options. It comes with pushbutton start, automatic climate control, backup camera, and many nice touches.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid is a more attractive choice than last year, and the new SE model gives hybrid buyers access to a popular and affordable trim package. Fuel economy is quite good, but it is true that falling gas prices make the hybrid payback period stretch out longer.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The SE hybrid's base price of $28,820 (including destination) is almost $2,000 less than the XLE hybrid. Our only options were Premium audio and Navigation ($1,300), power moonroof ($915) and floor mats.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid is a more attractive choice than last year, and the new SE model gives hybrid buyers access to a popular and affordable trim package. Fuel economy is quite good, but it is true that falling gas prices make the hybrid payback period stretch out longer.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Rated fuel economy of 40 mpg Combined (40 City/38 Highway) was replicated on our suburban test loop, which the SE hybrid circulated at 42.9 mpg. Other tanks registered in the high 30's. Impressive for a midsize family sedan.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid is a more attractive choice than last year, and the new SE model gives hybrid buyers access to a popular and affordable trim package. Fuel economy is quite good, but it is true that falling gas prices make the hybrid payback period stretch out longer.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota warranties aren't class-leading. You get 3 yrs/36,000 miles of basic coverage and 5 yrs/60,000 miles of powertrain coverage. Hybrid component coverage is more generous by law at 8 yrs/100,000 miles (even longer in CARB states).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid is a more attractive choice than last year, and the new SE model gives hybrid buyers access to a popular and affordable trim package. Fuel economy is quite good, but it is true that falling gas prices make the hybrid payback period stretch out longer.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota offers roadside assistance and free scheduled oil changes and tire rotations for 2 yrs/25,000 miles. And the nature of hybrid regenerative braking means the brake pads and rotors could last 2-3 times as long as a normal Camry.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid is a more attractive choice than last year, and the new SE model gives hybrid buyers access to a popular and affordable trim package. Fuel economy is quite good, but it is true that falling gas prices make the hybrid payback period stretch out longer.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The 2015 Camry Hybrid is more interesting than ever before thanks to the new SE trim and the slightly more engaging suspension and steering tuning that comes with it. Fuel economy remains solid, and the hybrid system is highly developed.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Those that like the idea of a hybrid but still want a car that's responsive when the road stops being straight may well find a happy medium in the 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid SE. The fuel economy is as good as ever, but the SE isn't as soft and weak-kneed as some of its siblings.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Camry Hybrid
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan (2.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The new 2015 bodywork is much less dreary than last year's squared-off Pinewood Derby look. This time there's actually a slight implication of eagerness and athleticism. That said, it's still the sort of conservative look that won't offend.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Those that like the idea of a hybrid but still want a car that's responsive when the road stops being straight may well find a happy medium in the 2015 Toyota Camry Hybrid SE. The fuel economy is as good as ever, but the SE isn't as soft and weak-kneed as some of its siblings.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The LE Eco makes 140 horsepower from a 1.8-liter 4-cylinder hooked to a Continuously Variable Transmission. In Sport mode it outpaces rivals like the Civic, but the CVT can cause an unpleasant engine drone.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Performance is not the Corolla's friend. The driving dynamics will satisfy casual drivers, but anyone craving a little excitement should look elsewhere.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: With a panic-stop distance of 130 feet, the Corolla lands right in the middle of the pack. In daily driving the pedal is firm and progressive with no jumpiness.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Performance is not the Corolla's friend. The driving dynamics will satisfy casual drivers, but anyone craving a little excitement should look elsewhere.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla's steering is light, but not disconcertingly so. There's virtually no feedback, however, and in parking lot situations it's easy to outrun the power steering.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Performance is not the Corolla's friend. The driving dynamics will satisfy casual drivers, but anyone craving a little excitement should look elsewhere.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Handling has never been a Corolla strongsuit and it still isn't in the 2014 model. Body roll is pronounced and overall grip is low. Not a driver's car.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Performance is not the Corolla's friend. The driving dynamics will satisfy casual drivers, but anyone craving a little excitement should look elsewhere.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The CVT's dedicated Sport and Braking modes via the gear selector enhance the Corolla's driveability, giving two levels of engine braking. Most compacts don't offer this degree of control.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Performance is not the Corolla's friend. The driving dynamics will satisfy casual drivers, but anyone craving a little excitement should look elsewhere.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla is a case of "if you fit, you fit." Seat fabric feels a little thin and seating position adjustments are basic. There's no lumbar support, which bothered some of our testers.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Quiet and composed for its size, the 2014 Corolla will certainly impress those coming from the last generations of compacts. Lots of rear seat space, but the driver's seat lacks padding and lumbar support.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: One of the Corolla's strong suits, the ride isn't bouncy or floaty like other compacts. It feels buttoned-down, but never rough. Pleasing over virtually all surfaces.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Quiet and composed for its size, the 2014 Corolla will certainly impress those coming from the last generations of compacts. Lots of rear seat space, but the driver's seat lacks padding and lumbar support.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: There's little wind or road/tire noise, even at highway speeds. The Corolla is, however, susceptible to some bump-related thunking from the suspension.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Quiet and composed for its size, the 2014 Corolla will certainly impress those coming from the last generations of compacts. Lots of rear seat space, but the driver's seat lacks padding and lumbar support.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Toyota has made a living by not confusing people. Everything in the Corolla is where you expect it to be and does what you expect it to do. Touchscreen is marvelously simple/effective.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla's wide-opening doors and normal seat height mean minimal bending is required for entrance. Head clearance is good, too. Even the backseats are usable by adults.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Up front, the Corolla can feel a little tight thanks to a tall dash and wide door panels, but head/hip/leg room is very good. Rear seats have real leg room, plenty of room for adults or a car seat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A rear-view camera is standard on the LE trim, but it's barely necessary. Even though the trunk is a touch high, visibility out the rear is still very good. Forward visibility is unhindered.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla's 13 cubic-feet of trunk space is average for the class. Interior storage bins are minimal, cupholders (2 up front) hold drinks in place well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The materials used in the Corolla aren't the best in the industry, but tolerances are tight and there wasn't a squeak or rattle. Important touch-points, like the steering wheel and shifter, feel solid.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 2014 Corolla comes with LED headlights, air conditioning, Bluetooth and USB. Even with CVT, backup camera, keyless entry, cruise control, auto climate control and touchscreen, it was still under $20,000.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: With a starting price of $17,610, an as-tested price of $19,735 and a fully-loaded sticker of just under $23,000, the 2014 Corolla isn't the cheapest car you can buy, but it's a solid price for this segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: We averaged just over 30 mpg in the Corolla, shy of its 35 Combined mpg (30 City/42 Highway) EPA rating. On our 116-mile evaluation loop, the Corolla returned 35 mpg and we don't doubt that 42 mpg is possible.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: MPG

style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 2014 Toyota Corolla offers a 3-year/36,000-mile bumper-to-bumper warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla offers free scheduled maintenance for 2 years/25,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The critical experience of a Corolla isn't in the drive, it's in the long-term reliability, fuel economy and low cost of ownership.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: While the Corolla won't disappoint those looking for effective A-to-B transport, it won't surprise or delight anyone either. This is a commuter car, not a toy. If you want fun, try the Mazda 3 or Ford Focus.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Again, personality ins't the Corolla's game. It's got a personality that quietly declares the owner's sound, reasonable decision making.

model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Up front, the Corolla can feel a little tight thanks to a tall dash and wide door panels, but head/hip/leg room is very good. Rear seats have real leg room, plenty of room for adults or a car seat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: A rear-view camera is standard on the LE trim, but it's barely necessary. Even though the trunk is a touch high, visibility out the rear is still very good. Forward visibility is unhindered.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla's 13 cubic-feet of trunk space is average for the class. Interior storage bins are minimal, cupholders (2 up front) hold drinks in place well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In contrast to some of its competitors, the 2014 Corolla's interior is a marvel of restraint. Everything is easy to reach, easy to read and easy to use.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The materials used in the Corolla aren't the best in the industry, but tolerances are tight and there wasn't a squeak or rattle. Important touch-points, like the steering wheel and shifter, feel solid.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 2014 Corolla comes with LED headlights, air conditioning, Bluetooth and USB. Even with CVT, backup camera, keyless entry, cruise control, auto climate control and touchscreen, it was still under $20,000.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: With a starting price of $17,610, an as-tested price of $19,735 and a fully-loaded sticker of just under $23,000, the 2014 Corolla isn't the cheapest car you can buy, but it's a solid price for this segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: We averaged just over 30 mpg in the Corolla, shy of its 35 Combined mpg (30 City/42 Highway) EPA rating. On our 116-mile evaluation loop, the Corolla returned 35 mpg and we don't doubt that 42 mpg is possible.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The 2014 Toyota Corolla offers a 3-year/36,000-mile bumper-to-bumper warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The Corolla offers free scheduled maintenance for 2 years/25,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Value is where the Corolla shines. With an as-tested price of $19,735, our tester was equipped with a touchscreen, Bluetooth, USB input and an EPA rating of 35 Combined mpg.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: The critical experience of a Corolla isn't in the drive, it's in the long-term reliability, fuel economy and low cost of ownership.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: While the Corolla won't disappoint those looking for effective A-to-B transport, it won't surprise or delight anyone either. This is a commuter car, not a toy. If you want fun, try the Mazda 3 or Ford Focus.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Corolla
style.name: LE Eco 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl CVT)
summary: Again, personality ins't the Corolla's game. It's got a personality that quietly declares the owner's sound, reasonable decision making.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: While the Corolla won't disappoint those looking for effective A-to-B transport, it won't surprise or delight anyone either. This is a commuter car, not a toy. If you want fun, try the Mazda 3 or Ford Focus.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Despite expectations, the Prius has enough power to comfortably merge onto the freeway and climb grades. Its 10.1-second run to 60 mph isn't going to win it any speed trophies, but that's not the point.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can roll along at 50 mpg.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Our 60-mph panic stop took just 124 feet, a decent result on skinny low-rolling resistance tires. The pedal is mostly firm, but can feel weird at times because of the behind-the-scenes blending of magnetic and mechanical braking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can roll along at 50 mpg.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Steering effort is appropriate for this sort of family car and it responds smartly enough. But the feeling is somewhat muted and inauthentic. Tires like to follow seams and rain grooves.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can roll along at 50 mpg.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius is a little less sprightly than the shorter Prius C, and its fuel-saving low rolling resistance tires don't offer tons of ultimate grip. Still, it is maneuverable and coordinated.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can roll along at 50 mpg.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's hybrids are built around a stepless continuously variable transmission that's butter smooth. It sometimes doesn't sound that way as the motor cycles on and off, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can roll along at 50 mpg.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius front and rear seats are soft and supportive, though the front seats may not adjust down far enough to find the perfect driving position relative to the pedals and steering wheel.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is generally comfortable in most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally smooth in most situations, but the high-pressure tires do make it feel up on tiptoes sometimes.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is generally comfortable in most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: At or slightly above the class average in terms of wind noise. Reasonable road noise. Engine mostly quiet but certain hybrid system whirring, whining and clicking noises emerge at odd intervals.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is generally comfortable in most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The shifter and park button are unnecessarily odd and the central gauges take getting used to. But it does become familiar soon enough. Other controls are easy and the steering wheel buttons work well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The front doors open wide and there are no obstructions. Exceedingly high roofline. The story is much the same in the back.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Plenty of front seat headroom and legroom for tall folks, and the steering wheel tilts and telescopes. Rear-seat space is generous too, particularly legroom. It's clear why these make good eco-taxis.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Slender pillars and lots of glass add up to good forward and rear side visibility. The rear view is enhanced by the vertical glass panel in the hatch. Our back-up camera was pure gravy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The characteristic Prius shape is what makes it so useful here. There's plenty of space under the hatch and it's downright cavernous with the rear seats folded. Decent interior storage up front.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Hybrids are more expensive than their conventional counterparts, but Toyota hasn't scrimped to offset the hybrid premium. That said, some interior materials could be more premium-looking.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius offers amazing MPG and reliability, and can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets and preferences.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Our mid-level Prius Three comes with navigation, a telescopic wheel, automatic climate control and power seats. At the highest levels you can get a heads-up display and adaptive cruise control, but that starts to get pricey.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius offers amazing MPG and reliability, and can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets and preferences.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The price of a Prius has come down low enough that it can offset its higher hybrid price in a couple of years. Five available trim levels offer different equipment but share the fuel economy.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius offers amazing MPG and reliability, and can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets and preferences.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: It doesn't get any better than this. Its 50 mpg Combined rating (51 City/48 Highway) is the best, bar none, for a gasoline-powered car that doesn't have a plug-in system.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius offers amazing MPG and reliability, and can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets and preferences.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The powertrain is covered for 5 years/60,000 miles and the hybrid components and battery are covered for 8 years/100,000 miles. But it would be nice if Toyota's basic warranty were better than 3 years/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius offers amazing MPG and reliability, and can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets and preferences.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Fuel costs are nil, and oil changes and tire rotations are covered by Toyota for the first 2 years. The engine has no belts to change, brake pads should last years; there's little to go wrong.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius offers amazing MPG and reliability, and can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets and preferences.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: This isn't really a driver's car unless saving fuel and bragging about mpg is your thing. To that end the Prius has engaging driver feedback that turns saving fuel into a game.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps. Perhaps satisfying is a better word. And the interactive driver feedback can turn fuel saving into a game, if you're inclined to play along.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Like it or not, the Prius has a clearly-defined and strong personality. It's pretty much a brand unto itself. It makes a statement, even if only half the electorate agrees with it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive

model.name: Prius

summary: Like it or not, the Prius has a clearly-defined and strong personality. It's pretty much a brand unto itself. It makes a statement, even if only half the electorate agrees with it.
