title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius has enough power (134 hp) to comfortably merge onto the freeway. It's 10.2-second run from 0-60 mph isn't going to win any trophies, but that's not why you buy one. Wring it too hard, though, and you'll really cut into your MPG.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Prius is an MPG-focused machine that rides on a simplistic chassis and economy-minded tires. It should be no surprise that it isn't a speed demon, nor does it excel at steering, cornering or braking. It's competent, but recent competitors have made it feel lacking.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Our 60-0 mph panic stop took 124 feet, a reasonable result. But the pedal feels weirdly non-linear (sometimes grabby, sometimes not), especially at city speeds. Rivals are better at blending magnetic and mechanical braking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Prius is an MPG-focused machine that rides on a simplistic chassis and economy-minded tires. It should be no surprise that it isn't a speed demon, nor does it excel at steering, cornering or braking. It's competent, but recent competitors have made it feel lacking.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Steering weight is appropriate for this sort of family car and it responds smartly enough. But its straight-ahead sense is muffled at city speeds. Crosswinds, road crown and pavement seams can move the Prius about at higher speeds.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Prius is an MPG-focused machine that rides on a simplistic chassis and economy-minded tires. It should be no surprise that it isn't a speed demon, nor does it excel at steering, cornering or braking. It's competent, but recent competitors have made it feel lacking.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius feels maneuverable and coordinated in routine situations. But the suspension doesn't like it when you hustle the car through turns, and the fuel-saving tires are low on grip. High seating position amplifies the feeling of roll.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Prius is an MPG-focused machine that rides on a simplistic chassis and economy-minded tires. It should be no surprise that it isn't a speed demon, nor does it excel at steering, cornering or braking. It's competent, but recent competitors have made it feel lacking.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's hybrids employ a stepless continuously variable transmission that's butter smooth. It oftentimes doesn't sound that way, though, as the thrashy motor cycles on and off.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Prius is an MPG-focused machine that rides on a simplistic chassis and economy-minded tires. It should be no surprise that it isn't a speed demon, nor does it excel at steering, cornering or braking. It's competent, but recent competitors have made it feel lacking.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Five's front leather seats are supportive and reasonably soft, but there are few adjustments for those that want to fine-tune the fit. Tall drivers will wish the seat could adjust lower, too. Backseat is well-sculpted and comfy.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort isn't the Prius' strongest suit, but it's not uncomfortable, either. The ride isn't particularly memorable but the seats do a good job if they fit you. Road and wind noise are held in check, but the hybrid system emits an odd collection of whirs, clicks and keening sounds.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally smooth if the road is in reasonable shape, but the suspension isn't sophisticated enough to deal with complex road surfaces. The high-pressure fuel-saving tires make it feel like it's up on its tiptoes sometimes, too.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort isn't the Prius' strongest suit, but it's not uncomfortable, either. The ride isn't particularly memorable but the seats do a good job if they fit you. Road and wind noise are held in check, but the hybrid system emits an odd collection of whirs, clicks and keening sounds.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Reasonable road noise, and wind noise is near class average. But the hybrid system makes a lot of ringing and keening sounds at odd intervals, and the engine can rev noisily when you least expect it. Newer products eclipse the Prius here.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort isn't the Prius' strongest suit, but it's not uncomfortable, either. The ride isn't particularly memorable but the seats do a good job if they fit you. Road and wind noise are held in check, but the hybrid system emits an odd collection of whirs, clicks and keening sounds.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The shifter and park button are unnecessarily odd and time has proven the strangeness of the central gauges, which have not been copied by anyone. Radio and climate controls are reasonably easy and the steering buttons do the job.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Legroom and headroom abound in the Prius, but the driving position doesn't adapt well to taller drivers, even though they fit easily. Odd shifter and unusual central gauges have not proven their worth and now feel dated and gimmicky. But, wow, a Prius sure swallows a lot of cargo.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Easy. The front doors open wide and the peak of the roof is high. The story is much the same in the back, though the downward slope of the roof back there does come into play if you're tall.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Legroom and headroom abound in the Prius, but the driving position doesn't adapt well to taller drivers, even though they fit easily. Odd shifter and unusual central gauges have not proven their worth and now feel dated and gimmicky. But, wow, a Prius sure swallows a lot of cargo.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Plenty of front seat headroom, but the top edge of the windshield feels low. Steering wheel tilts and telescopes, but it needs ability to pull back more. Rear-seat legroom is generous, but itâ€™s a bit narrow for three across back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Legroom and headroom abound in the Prius, but the driving position doesn't adapt well to taller drivers, even though they fit easily. Odd shifter and unusual central gauges have not proven their worth and now feel dated and gimmicky. But, wow, a Prius sure swallows a lot of cargo.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Slender pillars and lots of glass add up to good forward and side visibility. The rear three-quarter view is bothered by headrests and structure, but a vertical glass panel in the hatch opens up the view directly behind.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Legroom and headroom abound in the Prius, but the driving position doesn't adapt well to taller drivers, even though they fit easily. Odd shifter and unusual central gauges have not proven their worth and now feel dated and gimmicky. But, wow, a Prius sure swallows a lot of cargo.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The characteristic Prius shape and its hatchback design allow it to swallow a lot of cargo. And it's downright cavernous with the rear seats folded. Interior storage in the passenger areas is lacking somewhat, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Legroom and headroom abound in the Prius, but the driving position doesn't adapt well to taller drivers, even though they fit easily. Odd shifter and unusual central gauges have not proven their worth and now feel dated and gimmicky. But, wow, a Prius sure swallows a lot of cargo.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: A Prius is more expensive than its conventional counterparts, but the exterior maintains a Camry level of build quality. The interior fits together well, but the plastic bits have weird textures that come across as cheap-looking.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius still offers otherworldy MPG and needs little in the way of maintenance. It can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets, but as time passes it seems less and less class-leading and modern as it once did.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Five comes with navigation, telescopic steering, automatic climate control, 8-way power seats, automatic LED headlights, 17-inch wheels and more. The unimpressive leather looks fake, though. Optional Tech package is pricey.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius still offers otherworldy MPG and needs little in the way of maintenance. It can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets, but as time passes it seems less and less class-leading and modern as it once did.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The base price of the Prius has come down far enough that the cost of its hybrid powertrain can be offset in a couple of years. But this top-level Prius Five (tested) starts at $30,830, and there are options beyond that.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius still offers otherworldy MPG and needs little in the way of maintenance. It can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets, but as time passes it seems less and less class-leading and modern as it once did.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: It doesn't get any better than this. The Prius' 50-mpg EPA Combined rating (51 City/48 Highway) remains the thriftiest gasoline-fired car that doesn't plug in anyplace. That said, other hybrids are nipping at its heels.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius still offers otherworldy MPG and needs little in the way of maintenance. It can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets, but as time passes it seems less and less class-leading and modern as it once did.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The powertrain is covered for 5 years/60,000 miles and the hybrid components and battery are covered for 8 years/100,000 miles. We wish Toyota's basic warranty was better than 3 years/36,000 miles, though.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius still offers otherworldy MPG and needs little in the way of maintenance. It can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets, but as time passes it seems less and less class-leading and modern as it once did.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Fuel costs are nil, and oil changes and tire rotations are free from Toyota for the first two years. The engine has no belts to change and the brake pads could last years. Other than tires and wiper blades, there's little to go wrong.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius still offers otherworldy MPG and needs little in the way of maintenance. It can be equipped in a variety of ways to suit different budgets, but as time passes it seems less and less class-leading and modern as it once did.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius isn't a driver's car. Sure, it gets great mpg, but the quirkiness of the driving experience has lost whatever charm it once had as newer competing hybrids get more polished and refined. If it got 30 mpg you'd never consider it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun does not enter the equation unless you get your jollies by driving past gas stations. Perhaps satisfying is a better word. Also, the bragging-at-parties aspect has been fully played out because of all the greener-than-thou electric vehicles now on the market.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Five 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Like it or not, the Prius and its instantly-recognizable shape says something about the person behind the wheel. If your political outlook matches that image, great. If not, you've probably already decided you don't want one.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun does not enter the equation unless you get your jollies by driving past gas stations. Perhaps satisfying is a better word. Also, the bragging-at-parties aspect has been fully played out because of all the greener-than-thou electric vehicles now on the market.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Acceleration is adequate, although overall horsepower is down from the previous model. A 9.8-second 0-60 time is near the bottom of the segment, though the Prius has enough zip off the line to feel lively around town.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Fuel efficiency is the name of the game with the Prius, and the raw performance numbers reflect this. On its own, though, the Prius is a competent and efficient hatchback with solid handling and agreeable drivability. Numbers alone don't show the entire picture with this hybrid.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius stops from 60 to 0 mph in a solid 120 feet. In testing, braking distances remained consistent. Except at crawling speeds, pedal feel is smooth and linear without any of the awkwardness indicative of many hybrid systems.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Fuel efficiency is the name of the game with the Prius, and the raw performance numbers reflect this. On its own, though, the Prius is a competent and efficient hatchback with solid handling and agreeable drivability. Numbers alone don't show the entire picture with this hybrid.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The steering is direct, though it doesn't provide much feedback from the road. The system is well-weighted, and little effort is required to point the Prius in the intended direction without catching grooves or seams.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Fuel efficiency is the name of the game with the Prius, and the raw performance numbers reflect this. On its own, though, the Prius is a competent and efficient hatchback with solid handling and agreeable drivability. Numbers alone don't show the entire picture with this hybrid.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius feels responsive and reasonably agile on the street. Body roll is present and the tires fight for grip, but the car never feels unwieldy or dangerous. The Prius remains composed over mid-corner bumps and dips.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Fuel efficiency is the name of the game with the Prius, and the raw performance numbers reflect this. On its own, though, the Prius is a competent and efficient hatchback with solid handling and agreeable drivability. Numbers alone don't show the entire picture with this hybrid.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The transition from EV to hybrid mode feels seamless, though the engine sounds harsh when firing up. Acceleration is smooth without transmission shifts. Cruise control holds speed well going both up and downhill.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Fuel efficiency is the name of the game with the Prius, and the raw performance numbers reflect this. On its own, though, the Prius is a competent and efficient hatchback with solid handling and agreeable drivability. Numbers alone don't show the entire picture with this hybrid.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The seat offers loads of vertical adjustment, but there's no lumbar adjustment. The seat cushion is soft without feeling mushy and remains comfortable after long drives. Moderate side bolstering supports without squeezing.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable and quiet around town, especially in EV mode. The seats aren't class-leading, but they're comfortable and a step up from the previous model. It's only the buzzy engine that drags down the Prius' comfort level.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius is smooth and composed on the street. Rebound over bumps is minimal and the car never feels too bouncy or too stiff. Broken or uneven pavement doesn't upset the car or translate into a harsh ride quality.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable and quiet around town, especially in EV mode. The seats aren't class-leading, but they're comfortable and a step up from the previous model. It's only the buzzy engine that drags down the Prius' comfort level.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Extremely quiet in EV mode, but the engine provides a noticeable hum, which is exacerbated by the transmission holding RPMs steady. Wind noise is moderate and not overly booming. Better than the last Prius, but still not great.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable and quiet around town, especially in EV mode. The seats aren't class-leading, but they're comfortable and a step up from the previous model. It's only the buzzy engine that drags down the Prius' comfort level.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Touchscreen is user friendly and very responsive, but other functions are controlled by touch capacitive icons and not real buttons. Most controls are simple and well placed, but the odd shifter and center gauges seem needlessly unique.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Prius is, unsurprisingly, both practical and spacious. The hatch provides plenty of storage, while the large windows allow in plenty of light. The odd, center-mounted gauge cluster carries over from the last car, as does the unique shifter and park button.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Although the roof is lower than before, the Prius remains quite easy to get in and out of. The doors open wide allowing easy access to the front. Rear seat access is also good, but hampered slightly by the sloping roof line.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Prius is, unsurprisingly, both practical and spacious. The hatch provides plenty of storage, while the large windows allow in plenty of light. The odd, center-mounted gauge cluster carries over from the last car, as does the unique shifter and park button.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Front seats sit lower than before, increasing headroom. The feeling of sitting atop a bucket is gone. There's generous front shoulder and legroom. A new suspension design means less rear seat legroom than previous Prii.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Prius is, unsurprisingly, both practical and spacious. The hatch provides plenty of storage, while the large windows allow in plenty of light. The odd, center-mounted gauge cluster carries over from the last car, as does the unique shifter and park button.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Forward visibility is great, with large windows and a low dash providing a great view. Rear visibility is OK, but the split in the glass cuts through the sightline. Over-the-shoulder visibility is only slightly hindered by a sloping roof.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Prius is, unsurprisingly, both practical and spacious. The hatch provides plenty of storage, while the large windows allow in plenty of light. The odd, center-mounted gauge cluster carries over from the last car, as does the unique shifter and park button.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Cargo space is abundant. The hatch provides plenty of space with the rear seats up or down. A cargo cover folds and stores easily when not in use. The deep console provides plenty of space up front.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Prius is, unsurprisingly, both practical and spacious. The hatch provides plenty of storage, while the large windows allow in plenty of light. The odd, center-mounted gauge cluster carries over from the last car, as does the unique shifter and park button.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: We tested an early pre-production vehicle with minor fit and finish issues we don't believe will make it to full production. Overall, the Prius feels solid and, aside from an odd center console, uses nice materials throughout.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius' fuel efficiency is simply amazing, though it might take a few years for the savings to match the cost of the hybrid system. Still, the new Prius feels solid inside and out, with quality materials and a responsive infotainment system.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Three comes standard with LED headlights, keyless entry, Bluetooth audio, a wireless phone charging pad and a 4.2-inch touchscreen display with navigation. Blind-spot monitoring and radar cruise control are optional.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius' fuel efficiency is simply amazing, though it might take a few years for the savings to match the cost of the hybrid system. Still, the new Prius feels solid inside and out, with quality materials and a responsive infotainment system.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: A base Prius Two starts at $24,200, the same as the outgoing 2015 model. The Prius Three we tested starts around $26,000, and prices can creep past $30,000 with options.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius' fuel efficiency is simply amazing, though it might take a few years for the savings to match the cost of the hybrid system. Still, the new Prius feels solid inside and out, with quality materials and a responsive infotainment system.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: We achieved an all-time best 59.7 on our evaluation loop without trying to get good fuel economy. One tank averaged 61.4 mpg over 423.2 miles. This far exceeds the EPA estimated 54 city/50 highway/52 combined mpg. Extremely impressive numbers.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius' fuel efficiency is simply amazing, though it might take a few years for the savings to match the cost of the hybrid system. Still, the new Prius feels solid inside and out, with quality materials and a responsive infotainment system.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile comprehensive warranty. The powertrain is covered for 5 years/60,000 miles. Hybrid related components are covered for up to 15 years/150,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius' fuel efficiency is simply amazing, though it might take a few years for the savings to match the cost of the hybrid system. Still, the new Prius feels solid inside and out, with quality materials and a responsive infotainment system.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Excellent fuel economy reduces fuel costs drastically. Brake pad life extended by extensive use of regenerative braking. Every new Prius comes with two years of free scheduled maintenance as well as three years of 24/7 roadside assistance.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius' fuel efficiency is simply amazing, though it might take a few years for the savings to match the cost of the hybrid system. Still, the new Prius feels solid inside and out, with quality materials and a responsive infotainment system.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The driving experience is vastly improved over the previous model, but it still isn't enjoyable to drive in the traditional sense. Prius shoppers most likely care more about how it performs at the gas station than through a curve.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fuel economy is the name of the game with a Prius. Everything else in the driving experience comes second, though eeking out those last few miles on a tank can be fun. The Prius is unlikely to inspire any trips to a fun road, but it does inspire fewer trips to the Chevron.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Everything that owners and fans loved about the previous Prius carries over, mostly improved. It is still a uniquely styled and extremely fuel miserly hatchback. The more things change, the more they stay the same.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fuel economy is the name of the game with a Prius. Everything else in the driving experience comes second, though eeking out those last few miles on a tank can be fun. The Prius is unlikely to inspire any trips to a fun road, but it does inspire fewer trips to the Chevron.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius C is not speedy, but it gets up to freeway speed adequately and holds its own in city traffic. Besides, if 50 mpg is your goal you won't be flogging it anyway.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The brake pedal comes across as reassuring in most situations. In light use there's a faint whine as the hybrid system turns braking energy into electricity for the battery.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally, the steering is responsive and direct. Smaller tires and wheels allow the I, II and III to make much tighter U-turns than the top-of-the-line IV model.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius C is well-balanced and agile, but its fuel-saving low rolling resistance tires don't have lots of ultimate grip. Unsurprisingly, this isn't a high-performance machine.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's hybrids are built around a stepless continuously variable transmission that's butter smooth. It sometimes doesn't sound that way as the motor cycles on and off, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Although they don't come across as plush, the seats are comfortable in that they don't call attention to themselves after long hours behind the wheel.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius C is a small car that rides bigger than you'd guess by looking at it.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: A longer wheelbase settles the ride and makes the C feel one class bigger. It even seems more settled and less up on tiptoes than its older brother, the original Prius.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius C is a small car that rides bigger than you'd guess by looking at it.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: At or slightly above the class average in terms of wind and road noise. On the other hand the hybrid system emits characteristic noises at unpredictable intervals.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius C is a small car that rides bigger than you'd guess by looking at it.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Unlike other Prius models, the C's shifter is conventional. The automatic climate controls are elegant and easy, and there are numerous useful steering wheel buttons.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Simple, well-placed controls make the C easy to live with, and its long wheelbase opens up usable cabin room for occupants. Trunk space starts off modest, but with seats folded the hatchback adds versatility.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The front doors open wide and there are no obstructions. The rear is similar, but not as well suited for those over 6 feet tall.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Simple, well-placed controls make the C easy to live with, and its long wheelbase opens up usable cabin room for occupants. Trunk space starts off modest, but with seats folded the hatchback adds versatility.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Plenty of front seat space for tall guys, and the steering wheel tilts and telescopes for the proper fit. Rear-seat space is a bit tighter, though.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Simple, well-placed controls make the C easy to live with, and its long wheelbase opens up usable cabin room for occupants. Trunk space starts off modest, but with seats folded the hatchback adds versatility.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c

summary: Slender pillars and lots of glass add up to good forward and rear side visibility. The C-pillar is thick and the rear window is small; a back-up camera would be nice here.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Simple, well-placed controls make the C easy to live with, and its long wheelbase opens up usable cabin room for occupants. Trunk space starts off modest, but with seats folded the hatchback adds versatility.

summary: There's space enough behind the rear seats for groceries, and a large suitcase just fits. Fold down the rear seats and this small hatchback becomes fairly voluminous.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)

ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps. Perhaps satisfying is a better word. And the interactive driver feedback can turn fuel saving into a game if you're so inclined to play along.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c

ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps. Perhaps satisfying is a better word. And the interactive driver feedback can turn fuel saving into a game if you're so inclined to play along.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius C is not speedy, but it gets up to freeway speed adequately and holds its own in city traffic. Besides, if 50 mpg is your goal you won't be flogging it anyway.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The brake pedal comes across as reassuring in most situations. In light use there's a faint whine as the hybrid system turns braking energy into electricity for the battery.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally, the steering is responsive and direct. Smaller tires and wheels allow the I, II and III to make much tighter U-turns than the top-of-the-line IV model.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius C is well-balanced and agile, but its fuel-saving low rolling resistance tires don't have lots of ultimate grip. Unsurprisingly, this isn't a high-performance machine.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's hybrids are built around a stepless continuously variable transmission that's butter smooth. It sometimes doesn't sound that way as the motor cycles on and off, though.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Very solid and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can exceed 50 mpg.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Although they don't come across as plush, the seats are comfortable in that they don't call attention to themselves after long hours behind the wheel.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius C is a small car that rides bigger than you'd guess by looking at it.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: A longer wheelbase settles the ride and makes the C feel one class bigger. It even seems more settled and less up on tiptoes than its older brother, the original Prius.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius C is a small car that rides bigger than you'd guess by looking at it.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: At or slightly above the class average in terms of wind and road noise. On the other hand the hybrid system emits characteristic noises at unpredictable intervals.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius C is a small car that rides bigger than you'd guess by looking at it.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius c
style.name: Three 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Unlike other Prius models, the C's shifter is conventional. The automatic climate controls are elegant and easy, and there are numerous useful steering wheel buttons.

ratings.summary: Simple, well-placed controls make the C easy to live with, and its long wheelbase opens up usable cabin room for occupants. Trunk space starts off modest, but with seats folded the hatchback adds versatility.

model.name: Prius c

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in won't win any speed contests, but it has sufficient power for safe freeway merges. It's 9.9-second run to 60 mph is a couple tenths quicker than a regular Prius.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Our 60-mph panic stop took 127 feet, a few feet longer than a standard Prius, perhaps due to the extra weight of the plug-in system. The pedal is reassuringly firm much of the time.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Steering effort is appropriate for this sort of family car and it responds smartly enough. But the feeling is somewhat muted and inauthentic. Tires like to follow seams and rain grooves.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in is just as maneuverable as a standard Prius, and both share the same fuel-saving low rolling resistance tires which don't have much ultimate grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's hybrids are built around a stepless continuously variable transmission that's butter smooth. The Plug-in adds 11 whisper-silent battery miles before the gas engine takes over.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius' seats are soft and supportive. Tall drivers might say the lowest seat setting isn't low enough realtive to the telescopic steering wheel, which doesn't pull back quite far enough.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable is most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally smooth in most situations, but the high-pressure tires make it feel like it's up on tiptoes sometimes.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable is most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: At or slightly above the class average in terms of wind noise. Resonable road noise. Electric mode (EV) is largely silent. Engine noise in hybrid mode is similar to any other Prius.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable is most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The shifter and park button are unnecessarily odd and the central gauges take getting used to. Other controls are easy and the steering buttons work well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The front doors open wide and there are no obstructions. Exceedingly high roofline means no ducking. The story is much the same in the back.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Plenty of front seat headroom for tall folks, and the steering wheel tilts and telescopes. Rear-seat space is generous too, particularly legroom. It's clear why these make good eco-taxis.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Slender pillars and lots of glass add up to good forward and rear side visibility. The rear view is enhanced by the vertical glass panel in the hatch. The back-up camera is pure gravy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in avoids the huge loss of cargo that plagues other plug-in hybrids because its modest rechargeable battery is under the floor. There's plenty of hatch space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: You're into $40,000 territory once you go for the plug-in version. The interior materials and presentation that were okay in the 25k-30k Prius level start to feel substandard at this price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in at least tries to offset its price by including adaptive cruise control and a heads-up display, things that are optional on the high-grade regular Prius Five.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: It's hard to justify the cost of a Prius Plug-in over a regular Prius; $40,500 is a lot to pay for what is essentially a standard 50-mpg Prius after the first 11 battery miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Looked at separately, the Prius Plug-In is rated at 50 mpg combined (51 city/49 highway) on gasoline and can travel 11 miles on batteries.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The powertrain is covered for 5 yrs/60,000 miles and the hybrid components and battery are covered for 8 yrs/100,000 miles. But the basic warranty should be longer than 3 yrs/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The battery is small enough that a standard 120V outlet is all you need to recharge a Prius Plug-in at home. Plug-ins may be eligible for carpool lane stickers in California and elsewhere.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The plug-in feature is best for those with short commutes. Gasoline is king on long highway trips where the Prius Plug-in gets 49 mpg, but any Prius can do that.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps and running on electricity. The Plug-in Prius is good at both, and is most satisfying for those that live relatively close to work.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Like it or not, the Prius has a clearly-defined and strong personality. It's pretty much a brand unto itself. It makes a statement, even if only half the electorate agrees with it.

ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in is just as maneuverable as a standard Prius, and both share the same fuel-saving low rolling resistance tires which don't have much ultimate grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's hybrids are built around a stepless continuously variable transmission that's butter smooth. The Plug-in adds 11 whisper-silent battery miles before the gas engine takes over.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius' seats are soft and supportive. Tall drivers might say the lowest seat setting isn't low enough realtive to the telescopic steering wheel, which doesn't pull back quite far enough.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable is most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Generally smooth in most situations, but the high-pressure tires make it feel like it's up on tiptoes sometimes.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable is most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: At or slightly above the class average in terms of wind noise. Resonable road noise. Electric mode (EV) is largely silent. Engine noise in hybrid mode is similar to any other Prius.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Prius is comfortable is most situtations, but sometimes the reality of its light weight and fuel-saving tires comes through.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The shifter and park button are unnecessarily odd and the central gauges take getting used to. Other controls are easy and the steering buttons work well.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The front doors open wide and there are no obstructions. Exceedingly high roofline means no ducking. The story is much the same in the back.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Plenty of front seat headroom for tall folks, and the steering wheel tilts and telescopes. Rear-seat space is generous too, particularly legroom. It's clear why these make good eco-taxis.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Slender pillars and lots of glass add up to good forward and rear side visibility. The rear view is enhanced by the vertical glass panel in the hatch. The back-up camera is pure gravy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in avoids the huge loss of cargo that plagues other plug-in hybrids because its modest rechargeable battery is under the floor. There's plenty of hatch space.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Aside from the odd shifter and gauges, the interior of the Prius Plug-in is functional and spacious enough that it could easily be your only car.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: You're into $40,000 territory once you go for the plug-in version. The interior materials and presentation that were okay in the 25k-30k Prius level start to feel substandard at this price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in at least tries to offset its price by including adaptive cruise control and a heads-up display, things that are optional on the high-grade regular Prius Five.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: It's hard to justify the cost of a Prius Plug-in over a regular Prius; $40,500 is a lot to pay for what is essentially a standard 50-mpg Prius after the first 11 battery miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Looked at separately, the Prius Plug-In is rated at 50 mpg combined (51 city/49 highway) on gasoline and can travel 11 miles on batteries.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The powertrain is covered for 5 yrs/60,000 miles and the hybrid components and battery are covered for 8 yrs/100,000 miles. But the basic warranty should be longer than 3 yrs/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The battery is small enough that a standard 120V outlet is all you need to recharge a Prius Plug-in at home. Plug-ins may be eligible for carpool lane stickers in California and elsewhere.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Prius Plug-in is essentially a loaded Prius with a big battery good for 11 miles or so of battery running. You pay $40,000 for this (and possible carpool lane access), but to us a standard Prius and its 50 mpg is a better value.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The plug-in feature is best for those with short commutes. Gasoline is king on long highway trips where the Prius Plug-in gets 49 mpg, but any Prius can do that.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps and running on electricity. The Plug-in Prius is good at both, and is most satisfying for those that live relatively close to work.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Like it or not, the Prius has a clearly-defined and strong personality. It's pretty much a brand unto itself. It makes a statement, even if only half the electorate agrees with it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps and running on electricity. The Plug-in Prius is good at both, and is most satisfying for those that live relatively close to work.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius Plug-in won't win any speed contests, but it has sufficient power for safe freeway merges. It's 9.9-second run to 60 mph is a couple tenths quicker than a regular Prius.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Predictable and reassuring, but not exactly sporty. Still, there's more to like here than you'd expect for something that can get 50 mpg on gas and run 11 miles or more on batteries.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Our 60-mph panic stop took 127 feet, a few feet longer than a standard Prius, perhaps due to the extra weight of the plug-in system. The pedal is reassuringly firm much of the time.
