make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius Plug-in
style.name: Advanced 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Like it or not, the Prius has a clearly-defined and strong personality. It's pretty much a brand unto itself. It makes a statement, even if only half the electorate agrees with it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun isn't really the right word unless you get jazzed about driving past gas pumps and running on electricity. The Plug-in Prius is good at both, and is most satisfying for those that live relatively close to work.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: During our testing, the Prius V accelerated from 0 to 60 mph in a very slow 10.7 seconds. With the pedal floored, a loud groan from the engine is constant as the CVT keeps revs high. Highway merging and passing requires some planning.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With the Prius V's tight focus on fuel economy, performance is secondary. It neither accelerates nor corners with any urgency and the driver feels noticeably disconnected from the car's limited dynamics. In city or suburban driving it will suit most drivers just fine.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: A panic stop from 60 mph took an acceptable 122 feet. In normal driving, the pedal is soft as initial pedal application engages the hybrid system's regenerative braking. At first, drivers may find the lack of responsiveness unsettling.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With the Prius V's tight focus on fuel economy, performance is secondary. It neither accelerates nor corners with any urgency and the driver feels noticeably disconnected from the car's limited dynamics. In city or suburban driving it will suit most drivers just fine.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Steering effort is very light and relays very little information to the driver. This is fine in a crowded parking lot, but on twisting roads, it may leave some drivers unsatisfied. The ovoid steering wheel is also odd when quick-steering is required.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With the Prius V's tight focus on fuel economy, performance is secondary. It neither accelerates nor corners with any urgency and the driver feels noticeably disconnected from the car's limited dynamics. In city or suburban driving it will suit most drivers just fine.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Body roll is prominent when cornering, as is a loud howl from the tires. Like the rest of the Prius V's performance, handling is best described as acceptable or leisurely. For the hybrid segment, however, it's just about what you'd expect.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With the Prius V's tight focus on fuel economy, performance is secondary. It neither accelerates nor corners with any urgency and the driver feels noticeably disconnected from the car's limited dynamics. In city or suburban driving it will suit most drivers just fine.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Despite its limited performance, the Prius V is very easy to drive and places no demands on the driver. Extracting high fuel economy results does not require any special driving techniques and it's very maneuverable in tight spots.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With the Prius V's tight focus on fuel economy, performance is secondary. It neither accelerates nor corners with any urgency and the driver feels noticeably disconnected from the car's limited dynamics. In city or suburban driving it will suit most drivers just fine.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The lack of extension from the telescoping steering wheel forces even average-sized drivers to sit upright as if it were a minivan. The short cushions and stifling, heat-retaining synthetic coverings in all seats also compromise comfort.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Seats are our main complaint when it comes to comfort. For an average 5' 10" driver, a lack of thigh support and steering wheel placement are definite drawbacks. Toyota's SofTex coverings feel like outdated vinyl and are uncomfortable after only an hour of driving.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: All but the most pockmarked road surfaces are well smoothed over by the Prius V's soft suspension. At highway speeds, it never feels floaty or unsettled.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Seats are our main complaint when it comes to comfort. For an average 5' 10" driver, a lack of thigh support and steering wheel placement are definite drawbacks. Toyota's SofTex coverings feel like outdated vinyl and are uncomfortable after only an hour of driving.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: On flat roads, the Prius V adequately silences road and wind noise. Whether climbing or descending hills or under hard acceleration, a loud and constant groan from the engine could be a source of annoyance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Seats are our main complaint when it comes to comfort. For an average 5' 10" driver, a lack of thigh support and steering wheel placement are definite drawbacks. Toyota's SofTex coverings feel like outdated vinyl and are uncomfortable after only an hour of driving.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Centrally located gauges are cluttered in their layout and take some getting used to. The small infotainment screen is prone to glare, making it even harder to read. Voice activation is accurate and preferred to manual control.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In terms of space, the Prius V is noteworthy for its ability to accommodate both passengers and cargo. You'd have to switch to a small SUV to match this kind of volume. Unfortunately this quantity isn't matched by quality, as the interior looks and feels a bit downmarket.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Tall door openings make accessing all seats easy. Even taller passengers should have no problem. The doors are fairly sort in length, too, which is a benefit in tight parking spots.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In terms of space, the Prius V is noteworthy for its ability to accommodate both passengers and cargo. You'd have to switch to a small SUV to match this kind of volume. Unfortunately this quantity isn't matched by quality, as the interior looks and feels a bit downmarket.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Despite the seat comfort issues, there is a welath of legroom and headroom, even for taller occupants. Rear seats slide and recline and overall, the cabin feels open and spacious.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In terms of space, the Prius V is noteworthy for its ability to accommodate both passengers and cargo. You'd have to switch to a small SUV to match this kind of volume. Unfortunately this quantity isn't matched by quality, as the interior looks and feels a bit downmarket.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: All-around visibility is praiseworthy. The driver has a very good reference of where the car's boundaries are, even when backing into a spot. A rearview camera is standard on the Three and Five trim levels, but rarely relied upon.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In terms of space, the Prius V is noteworthy for its ability to accommodate both passengers and cargo. You'd have to switch to a small SUV to match this kind of volume. Unfortunately this quantity isn't matched by quality, as the interior looks and feels a bit downmarket.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: As compact as the Prius V is, it can accommodate a surprising amount of cargo. Up to 34.3 cu-ft can fit behind the rear seats and 67.3 cu-ft with them folded. Interior storage is also ample, with numerous bins and pockets.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: In terms of space, the Prius V is noteworthy for its ability to accommodate both passengers and cargo. You'd have to switch to a small SUV to match this kind of volume. Unfortunately this quantity isn't matched by quality, as the interior looks and feels a bit downmarket.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: With an abundance of hard plastics inside and thin padding and electronic interfaces that already seem outdated, the Prius V falls short of marks set by its  rival Ford C-Max Hybrid and Volkswagen Jetta Sportwagen TDI.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Prius V in Two trim starts at $27,560. Our test vehicle in range-topping Five trim and the $5,650 Advanced Technology package came to $37,080. Most of these upgrades and features are as either uncecessary or novelties. Opting for supporting trims wouldn't be a step down.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: As we're not impressed with the features that come with the top-of-the-line Five trim (SofTex seats) or the Advanced package (self-parking, premium audio, adaptive cruise control), the supporting Two or Three trims are smarter buys.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Prius V in Two trim starts at $27,560. Our test vehicle in range-topping Five trim and the $5,650 Advanced Technology package came to $37,080. Most of these upgrades and features are as either uncecessary or novelties. Opting for supporting trims wouldn't be a step down.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius V is priced comparably to the competing Ford C-Max Hybrid and Volkswagen Jetta Sportwagen TDI. Both offer more refinement and driver engagement, but the Ford holds less cargo and the VW is less fuel efficient.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Prius V in Two trim starts at $27,560. Our test vehicle in range-topping Five trim and the $5,650 Advanced Technology package came to $37,080. Most of these upgrades and features are as either uncecessary or novelties. Opting for supporting trims wouldn't be a step down.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: EPA estimates of 42 mpg Combined (44 City/40 Highway) were confirmed by our overall figure of 39.4 mpg. On our highway-heavy evaluation loop, we easily exceeded estimates with an impressive 50.4 mpg result.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Prius V in Two trim starts at $27,560. Our test vehicle in range-topping Five trim and the $5,650 Advanced Technology package came to $37,080. Most of these upgrades and features are as either uncecessary or novelties. Opting for supporting trims wouldn't be a step down.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: The Prius V's 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and 5-yr/60,000-mi powertrain coverage are comparable to competitors. The hybrid powertrain is further backed by an 8-yr/100,000-mi warranty.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Prius V in Two trim starts at $27,560. Our test vehicle in range-topping Five trim and the $5,650 Advanced Technology package came to $37,080. Most of these upgrades and features are as either uncecessary or novelties. Opting for supporting trims wouldn't be a step down.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Toyota's 2-yr/25,000-mi roadside assistance comes up short compared to rivals, but 2 yrs of free scheduled maintenance is not that common.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The base Prius V in Two trim starts at $27,560. Our test vehicle in range-topping Five trim and the $5,650 Advanced Technology package came to $37,080. Most of these upgrades and features are as either uncecessary or novelties. Opting for supporting trims wouldn't be a step down.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Easy-to-drive is an appropriate description of how the Prius V behaves. The controls are effortless and nearly everything about it is plaeasantly calm and quiet. Just know that you're probably not going to out-accelerate anything on the road, but will be rewarded at the pump.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Prius V's main intention is to achieve excellent fuel economy with a spacious interior. In that regard it succeeds. Entertainment behind the wheel is not a priority, and shoppers in this segment should have lowered expectations when it comes to fun.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Prius v
style.name: Five 4dr Wagon (1.8L 4cyl gas/electric hybrid CVT)
summary: Despite the V's larger dimensions inside and out, it would never be mistaken for anything but a Prius. It's not fast, but it's definitely efficient. You'll be laughing all the way past the gas stations.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Prius V's main intention is to achieve excellent fuel economy with a spacious interior. In that regard it succeeds. Entertainment behind the wheel is not a priority, and shoppers in this segment should have lowered expectations when it comes to fun.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Acceleration from the 176-horsepower RAV4 is about average for the crossover segment, as the V6 option that was an option last year is no longer available. Engine can feel coarse at higher rpm; noise is prevalent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Overall performance is quite good in the RAV4. Its handling is among the best in the segment and only the turbocharged entries in the class are significantly quicker.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: At around 125 feet from 60-0, the RAV's panic braking performance is just about average. Pedal feel in normal use, on the other hand, is better than most competitors'.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Overall performance is quite good in the RAV4. Its handling is among the best in the segment and only the turbocharged entries in the class are significantly quicker.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Electric power steering provides decent feel in the RAV4. Steering effort is adjustable but defaults to light. You can select Sport mode if you prefer more steering weight.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Overall performance is quite good in the RAV4. Its handling is among the best in the segment and only the turbocharged entries in the class are significantly quicker.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Handling is a strength in AWD RAV4s. Good balance and realistic ESC tuning make the RAV easy to drive. Ultimate handling is compromised by low grip.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Overall performance is quite good in the RAV4. Its handling is among the best in the segment and only the turbocharged entries in the class are significantly quicker.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The RAV's 6-speed transmission provides good gear spacing, but response to requests -- especially downshifts -- is sluggish. Tends to hunt for the correct gear on grades.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Overall performance is quite good in the RAV4. Its handling is among the best in the segment and only the turbocharged entries in the class are significantly quicker.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: A lockable center differential and short overhangs give the RAV4 a slight edge compared to its direct rivals. But this is still a dirt-roader, not a boulder hopper.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Overall performance is quite good in the RAV4. Its handling is among the best in the segment and only the turbocharged entries in the class are significantly quicker.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The RAV's seats are not hugely supportive, but they are quite comfortable. Average for the segment overall.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Overall, the RAV4 is exactly as comfortable as it needs to be. Its accommodations are large and its seats are soft enough for hours in the saddle. Ride quality, too, is acceptable.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Quite good, though our Limited model's 18-inch wheels and tires compromised ride quality some, but the penalty is small.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Overall, the RAV4 is exactly as comfortable as it needs to be. Its accommodations are large and its seats are soft enough for hours in the saddle. Ride quality, too, is acceptable.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Noise supression is good in the RAV4. No potential noise source draws undue attention to itself, and it's quieter than many competitors.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Overall, the RAV4 is exactly as comfortable as it needs to be. Its accommodations are large and its seats are soft enough for hours in the saddle. Ride quality, too, is acceptable.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Most controls are well placed and easy to reach and primary controls for HVAC and audio are large and obvious, but have a slightly flimsy feel to them.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Our Limited example offered a leather-covered dash, shifter, seats and steering wheel. Overall, this is big step up for the RAV4 in both materials and design. Function is still lower than some competitors, though.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Large, wide-opening doors aid ingress/egress. Seat height, too, is just right for most adults.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Our Limited example offered a leather-covered dash, shifter, seats and steering wheel. Overall, this is big step up for the RAV4 in both materials and design. Function is still lower than some competitors, though.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The RAV's cabin is large for the driver and front passenger.  Rear seats are narrow, and the center seat is very small.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Our Limited example offered a leather-covered dash, shifter, seats and steering wheel. Overall, this is big step up for the RAV4 in both materials and design. Function is still lower than some competitors, though.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: No significant blind spots are present in the RAV4. Even rear-quarter visibility is good. Rearview camera helps. Remarkably easy to park.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Our Limited example offered a leather-covered dash, shifter, seats and steering wheel. Overall, this is big step up for the RAV4 in both materials and design. Function is still lower than some competitors, though.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Class-leading cargo space and nearly flat-folding rear seats are very good. Lift-over height is low. Power liftgate is rare in this segment. Compromised cupholder placement and limited small-item storage.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Our Limited example offered a leather-covered dash, shifter, seats and steering wheel. Overall, this is big step up for the RAV4 in both materials and design. Function is still lower than some competitors, though.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Build quality is better than the previous RAV4, but no better than most competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricing for the 2013 RAV4 is competitive but it does not undercut the competition. It easily competes with others in the segment here.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Ample features keep the RAV4 competitive. A height-adjustable powered liftgate and truly keyless entry/ignition are some of several new features offered on this new RAV4.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricing for the 2013 RAV4 is competitive but it does not undercut the competition. It easily competes with others in the segment here.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: The Toyota RAV4 Limited is more expensive than some competitors, but it is also better equipped.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricing for the 2013 RAV4 is competitive but it does not undercut the competition. It easily competes with others in the segment here.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Not quite class-leading, but solid. And past experience has shown us that Toyota mpg ratings are achievable in the real world.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricing for the 2013 RAV4 is competitive but it does not undercut the competition. It easily competes with others in the segment here.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: With a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty, the RAV4's warranty is average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricing for the 2013 RAV4 is competitive but it does not undercut the competition. It easily competes with others in the segment here.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Two years or roadside assistance and free scheduled maintenance are a nice touch, not to mention a competitive advantage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Pricing for the 2013 RAV4 is competitive but it does not undercut the competition. It easily competes with others in the segment here.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: There are no substantial high or low spots in the RAV's driving experience. It's the toaster of small SUVs. And it toasts very well.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Though the RAV does offer better handling than many SUVs in the class, it's not exactly "fun to drive" in an enthusiast sense. Its off-road abilities do earn it some points, however.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: RAV4
style.name: Limited 4dr SUV AWD (2.5L 4cyl 6A)
summary: Like the Camry, the RAV4 is the safe choice in the segment. It will get the job done day in and day out for years. Most buyers won't ever complain. But there's little here in the way of "personality."
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Though the RAV does offer better handling than many SUVs in the class, it's not exactly "fun to drive" in an enthusiast sense. Its off-road abilities do earn it some points, however.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: This is a strong and smooth V6. It's a bit soft below 3,000 rpm, but then comes alive with a hearty midrange punch and an even bigger boost of momentum above 5,000 rpm.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: People don't buy minivans for performance reasons. Rather, we buy them to cart around kids and loads of groceries, sports equipment and home-improvement supplies. But we appreciate the Sienna's strong and smooth V6 and supple transmission.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Brakes have a linear delivery. None of the around-town touchiness that is so common these days. Pedal has a firm feel and panic stopping distances were consistent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: People don't buy minivans for performance reasons. Rather, we buy them to cart around kids and loads of groceries, sports equipment and home-improvement supplies. But we appreciate the Sienna's strong and smooth V6 and supple transmission.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: We like the road surface feedback through the wheel, but there's too much power assist making for overly light steering that lacks proper precision. Of course, it is a minivan.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: People don't buy minivans for performance reasons. Rather, we buy them to cart around kids and loads of groceries, sports equipment and home-improvement supplies. But we appreciate the Sienna's strong and smooth V6 and supple transmission.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The suspension is tuned for softies, with lots of body roll. It does take a nice set with each transition, but around our slalom cones the stability system was overly intrusive.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: People don't buy minivans for performance reasons. Rather, we buy them to cart around kids and loads of groceries, sports equipment and home-improvement supplies. But we appreciate the Sienna's strong and smooth V6 and supple transmission.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: With a smooth-shifting and quick-reacting six-speed automatic transmission, linear throttle delivery and a handily-tight turning radius, the Sienna is a breeze to drive smoothly.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: People don't buy minivans for performance reasons. Rather, we buy them to cart around kids and loads of groceries, sports equipment and home-improvement supplies. But we appreciate the Sienna's strong and smooth V6 and supple transmission.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: V6 models have a 3,500-pound towing capacity.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: People don't buy minivans for performance reasons. Rather, we buy them to cart around kids and loads of groceries, sports equipment and home-improvement supplies. But we appreciate the Sienna's strong and smooth V6 and supple transmission.
title: Towing

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The cushions are relatively firm but still offer plenty of comfort. Second-row seats are also comfy, but third row is difficult to get the seatback to that just-right angle.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: To say the Sienna is a comfortable people-hauler is an understatement. Between its butt-friendly seats and plush ride it's downright pillowy. The V6 is silent at highway speeds, but wind noise can be excessive.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Cushy ride that absorbs most bumps with ease. This thing seems to just float down the highway.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: To say the Sienna is a comfortable people-hauler is an understatement. Between its butt-friendly seats and plush ride it's downright pillowy. The V6 is silent at highway speeds, but wind noise can be excessive.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The Sienna's sound deadening is only OK, as there is a significant amount of noise from that expansive windshield. Whisper-silent V6 and quiet tires on highway.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: To say the Sienna is a comfortable people-hauler is an understatement. Between its butt-friendly seats and plush ride it's downright pillowy. The V6 is silent at highway speeds, but wind noise can be excessive.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The driving position is excellent. Most controls are straightforward, although the stereo touchscreen is outdated. The power side door button can be confused for a light switch.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's lots of room here. It's easy to get in and out and the view for the driver is exceptional. Things like the stereo's touchscreen could be improved and the cupholders don't hold cups well, but overall this is a well-done interior.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The front seats are very easy to get in/out of. Have to hop up a bit to get into second row. Third-row access is made easier by the sliding/tilting second row.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's lots of room here. It's easy to get in and out and the view for the driver is exceptional. Things like the stereo's touchscreen could be improved and the cupholders don't hold cups well, but overall this is a well-done interior.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Third-row headroom is surprisingly good, but elbow and hip room are tight. Second-row headroom is voluminous. Not lacking headroom or width up front, either.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's lots of room here. It's easy to get in and out and the view for the driver is exceptional. Things like the stereo's touchscreen could be improved and the cupholders don't hold cups well, but overall this is a well-done interior.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Absolutely expansive window area all around the Sienna. Standard rear backup camera just gives you even less excuses for inadvertently hitting something in a parking lot.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's lots of room here. It's easy to get in and out and the view for the driver is exceptional. Things like the stereo's touchscreen could be improved and the cupholders don't hold cups well, but overall this is a well-done interior.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: 14 cupholders, but the four most important ones--in the center console and slide-out--are too wide and let bottles tip easily. Second row has limited storage cubbies.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: There's lots of room here. It's easy to get in and out and the view for the driver is exceptional. Things like the stereo's touchscreen could be improved and the cupholders don't hold cups well, but overall this is a well-done interior.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: As you'd expect of a Toyota, the Sienna is put together well, although some of the materials are on the cheap side, for instance the tacky, fake wood trim and plastic dash.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Toyota has long been known as a value leader because its well-built cars, trucks and minivans seem to run forever, have a reasonable amount of equipment and out-the-dealer pricing won't break your wallet. Those qualities remain true.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The Sienna LE V6 comes with most of the standard items you'd expect, like power sliding side doors, backup camera and Bluetooth. The one item it's missing is a power rear door.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Toyota has long been known as a value leader because its well-built cars, trucks and minivans seem to run forever, have a reasonable amount of equipment and out-the-dealer pricing won't break your wallet. Those qualities remain true.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: A little over $30,000 is not an unreasonable sum for an uplevel full-size minivan with a V6. Its out-the-door $31,880 price is only truly missing a power rear door.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Toyota has long been known as a value leader because its well-built cars, trucks and minivans seem to run forever, have a reasonable amount of equipment and out-the-dealer pricing won't break your wallet. Those qualities remain true.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: Anytime we better the EPA's city mpg by almost 2 mpg with our average, we're doing OK. The EPA rates the Sienna at 18 city/25 highway/21 mpg combined. We averaged 19.9 mpg.

style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The Sienna comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile warranty plus a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Toyota has long been known as a value leader because its well-built cars, trucks and minivans seem to run forever, have a reasonable amount of equipment and out-the-dealer pricing won't break your wallet. Those qualities remain true.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: The Sienna comes with free maintenance and roadside assistance for 2 years/25,000 miles. Plus, Toyota has a reputation for building some of the best vehicles in the world.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Toyota has long been known as a value leader because its well-built cars, trucks and minivans seem to run forever, have a reasonable amount of equipment and out-the-dealer pricing won't break your wallet. Those qualities remain true.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Sienna
style.name: LE 8-Passenger 4dr Minivan (3.5L 6cyl 6A)
summary: This is a truly comfortable family hauler, the driving experience of which is only marred by its susceptibility to crosswinds and imprecise steering which allows some wandering.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Is the Sienna fun to drive? Not really, although it is fun to romp on the throttle and accelerate as quick (or quicker) than some cars and most pickups, with 0-60 in 7.5 seconds.

summary: The V6 is strong and has a presence, the transmission is smooth and intelligent, but everything else is very trucklike, so be ready for it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Tacoma Double Cab TRD V6 isn't awful on pavement, but if you want to have fun, then you'll have to go someplace and get dirty.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: It has the toughness you need for hard-core driving in the dirt, but don't expect it to feel as bland as a rental car on the pavement.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Tacoma Double Cab TRD V6 isn't awful on pavement, but if you want to have fun, then you'll have to go someplace and get dirty.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: With its 4.0-liter, 236-hp V6 and 5-spd automatic, this pickup offers acceptable midrange grunt. We clocked it to 60 mph in 7.8 sec., which is just okay. At freeway speeds the truck's brick-like aerodynamics noticeably blunt acceleration.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Extremely difficult to modulate the brakes smoothly around town due to jumpy, nonlinear response, especially when you first hit the pedal. It took 143 feet for the Tacoma to stop from 60 mph in our testing, which isn't great.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: The steering has decent feel and is appropriately weighted, making the Tacoma pretty easy to maneuver. Lane wander is at a minimum, a welcome surprise given the off-road nature of the truck's unique suspension and tires.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: The off-road biased tires add a bit of vagueness to the proceedings but don't make the truck feel ponderous. It takes corners reasonably upright. Considering its off-road ability, its traits on the road are perfectly acceptable.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: The jumpy brakes and excessively loud, droning exhaust mean this truck is in need of immediate help. Too bad, as the rest of the package is dragged down by these two shortcomings. Shifts from the 5-spd automatic could be smoother too.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Our test truck was equipped with the optional $650 Tow Prep Package available only for V6 models, elevating its max towing rating to 6,500 pounds. Without this option the truck can tow a max of 3,500 lbs. It's money well-spent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.
title: Towing

model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: There's little that can stop this truck in the wild. It's among the most purpose-built off-road biased trucks you can buy. Keep in mind it's not optimized for rock crawling, instead it's all about bombing through the desert at speed.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package elevates the Tacoma's off-road chops significantly, yet its steering and handling don't suffer much in street driving. However, it also suffers from poor braking action and a loud exhaust. The engine is showing its age, though it performs adequately.
title: Off-Road

model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Relatively flat, with little lateral support, making the seat comfortable to sprawl out in, even though it only has basic adjustments. But backseat passengers won't like the flat, upright seats one bit.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Ride comfort is more than satisfactory for daily use, despite the TRD off road-biased suspension and tires. And the seats, although not the most supportive thrones out there, stay comfortable over long voyages. Ultimately this TRD package's loud exhaust drags down its score.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: This truck has a suspension intended to easily swallow desert heaves. Its ride quality on the road is busy over sharp road imperfections but it has the ability to dispatch large ones with ease thanks to the plentiful suspension travel.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Ride comfort is more than satisfactory for daily use, despite the TRD off road-biased suspension and tires. And the seats, although not the most supportive thrones out there, stay comfortable over long voyages. Ultimately this TRD package's loud exhaust drags down its score.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: It's difficult to discern this truck's road and wind noise because everything, including your sanity, is drowned out by the droning exhaust. It's loud and obnoxious no matter how gently you tip into the gas pedal.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: The driving position has an upright seat. Primary controls like the three-knob temperature controls are simple and laid out in a logical fashion. Secondary buttons are a bit low. The instrument cluster is low-contrast and hard to read.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: While aesthetically in need of some attention, the fundmentals of the Tacoma's interior are sound. It's easy to live with because the cabin is fairly versatile. The taller-riding TRD TX Baja package does make it a bit less accessible for stepping up into, however.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: It's a bit of a high step to get into this truck, as it has been raised over the base Tacoma. The rear door openings are on the small side. Fortunately the flat seats provide little obstacle for getting in or out.

style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Midsize trucks are right-sized for many people because they're big enough to be useful yet small enough to park easily. The Tacoma is in a class of two, and it betters its rival (Nissan Frontier) in terms of the usefulness of the interior.

summary: The split backseat folds flat and there are cubbies behind and under the seats. There's a good-size console bin up front along with slim door pockets. Two small cupholders up front.

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Interior surfaces are hard and plasticky (though durable), making the cabin feel cheap and sparsely appointed.  This truck is long overdue for a full model change.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package means this Tacoma has few peers in terms of off-road capability, so in that sense it's a good value. However, it is easy to option the price up to near that of a Ford Raptor. This, for a Tacoma that is at the end of its long model cycle, is tough to swallow.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Our test truck was equipped with more than $11,000 in options, most of them related to suspension and tires. It also had Toyota's slick EnTune multimedia system, a $2,330 option. It's well-equipped, but you pay a lot for the privilege.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The TRD TX Baja package means this Tacoma has few peers in terms of off-road capability, so in that sense it's a good value. However, it is easy to option the price up to near that of a Ford Raptor. This, for a Tacoma that is at the end of its long model cycle, is tough to swallow.

model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Our test truck's $39,910 as-tested price is formidable but acceptable if (and only if) you plan on using this truck off-road. There are few trucks that are as worthy in a harsh, desert-like environment. Still, it's near a Raptor's MSRP.

summary: 2 years/25,000 miles of free scheduled maintenance is nice, and not offered by its competition. It also has roadside assistance for the same period.

title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: This is arguably the most fun and most capable mid-size pickup you can buy. There's a lot of great hardware that comes with the TRD package, and it makes this a confident off-road truck. It feels robust.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Off-road, the Tacoma with the TRD TX Baja package is a hoot. It can be driven hard across open desert with tremendous ease, and is intended expressly for such purposes. On road, it's still liveable for daily duty. Well done, Toyota.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tacoma
style.name: V6 4dr Double Cab 4WD 5.0 ft. SB (4.0L 6cyl 5A)
summary: Basically this truck says, "No problem. What else can you throw at me?" like no other mid-size truck. It's confidence-inspiring to drive. On the road the loud exhaust is an unnecessary affectation.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Off-road, the Tacoma with the TRD TX Baja package is a hoot. It can be driven hard across open desert with tremendous ease, and is intended expressly for such purposes. On road, it's still liveable for daily duty. Well done, Toyota.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The Tundra's 5.7-liter V8 is good for 381 horsepower and 401 pound-feet of torque. It hauled the 5,872-pound 1794 edition to 60 mph in 6.8 seconds, which is as quick as most competitors. The 6-speed automatic never hunts for gears in Drive and offers full manual control.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Consistent, powerful braking is a Tundra strength. Brake feel is good and our testing shows the truck's brakes are more than sufficient. Its best panic-brake stop from 60 mph was 130 feet, although numbers varied considerably from run-to-run.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: As one of the few full-size trucks to retain hydraulic-assisted steering, the Tundra has steering that is accurate enough to place the truck precisely. Turning circle, at 44.0 feet, is respectable for a truck this long.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: As truck handling goes, the Tundra isn't bad, but it is big, which can make it uncomfortable on small roads. It will manage, but you'll need to take your time, place it carefully and pay attention to lane discipline.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Ample torque and low gearing means the Tundra is jumpy off the line if you're not careful. We quickly adjusted to the truck's power delivery, however. A manual shift option is useful for engine braking and gear holding.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: A 9,000-pound tow rating is lower than key competitors (when fitted with optional tow packages). Still, it's the only light truck which complies with the SAE's towing standard and it offers the highest standard tow rating among light trucks.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Towing

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Standard A-TRAC advanced traction control and the Tundra's Auto Limited-Slip Differential give the Tundra genuine off-road capability that's better than systems from many competitors.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a strong engine and the only SAE-certified tow rating among full-size trucks, the Tundra offers legitimate performance. It's quick and it feels capable of hauling itself through any scenario a real truck user might find themselves in.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Seat adjustability in the 1794 edition includes a 12-way adjustable power driver's seat with power thigh and lumbar adjustability. Both front seats are heated and ventilated. But overall comfort is only average.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Tundra, when equipped with the 5.7-liter V8, lacks ride comfort relative to competitors who don't couple a towing package to their biggest engine like Toyota. The smaller 4.6-liter V8-equipped Tundra gets softer springs.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Because Toyota pairs stiff springs for towing with the 5.7-liter engine, there's no getting away from the Tundra's stiff ride, which is a shame. Driving around town, you'll constantly be reminded that your truck is capable of towing a small RV.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Tundra, when equipped with the 5.7-liter V8, lacks ride comfort relative to competitors who don't couple a towing package to their biggest engine like Toyota. The smaller 4.6-liter V8-equipped Tundra gets softer springs.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Typical of Toyota trucks, the Tundra is loud when it's first started (fan noise, mostly), but also rather noisy even during cruising. Engine racket during acceleration isn't overly obtrusive, though.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Tundra, when equipped with the 5.7-liter V8, lacks ride comfort relative to competitors who don't couple a towing package to their biggest engine like Toyota. The smaller 4.6-liter V8-equipped Tundra gets softer springs.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Big progress was made this year in improving reach and usability of the Tundra's dash controls, which are now 2.6 inches closer to the driver. Climate and audio controls are now within easy reach. Large buttons and knobs improve ease of use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Tundra's new-for-2014 1794 model is covered in perforated, stitched leather and suede. These are among the nicest materials we've seen in a full-size truck. Overall, interior improvements are significant across the board this year.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Four-wheel-drive Tundras are, like most 4x4 trucks, tall, which makes ingress and egress awkward. The large, wide-opening doors help, even in tight parking spots. The optional running boards are definitely worth the money.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Tundra's new-for-2014 1794 model is covered in perforated, stitched leather and suede. These are among the nicest materials we've seen in a full-size truck. Overall, interior improvements are significant across the board this year.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The upshot of being huge is having lots of space. That's the case in the Tundra both up front and in the back where the CrewMax cab is absolutely massive. Three adults easily fit in the back seat.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Tundra's new-for-2014 1794 model is covered in perforated, stitched leather and suede. These are among the nicest materials we've seen in a full-size truck. Overall, interior improvements are significant across the board this year.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Front and rear-quarter visibility are adequate from the driver's seat. A standard-across-the-line rear-view camera works wonders in tight parking situations. Parking sonar, included on upper trims, helps in close-quarters situations.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Tundra's new-for-2014 1794 model is covered in perforated, stitched leather and suede. These are among the nicest materials we've seen in a full-size truck. Overall, interior improvements are significant across the board this year.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The Tundra utilizes its space well. There's a massive center console big enough for multiple average-size laptops. Door pockets are large and fitted for large drink containers. The rear seat bottom is 60/40 split-folding.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The interior of the Tundra's new-for-2014 1794 model is covered in perforated, stitched leather and suede. These are among the nicest materials we've seen in a full-size truck. Overall, interior improvements are significant across the board this year.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Ultra-high-quality leather and suede cover the seats and interior pieces giving the Tundra an upscale look inside. Small details, like a poor-fitting trim piece on the steering wheel, keep the Tundra from scoring higher.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: When it comes to premium full-size trucks, $50,000 seems to be the going rate. The Tundra is ever-so-slightly below that price. Probably the most valuable asset the Tundra offers is its transparency in tow and mpg ratings, which are harder to discern in the competition.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The 1794 Edition Tundra's standout feature is its suede and leather interior. It also includes dual-zone climate control, Entune (Toyota's suite of smartphone connected apps), navigation, a sunroof and a JBL premium audio system.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: When it comes to premium full-size trucks, $50,000 seems to be the going rate. The Tundra is ever-so-slightly below that price. Probably the most valuable asset the Tundra offers is its transparency in tow and mpg ratings, which are harder to discern in the competition.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: At $48,345, the 1794 trim is the premium-level Tundra designed to compete with the Chevy Silverado High Country, GMC Sierra Denali and Ford F-150 King Ranch. It's marginally less expensive but includes similar equipment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: When it comes to premium full-size trucks, $50,000 seems to be the going rate. The Tundra is ever-so-slightly below that price. Probably the most valuable asset the Tundra offers is its transparency in tow and mpg ratings, which are harder to discern in the competition.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The Tundra's 15-mpg combined rating is lower than most competitors, all of which have a numerically higher final drive. Be sure to note the competition's final drive for accurate comparisons. Our tester produced 16.6 mpg on our 116-mile loop using its standard 4.3:1 final drive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: When it comes to premium full-size trucks, $50,000 seems to be the going rate. The Tundra is ever-so-slightly below that price. Probably the most valuable asset the Tundra offers is its transparency in tow and mpg ratings, which are harder to discern in the competition.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: 3 years/36,000 miles for the basic warranty, plus 5 years/60,000 miles for the powertrain coverage and 60,000 miles for corrosion. These terms are about average for the segment.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: When it comes to premium full-size trucks, $50,000 seems to be the going rate. The Tundra is ever-so-slightly below that price. Probably the most valuable asset the Tundra offers is its transparency in tow and mpg ratings, which are harder to discern in the competition.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Scheduled maintenance and roadside assistance for 2 years/25,000 miles is a nice bonus.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: When it comes to premium full-size trucks, $50,000 seems to be the going rate. The Tundra is ever-so-slightly below that price. Probably the most valuable asset the Tundra offers is its transparency in tow and mpg ratings, which are harder to discern in the competition.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: Big, stiff-riding and built like a reinforced bomb shelter, the Tundra says "truck" when you drive it, more so than its domestic competitors. If that's what you like then this is your truck.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: We wouldn't describe the Tundra as fun. Big? Tough? Present? Sure. Fun? Not really.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Tundra
style.name: 1794 4dr CrewMax 4WD SB (5.7L 8cyl 6A)
summary: The above traits give the Tundra ample personality. It's also quick. Stomp the pedal and the Tundra's DOHC V8 still screams like a V8 should. This thing looks the truck part, too.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: We wouldn't describe the Tundra as fun. Big? Tough? Present? Sure. Fun? Not really.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Yep, it's slow. There's little power to speak of at low revs, and the antiquated four-speed automatic saps whatever's left. Too much space between gears.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The good: Intuitive, sporty steering and a well-tuned suspension deliver handling on the enthusiast side. The bad: Weak acceleration and an outdated four-speed automatic.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The panic braking distances were unimpressive, especially for such a little and lilghtweight car. But the pedal is firm and linear and we experienced zero fade.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The good: Intuitive, sporty steering and a well-tuned suspension deliver handling on the enthusiast side. The bad: Weak acceleration and an outdated four-speed automatic.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Nice and precise, the Yaris goes where you point it. The steering is intuitively quick with just the right amount of power assist.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The good: Intuitive, sporty steering and a well-tuned suspension deliver handling on the enthusiast side. The bad: Weak acceleration and an outdated four-speed automatic.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Skid-pad numbers were low, mostly due to the lack of grip from the tires, but the Yaris is nimble and feels sporty through turns. Pretty precise despite significant body roll.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The good: Intuitive, sporty steering and a well-tuned suspension deliver handling on the enthusiast side. The bad: Weak acceleration and an outdated four-speed automatic.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Brakes and throttle delivery are linear. But the gears of the four-speed automatic are too widely spaced, making for slow acceleration. Horrible turning radius for such a tiny car.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The good: Intuitive, sporty steering and a well-tuned suspension deliver handling on the enthusiast side. The bad: Weak acceleration and an outdated four-speed automatic.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The front seats are comfortable and have some lateral support, too. Score one for the quality cloth fabric. No rear center armrest, and rear seats lean in toward the middle.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: If you're thinking Camry comfort, think again. Yes, the Yaris seats are fine for long days, and we especially like the cloth fabric, but the short wheelbase gives a jittery ride and the four-cylinder engine is loud and thrashy.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The result of a short wheelbase and a suspension tuned for some semblance of handling? A pretty jiggly ride on the highway.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: If you're thinking Camry comfort, think again. Yes, the Yaris seats are fine for long days, and we especially like the cloth fabric, but the short wheelbase gives a jittery ride and the four-cylinder engine is loud and thrashy.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: More than your average amount of tire and wind noise, at least for a Toyota. The little engine seems to always be thrumming along since it has to work so hard.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: If you're thinking Camry comfort, think again. Yes, the Yaris seats are fine for long days, and we especially like the cloth fabric, but the short wheelbase gives a jittery ride and the four-cylinder engine is loud and thrashy.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The aux-in and USB jacks are effectively hidden in the glovebox. Otherwise, most controls are large and easy to use. But stereo tuning should be a knob, not a button.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Unlike the original Yaris with its center-dash speedo, the interior is now straightforward, with large, easy-to-use controls. But the iPod jacks are hidden way up in the glovebox. Still, there's good people space inside.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Very easy to get in/out of front seats. Rear doors don't open very wide, but for such a small car ingress/egress is above average.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Unlike the original Yaris with its center-dash speedo, the interior is now straightforward, with large, easy-to-use controls. But the iPod jacks are hidden way up in the glovebox. Still, there's good people space inside.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Front headroom is quite generous. More surprising is that width is decent, too. Rear headroom is tight for anyone over average height, although foot and knee room are good.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Unlike the original Yaris with its center-dash speedo, the interior is now straightforward, with large, easy-to-use controls. But the iPod jacks are hidden way up in the glovebox. Still, there's good people space inside.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: You can't see the stubby little hood, but outward vision is barely obstructed by the small A- and B-pillars. The thick C-pillar forms a blind spot but the rear window is large.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Unlike the original Yaris with its center-dash speedo, the interior is now straightforward, with large, easy-to-use controls. But the iPod jacks are hidden way up in the glovebox. Still, there's good people space inside.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The cupholders don't hold water (bottles), as they are too wide and slippery. Interior storage isn't as plentiful as old Yaris. Limited trunk space, but rear seats do fold down.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Unlike the original Yaris with its center-dash speedo, the interior is now straightforward, with large, easy-to-use controls. But the iPod jacks are hidden way up in the glovebox. Still, there's good people space inside.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Between plenty of soft-touch items and high-quality cloth seats, this cheap car does not feel cheap. Feels well put together.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Here's a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Numerous soft-touch trim pieces, nice build qualilty, leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. Fuel economy is decent but not ground-breaking. Our real-world mpg was on the low side.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Some decent features here for the money, including leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. But without question this car has the most confusing Bluetooth phone pairing ever.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Here's a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Numerous soft-touch trim pieces, nice build qualilty, leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. Fuel economy is decent but not ground-breaking. Our real-world mpg was on the low side.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The four-speed automatic tacks on $800 over the five-speed manual, bringing the Yaris SE base price to $17,200. Not a small amount for such a small car. But it doesn't feel cheap.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Here's a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Numerous soft-touch trim pieces, nice build qualilty, leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. Fuel economy is decent but not ground-breaking. Our real-world mpg was on the low side.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The EPA rates the Yaris four-speed automatic at 30 city/35 highway/32 combined mpg. We averaged 27 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Here's a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Numerous soft-touch trim pieces, nice build qualilty, leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. Fuel economy is decent but not ground-breaking. Our real-world mpg was on the low side.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The basic warranty is 3 years/36,000 miles, along with 5 years/60,000 miles for the drivetrain. The Chevrolet Sonic's drivetrain coverage goes to 100,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Here's a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Numerous soft-touch trim pieces, nice build qualilty, leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. Fuel economy is decent but not ground-breaking. Our real-world mpg was on the low side.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Aside from the expectedly high Toyota build quality, the Yaris boasts free maintenance and roadside assistance for 2 years/25,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Here's a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Numerous soft-touch trim pieces, nice build qualilty, leather-wrapped steering wheel and shift knob. Fuel economy is decent but not ground-breaking. Our real-world mpg was on the low side.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: We like the comfort level here, but the weak power, outdated automatic and poor turning radius mar the driving experience. We would've liked to see better fuel economy, too.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If the Yaris had a slightly more powerful and less thrashy engine, just think how much fun it would be. Because its sporty handling begs you to take corners at higher-than-econobox speeds. It needs a modern automatic, too.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Unlilke many econoboxes, the Yaris SE isn't afraid of a turn. It can fit into tight parking spaces, despite its poor lock-to-lock turning ability.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: If the Yaris had a slightly more powerful and less thrashy engine, just think how much fun it would be. Because its sporty handling begs you to take corners at higher-than-econobox speeds. It needs a modern automatic, too.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Little punch from the 106-hp 1.5-liter 4-cylinder. It labors up steep hills; the four-speed automatic transmission needs to constantly downshift in an effort to find some power. We hit 60 mph in 10.7 sec., which is slow for the class.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Capable steering and handling keep some life in the old Yaris, but the weak engine and old-school transmission bring it back down. Make sure you have plenty of room when pulling out into fast traffic. Doesn't stop as quickly as you'd think, either.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The brake pedal has a solid, reassuring feel, but we found the Yaris squirming side-to-side during heavy braking on the road. At our test track it stopped from 60 mph in 126 feet, which is one of the longest distances in the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Capable steering and handling keep some life in the old Yaris, but the weak engine and old-school transmission bring it back down. Make sure you have plenty of room when pulling out into fast traffic. Doesn't stop as quickly as you'd think, either.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Nice and precise, the Yaris goes where you point it. The electric power steering reacts intuitively with just the right amount of assist. It's light around town but firms up with good weighting at speed.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Capable steering and handling keep some life in the old Yaris, but the weak engine and old-school transmission bring it back down. Make sure you have plenty of room when pulling out into fast traffic. Doesn't stop as quickly as you'd think, either.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The Yaris is nimble and feels sporty through turns. It's precise despite a significant amount of lean. Grip limits are low, and the stability control system can be intrusive through corners even when you're not driving aggressively.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Capable steering and handling keep some life in the old Yaris, but the weak engine and old-school transmission bring it back down. Make sure you have plenty of room when pulling out into fast traffic. Doesn't stop as quickly as you'd think, either.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The Yaris' slow acceleration hurts driveability. You can't pop out into fast-moving traffic, yet the gas pedal can be jumpy leaving a stoplight. During anything like brisk acceleration, the antiquated 4-sp transmission makes abrupt upshifts.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Capable steering and handling keep some life in the old Yaris, but the weak engine and old-school transmission bring it back down. Make sure you have plenty of room when pulling out into fast traffic. Doesn't stop as quickly as you'd think, either.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Front seats are comfortable enough; they even have some lateral bolstering, but no center armrest. Cloth covering is soft and grippy. Rear seats are comfy, but you sit more on them than in them. Hard plastic door armrests.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The soft, well-made cloth fabric helps to make the Yaris' seats comfy for all-day travel, but the jittery ride and loud four-cylinder engine conspire to make it less than an ideal choice for long road trips.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The ride is pretty choppy, can be harsh. The bigger the bump, the bigger the bounce. The short wheelbase is part of the problem, but most competitors do a better job smoothing things out than this Yaris. Passengers will notice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The soft, well-made cloth fabric helps to make the Yaris' seats comfy for all-day travel, but the jittery ride and loud four-cylinder engine conspire to make it less than an ideal choice for long road trips.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Minimal sound deadening; tire and road noise are prevalent. The tires thump over any road imperfection or seam, considerable hum over coarse surfaces. Definite wind noise from the side mirrors and the huge, single windshield wiper.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The soft, well-made cloth fabric helps to make the Yaris' seats comfy for all-day travel, but the jittery ride and loud four-cylinder engine conspire to make it less than an ideal choice for long road trips.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The controls are decidedly dated-looking, but they're large and easy to use, simple radio is easy to figure out. Phone paired quickly. The USB port and aux-in jack are hidden (and out of reach) in the glovebox, odd for these modern times.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The original center-dash speedo has been gone for several years, replaced with more standard gauges. The controls are easy to use but they're looking pretty old. And what's with the music ports in the glovebox? Beyond that, this is an easy daily car, with good room and entry/exit.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The front doors open pretty wide and are large enough for easy entry/exit, aided by a tall roof. Rear doors open less wide, yet there's still a pretty large entryway. Only have to duck slightly to keep from bumping head into roof.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The original center-dash speedo has been gone for several years, replaced with more standard gauges. The controls are easy to use but they're looking pretty old. And what's with the music ports in the glovebox? Beyond that, this is an easy daily car, with good room and entry/exit.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Tons of front headroom, cramped door-side elbow room but center console doesn't protrude into driver's right knee. Rear headroom will be tight for anyone average height and above, but knee room is good. Door-side elbow room is tight.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The original center-dash speedo has been gone for several years, replaced with more standard gauges. The controls are easy to use but they're looking pretty old. And what's with the music ports in the glovebox? Beyond that, this is an easy daily car, with good room and entry/exit.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Windshield pillars are long and thick, hard to look through corners even with a semi-triangular extra window. Overall, outward view isn't bad, minimal over-the-shoulder blind spots. Reasonably large rear window, but no backup camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The original center-dash speedo has been gone for several years, replaced with more standard gauges. The controls are easy to use but they're looking pretty old. And what's with the music ports in the glovebox? Beyond that, this is an easy daily car, with good room and entry/exit.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
