style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Plenty of small cubby areas. No center armrest, no center bin, but a slot for wallets. Door pockets are slim. Rear seats fold down easily in a 60/40 split. There's 15.6 cu-ft behind the second row, which is about average for the class.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The original center-dash speedo has been gone for several years, replaced with more standard gauges. The controls are easy to use but they're looking pretty old. And what's with the music ports in the glovebox? Beyond that, this is an easy daily car, with good room and entry/exit.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The Yaris' interior doesn't look great but feels pretty solid. There's some soft-touch on the door sills, part of the dash. Steering wheel isn't leather but feels good in your hands. We really liked the soft feel of the cloth seats.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Yaris maintains its reputation as a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Several soft-touch trim pieces, good build quality and an overall solid feel. We were impressed with the real-world fuel economy we achieved on our evaluation loop, considering the four-speed automatic.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Our $17,285 5-door LE came with air conditioning, power windows with driver's side auto-down, cruise control, tilt steering wheel with audio controls, Bluetooth and a 6-speaker CD audio system with aux-in/USB ports.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Yaris maintains its reputation as a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Several soft-touch trim pieces, good build quality and an overall solid feel. We were impressed with the real-world fuel economy we achieved on our evaluation loop, considering the four-speed automatic.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Base Yaris L 2-door with a 5-speed manual begins at $15,225, the L 4-door with a 4-sp automatic starts at $16,250, the LE 4-door starts at $17,285. Not the cheapest in the class, but also not the most expensive.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Yaris maintains its reputation as a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Several soft-touch trim pieces, good build quality and an overall solid feel. We were impressed with the real-world fuel economy we achieved on our evaluation loop, considering the four-speed automatic.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The EPA rates the Yaris 5-door with a 4-sp automatic at 32 mpg Combined (30 City/36 Highway). About even with the Ford Fiesta and Hyundai Accent, well below the Honda Fit. We averaged 29.9 mpg overall, 35.6 mpg on our evaluation loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Yaris maintains its reputation as a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Several soft-touch trim pieces, good build quality and an overall solid feel. We were impressed with the real-world fuel economy we achieved on our evaluation loop, considering the four-speed automatic.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Toyota covers the basic warranty for 3 years/36,000 miles and the drivetrain for 5 years/60,000 miles. Chevy covers the Sonic's drivetrain for 100,000 miles, while the Hyundai Accent's warranties top the industry.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Yaris maintains its reputation as a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Several soft-touch trim pieces, good build quality and an overall solid feel. We were impressed with the real-world fuel economy we achieved on our evaluation loop, considering the four-speed automatic.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The Yaris comes with roadside assistance and free maintenance for 2 years/25,000 miles. That's better than most in the segment, although the Chevy Sonic's coverage is slightly stronger.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Yaris maintains its reputation as a cheap car that doesn't feel cheap. Several soft-touch trim pieces, good build quality and an overall solid feel. We were impressed with the real-world fuel economy we achieved on our evaluation loop, considering the four-speed automatic.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: The crude transmission and weak, rather loud engine mar the Yaris' driving experience. On the bright side, the seats are comfortable, which somewhat makes up for the rough ride. Decent fuel economy means few stops at the pump.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Handling is tuned on the sporty side for this segment, it's fun to get aggressive within its low limits. But the stability control cuts in early, even with only minor verve on public roads.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: LE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 4A)
summary: Unlike many cars in this class, the Yaris' sharp steering and forgiving handling mean it's not afraid of a turn. It can fit into tight parking spaces with ease, and its styling still gives off some of that Euro-esque runabout vibe.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Handling is tuned on the sporty side for this segment, it's fun to get aggressive within its low limits. But the stability control cuts in early, even with only minor verve on public roads.
title: Personality

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The 1.5-liter inline-4's 106 hp is quite low for the segment, yet its 0-60 mph time of 9.5 seconds (with the manual transmission) is closer to average. That said, the engine's lack of guts makes it feel slower than rivals out on the road.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Although the Toyota Yaris may not deliver class-leading driving engagement, it doesn't disappoint, either, and is indeed competent. Note that this rating applies to the five-speed manual. The four-speed automatic hampers acceleration and driveability, and we don't recommend it.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Yaris needed 123 feet to stop from 60 mph, which is average for sub-compact cars. However, its stopping distances were more consistent than most rivals, showing a resistance to fade that is rare for the segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Although the Toyota Yaris may not deliver class-leading driving engagement, it doesn't disappoint, either, and is indeed competent. Note that this rating applies to the five-speed manual. The four-speed automatic hampers acceleration and driveability, and we don't recommend it.
title: Braking

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The steering is responsive, direct and precise, much better than the last Yaris we tested. Still not as good as the spot-on feedback and effort provided by the Ford Fiesta, but it has elevated itself above mere appliance expectations.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Although the Toyota Yaris may not deliver class-leading driving engagement, it doesn't disappoint, either, and is indeed competent. Note that this rating applies to the five-speed manual. The four-speed automatic hampers acceleration and driveability, and we don't recommend it.
title: Steering

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Above and beyond the inherent nimbleness of its diminutive dimensions and light weight, the Yaris' excellent steering steering and reasonable grip make it a confident and adept handler. Not quite Fiesta good, but better than most.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Although the Toyota Yaris may not deliver class-leading driving engagement, it doesn't disappoint, either, and is indeed competent. Note that this rating applies to the five-speed manual. The four-speed automatic hampers acceleration and driveability, and we don't recommend it.
title: Handling

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The 5-speed manual transmission features a light effort with easy-to-find gears and an intuitive clutch takeup. This is a much better choice than the outdated, optional 4-speed automatic that is ill-suited to the modestly powered engine.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Although the Toyota Yaris may not deliver class-leading driving engagement, it doesn't disappoint, either, and is indeed competent. Note that this rating applies to the five-speed manual. The four-speed automatic hampers acceleration and driveability, and we don't recommend it.
title: Driveability

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Multiple drivers found it difficult to get comfortable in the Yaris' driver seat, with plenty of squirming on long drives. The non-telescoping steering wheel caused tall drivers to hunch over. It also lacks a center armrest.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As an urban runabout the Toyota Yaris is acceptable. But, if considerable highway travel is in the cards, competitors like the Ford Fiesta, Honda Fit and Chevrolet Sonic are not only more comfortable, they also possess a degree of solidity that the Yaris lacks.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Improvements to its suspension and body structure for 2015 make the Yaris feel less brittle over bumps. It still lacks the suppleness provided by the Fiesta and Fit, however, and that's why it is a less agreeable highway choice.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As an urban runabout the Toyota Yaris is acceptable. But, if considerable highway travel is in the cards, competitors like the Ford Fiesta, Honda Fit and Chevrolet Sonic are not only more comfortable, they also possess a degree of solidity that the Yaris lacks.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: This is a sub-compact and as such there is considerable wind, road and engine noise, but it's about what is typical for the segment.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: As an urban runabout the Toyota Yaris is acceptable. But, if considerable highway travel is in the cards, competitors like the Ford Fiesta, Honda Fit and Chevrolet Sonic are not only more comfortable, they also possess a degree of solidity that the Yaris lacks.
title: Quietness

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Entune touchscreen interface that works so well in other Toyotas is less agreeable here, as its smaller screen makes the icons difficult to press and the frequently used media selection menu is odd. Climate controls couldn't be simpler.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Yaris' cargo area is its number one detriment. No one should expect a sub-compact to be a cargo hauler, but its rivals (especially the Honda Fit) can at least hold more than a couple of grocery bags. Passenger space and interior controls are acceptable.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Big front doors, a tall-ish roof and a relatively high hip point make getting into the Yaris easy. Rear doors are decently sized as well and relatively generous legroom means you shouldn't have to squeeze yourself in.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Yaris' cargo area is its number one detriment. No one should expect a sub-compact to be a cargo hauler, but its rivals (especially the Honda Fit) can at least hold more than a couple of grocery bags. Passenger space and interior controls are acceptable.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Back seat headroom is restricted by the sloping headliner that meets the hatchback, but rear legroom is above average. Two adults should fit quite comfortably. Driver seat adjusts sufficiently even for tall drivers.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Yaris' cargo area is its number one detriment. No one should expect a sub-compact to be a cargo hauler, but its rivals (especially the Honda Fit) can at least hold more than a couple of grocery bags. Passenger space and interior controls are acceptable.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Excellent forward visibility thanks to the expansive windshield and tall front side windows. Big rear head restraints and chunky rear quarter pillars impede rearward vision. Unlike most competitors, there's no rearview camera available.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Yaris' cargo area is its number one detriment. No one should expect a sub-compact to be a cargo hauler, but its rivals (especially the Honda Fit) can at least hold more than a couple of grocery bags. Passenger space and interior controls are acceptable.
title: Visibility

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: While 15.6 cu-ft of cargo room might seem decent, much of that is vertical space. A single row of grocery bags essentially fills up the entire space from tailgate to backseat, and from floor to tonneau cover. Small even for this segment.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Yaris' cargo area is its number one detriment. No one should expect a sub-compact to be a cargo hauler, but its rivals (especially the Honda Fit) can at least hold more than a couple of grocery bags. Passenger space and interior controls are acceptable.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: There are a few more soft-touch points for 2015, but the Yaris' cabin is a rather dreary place with plastic bits seemingly everywhere. Most competitors provide a more premium look and feel for similar money.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Competitive equipment and pricing, along with Toyota's free scheduled maintenance and reputation for reliability, provide a strong value proposition. Fuel economy also stood out in our real-world testing. Interior materials and overall ambiance were disappointing, however.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Yaris hatchback pricing starts at $15,670, comes with a/c, Bluetooth phone and audio, iPod control and a touchscreen interface. The SE adds a leather-wrapped wheel, rear discs and alloy wheels. Navigation is optional on all trims.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Competitive equipment and pricing, along with Toyota's free scheduled maintenance and reputation for reliability, provide a strong value proposition. Fuel economy also stood out in our real-world testing. Interior materials and overall ambiance were disappointing, however.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Our SE test car was $17,645. It's easy to purchase a Yaris since, unlike most other Toyotas, there are no options apart from navigation. Then again, no options means features like leather or a rearview camera are unavailable.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Competitive equipment and pricing, along with Toyota's free scheduled maintenance and reputation for reliability, provide a strong value proposition. Fuel economy also stood out in our real-world testing. Interior materials and overall ambiance were disappointing, however.
title: Cost

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: We returned 37 mpg on the Edmunds evaluation loop with the 5-speed manual, which is one of the best results we've seen in the sub-compact category. The EPA estimates the Yaris manual at 33 mpg Combined (30 City/37 Highway).
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Competitive equipment and pricing, along with Toyota's free scheduled maintenance and reputation for reliability, provide a strong value proposition. Fuel economy also stood out in our real-world testing. Interior materials and overall ambiance were disappointing, however.
title: MPG

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: The Yaris comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and a 5-year/60,000-mile drivetrain warranty, which is typical for this class of car. But, the Hyundai Accent and Chevrolet Sonic offer better coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Competitive equipment and pricing, along with Toyota's free scheduled maintenance and reputation for reliability, provide a strong value proposition. Fuel economy also stood out in our real-world testing. Interior materials and overall ambiance were disappointing, however.
title: Warranty

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Toyota provides 2 years/25,000 miles of free scheduled maintenance, which is a rarity in this and any other non-luxury segment. Plus, Toyota's reputation for reliability cannot be ignored.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Competitive equipment and pricing, along with Toyota's free scheduled maintenance and reputation for reliability, provide a strong value proposition. Fuel economy also stood out in our real-world testing. Interior materials and overall ambiance were disappointing, however.
title: Ownership

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Its engine delivers class-competitive acceleration, but it doesn't feel it in real-world driving. You really have to wring this thing's neck. Turbocharged competitors are more willing. Yes, it's nimble, but not as fun as a Sonic or Fiesta.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Yaris' improved handling and steering for 2015 make it more engaging, and it can indeed be fun when zipping around town. But its engine lacks the punch of most rivals, and if you opt for the 4-speed automatic you'll be pretty much sapping any semblance of fun out of the car.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Toyota
model.name: Yaris
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (1.5L 4cyl 5M)
summary: Toyota succeeded in adding personality to the Yaris for 2015 thanks to a more expressive front end, but the styling result is a bit disjointed. Great sub-compacts should feign a premium and/or cool vibe, but the Yaris does neither.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The Yaris' improved handling and steering for 2015 make it more engaging, and it can indeed be fun when zipping around town. But its engine lacks the punch of most rivals, and if you opt for the 4-speed automatic you'll be pretty much sapping any semblance of fun out of the car.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: There's a hint of initial turbo lag, but once underway it's a non-issue. We reached 60 mph in a quick 6.5 seconds. Power delivery is linear and the 6-speed manual's gear ratios make perfect use of it.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Beetle GSR's combination of 210 hp from the 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder and confident handling make it surprisingly fun to drive. Exciting enough, in fact, to consider the Beetle alongside other performance hatchbacks.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Stopping from 60 mph took 118 feet, which is few feet shorter than the segment average. The pedal is moderately firm, and panic stops were straight, composed and consistent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Beetle GSR's combination of 210 hp from the 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder and confident handling make it surprisingly fun to drive. Exciting enough, in fact, to consider the Beetle alongside other performance hatchbacks.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Steering response and precision are good with proper weighting and feedback through the wheel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Beetle GSR's combination of 210 hp from the 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder and confident handling make it surprisingly fun to drive. Exciting enough, in fact, to consider the Beetle alongside other performance hatchbacks.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Enough confidence to toss it into corners with aggression and know how it will react. ESC can't be disabled, which limits handling numbers. Near that limit, the car tracks beautifully through turns.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Beetle GSR's combination of 210 hp from the 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder and confident handling make it surprisingly fun to drive. Exciting enough, in fact, to consider the Beetle alongside other performance hatchbacks.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The GSR is as adept at carving corners as it is commuting or running errands. The car's small footprint makes it especially maneuverable in tight confines.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Beetle GSR's combination of 210 hp from the 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder and confident handling make it surprisingly fun to drive. Exciting enough, in fact, to consider the Beetle alongside other performance hatchbacks.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Large side bolsters hold you in place well through corners, but taller drivers may find thigh support a bit lacking. Cushioning is on the firm side, but the well-shaped seats don't create any hard points.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its sportier intentions, the Beetle GSR doesn't sacrifice comfort for performance. Long distance cruising doesn't cause any noticeable fatigue on driver or passengers in regard to ride comfort or road noise.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Though the suspension is slightly stiff, it's still not harsh. Ride quality can jostle passengers over repeated bumps, but not to disagreeable levels. A good balance between sport and comfort.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its sportier intentions, the Beetle GSR doesn't sacrifice comfort for performance. Long distance cruising doesn't cause any noticeable fatigue on driver or passengers in regard to ride comfort or road noise.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: On coarse surfaces, road noise con be intrusive. Otherwise, the cabin remains pleasantly quiet with little or no wind noise to speak of at highway speeds.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its sportier intentions, the Beetle GSR doesn't sacrifice comfort for performance. Long distance cruising doesn't cause any noticeable fatigue on driver or passengers in regard to ride comfort or road noise.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Controls are placed logically and within easy reach. The media interface is a combination of touchscreen and hard buttons and is acceptably quick to respond to commands.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Extensive glass and a high roofline make the Beetle feel spacious up front, less so in the rear seat. The hatchback design and folding rear seats improve practicality. Controls are easy to learn.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Large doors make entry extremely easy. But the doors are heavy and can't open fully in tight parking lot situations. The front seat bolsters do require some maneuvering to get around.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Extensive glass and a high roofline make the Beetle feel spacious up front, less so in the rear seat. The hatchback design and folding rear seats improve practicality. Controls are easy to learn.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The bubble-shaped roofline creates a spacious cabin feel. Plenty of headroom up front, though adults will brush elbows. Rear seats are comfortable but head- and legroom are minimal.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Extensive glass and a high roofline make the Beetle feel spacious up front, less so in the rear seat. The hatchback design and folding rear seats improve practicality. Controls are easy to learn.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Excellent forward visibility but large rear headrests and rear roof pillars obscure the view back considerably. This forces reliance on the standard rearview camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Extensive glass and a high roofline make the Beetle feel spacious up front, less so in the rear seat. The hatchback design and folding rear seats improve practicality. Controls are easy to learn.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The small center armrest and elastic front door pockets are only somewhat useful. A cavernous bin below the center stack is nice for small items. Hatchback versatility is a plus.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Extensive glass and a high roofline make the Beetle feel spacious up front, less so in the rear seat. The hatchback design and folding rear seats improve practicality. Controls are easy to learn.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Build quality is solid and on par with other cars at this price. There are some hard plastics, but they are mostly for style purposes and not placed at usual contact points.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,815, the Beetle GSR is the same price as the identically equipped Beetle R-Line. So the GSR's questionable cosmetic upgrades, inside and out, are essentially free. Two years of free maintenance sweetens the deal.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The GSR is essentially a fully loaded Beetle. For the money, you'll get about the same features as other sporty hatchbacks. The only notable option is an automated manual transmission for $1,100.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,815, the Beetle GSR is the same price as the identically equipped Beetle R-Line. So the GSR's questionable cosmetic upgrades, inside and out, are essentially free. Two years of free maintenance sweetens the deal.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Performance and personalitly are the selling points for the GSR and in this regard, the GSR delivers.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,815, the Beetle GSR is the same price as the identically equipped Beetle R-Line. So the GSR's questionable cosmetic upgrades, inside and out, are essentially free. Two years of free maintenance sweetens the deal.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The EPA estimates 26 mpg Combined (23 City/31 Hwy) which is typical for sport-minded hatchbacks. We attained an impressive 31.1 mpg on our evaluation loop and 24 mpg overall.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,815, the Beetle GSR is the same price as the identically equipped Beetle R-Line. So the GSR's questionable cosmetic upgrades, inside and out, are essentially free. Two years of free maintenance sweetens the deal.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: VW's 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties are identical to segment rivals. As with other manufacturers, optional extended warranties are offered.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,815, the Beetle GSR is the same price as the identically equipped Beetle R-Line. So the GSR's questionable cosmetic upgrades, inside and out, are essentially free. Two years of free maintenance sweetens the deal.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Two years/24,000 miles of free scheduled maintenance comes standard on the 2014 Beetle GSR. Competitors offer this at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,815, the Beetle GSR is the same price as the identically equipped Beetle R-Line. So the GSR's questionable cosmetic upgrades, inside and out, are essentially free. Two years of free maintenance sweetens the deal.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: There's a lot to like in the way the GSR drives. From mundane errand runner to canyon carver, these turbocharged Beetles have a wide range of appeal with little sacrifice.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite its lighthearted styling, the Beetle GSR is a willing and eager plaything. It's just as much fun to drive spiritedly as the segment-defining VW GTI, and for good reason as they share much of their mechanicals.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle
style.name: GSR PZEV 2dr Hatchback (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: As the heritage name suggests, the GSR is only available in the brash yellow and black paint scheme. Definitely an acquired taste. Some may consider it an eyesore.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite its lighthearted styling, the Beetle GSR is a willing and eager plaything. It's just as much fun to drive spiritedly as the segment-defining VW GTI, and for good reason as they share much of their mechanicals.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Strong acceleration from the 210-hp 2.0-liter turbo four-cylinder. Feels more powerful than the numbers suggest. Quite torquey. A bit of turbo lag if you lay into the throttle at low revs. Got to 60 mph in 6.7 seconds in our testing.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The engine provides plenty of thrust in this convertible, and it goes around corners with reasonable confidence. Light-effort steering, shifter and clutch. Its brake pedal, like many Volkswagens, is mushy and doesn't inspire confidence even if ultimate braking ability is good.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: In routine driving the brake pedal is soft with a nonlinear action and does not have a lot of initial bite. It doesn't inspire confidence. However, in our panic-stop tests the Beetle performed well, stopping with no drama.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The engine provides plenty of thrust in this convertible, and it goes around corners with reasonable confidence. Light-effort steering, shifter and clutch. Its brake pedal, like many Volkswagens, is mushy and doesn't inspire confidence even if ultimate braking ability is good.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The steering does not offer the driver much in the way of feel or feedback. The effort is light and the ratio is quick, so it's easy to whip the Beetle around when parking. The steering wheel rim is oddly skinny.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The engine provides plenty of thrust in this convertible, and it goes around corners with reasonable confidence. Light-effort steering, shifter and clutch. Its brake pedal, like many Volkswagens, is mushy and doesn't inspire confidence even if ultimate braking ability is good.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Body motions are well controlled with good handling manners. It's certainly not the last word in sporting handling, but it's composed and capable enough to be enjoyable on a fun road. The R-Line-specific suspension changes are mild.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The engine provides plenty of thrust in this convertible, and it goes around corners with reasonable confidence. Light-effort steering, shifter and clutch. Its brake pedal, like many Volkswagens, is mushy and doesn't inspire confidence even if ultimate braking ability is good.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Easy to drive, with a feather-light clutch and a manual shift lever that's so light it's almost toy-like in its action. Engine braking (to slow the car) is unfortunately minimal. Some minor turbo lag, but overall a smooth power delivery.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The engine provides plenty of thrust in this convertible, and it goes around corners with reasonable confidence. Light-effort steering, shifter and clutch. Its brake pedal, like many Volkswagens, is mushy and doesn't inspire confidence even if ultimate braking ability is good.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Front seat is a great mix of comfort and support. Easy to drive long hours with no discomfort. Thigh support is good despite having a fixed thigh bolster. No hot spots or pressure points. Backseat is upright but still has good comfort.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: From the ride quality to the seat contours, the Beetle hits the high notes on the comfort side of the coin. The chassis is up to the task of having its top lopped off as cowl shake, while present, is minimal. Wind noise is (predictably) prominent, but no more so than other convertibles.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The ride is compliant while retaining a good amount of chassis stiffness, even with its roof hacked off. The suspension is absorbent and rounds off harsh edges from the road, but isn't floaty or overly soft. A good compromise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: From the ride quality to the seat contours, the Beetle hits the high notes on the comfort side of the coin. The chassis is up to the task of having its top lopped off as cowl shake, while present, is minimal. Wind noise is (predictably) prominent, but no more so than other convertibles.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: At cruising speed there is very little road noise. Engine racket is fairly well controlled, too, but the wind noise around the fabric convertible top is significant.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: From the ride quality to the seat contours, the Beetle hits the high notes on the comfort side of the coin. The chassis is up to the task of having its top lopped off as cowl shake, while present, is minimal. Wind noise is (predictably) prominent, but no more so than other convertibles.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Easy-to-use cabin controls. Large trio of climate control knobs and chunky rotary headlight switch. Good driving position with light-effort clutch pedal and shift lever.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Beetle's instrument panel is uncluttered and logically laid out. A good blend of retro and modern that doesn't sacrifice functionality or fall victim to kitsch. Interior is easy to use and there's good space up front. Outward visibility and trunk access are big shortcomings, though.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Large door openings and low sills. The front seat is easy to plop into, and backseat access gets high marks considering this is a two-door. The front seat tilts and slides forward in one operation, quite handy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Beetle's instrument panel is uncluttered and logically laid out. A good blend of retro and modern that doesn't sacrifice functionality or fall victim to kitsch. Interior is easy to use and there's good space up front. Outward visibility and trunk access are big shortcomings, though.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Loads of headroom up front, even for tall folks. Backseat headroom is also good, though leg room is at a premium and shoulder room is restricted by the wide bulkheads necessitated by the folding top.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Beetle's instrument panel is uncluttered and logically laid out. A good blend of retro and modern that doesn't sacrifice functionality or fall victim to kitsch. Interior is easy to use and there's good space up front. Outward visibility and trunk access are big shortcomings, though.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Visibility forward and out the side glass is good. However, the view over your shoulder is blocked by the soft-top's colossal C-pillar and relatively small rear window. There's no backup camera either, and this is a car that needs one.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Beetle's instrument panel is uncluttered and logically laid out. A good blend of retro and modern that doesn't sacrifice functionality or fall victim to kitsch. Interior is easy to use and there's good space up front. Outward visibility and trunk access are big shortcomings, though.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Trunk has a small, upright opening suitable for a couple of bags, but little else. Inside, there are two average-sized cupholders, a bin at the shifter base, a flip-down center console of modest size, two gloveboxes, two door pockets.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Beetle's instrument panel is uncluttered and logically laid out. A good blend of retro and modern that doesn't sacrifice functionality or fall victim to kitsch. Interior is easy to use and there's good space up front. Outward visibility and trunk access are big shortcomings, though.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The power convertible top stows quickly with one touch of a button. When down, the folded top sticks up prominently, blocking the rear view. It closes with similar speed, again with just a single touch.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Beetle's instrument panel is uncluttered and logically laid out. A good blend of retro and modern that doesn't sacrifice functionality or fall victim to kitsch. Interior is easy to use and there's good space up front. Outward visibility and trunk access are big shortcomings, though.
title: Convertible Top

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Aside from a creaky clutch pedal, our test car was a tight example. Its interior looked well-assembled with no glaring missteps. Although materials and surfaces are pleasant, you might expect a bit more panache for the price.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our test car is nearly the costliest Beetle convertible variant. This puts it within striking distance, price-wise, of a higher class of cars than its intended competition. Its feature set is good but lacks a backup camera. Oddly, summer performance tires are not part of the R-Line trim.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Strange that the R-Line performance trim comes with all-season tires. Other features include leather, heated seats and keyless entry. Our test car had optional navigation and premium audio, but no backup camera. It needs it. Badly.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our test car is nearly the costliest Beetle convertible variant. This puts it within striking distance, price-wise, of a higher class of cars than its intended competition. Its feature set is good but lacks a backup camera. Oddly, summer performance tires are not part of the R-Line trim.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: At $34,615 as-tested, this is not an inexpensive car. Priced similary to a full-spec Mini John Cooper Works droptop, and more than a Fiat 500 Abarth Convertible. For reference, an Audi A3 convertible starts at $36,525 with destination.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our test car is nearly the costliest Beetle convertible variant. This puts it within striking distance, price-wise, of a higher class of cars than its intended competition. Its feature set is good but lacks a backup camera. Oddly, summer performance tires are not part of the R-Line trim.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: EPA rating of 26 mpg Combined (23 City/31 Highway) places the Beetle just shy of its competition, the smaller Mini Cooper and Fiat Abarth convertibles. Our test car returned 20.5 mpg overall, with 28.3 mpg on the Edmunds evaluation loop.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our test car is nearly the costliest Beetle convertible variant. This puts it within striking distance, price-wise, of a higher class of cars than its intended competition. Its feature set is good but lacks a backup camera. Oddly, summer performance tires are not part of the R-Line trim.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: The Beetle's basic warranty coverage of 3 years/36,000 miles is short of its rivals. The 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty is more competitive. Also offers 12 years/unlimited miles against corrosion.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our test car is nearly the costliest Beetle convertible variant. This puts it within striking distance, price-wise, of a higher class of cars than its intended competition. Its feature set is good but lacks a backup camera. Oddly, summer performance tires are not part of the R-Line trim.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Free scheduled maintenance for 2 years/24,000 miles is a nice feature. Roadside assistance last for 3 years/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our test car is nearly the costliest Beetle convertible variant. This puts it within striking distance, price-wise, of a higher class of cars than its intended competition. Its feature set is good but lacks a backup camera. Oddly, summer performance tires are not part of the R-Line trim.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: With the top up, this is a reasonably refined convertible. Its wind-in-the-hair capability is easily accessed, via one button and a brief wait which can be done even while moving (as long as you're not driving too fast).
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Less a performance convertible and more a capable cruiser, the Beetle R-Line with a manual transmission is sure to be a rare breed. It does manage to be a cohesive piece and doesn't suffer much, relatively speaking, for having its roof removed.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Beetle Convertible
style.name: R-Line 2dr Convertible w/Sound, Navigation (2.0L Turbo 4cyl 6M)
summary: Our test car had a combination of head-scratching attributes: there's the optional performance trim level that's not that serious. It's a convertible, yet it has a manual gearbox. An odd mix, but it still managed to work well as a whole.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Less a performance convertible and more a capable cruiser, the Beetle R-Line with a manual transmission is sure to be a rare breed. It does manage to be a cohesive piece and doesn't suffer much, relatively speaking, for having its roof removed.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Acclimating to the power characteristics of this turbodiesel (vs a gasoline engine) is intuitive. Power falls off as the revs climb, but 60 mph arrives in 8.7 seconds, which is competitive for the compact segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Golf TDI's 150-hp 2.0-liter turbodiesel four-cylinder is ideally suited for commuting or highway cruising. The VW's steering, handling and braking are top of the segment, but don't quite match the class-leading Mazda 3's benchmark for driver engagement.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Out on the road, the brakes feel intuitive and confident. In our brake testing the Golf stopped from 60 mph in a short 119 feet. Although the pedal softened after repeated runs, the distances remained consistent.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Golf TDI's 150-hp 2.0-liter turbodiesel four-cylinder is ideally suited for commuting or highway cruising. The VW's steering, handling and braking are top of the segment, but don't quite match the class-leading Mazda 3's benchmark for driver engagement.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: By compact car standards the Golf's steering is more engaging and precise than most. The steering effort is light for parking lots and firms up on the highway for stable and confident driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Golf TDI's 150-hp 2.0-liter turbodiesel four-cylinder is ideally suited for commuting or highway cruising. The VW's steering, handling and braking are top of the segment, but don't quite match the class-leading Mazda 3's benchmark for driver engagement.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The Golf TDI is a capable and predictable handler despite some body roll/lean through sharp turns. Still, it's forgiving and responsive, but if you need better handling, consider the sporty Golf GTI.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Golf TDI's 150-hp 2.0-liter turbodiesel four-cylinder is ideally suited for commuting or highway cruising. The VW's steering, handling and braking are top of the segment, but don't quite match the class-leading Mazda 3's benchmark for driver engagement.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Because this diesel offers so much low-end grunt at relatively low speeds, it's a cinch to drive in traffic, and the gear you're in almost doesn't matter thanks to the well-sorted, easy-shifting 6-sp manual transmission.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Golf TDI's 150-hp 2.0-liter turbodiesel four-cylinder is ideally suited for commuting or highway cruising. The VW's steering, handling and braking are top of the segment, but don't quite match the class-leading Mazda 3's benchmark for driver engagement.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The heated front seats are superb: comfortable, supportive and with plenty of headroom. Rear seats also offer acceptable headroom. The faux leather material, however, doesn't breathe as well as the real thing.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Like the rest of the Golf line, the TDI's compliant suspension, comfortable seats and remarkably quiet cabin put it near the top of the compact segment in terms of comfort.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The Golf's compliant suspension and standard 17-inch alloy wheels with all-season tires isolate road irregularities with ease. The highway ride is composed, never floaty. Makes it feel like a car with a longer, more substantial wheelbase.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Like the rest of the Golf line, the TDI's compliant suspension, comfortable seats and remarkably quiet cabin put it near the top of the compact segment in terms of comfort.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Engine noise is no more prominent at idle or under heavy acceleration than it is in the gasoline-powered Golf. There's some occasional road noise, but it's not intrusive. Wind noise is negligible.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Like the rest of the Golf line, the TDI's compliant suspension, comfortable seats and remarkably quiet cabin put it near the top of the compact segment in terms of comfort.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The standard 5.8-inch touchscreen now seems small, but it functions intuitively and responds well for infotainment needs. Other knobs/buttons are robust and well-placed for ease of use.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: VW's tradition of functional austerity carries on in this new-generation Golf. The materials used and the solid build quality exceed those of most competitors and fulfill European-inspired standards.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Door sizes and shapes afford easy access to all seats, even in tight parking spaces, or for tall occupants. Roof-mounted grab-handles at all positions are a welcome aid. Seatbelt reach is ideal.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: VW's tradition of functional austerity carries on in this new-generation Golf. The materials used and the solid build quality exceed those of most competitors and fulfill European-inspired standards.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Because there's plenty of fore-aft and height adjustability, the front seats accommodate a wide range of passengers. Rear seat cushions are low enough to afford tall folks plenty of headroom.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: VW's tradition of functional austerity carries on in this new-generation Golf. The materials used and the solid build quality exceed those of most competitors and fulfill European-inspired standards.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Since the Golf is a hatchback, backing into a parking spot is easy thanks to the upright rear glass. The standard rearview camera and optional parking sensors are not critical because sight lines aren't compromised by thick pillars.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: VW's tradition of functional austerity carries on in this new-generation Golf. The materials used and the solid build quality exceed those of most competitors and fulfill European-inspired standards.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Cargo area behind rear seats is 22.8 cubic-feet, so useable room is less than rivals. But max capacity (with rear seats folded) is excellent at 52.7 cu-ft. Interior storage is better than rivals with large door pockets and plenty of nooks.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: VW's tradition of functional austerity carries on in this new-generation Golf. The materials used and the solid build quality exceed those of most competitors and fulfill European-inspired standards.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Compared to other compact cars, the Golf feels more solid and substantial, from the way the doors close to the lack of rough-road rattles. Paint quality and fit are also slightly better.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $21,995 for the base Golf TDI S and $25,495 for our mid-level SE test car with a manual transmission, the diesel-powered Golf is priced precisely $1,000 more than comparable gasoline Golf hatchbacks. Some competitors offer more standard and optional features for the money.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The Golf TDI's higher price in relation to its Golf TSI siblings (and rivals) remains consistent as trim levels and options are increased. Some comfort and tech features are notably absent compared to its prime competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $21,995 for the base Golf TDI S and $25,495 for our mid-level SE test car with a manual transmission, the diesel-powered Golf is priced precisely $1,000 more than comparable gasoline Golf hatchbacks. Some competitors offer more standard and optional features for the money.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The MSRP of this mid-level TDI SE with manual transmission is $25,495, or exactly $1,000 more than the gasoline-powered Golf SE and much higher than rivals like the fuel-efficient Mazda 3 that offers more equipment for the money.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $21,995 for the base Golf TDI S and $25,495 for our mid-level SE test car with a manual transmission, the diesel-powered Golf is priced precisely $1,000 more than comparable gasoline Golf hatchbacks. Some competitors offer more standard and optional features for the money.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: EPA estimates stand at 36 mpg Combined (30 City/45 Highway). We easily managed 49 mpg on our highway-heavy 120-mile evaluation loop, but it would still require years to break even on fuel efficiency alone.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $21,995 for the base Golf TDI S and $25,495 for our mid-level SE test car with a manual transmission, the diesel-powered Golf is priced precisely $1,000 more than comparable gasoline Golf hatchbacks. Some competitors offer more standard and optional features for the money.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The Golf offers a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty and a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, both of which are comparable to rival hatchbacks.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $21,995 for the base Golf TDI S and $25,495 for our mid-level SE test car with a manual transmission, the diesel-powered Golf is priced precisely $1,000 more than comparable gasoline Golf hatchbacks. Some competitors offer more standard and optional features for the money.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: VW stands out among competitors with 1 year/10,000 miles of free scheduled maintenance. The roadside assistance of 3 years/36,000 miles is typical for the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $21,995 for the base Golf TDI S and $25,495 for our mid-level SE test car with a manual transmission, the diesel-powered Golf is priced precisely $1,000 more than comparable gasoline Golf hatchbacks. Some competitors offer more standard and optional features for the money.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: Besides getting used to the odd power delivery of its low-revving turbodiesel engine, driving the Golf TDI is as comfortable, sporty and substantial as other Golf hatchbacks. It will exceed expectations.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: A torque-rich turbodiesel and sporty handling allow the 2015 Volkswagen Golf TDI to be remarkably fun on curvy backroads. It's far more capable than most drivers will ever need, but true driving enthusiasts will still want to opt for the reborn, gasoline-powered GTI version.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TDI SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6M)
summary: The redesigned 2015 VW Golf is an evolution in the hatchback's long history. It feels a little more grown-up and polished than before, and the new turbodiesel engine gives it some seriously long range.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: A torque-rich turbodiesel and sporty handling allow the 2015 Volkswagen Golf TDI to be remarkably fun on curvy backroads. It's far more capable than most drivers will ever need, but true driving enthusiasts will still want to opt for the reborn, gasoline-powered GTI version.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: With 170 horsepower and 200 lb-ft of torque, the Golf reaches 60 mph in a quick 7.8 seconds. The turbo gets it up to highways speeds with ease. Under hard acceleration, shifts from the 6-speed automatic are quick and smooth.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder will prove plenty potent for the vast majority of drivers. The same holds true for handling. Our testing results show the Golf nearly matching the class-leading Mazda 3, although the Golf can't quite mimic the Mazda's level of driver engagement.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: In our panic-brake test, the Golf stopped from 60 mph in a short 119 feet. Noticeable nosedive and the pedal softened after repeated runs, but distances were consistent. On the road, transmission downshifts caused some awkward lurches.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder will prove plenty potent for the vast majority of drivers. The same holds true for handling. Our testing results show the Golf nearly matching the class-leading Mazda 3, although the Golf can't quite mimic the Mazda's level of driver engagement.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Steering effort is pleasantly light at lower speeds for easy maneuvering. We found the steering precise, but it just doesn't give quite the level of feedback you'll find in a Mazda 3.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder will prove plenty potent for the vast majority of drivers. The same holds true for handling. Our testing results show the Golf nearly matching the class-leading Mazda 3, although the Golf can't quite mimic the Mazda's level of driver engagement.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: On a twisting road, the Golf is responsive and capable. There is considerable body lean/roll through sharp turns, but this is a forgiving, responsive car that's easy to control at its limits. If you need better handling, consider the GTI.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder will prove plenty potent for the vast majority of drivers. The same holds true for handling. Our testing results show the Golf nearly matching the class-leading Mazda 3, although the Golf can't quite mimic the Mazda's level of driver engagement.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Driveability is hampered by finicky automatic transmission producing small lurches as it leaves the line and when a change in speed is required. You either have to let it creep slowly or stomp the gas pedal to eliminate this behavior.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder will prove plenty potent for the vast majority of drivers. The same holds true for handling. Our testing results show the Golf nearly matching the class-leading Mazda 3, although the Golf can't quite mimic the Mazda's level of driver engagement.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Front seats are superb, with ample comfort, support and headroom. Low-mounted rear-seat cushions give acceptable headroom for anyone under 5-foot-10. The synthetic leather looks convincing, but doesn't breathe as well as genuine leather.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: With its tall cabin and relatively soft suspension, the Golf provides a comfortable place to pass the miles, whether commuting to work or taking a long road trip.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Ruts and potholes are smoothed over easily by the Golf's compliant suspension. On the highway it has a settled and composed ride, never floaty or detached.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: With its tall cabin and relatively soft suspension, the Golf provides a comfortable place to pass the miles, whether commuting to work or taking a long road trip.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Some road noise is noticeable but not intrusive, and there's hardly any wind whistling out on the highway. Engine noise is prominent under heavy acceleration, but it's more of an enthusiast-pleasing burly sound.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: With its tall cabin and relatively soft suspension, the Golf provides a comfortable place to pass the miles, whether commuting to work or taking a long road trip.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Controls are well placed and labeled for ease of use. The 5.8-inch touchscreen is on the small side but the graphics are sharp and the system functions well. Menu layout is simple and intuitive, too.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Golf's interior hasn't changed dramatically from the previous generation, and that's a good thing. Materials are excellent for the class. The car's classically German, austere design tips the needle toward the entry-level luxury spectrum, rather than economy compact.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Tall doors make getting in and out easy, even for taller passengers. But because the doors are narrow, width-wise, opening them in tight parking spots is pretty simple. Seatbelts are just a short reach over the shoulder.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Golf's interior hasn't changed dramatically from the previous generation, and that's a good thing. Materials are excellent for the class. The car's classically German, austere design tips the needle toward the entry-level luxury spectrum, rather than economy compact.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Front seats are roomy with plenty of adjustment travel for tall folks. Rear-seat cushions are mounted low to the floor, which can make for a big knee-bend. But, the extra headroom this gives means there's space for a 5-foot-10 adult.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Golf's interior hasn't changed dramatically from the previous generation, and that's a good thing. Materials are excellent for the class. The car's classically German, austere design tips the needle toward the entry-level luxury spectrum, rather than economy compact.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: All-around visibility is excellent thanks to narrow roof pillars. With the upright rear hatchback glass, backing into a spot is so easy that you don't need to rely on the standard rearview camera.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Golf's interior hasn't changed dramatically from the previous generation, and that's a good thing. Materials are excellent for the class. The car's classically German, austere design tips the needle toward the entry-level luxury spectrum, rather than economy compact.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Cargo capacity behind rear seats is 22.8 cu-ft if stacked to the roof. If stacked to the top of the seats, useable room is less than rivals. But seats-folded max capacity is excellent at 52.7 cu-ft. Interior storage is similar to rivals.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The 2015 Golf's interior hasn't changed dramatically from the previous generation, and that's a good thing. Materials are excellent for the class. The car's classically German, austere design tips the needle toward the entry-level luxury spectrum, rather than economy compact.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Inside and out, the Golf feels sturdy and well built. We did detect a few creaks from time to time, but only on rough roads and no more so than other cars in this class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $18,815 for the base two-door Launch Edition Golf and $20,915 for a four-door Golf S with manual transmission, the Golf is priced slightly higher than other hatchbacks. Competitors also offer more standard and optional features for the money, too.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Golf's higher price in relation to its rivals remains consistent as trim levels and options are increased. Leather and some infotainment features are notably absent compared to its prime competitors.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $18,815 for the base two-door Launch Edition Golf and $20,915 for a four-door Golf S with manual transmission, the Golf is priced slightly higher than other hatchbacks. Competitors also offer more standard and optional features for the money, too.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: In range-topping SEL trim, this Golf is only offered as a four-door with an automatic transmission costing $27,815. With the optional lighting package, the total is $28,810, which is $1,225 higher than a more generously equipped Mazda 3.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $18,815 for the base two-door Launch Edition Golf and $20,915 for a four-door Golf S with manual transmission, the Golf is priced slightly higher than other hatchbacks. Competitors also offer more standard and optional features for the money, too.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Early EPA estimates put fuel economy at 26 mpg City/36 Highway, which is competitive among hatchbacks. We were unable to match those numbers. We achieved 32.0 mpg on our highway-heavy evaluation loop, and averaged 25.3 mpg overall.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $18,815 for the base two-door Launch Edition Golf and $20,915 for a four-door Golf S with manual transmission, the Golf is priced slightly higher than other hatchbacks. Competitors also offer more standard and optional features for the money, too.
title: MPG

model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Golf offers a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty and a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, both of which are comparable to rival hatchbacks.
