title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: VW stands out among competitors with 1-yr/10,000 miles free scheduled maintenance. Roadside assistance of 3 years/36,000 miles is typical for the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $18,815 for the base two-door Launch Edition Golf and $20,915 for a four-door Golf S with manual transmission, the Golf is priced slightly higher than other hatchbacks. Competitors also offer more standard and optional features for the money, too.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: In a word, the 2015 VW Golf is German. It's comfortable, sturdy and responsive. Other than the odd low-speed manners of its automatic transmission, it's easy to drive and should exceed performance expectations.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With its eager turbo engine and confident handling characteristics, the 2015 Volkswagen Golf provides big grins on curvy back roads. It's far more capable than most drivers will ever need, and maybe just one tick short of the Mazda 3's precision. But, you can also opt for the GTI version.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf
style.name: TSI SEL 4dr Hatchback (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The redesigned 2015 VW Golf is an incremental evolution in the model's long history. As such, it remains fairly commonplace and sensible, yet fashionably understated. The new base turbo engine gives it some much-needed sass.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: With its eager turbo engine and confident handling characteristics, the 2015 Volkswagen Golf provides big grins on curvy back roads. It's far more capable than most drivers will ever need, and maybe just one tick short of the Mazda 3's precision. But, you can also opt for the GTI version.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: With the Performance Pack's 220 hp and launch control, the GTI gets to 60 mph in 6.3 sec. Only the Subaru WRX is quicker in the class. Lightning fast shifts from the DSG transmission whether shifted via paddles or in automatic modes.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Thanks to summer tires, the GTI stops from 60 mph in only 109 feet. The real coup here for the GTI is the superb, firm, easy-to-control brake feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Quick and not too heavy, the GTI's steering, like the brakes, is proof that VW still has some drivers on its staff. It has a sporty feel when you wick the pace up, yet doesn't remind you about it in daily driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: A true hot hatch, the GTI begs to be driven hard and rewards the driver with slight oversteer, good grip and predictable inputs. A total blast with no real torque steer and awesome traction from the limited-slip front differential.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: There's one ding on the GTI's driveability: slight low-speed jerkiness from the DSG, just like with all dual-clutch transmissions. Still, phenomenally easy car to drive and live with.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Though we had leather and not the base GTI-spec tartan cloth, the seats were still grippy, well-bolstered and breathable. Manual adjustments for rake and reach, however, can be awkward.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A stiff ride is expected in this segment, but the GTI puts a toe over the line with a fairly busy ride. Comfy seats and a quiet interior help make up for it, to a large extent.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The blame could lie with the sporty summer tires on our test car, or the non-adjustable suspension, but the GTI exhibited a busy ride over most surfaces we encountered. Still, it has sporting intentions, so drive before you decide.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A stiff ride is expected in this segment, but the GTI puts a toe over the line with a fairly busy ride. Comfy seats and a quiet interior help make up for it, to a large extent.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Despite the stiff-legged ride, the GTI's cabin is quiet for the class. Minimal tire noise, a pleasant engine sound and only a hint of audible impact harshness. No noticeable wind noise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A stiff ride is expected in this segment, but the GTI puts a toe over the line with a fairly busy ride. Comfy seats and a quiet interior help make up for it, to a large extent.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Designed for the driver, the GTI's controls are all a short reach away from the steering wheel, placed well and obviously labeled. The 5.8-inch touchscreen is on the small side but the graphics are sharp with good system functions.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Wide and tall doors with a moderately high seat work out to an easy car to get into and out of. Especially for its size.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: It's not until you get out of the GTI that you realize how small it actually is. The cabin feels large and the tilt/telescope action of the steering wheel allows tall drivers to get comfortable, too.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: This GTI SE featured a rearview camera that was handy, but entirely unnecessary. This car has great sightlines all around and a high seating position for a terrific view outward.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Cargo area has 20.4 cu-ft of space with the parcel shelf removed, less with it in place. Fold the rear seats down and you get 47.2 cu-ft of max cargo. Cupholders are deep with anti-tilt so items stay in place, even through corners.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: In traditional German fashion, the GTI's interior feels sturdy and looks utilitarian. No squeaks or rattles from our tester and switches operated with satisifying tactile confirmation.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The GTI is more expensive than its peers and options are lumped into the GTI's three trim levels. Want the plaid cloth seats together with navigation? You can't do that. Frustrating.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: As equipped, this 2015 Golf GTI SE costs $31,410 including $1,495 for the Performance package. The SE features a rearview camera, sunroof, 5.8-inch touchscreen (non-nav), Bluetooth, keyless entry and push-button start.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Cost

model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The EPA estimates the four-door GTI with DSG will get 28 mpg Combined (25 City/33 Highway). We averaged 24 mpg overall with a best tank of 33 mpg.

title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Few cars work this well as a normal, daily driver, then perform so phenomenally when a sporting mood suddenly strikes you. It's like getting two cars in one.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun is the GTI's raison d'etre and it doesn't disappoint. The steering is quick, the car is happy to step the tail out when you're driving hard on a backroad and it has plentiful punch out of corners. Only the Ford Focus ST can match it in the hatchback world.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: It's a performance car with a willing, great-sounding turbo engine and available tartan plaid interior. We like! Unlike some other hot hatches, the GTI's personality doesn't try to overwhelm onlookers. It's just cool.

style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Thanks to summer tires, the GTI stops from 60 mph in only 109 feet. The real coup here for the GTI is the superb, firm, easy-to-control brake feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Quick and not too heavy, the GTI's steering, like the brakes, is proof that VW still has some drivers on its staff. It has a sporty feel when you wick the pace up, yet doesn't remind you about it in daily driving.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: A true hot hatch, the GTI begs to be driven hard and rewards the driver with slight oversteer, good grip and predictable inputs. A total blast with no real torque steer and awesome traction from the limited-slip front differential.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: There's one ding on the GTI's driveability: slight low-speed jerkiness from the DSG, just like with all dual-clutch transmissions. Still, phenomenally easy car to drive and live with.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: You could drive the GTI every day and have no clue about its performance potential because it's so easy and normal-feeling. Get it on the right road, though, and it's a stunner with agile handling and invigorating mannerisms. Its 2.0-liter turbo 4-cylinder is always smooth, always eager.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Though we had leather and not the base GTI-spec tartan cloth, the seats were still grippy, well-bolstered and breathable. Manual adjustments for rake and reach, however, can be awkward.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A stiff ride is expected in this segment, but the GTI puts a toe over the line with a fairly busy ride. Comfy seats and a quiet interior help make up for it, to a large extent.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The blame could lie with the sporty summer tires on our test car, or the non-adjustable suspension, but the GTI exhibited a busy ride over most surfaces we encountered. Still, it has sporting intentions, so drive before you decide.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A stiff ride is expected in this segment, but the GTI puts a toe over the line with a fairly busy ride. Comfy seats and a quiet interior help make up for it, to a large extent.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Despite the stiff-legged ride, the GTI's cabin is quiet for the class. Minimal tire noise, a pleasant engine sound and only a hint of audible impact harshness. No noticeable wind noise.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: A stiff ride is expected in this segment, but the GTI puts a toe over the line with a fairly busy ride. Comfy seats and a quiet interior help make up for it, to a large extent.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Designed for the driver, the GTI's controls are all a short reach away from the steering wheel, placed well and obviously labeled. The 5.8-inch touchscreen is on the small side but the graphics are sharp with good system functions.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Wide and tall doors with a moderately high seat work out to an easy car to get into and out of. Especially for its size.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: It's not until you get out of the GTI that you realize how small it actually is. The cabin feels large and the tilt/telescope action of the steering wheel allows tall drivers to get comfortable, too.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: This GTI SE featured a rearview camera that was handy, but entirely unnecessary. This car has great sightlines all around and a high seating position for a terrific view outward.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Cargo area has 20.4 cu-ft of space with the parcel shelf removed, less with it in place. Fold the rear seats down and you get 47.2 cu-ft of max cargo. Cupholders are deep with anti-tilt so items stay in place, even through corners.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI is the grownup of the Hot Hatch segment and that really shows on the interior. Clean, clear, easy to use with excellent materials for the segment. A winner.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: In traditional German fashion, the GTI's interior feels sturdy and looks utilitarian. No squeaks or rattles from our tester and switches operated with satisifying tactile confirmation.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The GTI is more expensive than its peers and options are lumped into the GTI's three trim levels. Want the plaid cloth seats together with navigation? You can't do that. Frustrating.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: As equipped, this 2015 Golf GTI SE costs $31,410 including $1,495 for the Performance package. The SE features a rearview camera, sunroof, 5.8-inch touchscreen (non-nav), Bluetooth, keyless entry and push-button start.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The EPA estimates the four-door GTI with DSG will get 28 mpg Combined (25 City/33 Highway). We averaged 24 mpg overall with a best tank of 33 mpg.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The GTI offers a 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranty and a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty, both of which are comparable to rival hatchbacks.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: VW stands out among competitors with 1 year/10,000 miles of free scheduled maintenance. Roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles is typical for the class.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Volkswagen GTI isn't the cheapest car in the class, but it also doesn't feel like the cheapest car in the class, thanks to its well-built interior. Prices for a four-door start at $24,995 and run to $30,695 for an Autobahn with the six-speed DSG automatic.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Few cars work this well as a normal, daily driver, then perform so phenomenally when a sporting mood suddenly strikes you. It's like getting two cars in one.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun is the GTI's raison d'etre and it doesn't disappoint. The steering is quick, the car is happy to step the tail out when you're driving hard on a backroad and it has plentiful punch out of corners. Only the Ford Focus ST can match it in the hatchback world.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Golf GTI
style.name: SE 4dr Hatchback (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: It's a performance car with a willing, great-sounding turbo engine and available tartan plaid interior. We like! Unlike some other hot hatches, the GTI's personality doesn't try to overwhelm onlookers. It's just cool.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Fun is the GTI's raison d'etre and it doesn't disappoint. The steering is quick, the car is happy to step the tail out when you're driving hard on a backroad and it has plentiful punch out of corners. Only the Ford Focus ST can match it in the hatchback world.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The GTI goes from 0-60 in 6.4 seconds. Some turbo lag and the slow-reacting DSG transmission make it feel like it takes a second to get going. The 6-speed manual is the way to go.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a 200-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder, the GTI makes less power than its competitors (Ford Focus ST, Mazdaspeed3), but still provides an exciting driving dynamic.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Stopping from 60 mph took 125 feet, which is 10 to 13 feet longer than rivals, with some wiggles under panic stops. The DSG's downshifts during deceleration can make for lurchy braking.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a 200-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder, the GTI makes less power than its competitors (Ford Focus ST, Mazdaspeed3), but still provides an exciting driving dynamic.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Excellent steering feel with appropriate weighting. Very responsive to quick inputs, even if the rest of the car isn't quite as adept. Pleasantly light for parking in tight spots.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a 200-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder, the GTI makes less power than its competitors (Ford Focus ST, Mazdaspeed3), but still provides an exciting driving dynamic.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: All-season tires kept this GTI from meeting its true potential. The front tires let go first with easy understeer. ESC intervenes earlier than enthusiasts will like, and it can't be completely shut off.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a 200-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder, the GTI makes less power than its competitors (Ford Focus ST, Mazdaspeed3), but still provides an exciting driving dynamic.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Between the turbo lag and slow-reacting DSG, the GTI takes some getting used to for everyday driving. But the engine is super-smooth, the manual is easy to use, and the level of comfort trumps its rivals.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: With a 200-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder, the GTI makes less power than its competitors (Ford Focus ST, Mazdaspeed3), but still provides an exciting driving dynamic.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Driving position is fairly upright and comfortable. The traditional plaid cloth seats are well padded with adequate lateral support. After several hours, there was no fatigue to report.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its sporting intentions, the GTI provides a high level of comfort. In terms of refinement, it easily bests other hatchbacks in ride quality, space and sound insulation.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Plenty of suspension compliance soaks up bumps with ease. There's no harshness to speak of and residual rebounds are rarely, if ever, felt. It's a smooth and solid ride.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its sporting intentions, the GTI provides a high level of comfort. In terms of refinement, it easily bests other hatchbacks in ride quality, space and sound insulation.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Wind noise is barely there. Road noise is present, but not at all intrusive. Even the engine is pleasantly muted to a low growl. Interior squeaks are nonexistent.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Despite its sporting intentions, the GTI provides a high level of comfort. In terms of refinement, it easily bests other hatchbacks in ride quality, space and sound insulation.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Thoughtful placement of all controls makes operation second-nature, even for newcomers. Touchscreen is on the small side, but within easy reach and very legible.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI's interior is easily the best in the class, with Audi-like refinement and thoughtful design. Interior storage is lacking compared to other hatchbacks, as is cargo capacity. This is definitely a hatchback for more sophisticated tastes.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The upright seating position and moderate ride height make getting in and out an easy affair with little stooping. Short doors for all passengers further simplify things in tight parking spaces.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI's interior is easily the best in the class, with Audi-like refinement and thoughtful design. Interior storage is lacking compared to other hatchbacks, as is cargo capacity. This is definitely a hatchback for more sophisticated tastes.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Clever design makes the GTI seem more spacious than it really is. There's ample room for taller adults, even in the back seats.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI's interior is easily the best in the class, with Audi-like refinement and thoughtful design. Interior storage is lacking compared to other hatchbacks, as is cargo capacity. This is definitely a hatchback for more sophisticated tastes.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Good sightlines in every direction take any mystery out of the car's surroundings. The upright seats further help in this regard, as do thin roof pillars and ample mirrors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI's interior is easily the best in the class, with Audi-like refinement and thoughtful design. Interior storage is lacking compared to other hatchbacks, as is cargo capacity. This is definitely a hatchback for more sophisticated tastes.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The GTI's 15.2 cu-ft cargo capacity trails the Focus' 23.8 and Mazdaspeed3's 17.0. Rear seats don't fold completely flat, but do open up 46 cu-ft, beating rivals by 2 cubes or more. Interior storage bins are few.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The GTI's interior is easily the best in the class, with Audi-like refinement and thoughtful design. Interior storage is lacking compared to other hatchbacks, as is cargo capacity. This is definitely a hatchback for more sophisticated tastes.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Considering the VW's solid build and interior refinement, the added cost seems easily justifiable. Other hatchbacks in this class feel like toys by comparison.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,690, our 4-door GTI with sunroof and navigation costs about $2,000  more than a similarly equipped Focus ST and $3,000 more than a comparable Mazdaspeed3. The others do not offer an automatic transmission, which added $1,100 to the cost.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The base GTI is similarly equipped compared to other sporty hatchbacks but costs a bit more. Options are grouped in packages and push the price higher than rivals by $1,000 or more for fully-loaded versions.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,690, our 4-door GTI with sunroof and navigation costs about $2,000  more than a similarly equipped Focus ST and $3,000 more than a comparable Mazdaspeed3. The others do not offer an automatic transmission, which added $1,100 to the cost.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Starting at $25,590 for a base model with manual transmission, the GTI costs $1,095 more than the Focus ST and $595 more than the Mazdaspeed3. The gap widens as you add options.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,690, our 4-door GTI with sunroof and navigation costs about $2,000  more than a similarly equipped Focus ST and $3,000 more than a comparable Mazdaspeed3. The others do not offer an automatic transmission, which added $1,100 to the cost.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: The EPA estimates 27 mpg Combined (24 City/33 Hwy) for the GTI with the DSG automated manual, which is above average for the class. We managed 29.4 mpg on our evaluation loop and 24.2 overall.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,690, our 4-door GTI with sunroof and navigation costs about $2,000  more than a similarly equipped Focus ST and $3,000 more than a comparable Mazdaspeed3. The others do not offer an automatic transmission, which added $1,100 to the cost.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: VW's 3-year/36,000-mile basic and 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain warranties are identical to other hatchbacks in the segment. As with other manufacturers, optional extended warranties are offered.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,690, our 4-door GTI with sunroof and navigation costs about $2,000  more than a similarly equipped Focus ST and $3,000 more than a comparable Mazdaspeed3. The others do not offer an automatic transmission, which added $1,100 to the cost.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: 3-year/36,000-mile free scheduled maintenance was standard on the 2013 GTI, but it will drop to 2 years/24,000 for 2014. Rivals offer this at additional cost.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: At $30,690, our 4-door GTI with sunroof and navigation costs about $2,000  more than a similarly equipped Focus ST and $3,000 more than a comparable Mazdaspeed3. The others do not offer an automatic transmission, which added $1,100 to the cost.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: A sporty hatchback for more sophisticated tastes, its playful nature and more refined interior keep it relevant. You won't feel like you had to compromise on this choice.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite coming up short in terms of performance numbers, the VW GTI is still an entertaining hatchback. Cars with the manual are considerably more fun and involving, while still being easy to drive.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: GTI
style.name: 4dr Hatchback w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6AM)
summary: Styling is more conservative than the boy-racer hatchback rivals and for many, that's a good thing. The GTI is a hatchback for adults who still like to have fun behind the wheel.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Despite coming up short in terms of performance numbers, the VW GTI is still an entertaining hatchback. Cars with the manual are considerably more fun and involving, while still being easy to drive.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Fantastic engine for a compact sedan. Low-end power galore, responsive automatic transmission. Goes from zero to 60 mph in 7.4 seconds. No competitor we've tested does it quicker than 8.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta's new 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder is leaps and bounds better than the old engine and one of the best in the segment. However, "Performance" goes beyond acceleration. The Jetta's numb steering and unengaging driving experience do the engine few favors.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Many dislike Volkswagen's long-travel, low-effort pedal feel; others appreciate it with time. Its 60-0 stop in 118 feet is among best in segment.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta's new 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder is leaps and bounds better than the old engine and one of the best in the segment. However, "Performance" goes beyond acceleration. The Jetta's numb steering and unengaging driving experience do the engine few favors.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Steering has an elastic band quality -- numb with dead play at center, then weights up when turning increases. OK set-up on the highway, but not enough response or feedback.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta's new 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder is leaps and bounds better than the old engine and one of the best in the segment. However, "Performance" goes beyond acceleration. The Jetta's numb steering and unengaging driving experience do the engine few favors.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Grip is on-par with rivals (0.83g on skidpad) and pace on mountain road was acceptable, but utterly lacks feedback. You don't feel confident driving it energetically (nor would you want to).
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta's new 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder is leaps and bounds better than the old engine and one of the best in the segment. However, "Performance" goes beyond acceleration. The Jetta's numb steering and unengaging driving experience do the engine few favors.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Intuitive and easy to drive with the possible exception of the brakes. Excellent automatic transmission doesn't draw attention to itself, which is a plus. Cruise control does not hold speed downhill.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta's new 1.8-liter turbocharged four-cylinder is leaps and bounds better than the old engine and one of the best in the segment. However, "Performance" goes beyond acceleration. The Jetta's numb steering and unengaging driving experience do the engine few favors.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Firm, supportive seats that hold up better on lengthy drives than many other compact sedans. Space is plentiful front and back. Driver seat has power recline, all other directions are manual.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Damping on choppy pavement made the Jetta less comfortable than expected for a supposedly Autobahn-bred sedan. The seats are excellent, but this isn't the cross-country road trip car you might expect it to be.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Overly firm and borderline rough at times over choppy pavement, especially at highway speeds. Lacks the well-damped feel you'd expect from a German-tuned sedan.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Damping on choppy pavement made the Jetta less comfortable than expected for a supposedly Autobahn-bred sedan. The seats are excellent, but this isn't the cross-country road trip car you might expect it to be.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Turbocharged engine more pleasing to the ears than most other four-cylinders in the segment. Wind and road noise average for the segment. A road trip would not become tiresome.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Damping on choppy pavement made the Jetta less comfortable than expected for a supposedly Autobahn-bred sedan. The seats are excellent, but this isn't the cross-country road trip car you might expect it to be.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Very simple HVAC. Touchscreen audio requires too many touch "buttons" to be pressed for iPod/iPhone control. Bluetooth pairing unintuitive. Cruise controls are on the turn signal.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Huge cabin and trunk will appeal to families seeking the biggest car for their money. However, the electronics interface is below average and visibility suffers as the result of window reflections and limited rearview camera availability.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: With its sizeable interior proportions and big doors, this is an easy compact sedan to get in and out of. Squared-off roofline means fewer clunked heads for rear passengers.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Huge cabin and trunk will appeal to families seeking the biggest car for their money. However, the electronics interface is below average and visibility suffers as the result of window reflections and limited rearview camera availability.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Jetta is nearly a midsize car, as a pair of 6-footers can sit back-to-back. Headroom is plentiful, even with the sunroof. A much better family car than many compact sedans.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Huge cabin and trunk will appeal to families seeking the biggest car for their money. However, the electronics interface is below average and visibility suffers as the result of window reflections and limited rearview camera availability.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Big windows, thin pillars and squared roofline create good visibility. Rearview camera only available on pricier SEL trim. Excessive reflections from plastic trim front and rear.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Huge cabin and trunk will appeal to families seeking the biggest car for their money. However, the electronics interface is below average and visibility suffers as the result of window reflections and limited rearview camera availability.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: 15.5-cubic-foot trunk is enormous, matching those of midsize sedans and easily besting its compact rivals. Opening is very wide, 2 golf bags fit easily. 60/40 split-folding.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Huge cabin and trunk will appeal to families seeking the biggest car for their money. However, the electronics interface is below average and visibility suffers as the result of window reflections and limited rearview camera availability.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Jetta's materials are average at best; many competitors' look and feel richer. Dash and door tops are hard and cause annoying reflections. Vinyl seats breathe OK, prevent stains.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our Jetta SE does not "feel" like a $23,945 car. Features list is competitive, but rival cabins have a posher look and feel at a similar price. This is not the near-luxury interior of Jettas past. On the plus side, fuel economy is excellent.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Jetta SE includes cruise control, leatherette, satellite radio and an iPod interface. Bluetooth phone/audio, touchscreen, heated seats, leather wheel are options. No rearview camera.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our Jetta SE does not "feel" like a $23,945 car. Features list is competitive, but rival cabins have a posher look and feel at a similar price. This is not the near-luxury interior of Jettas past. On the plus side, fuel economy is excellent.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: $16,315 base price is a mirage -- no equipment, sub-par engine, special order only. SE starts at $19,715 and has turbo engine, decent equipment level. As-tested is $23,395.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our Jetta SE does not "feel" like a $23,945 car. Features list is competitive, but rival cabins have a posher look and feel at a similar price. This is not the near-luxury interior of Jettas past. On the plus side, fuel economy is excellent.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: We averaged 30.6 mpg in 539 miles of driving the Jetta SE -- EPA estimates 29 Combined. On the 116-mile Edmunds evaluation loop, we achieved 35.4 mpg. Impressive given this car's power.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our Jetta SE does not "feel" like a $23,945 car. Features list is competitive, but rival cabins have a posher look and feel at a similar price. This is not the near-luxury interior of Jettas past. On the plus side, fuel economy is excellent.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty and roadside assistance coverage. Drivetrain covered for 5 years/60,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our Jetta SE does not "feel" like a $23,945 car. Features list is competitive, but rival cabins have a posher look and feel at a similar price. This is not the near-luxury interior of Jettas past. On the plus side, fuel economy is excellent.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: 3-year roadside assistance coverage and 2-year free scheduled maintenance save money and peace of mind. A long-term Jetta test car of this generation was largely trouble free.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: Our Jetta SE does not "feel" like a $23,945 car. Features list is competitive, but rival cabins have a posher look and feel at a similar price. This is not the near-luxury interior of Jettas past. On the plus side, fuel economy is excellent.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Despite its top-notch engine, this is not a car you relish coming back to for another go behind the wheel. Its firm ride at times is not balanced by commensurate handling capabilities.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: This isn't a fun car to drive unless your idea of fun is simply beating other compact cars at traffic lights. The Jetta will humbly take you to work and chew away long journeys, but a Ford Focus or Mazda 3 are more engaging.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: SE 4dr Sedan w/Connectivity, Sunroof (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Energetic engine scores it points, but this is otherwise a forgettable compact sedan. Lacks the styling flair and driving verve of many rivals, and near-luxury feel of Jettas past.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: This isn't a fun car to drive unless your idea of fun is simply beating other compact cars at traffic lights. The Jetta will humbly take you to work and chew away long journeys, but a Ford Focus or Mazda 3 are more engaging.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: 1.8-liter turbo-4 is a superb engine (lower trims have 1.4-liter turbo-4). Low-end power galore makes it feel every bit as quick as it is -- 0-60 mph in 7.4 seconds is topped only by a few, very quick competitors like the 2016 Honda Civic 1.5 turbo.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta 1.8T is a bit of a drag racer amongst compact cars -- faster than almost all its rivals. But show it a corner, and it fails to deliver any semblance of responsiveness, engagement or confidence. Lower trims with smaller 1.4-liter engine would fare even worse.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Came to a stop from 60 mph in 114 feet, which is the best distance we've measured for a compact car without summer tires. Many will dislike VW's long-travel, low-effort pedal feel; others may grow to appreciate its modulation ability.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta 1.8T is a bit of a drag racer amongst compact cars -- faster than almost all its rivals. But show it a corner, and it fails to deliver any semblance of responsiveness, engagement or confidence. Lower trims with smaller 1.4-liter engine would fare even worse.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Steering has an elastic band quality -- numb with ample dead play at center, then weights up when turning increases. Scarse response and feedback. Hard to think of a competitor that is worse.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta 1.8T is a bit of a drag racer amongst compact cars -- faster than almost all its rivals. But show it a corner, and it fails to deliver any semblance of responsiveness, engagement or confidence. Lower trims with smaller 1.4-liter engine would fare even worse.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Grip is on par with rivals (0.85g measured on our skidpad), but there's an awful lot of body roll and it plows through corners. Not at all playful and it utterly lacks feedback. You don't feel confident driving it energetically (nor would you want to).
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta 1.8T is a bit of a drag racer amongst compact cars -- faster than almost all its rivals. But show it a corner, and it fails to deliver any semblance of responsiveness, engagement or confidence. Lower trims with smaller 1.4-liter engine would fare even worse.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Many will dislike brake pedal effort and travel, along with its positioning relative the accelerator. Jumpy acceleration at times. Adaptive cruise control holds speed downhill well.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Jetta 1.8T is a bit of a drag racer amongst compact cars -- faster than almost all its rivals. But show it a corner, and it fails to deliver any semblance of responsiveness, engagement or confidence. Lower trims with smaller 1.4-liter engine would fare even worse.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Power seats, even on loaded trims, adjust only six ways (no front seat bottom lift), reducing potential driver comfort. Acceptable adjustment in lower trims. Seats themselves are firm and supportive over distance.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Jetta is a compact car you could envision taking a cross-country road trip in as it is suitably quiet and comfortable. Is it more so than its competitors? Not really, and it also can't match the altogether more impressive Volkswagen Golf.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Composed and imparts a sense of solidity when going over bumps and undulations. No impact harshness detected over potholes and especially bad pavement. This is one of the few ways the Jetta feels like a proper German sedan.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Jetta is a compact car you could envision taking a cross-country road trip in as it is suitably quiet and comfortable. Is it more so than its competitors? Not really, and it also can't match the altogether more impressive Volkswagen Golf.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Turbocharged engine more pleasing to the ears than most other four-cylinders in the segment. Wind and road noise average for the segment. A road trip would not become tiresome.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Jetta is a compact car you could envision taking a cross-country road trip in as it is suitably quiet and comfortable. Is it more so than its competitors? Not really, and it also can't match the altogether more impressive Volkswagen Golf.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Smallish screen is mounted a bit low, but all-new system for 2016 is a big improvement with crisp graphics, quick responses and nicely sized icons. Apple CarPlay and Android Auto is standard on all but base Jetta. Straightforward controls elsewhere.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Jetta's generous size would be the reason to consider this car, especially one of its cheaper lower trims. Quite simply, this is one of the cheapest ways to get a new, family-friendly sedan.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: With its sizeable interior proportions and big doors, this is an easy compact sedan to get in and out of. Squared-off roofline means fewer clonked heads for rear passengers.

ratings.summary: The Jetta's generous size would be the reason to consider this car, especially one of its cheaper lower trims. Quite simply, this is one of the cheapest ways to get a new, family-friendly sedan.

summary: The Jetta is nearly a midsize car, as a pair of 6-footers can easily sit in a row. Headroom is plentiful, even with a sunroof. A viable family car -- most competitors cannot claim that.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Jetta's generous size would be the reason to consider this car, especially one of its cheaper lower trims. Quite simply, this is one of the cheapest ways to get a new, family-friendly sedan.

model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Big windows, thick pillars and squared-off roofline create good visibility all around. Rearview camera standard on all but most basic Jetta. Excessive reflections from plastic trim front and rear.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Jetta's generous size would be the reason to consider this car, especially one of its cheaper lower trims. Quite simply, this is one of the cheapest ways to get a new, family-friendly sedan.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: This trunk is enormous -- wide and very deep. Its 15.5-cubic-foot dimension is on-par with midsize sedans and easily bests compact rivals. OK small item storage up front. Forward bin keeps phone and wire out of the way.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Jetta's generous size would be the reason to consider this car, especially one of its cheaper lower trims. Quite simply, this is one of the cheapest ways to get a new, family-friendly sedan.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: High-quality switchgear, but only soft-touch surface is squishy dashboard found only on upper trims. Everything else is hard and shiny. Materials are sub-par for this segment, and in no way indicative of an as-tested $28,000 car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The more you spend on a Jetta, the less value you receive in return. As prices rise, the cheap cabin and dull driving experience start to matter more, and competitors seem like a smarter purchase. You get a very large car for the money either way and strong performance with the 1.8T engine.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: A basic Jetta 1.4T for around $20,000 includes bigger touchscreen, rearview camera, advanced smartphone connections and all the expected equipment. This is generous. Similar features value in upper trims as well.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The more you spend on a Jetta, the less value you receive in return. As prices rise, the cheap cabin and dull driving experience start to matter more, and competitors seem like a smarter purchase. You get a very large car for the money either way and strong performance with the 1.8T engine.

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Lower trim Jettas provide tons of space, acceptable performance and ample feature content. However, upper trims like our SEL Premium test car cost similar to bigger, far more refined and similarly equipped midsize sedans like a Honda Accord.

ratings.summary: The more you spend on a Jetta, the less value you receive in return. make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: EPA estimate for 1.8T engine is 29 mpg combined with either transmission. With auto, we got only 27.9 mpg on evaluation route; 26.5 mpg overall. Disappointing but perhaps not surprising given energetic engine. 1.4T engine returns 32 mpg combined with automatic.

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Despite class-leading acceleration, this is not a car you relish coming back to for another go behind the wheel. It does provide some semblance of that Germanic solidity one expects, but not nearly enough of it.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Its energetic turbocharged engine definitely scores it some points, but otherwise, the Jetta is a dull and unengaging car to drive in a segment chock full of compact sedans and hatchbacks perfectly capable of putting a smile on your face (including the VW Golf).
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Jetta
style.name: 1.8T SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: This car is the dry toast of automobiles and it gets even dryer when painted our test car's dreary shade of "ignore me!" gray. It lacks the styling flair and driving verve of many rivals and the near-luxury feel of past Jettas and the Golf.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Its energetic turbocharged engine definitely scores it some points, but otherwise, the Jetta is a dull and unengaging car to drive in a segment chock full of compact sedans and hatchbacks perfectly capable of putting a smile on your face (including the VW Golf).
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Getting to 60 mph takes about 9 seconds with the 2.0-liter turbodiesel engine and DSG transmission, which makes it slower than nearly every car in the class. But torque is abundant.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Passat is neither quick nor a remarkably good handler. Still, its all-torque power delivery moves it down the road adequately. Plan on a soft ride and equally soft handling. Long range and economy are its real strengths.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Although its stopping distance is average, brake feel and response are poor. The Passat's brake pedal is soft and long-travel, yet response is grabby. It's hard to be smooth.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Passat is neither quick nor a remarkably good handler. Still, its all-torque power delivery moves it down the road adequately. Plan on a soft ride and equally soft handling. Long range and economy are its real strengths.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: There's not a lof of useful information available through the Passat's wheel, but steering effort is appropriate.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Passat is neither quick nor a remarkably good handler. Still, its all-torque power delivery moves it down the road adequately. Plan on a soft ride and equally soft handling. Long range and economy are its real strengths.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat TDI has zero sporting intentions. Handling is well mannered but with low limits. It's perfectly fine if you never need to go quickly around a corner.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Passat is neither quick nor a remarkably good handler. Still, its all-torque power delivery moves it down the road adequately. Plan on a soft ride and equally soft handling. Long range and economy are its real strengths.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat's driveability is perfectly adequate, but nearly all responses are slow. Though the DSG shifts rapidly, the TDI powerplant doesn't motivate the car to do anything quickly.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: The Passat is neither quick nor a remarkably good handler. Still, its all-torque power delivery moves it down the road adequately. Plan on a soft ride and equally soft handling. Long range and economy are its real strengths.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat's steering wheel doesnâ€™t align with its driver's seat, the wheel is offset about an inch. Seats are softer than is typical in German sedans, but still amply supportive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a Passat strength. Suspension tuning favors the soft side with both plush springs and minimal damping. Inside there are ample amenities (dual-zone cimate control, suede seat inserts, keyless ignition) as well.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat favors comfort over agility. It's big, soft and cushy.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a Passat strength. Suspension tuning favors the soft side with both plush springs and minimal damping. Inside there are ample amenities (dual-zone cimate control, suede seat inserts, keyless ignition) as well.

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Wait, this is a diesel? Because it's tough to tell by listening. As quiet as a mid-size sedan needs to be. Tire and wind noise are unobtrusive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a Passat strength. Suspension tuning favors the soft side with both plush springs and minimal damping. Inside there are ample amenities (dual-zone cimate control, suede seat inserts, keyless ignition) as well.

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Climate control is easy to use and offers dual zones and rear vents. Phone pairing is managed through steering wheel controls/driver information display, which is unusual and awkward.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers ample storage.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat offers large, wide-opening doors with big apertures.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers ample storage.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Enormous inside. Rear seat space borders on luxury levels. Both leg room and lateral space are ample in the rear and footwells are massive. Big people will fit comfortably back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers ample storage.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Relatively small pillars all around. But the D pillars are large enough to cause marginal visibility hassles in any scenario that requires rear-quarter visibility.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers ample storage.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Enormous, 15.9-cubic-foot trunk. Deep and wide. Split-folding rear seats help with extra-large cargo. Folding rear center armrest. Good small-item storage thoughout.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers ample storage.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat is neatly assembled from quality materials. Its body panels align well and its interior is quiet and rattle-free.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat TDI's value depends on how much emphasis you place on range and fuel economy. The added cost for its powertrain is proportional to the benefits it offers.

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Fuel economy and range are the Passat TDI's biggest strengths. The EPA rates the Passat TDI at 30 city/40 mpg highway. We averaged 31.6 mpg over 1,154 miles with the car.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat TDI's value depends on how much emphasis you place on range and fuel economy. The added cost for its powertrain is proportional to the benefits it offers.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: The Passat TDI offers a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty along with 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat TDI's value depends on how much emphasis you place on range and fuel economy. The added cost for its powertrain is proportional to the benefits it offers.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: VW TDI drivers are vocal advocates, swearing by the car's economy and range. It helps that the Passat has free maintenance and roadside assistance for 3 years/36,000 miles.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat TDI's value depends on how much emphasis you place on range and fuel economy. The added cost for its powertrain is proportional to the benefits it offers.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Sluggish throttle response can make the Passat TDI slow off the line. Most control responses are lackadaisical, in fact.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Don't expect the Passat TDI to behave athletically in any measure of performance. But if big range and fuel economy tickle your fancy, then this is your car.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: TDI SEL Premium 4dr Sedan (2.0L 4cyl Turbodiesel 6AM)
summary: Diesel-powered VW sedans are where personality goes to die. Don't expect to find any here.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Don't expect the Passat TDI to behave athletically in any measure of performance. But if big range and fuel economy tickle your fancy, then this is your car.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: At 7.7 seconds to 60 mph, the Passat is quicker than a base-engine Toyota Camry. The new 1.8-liter turbocharged 4-cylinder puts out 170 hp, and is considerably smoother than the old 2.5-liter.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We wouldn't classify the Passat as quick, but its acceleration is on-par for the midsize sedan class. The Passat's soft and comfortable suspension tuning endow it with equally soft handling. Nothing bad, mind you, but not exciting, either.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The 123 feet it takes the Passat to stop from 60 mph is average, but its long-travel pedal might require some getting used to. This type of response is aligned with the car's character, however.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We wouldn't classify the Passat as quick, but its acceleration is on-par for the midsize sedan class. The Passat's soft and comfortable suspension tuning endow it with equally soft handling. Nothing bad, mind you, but not exciting, either.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: There's not a lot of useful information available through the Passat's steering wheel, but the assist level builds nicely with speed. It's appropriate for the type of driving expected here.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We wouldn't classify the Passat as quick, but its acceleration is on-par for the midsize sedan class. The Passat's soft and comfortable suspension tuning endow it with equally soft handling. Nothing bad, mind you, but not exciting, either.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat has zero sporting intentions. Set your expectations appropriately. Handling is well mannered but with low limits. It's perfectly fine if you never need to go quickly around a corner.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We wouldn't classify the Passat as quick, but its acceleration is on-par for the midsize sedan class. The Passat's soft and comfortable suspension tuning endow it with equally soft handling. Nothing bad, mind you, but not exciting, either.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat offers supple but slow responses to most inputs, which makes it an easy car to drive. Most will appreciate this car's 6-speed automatic transmission versus VW's more abrupt twin-clutch.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: We wouldn't classify the Passat as quick, but its acceleration is on-par for the midsize sedan class. The Passat's soft and comfortable suspension tuning endow it with equally soft handling. Nothing bad, mind you, but not exciting, either.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat's steering wheel is offset about an inch from the center of the seat. Seats are softer than is typical in German sedans, but still supportive. Driver's seat is 8-way power adjustable.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a Passat strength. Suspension tuning is on the soft side with relatively plush springs. Inside there are ample amenities (dual-zone climate control, suede seat inserts, keyless ignition) as well.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat favors comfort over agility. It's big, soft and cushy. Many people will love it for exactly these characteristics.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a Passat strength. Suspension tuning is on the soft side with relatively plush springs. Inside there are ample amenities (dual-zone climate control, suede seat inserts, keyless ignition) as well.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Quietness is another Passat strength. There's virtually no engine noise from the turbocharged four-cylinder, and both road and wind noise are non-intrusive.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: Comfort is a Passat strength. Suspension tuning is on the soft side with relatively plush springs. Inside there are ample amenities (dual-zone climate control, suede seat inserts, keyless ignition) as well.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The climate control is easy to use, and has dual zones and rear vents. Phone pairing is managed through steering wheel controls/driver information display, which is unusual and awkward.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers good small-item storage.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat offers large, wide-opening doors with big apertures. You'll be hard-pressed to find a sedan in this category that's easier to get in/out of.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers good small-item storage.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Enormous inside. Rear seat space borders on luxury levels. Both leg room and lateral space are generous in the rear, and footwells are massive. Big people will fit comfortably back there.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers good small-item storage.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Relatively small pillars all around. Only the rearmost pillars are large enough to cause marginal visibility hassles in some lane-changing or parking-lot scenarios.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers good small-item storage.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Cavernous 15.9-cubic-foot trunk. Deep and wide. Split-folding rear seats help with extra-large cargo. Folding rear center armrest. Thoughtful small-item storage throughout.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: Overall, the Passat's interior is above average. It's big, well finished, appropriately laid out and offers good small-item storage.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat is neatly assembled from quality materials. Its body panels align well and its interior is quiet and rattle free.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat's value depends partly on how much you value the VW name, because you can get an equally equipped Honda Accord or Toyota Camy for considerably less money.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat SEL comes with the features we'd expect in a midsize sedan, like navigation, premium audio, power sunroof and a rearview camera. But it lacks any real frills that justify its added expense.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat's value depends partly on how much you value the VW name, because you can get an equally equipped Honda Accord or Toyota Camy for considerably less money.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Though you get a German nameplate and a presumption of quality, the Passat's Japanese competition cost less than the $31,715 SEL Premium model. Yet they offer similar features and specifications.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat's value depends partly on how much you value the VW name, because you can get an equally equipped Honda Accord or Toyota Camy for considerably less money.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The EPA rates the Passat 1.8 Turbo at 28 mpg Combined (24 City/34 Highway). Our testing showed that 26 mpg is a more realistic expectation, which is about the same as we've seen in the 4-cylinder Honda Accord.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat's value depends partly on how much you value the VW name, because you can get an equally equipped Honda Accord or Toyota Camy for considerably less money.
title: MPG
