model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat comes with a 3-year/36,000-mile basic warranty along with 5-year/60,000-mile powertrain coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat's value depends partly on how much you value the VW name, because you can get an equally equipped Honda Accord or Toyota Camy for considerably less money.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Roadside assistance is offered for 3 years/36,000 miles. Free maintenance is covered for 2 years/24,000 miles, similar to the Toyota Camry.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Passat's value depends partly on how much you value the VW name, because you can get an equally equipped Honda Accord or Toyota Camy for considerably less money.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat is more of an A-to-B car than a machine you buy to enjoy the act of driving. It's big and comfortable and reasonably efficient.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Don't expect the Passat to behave athletically in any measure of performance. This is a practical people-mover, not a sport sedan by any stretch of the imagination.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Passat
style.name: SEL Premium PZEV 4dr Sedan (1.8L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Passat is an introvert. While it's a perfectly fine everyday sedan, it's as guarded in its character as it is in its performance.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: Don't expect the Passat to behave athletically in any measure of performance. This is a practical people-mover, not a sport sedan by any stretch of the imagination.
title: Personality

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The power from the turbo 4-cylinder won't knock your socks off, although it's quicker than most in the class, with 0-60 mph in 7.5 sec. There's a definite delay off the line.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Acceleration

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Tiguan has adequate brake cooling indicated by the consistency of the distances in our panic 60-0 mph brake test. Around town the brake pedal had a linear feel.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Braking

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The steering is rubbery off center, not especially natural feeling. But the level of power assist is just about right.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Steering

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Tiguan feels like the high-riding Golf it mostly is. There's plenty of body roll, but also good feedback to the driver. It's tossable if you want to have some fun with it.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Handling

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The turbo's on/off nature and the automatic transmission's constant desire to get into top gear ASAP (which lugs the engine) hurt the Tiguan's around-town drivability.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Driveability

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Tiguan has a maximum tow rating of 2,200 lb. The Honda CR-V is only rated to tow a max of 1,500 lb.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Towing

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: As with most car-based crossover SUVs, the Tiguan isn't designed with any kind of serious off-roading in mind. Good for snow and maintained dirt roads.
ratings.title: Performance
ratings.summary: Even though the Tiguan is more performance-minded than the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4, it's not a truly sporty machine. The turbo engine is strong when it's on-boost, but there is some turbo lag. Plus, the transmission is too busy.
title: Off-Road

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The seats aren't exactly what you'd call super plush, front or rear, and the V-Tex leatherette material gets sticky on hot days.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers what should be more than enough comfort for most. Sure, the seats could be a bit softer and the ride is fairly taut, but it's also exceptionally quiet. We don't like the fake leather seating surfaces, though.
title: Seating Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Tiguan exhibits a slightly cushioned version of that typical taut German ride. There was a bit more jiggling on the highway than we expected.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers what should be more than enough comfort for most. Sure, the seats could be a bit softer and the ride is fairly taut, but it's also exceptionally quiet. We don't like the fake leather seating surfaces, though.
title: Ride Comfort

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Very, very quiet. The tires make hardly any noise whatsoever, with only the occasional bit of flap over surface changes.
ratings.title: Comfort
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers what should be more than enough comfort for most. Sure, the seats could be a bit softer and the ride is fairly taut, but it's also exceptionally quiet. We don't like the fake leather seating surfaces, though.
title: Quietness

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: It has the high driving position that everyone craves. Other than the slighly nonintuitive stereo, the controls are simple and easy to use, if a bit bland. Knobs could be larger.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers a mix of good and bad inside the cabin. The good is that it's well made, although the styling is bland. There's nice space up front, but cargo volume is decidedly less than its competitors. Outward vision is excellent.
title: Ergonomics

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Tiguan sits at the perfect height for easy ingress/egress. You neither have to hop up nor fall in to enter the cabin. It's easy.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers a mix of good and bad inside the cabin. The good is that it's well made, although the styling is bland. There's nice space up front, but cargo volume is decidedly less than its competitors. Outward vision is excellent.
title: Ingress/Egress

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Decent elbow and shoulder room up front, especially considering this is a small SUV. The rear seat isn't a penalty box, either, as it moves fore/aft and the seatback reclines.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers a mix of good and bad inside the cabin. The good is that it's well made, although the styling is bland. There's nice space up front, but cargo volume is decidedly less than its competitors. Outward vision is excellent.
title: Space/Room

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Excellent outward vision due to the high driving position and lots of windows. Also helping are the small pillars and the extra rear side windows.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers a mix of good and bad inside the cabin. The good is that it's well made, although the styling is bland. There's nice space up front, but cargo volume is decidedly less than its competitors. Outward vision is excellent.
title: Visibility

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Odd, two-compartment armrest bin. Decent-size front bin. Door pockets have bottle holders but are narrow and hard to access. Cargo volume is smaller than most competitors.
ratings.title: Interior
ratings.summary: The Tiguan offers a mix of good and bad inside the cabin. The good is that it's well made, although the styling is bland. There's nice space up front, but cargo volume is decidedly less than its competitors. Outward vision is excellent.
title: Cargo/Storage

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The build quality is decent for the price, which came in at $31,345 as-tested. It definitely doesn't feel cheap, but admittedly some of the materials could be better.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Tiguan's value comes from its quality interior, large array of helpful standard features and good craftsmanship. Its fuel mileage isn't going to win any awards, but we beat the city mpg rating, which is rare for a turbo vehicle.
title: Build Quality (vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Panoramic sunroof, navigation with a 5-inch screen, Bluetooth, heated front seats and iPod jacks all come standard on the SE. But, no backup camera.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Tiguan's value comes from its quality interior, large array of helpful standard features and good craftsmanship. Its fuel mileage isn't going to win any awards, but we beat the city mpg rating, which is rare for a turbo vehicle.
title: Features(vs. $)

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The Tiguan starts around $23,000, the SE begins at about $28,000, while our front-drive SE test vehicle cost $31,345. This is on the pricey side compared to the competition.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Tiguan's value comes from its quality interior, large array of helpful standard features and good craftsmanship. Its fuel mileage isn't going to win any awards, but we beat the city mpg rating, which is rare for a turbo vehicle.
title: Cost

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: The EPA rates the front-drive Tiguan at 22 city/27 highway/24 mpg combined. We averaged 22.4 mpg during 955 miles of varied driving. But it requires premium fuel.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Tiguan's value comes from its quality interior, large array of helpful standard features and good craftsmanship. Its fuel mileage isn't going to win any awards, but we beat the city mpg rating, which is rare for a turbo vehicle.
title: MPG

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Basic warranty is 3 years/36,000 miles with 5 years/60,000 miles for the drivetrain. This is average, and well behind the Kia Sportage's 10-year/100,000-mile drivetrain coverage.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Tiguan's value comes from its quality interior, large array of helpful standard features and good craftsmanship. Its fuel mileage isn't going to win any awards, but we beat the city mpg rating, which is rare for a turbo vehicle.
title: Warranty

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: VW provides roadside assistance and free scheduled maintenance for 3 years/36,000 miles. The Honda CR-V, for instance, offers neither.
ratings.title: Value
ratings.summary: The Tiguan's value comes from its quality interior, large array of helpful standard features and good craftsmanship. Its fuel mileage isn't going to win any awards, but we beat the city mpg rating, which is rare for a turbo vehicle.
title: Ownership

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: This is a relatively light and small SUV, but aside from the sporty-for-the-class handling, there's nothing really special in the driving experience that says "fun."
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The VW's light feel and sporty-minded handling make the Tiguan more fun than a Honda CR-V, Toyota RAV4 or Kia Sportage. But the eager-to-upshift transmission and on/off turbo mar the experience a bit.
title: Driving Experience

make.name: Volkswagen
model.name: Tiguan
style.name: SE 4dr SUV w/Sunroof, Navigation (2.0L 4cyl Turbo 6A)
summary: Almost always a turbo gives a car a bit of extra personality, and that is the case with the Tiguan as well. But, the lag leaving a stoplight can be annoying for around-town duty.
ratings.title: Fun To Drive
ratings.summary: The VW's light feel and sporty-minded handling make the Tiguan more fun than a Honda CR-V, Toyota RAV4 or Kia Sportage. But the eager-to-upshift transmission and on/off turbo mar the experience a bit.
title: Personality
